description:
Equivalent Experience  

Description: 
Actalent is offering an extraordinary opportunity to be part of a small,
innovative team with a low process, high throughput culture. The team is 
working on Defense Orchestrator, which manages policy and configuration of
Security Business Group's firewalls. We are looking for an energetic 
DevOps engineer to contribute to all parts of our infrastructure stack. The
DevOps Engineer will be responsible for the production process, including 
continuous delivery of features, infrastructure automation, configuration
management, high availability, and related tooling. Candidates will also be 
expected to contribute to software development and testing. 
Responsibilities 
Participate as a technical contributor on a fast paced project team of
engineers involved in the development of SaaS security products; 
Continuously evolve cloud infrastructure, making it more resilient, scalable
and secure; 
Aggressively automate any and all manual procedures; 
Partner with the engineering organization to converge on common infrastructure
setup, tooling and deployment processes; 
Research and recommend technologies to help further product goals; 
Create innovative solutions for complex technical problems; 
Respond to and resolve infrastructure related escalations. 
Manage and participate in on-call rotation, rotated through engineering team 
Interface with the greater technical support team  

Skills: 
devops, object oriented development, aws, deployment, release management  

Top Skills Details: 
devops,object oriented development  

Additional Skills & Qualifications: 
Required Experience and Skills 
Proven ability to manage builds, release, and deployment in a SaaS environment
with a strict SLA; 
Extensive and proven experience with running production software in AWS; 
Strong working knowledge of Linux based systems; 
SaaS deployment and upgrade automation using configuration management tools
such as Chef and/or Puppet; 
Infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform and CloudFormation; 
Automated application of configuration changes across multi-use environments
(dev, test, staging, prod, etc); 
Create and manage a safe deployment procedure of new product changes across
multiple environments; 
Ability to build SaaS monitoring solutions that detect and automatically
remediate system faults; 
Setting up, configuring, maintaining and evolving a continuous delivery
environment using CI tools such as Jenkins/TeamCity/Bamboo/etc; 
General purpose language such as Ruby/Python plus shell scripting. 
SaaS operations such as maintenance, escalations & triage; 
Debugging and troubleshooting in a distributed environment; 
BS/CS with 5+ years of DevOps experience. 
Desired Experience and Skills 
Agile software development; 
Development experience in an object oriented language; 
Team player, with strong communication skills.  

Experience Level: 
Expert Level  

About Actalent: 
Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and
services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to
help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are
making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and
sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes
consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous
development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company
of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions.  

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all
applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national
origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity,
genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

description:
Greetings from Konnectingtree Inc.,

Seeking Cloud DevOps Lead for Contract to hire position. Only GC holders and
US Citizens are eligible for this position.

Required Skillsets/Work Experience in the following : 
---------------------------------------------------------- 
* 5+ years of experience with migration from private to public cloud 
* 5+ years of experience with Amazon Web Services (like EC2, ELB, CloudFormation, S3, IAM, RDS, SNS, etc.) 
* 2+ years of experience developing and maintaining infrastructure as code, ideally using Terraform 
* Experience with server-side technologies such as Apache, NodeJS, HaProxy, Tomcat & Jboss Chef/Ansible 
* Experience with OpenShift, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS 
* DBMS experience in MySQL, Cassandra & Oracle 
* Experience with IBM MQ, RabbitMQ, Kafka. 
* Experience with Dynatrace, Splunk. DNS management (PDNS and Route53 experience) 
* Shell scripting (Python, PowerShell, Bash, etc.)

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Informatica: 1 year (Preferred)
* SQL: 1 year (Preferred)
* Data warehouse: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: One location

See yourself at Twilio

Join the team as our next DevOps Engineer!

Who we are & why we're hiring

Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help
companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer
experiences.

Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we're on a journey to becoming
a globally antiracist company that supports diversity, equity & inclusion
wherever we do business. We employ thousands of Twilions worldwide, and we're
looking for more builders, creators, and visionaries to help fuel our growth
momentum.

About the job

This position is needed to support the hands-on operational team responsible
for design, implementation and management of our datacenter footprint across
the US and EU. We are building a world-class platform to enable Twilio's
developers to quickly deploy reliable, scalable, and secure products to Twilio
customers. As Twilio continues to grow, the team is leading the expansion of
our datacenter footprint across the globe.

Responsibilities

In this role, you'll:

* Build out world class data center facilities that support our customers worldwide
* Develop automation for processes within the team
* Identify and drive areas of improvement within our Data center management practices.
* Foster an inclusive environment and imports team members to succeed and grow.

Qualifications

Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly.
Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage
everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having
"desired" qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants
with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or
hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering
Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the
table!

Required:

* Experience with large scale datacenter projects & infrastructure rollouts
* Hands-on operational experience in a data center facility. Installation of equipment in racks, attaching connections to power and network infrastructure. Ability to coordinate these activities remotely via remote hands services.
* An understanding of computer science fundamentals and practical experience developing distributed systems.
* A passion for automation and DevOps--blending operational excellence with development best practices.
* Deep familiarity with Linux (CentOS/RHEL preferred), bash scripting, service configuration and management.
* Proficiency with one or more programming languages. Go, Ruby, Python are preferred.

Desired:

* Experience creating declarative APIs to handle physical infrastructure in a hybrid cloud environment.
* Past development projects involving backend databases or interacting with other systems via API.
* Experience providing infrastructure as a service leveraging configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible, CFEngine, etc.

Location

This role will be remote, and ideally based in the central/eastern/mountain
time zones in the USA.

What We Offer

There are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to
competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness
leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary
by location.

Twilio thinks big. Do you?

We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are
always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody
our values -- something we call Twilio Magic. Additionally, we empower
employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their
volunteering and donation efforts.

So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be
the best version of yourself, apply now!

If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open
positions.

Please note this role is open to candidates outside of Colorado as well. The
information below is provided for those hired in Colorado only.

If you are a Colorado applicant:

* The estimated pay range for this role, based in Colorado, is $99,360 - $124,200.
* Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Twilio's equity plan.

The successful candidate's starting salary will be determined based on
permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and
geographic location within the state. This role is also eligible to
participate in Twilio's equity plan and for the following benefits: health
care insurance, 401(k) retirement account, paid sick time, paid personal time
off, paid parental leave.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Twilio is proud to be
an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not
discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including
pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical
conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age,
status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability,
genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally
protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal
histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.
Additionally, Twilio participates in the E-Verify program in certain
locations, as required by law.

Twilio is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified
individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application
procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability,
please contact us at accommodation@twilio.com.

The treatment of contractors here has left a bad taste in people's mouths, and I would recommend avoiding the pitfalls of other big tech companies that also hire a lot of contractors and treat them just as poorly.

If you want Twilio to have a good reputation, more than just your customers need to have a positive take on the company, and your employees are the last people you want to complain about the company.  We know tech companies hire lots of contractors, and while it's legal in this country, you're only hurting yourself by 1) not offering more FTE positions for contractors to apply to, and 2) maintaining a large number of a contracted workforce that is overworked and underpaid.", "cons": "Don't expect to stay. 

There were promises as contractors that we would be converted to full time employees (FTE's) when we were hired so long as we proved we could do the work, then it was completely switched on a dime with no warning. To be 'up to snuff' legally, they finally said contractors will not be converted, and will need to apply and go through the interview process for any FTE recruiting coordinator positions - so they were extremely misleading on how they recruited/hired a lot of us.

Management did not go up to bat for us when this was announced - they said "any of us can be fired at any time" and that we should always have our resumes up to date, which is true - but they actively avoided apologizing or advocating for us at any point from here on out (they basically held the door open for us to leave).

As a contractor you'll be asked to work a lot of overtime as the interview volume is insanely high, you'll literally be at your computer moving 100mph for a minimum of 8+ hours a day in order for scheduling metrics to be met. description:
Overview:

ARE YOU READY TO USE YOUR FULL POTENTIAL?

As a DevOps Automation Engineer, you will be responsible for developing
solutions to enable developer productivity across the enterprise. The
engineer,

* Will be tasked with the automation of security and governance controls,
implementation, and maintenance of the tools and infrastructure that support
the SDLC pipeline and configuration management capabilities.
* Will be responsible for acting as a developer advocate, helping to explain the needs of developers to the wider organization and evangelizing capabilities provided by the team.

At GM Financial, you will not only use your skills, you will be part of a team
that is engaged and utilizes your skills to the fullest potential!! Join the
excitement and challenge that adds value to your career progression! We look
forward to seeing your application!

Responsibilities:

JOB DUTIES

* Develop and support the tools and infrastructure that support the SDLC pipeline and configuration management capabilities
* Implement, customize and deploy CI/CD pipelines for software and infrastructure delivery
* Conduct knowledge transfer of standards, technical approach, and tooling capabilities of the team
* Communicate technical approach and implementation status to stakeholders
* Conduct problem isolation and troubleshooting on the infrastructure and tools owned by the team
* Contribute to continuous improvement of the tools and capabilities of the team
* Perform system planning, installation, and upgrades of the tools and infrastructure owned by the team
* Evangelize best practices, policies, and capabilities of the team to development organization
* Act as an advocate for stakeholder requirements when dealing with other teams in the enterprise
* Lead and/or facilitate critical incident escalation activities where required
* Manage intake queue working in an agile environment
* Update platform KPIs to be consumed by stakeholders
* After hours support and participation in an on-call rotation as needed
* Perform other duties as assigned
* Conform with all company policies and procedures

Qualifications:

Knowledge

* Experience leveraging and managing CI/CD tool chain products like Git, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, Octopus Deploy, etc
* Knowledge of configuration management tools like Ansible, Chef, Puppet
* Knowledge of provisioning tools like Terraform, ARM templates, Cloud Formation, etc…
* Knowledge of scripting and automation programming - languages like Ruby, Python, JavaScript, Bash, PowerShell
* Experience with a development framework for at least one of the following languages: JavaScript, C#, GoLang, Ruby, Python
* Knowledge of enterprise platforms, operating systems, web applications and micro-services
* Knowledge of containers and container management technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher, etc
* Knowledge of WebApp and API technologies - XML, XSL, WSDL, SOAP, JSON, HTML, and REST
* Knowledge on controlling access to APIs via authentication and authorization utilizing OAuth
* Working knowledge and troubleshooting experience with TCP/IP, DNS, and other common network protocols
* Familiarity with using SSL certificates, reverse proxies, and load-balancing
* Knowledge of IT security, networking, and infrastructure practices and capabilities
* Knowledge of information systems concepts, system administration and cloud platforms
* Knowledge of public cloud architectures and offerings: Blob, EC2, S3, Cosmos DB, Azure Functions, AKS, EKS

Skills
* Excellent communication, technical writing, and documentation skills
* Ability to work collaboratively, building relationships with team members and stakeholders
* Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills
* Experience using at least one of the following: JavaScript, Bash, PowerShell, Python, Ruby, GoLang, C#, Java
* Experience with automated build and release tools (Jenkins, TFS/Azure DevOps, Artifactory, Octopus)
* Experience running and troubleshooting applications running on containers
* Experience administering servers
* Experience working with configuration management/infrastructure-as-code tools (Puppet, Terraform, Chef, Ansible, Salt, DSC)
* Experience working with web server technologies (NGINX, Apache, Tomcat, IIS, etc)
* Experience running containerized workloads using docker

Education
* Bachelor's Degree in related field or equivalent work experience required

Experience
* 2-3 years CI/CD implementation, application development, systems automation or configuration management preferred
* 2-3 years working in a global enterprise environment preferred

description:
Finagraph is leading a new wave of innovation in FinTech that is transforming
the way financial services are offered to businesses. We continue to add some
of the world’s largest brands to our list of customers and these customers are
taking mission-critical dependencies on our cutting-edge technology. We are
expanding our team and looking for exceptional teammates that can help us grow
and make broad contributions to accelerate this industry’s transformation.

We are currently seeking a talented, results-oriented DevOps Engineer who is
experienced with all aspects of an Azure based SAAS offering.

At Finagraph, you won’t just be a spoke in the wheel. We are large enough to
make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. We are an
organization where every person matters. You’ll be a critical part of the
business where everyone contributes to the solutions that our customers love.
In addition to the day-to-day management of operations you’ll have the
opportunity to influence software design and implement parts of our solution.

What you will be doing:

* Infrastructure setup, provisioning and planning
* Environment standardization
* Platform configuration management
* CI/CD architecture
* Service tool implementation
* Implementation and monitoring of security testing
* Regular security audits and oversight
* Threat management and response

About you:
* At least 3-5 years of progressive experience and accrued good judgment with Azure provisioning, managing, and supporting cloud infrastructure for scalability and high availability.
* Passionate about delivering rich, high performing solutions that delight customers.
* Experience using and managing observability and monitoring tools supporting the operational and security health of services running in Azure
* Experience developing tools and infrastructure CI/CD pipelines for developer productivity running in Azure DevOps
* Experience with troubleshooting/incident management for cloud native services
* Demonstrable experience with scripting languages such as PowerShell
* Functional knowledge of 1 or more high level programming languages, preferably C#
* Infrastructure as Code methods and tools (ARM Templates, Bicep, etc.,)
* CI/CD - Azure DevOps, Git etc.,
* Ability to debate issues and not people.
* Ability to make complicated things simple 
* Self-awareness that allows you to thrive in an agile work environment where everybody is wearing a lot of hats.

Benefits and Perks:
* Remote position with a talented team.
* Comprehensive health benefit plan that has a rich provider network
* Unlimited vacation policy
* Peer bonus program
* Regular team events
* Vacation reimbursement benefit

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to undergo a background check? Y/N

Work Location: Remote

Responsibilities

Play a key role in the delivery of world-class patient care. Leverage
innovative technology to advance high-quality care. Take your career in a
rewarding new direction. At UCLA Health, you can do all this and more.

Under the direction of the Cloud Platform Services Manager, the Cloud DevOps
Engineer will be responsible for cloud infrastructure and application design
and implementation, DevOps optimizations, and 3rd party integrations. You will
apply DevSecOps principles to cloud infrastructure and is responsible for the
construction of landing zones and deployment of respective capabilities.
Additional responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Infrastructure production
* Security issues, and their underlying causes
* Maintaining and supporting current environments while identifying and executing system architecture and process improvements
* Building tooling to enable faster deployments and reliable rollbacks
* Write code and design processes to improve the delivery of our cloud instances and applications

Qualifications

Required  
* Extensive professional experience with Azure in a production environment (network, security, applications, serverless, and containers)
* Knowledgeable in cloud networking - security, identity and access management, DNS, etc.
* Eble to work with Terraform at an Enterprise level
* Strong experience with Linux system administration
* Experience with Configuration Management systems (i.e., Puppet, Ansible, Chef).
* Proven track record of supporting production systems, and able to effectively coordinate cloud infrastructure service requests and incident response
* Strong sense of ownership and can prioritize and work on tasks independently

Highly preferred  

* Professional experience with AWS.
* Experience with CI/CD systems such as Github Actions, CodeBuild/CodePipeline, or Azure DevOps
* Familiarity with Docker and Containerization of applications
* History of working in a HIPAA compliant environment

UCLA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,
color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,
disability, or protected Veteran status.

description:
We help the world run better

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by
building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the
foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences,
values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused
work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong
focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual
contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply
now!

* 
What you will do

SAP were original pioneers in the creation of integrated enterprise software.
2022 is our 50th year and we continue to invest in teams that deliver new and
exciting solutions with the remit to be creative and have innovation at the
centre of everything you do.

Our DevOps Engineers are problem solvers that have a real interest enabling
innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on
building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces
differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose- driven and
future-focused work

The Multicloud Hyperscaler DevOps†team play a critical central role within
SAPis global public cloud transition. The team of Cloud DevOps Engineers are
at the heart of the processes that empower SAP to develop and deliver high
quality products quickly. Working with our lines of business, you will help
build and run our next-generation multicloud technologies at global scale. If
you are an experienced DevOps Engineer with a passion for delivering
innovative IT services and value-creation, a career at SAP may be right for
you!

* 
What you bring

* You will need to have knowledge in one or more of Cloud environments such as
AWS, GCP or Azure and prior experience.
* 3+ years public cloud operations support in AWS, GCP, or Azure and Azure AD
* Experience in supporting enterprise environments, including customer relationship management
* Design and build advanced automations with a focus on more efficient operations and governance at enterprise scale
* Understanding of cloud based identity services and federation
* Documentation of solutions (e.g. configuration and setup)
* IaC -Infrastructure as Code (we use Terraform)
* Python / Bash / PowerShell (for scripting / automation)
* CI / CD (we use GitHub actions)
* Working in an Agile environment and a solid understanding of Agile methodologies
* Version control (we use GitHub), code reviews and good software working practices

* 
Meet your team

The SAP Multicloud team have a focus on delivering for our people while
delivering for the business. We have real diversity across our team, and also
in the topics we work on, so there are always fantastic opportunities to build
the career you want.

LI-Hybrid

We build breakthroughs together

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more
efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for
leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to
become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related
services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience
management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000
employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly
collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether
connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every
challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs,
together.

We win with inclusion

SAP's culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible
working models help ensure that everyone - regardless of background - feels
included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by
the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company,
and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize
their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and
creating a better and more equitable world. 
SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action
employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and
provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental
disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and
are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or
to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to
Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com. 
For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee
Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral
Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender
(including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity
or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

Requisition ID: 344545 | Work Area: Software-Development Operations | Expected
Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full
Time | Additional Locations: Virtual - USA #LI-Hybrid

description:
About Net Health 
 * _Belong. Thrive. Make a Difference._* 
Are you looking for a meaningful and satisfying career where you have endless
opportunities to grow and be financially rewarded? Net Health may be the
perfect place for you. 
A high-growth and profitable company, we help caregivers harness data for
human health. We also honor and respect the needs of our Net Health family and
staff, which is why we offer a work-from-anywhere environment and unlimited
PTO. Our welcoming and collaborative culture paired with progressive benefits
makes Net Health the ultimate career home! 
As a leading-edge SaaS company in healthcare, we deliver solutions that help
patients get better, faster, and live more fulfilling lives. Our software and
predictive analytics cover the continuum of care, from hospital-to-home,
across various medical specialties. Come join us and start the next chapter of
your exciting career while helping others to live better lives. 
 * _World-Class Benefits That Reflect Our World-Class Culture._* 
Click Here to Learn More!:  

WorkFromAnywhere #UnlimitedPTO #ComprehensiveBenefitsPackage

EmployeeResourceGroups #CasualDressCode #PrioritizedEmployeeWellness

DiversityAndInclusion #AVoice #NewHireSupport #CareerDevelopment

EducationalAssistance #EmployeeReferralBonus #ProgressiveParentalLeave

Net Health, a leading developer of specialized EMRs across various markets, is
looking for an experienced DBA who can help support our development teams as
they build apps and services using data at scale across multiple product
lines. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of Relational Database
systems, with some exposure to the DevOps methodology, nosql/document
databases, and containerization. The candidate should be as comfortable
designing tables and indexes as they are advising development teams on the
tradeoffs between standard row based data stores, columnar database systems,
or document based databases. 
 Purpose: The Devops DBA will be responsible for working with development
teams to design and build resilient, well-performing data environments that
meet our application needs in the most efficient, economic way possible.

* Essential Job Functions: 

* Work with a cross functional team in an Agile/Scrum process to refine stories into work product that meets Net Health’s standards for quality, performance, and usefulness within project timelines.
* Be able to translate stories into needed data stores, tables, queries, and processes required to meet story needs.
* Make sure projects are built for easy verification by automated testing and easy integration into CI/CD Pipelines
* Ability to turn feedback from internal stakeholders into meaningful courses of action
* Troubleshoot and tune poorly performing queries
* Monitor usage in production environments and design and execute plans to meet our SLOs around performance.
* Troubleshoot problems and provide options for possible solutions
* Pick up new technology, frameworks, data stores, apis, and sdks with minimal oversight
* Participate in code reviews

* Specialized Knowledge, Equipment/ Software Requirements: 

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field
* Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences
* 4-5 years’ experience running production RDBMS (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc…) at scale.
* 4-5 years’ experience working with development teams designing resilient, well–performing database environments
* 2-3 year’s experience working with data systems in public cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP, etc…)
* 2-3 years’ experience with scripting language (powershell, bash, python, etc…)
* 2-3 years’ experience integrating database changes into CI/CD pipelines

* Nice to Have: 

* Experience with running databases on containers
* Experience with kubernetes
* Experience with modern source control tools and practices

Additional Info: 
EEO Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for
employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. 
 Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee
may perform other related duties as requested to meet the ongoing needs of the
organization. 
 Colorado Pay Law: If you are a Colorado resident and this role is
available in Colorado or remote, you may be eligible to receive additional
information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will
provide upon request. Please send an email to Recruiting@NetHealth.com

Job Type: Full-time

description:
Title: DevOps Engineer (AWS, CI/CD) 
Location: 100% Remote 
Duration: 6+ months 
Background Check 
Per Client’s Request: 1 Reference completed prior to Interviewing, 2nd
reference can be done during or after Interview

W2 Preferred

Our client is looking for a Devops Engineer who can assist in building out a
CI/CD pipeline in AWS. Someone who has a good understanding of build release,
deployment process, can deploy from scratch, and can guide peers on deployment
best practices. Their current environment is legacy Java, so someone who can
at least read Java code.

MUSTS: 
Devops Engineer 
CI/CD (AWS Pipeline and/or Jenkins) 
Strong Automation/Infrastructure as Code (IaC) 
CloudFormation and/or AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK) 
Strong Documentation skills 
Can read Java code

description:
Do you have the skills--and drive--to join a tech team that's working to
digitally transform a trillion-dollar industry? From test-driving the latest
technologies to creating intuitive consumer apps, Liberty Mutual is constantly
innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind
for our customers worldwide.

As a software engineer on this Customer Success team at Liberty Mutual, you'll
apply your talents in an agile environment that has the creative energy of a
start-up--and the full backing and comprehensive benefits of a Fortune 100
company.

Note: This is a range posting - Software/Sr. Software Engineer - and the final
offer will be based on the candidate's skills and experiences.

Responsibilities:

* Provide technical support to Liberty Mutual's product development teams as they use our CI/CD tool suite to build and deploy code to our internal and cloud computing environments.
* Guide developers to self-service options for resolving issues.
* Troubleshoot CI/CD platform and infrastructure automation errors, provide solutions and escalate issues as needed.
* Interface with and direct customers to other teams as needed.
* Observe trends in ticket types or questions asked and engage with product teams to provide solutions for known issues.
* Learn the inner workings of our end-to-end CI/CD software delivery environment and innovative public cloud infrastructure automation.
* Improve the developer experience: reduce obstacles and provide solutions.
* Develop automation to provide fast resolution for common inquiries.
* Create self-service documentation and utilities.
* We encourage innovative ideas to improve our development community's experience.
* Demonstrated success in Jenkins, JIRA, AWS, Pipelines
* Familiarity with CI/CD deployment tools and agile software development practices is desired, including Jira, GitHub, Bamboo, Jenkins, Artifactory, AWS, Azure, GCP Cloud Foundry
* Experience working in an agile environment utilizing Scrum, Kanban or XP.
* Strong oral and written communication skills--and a knack for explaining your decision-making process to non-engineers.
* A collaborative, adaptable working style, demonstrated initiative and the ability to prioritize your time and efforts.
* A Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline, or equivalent experience.
* Troubleshooting complex systems, and needing an understanding of cloud computing, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud engineering best practices.

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently
pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness,
inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of
roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding
profession.  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great
Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of
the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's
2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of
America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New
Graduates--as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn
more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit:
https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and
we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-
being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:
https://LMI.co/Benefits  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate
discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual
orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status,
pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or
local law.

Bachelor's Degree 
15

description:
We are currently looking for a full-time DevOps Engineer to support the
infrastructure needs of our growing team. In this 
role, you'll be the second DevOps hire and will work directly with our lead
DevOps Engineer to maintain 
the reliability, security, scalability and deployment of our platform.  

Responsibilities  

* Build, integrate, test, monitor and deploy code across multiple cloud and on-premise environments
* Build tooling to assist with maintenance, upgrades, deployments and monitoring of AWS and on-premise
* environments.
* Assist with provisioning and setting up new AWS environments for dedicated cloud installations.
* Help maintain data security policies and best practices by designing and implementing secure, immutable
* infrastructure through infrastructure as code and thoughtful security practices compatible with external standards(SOC2)

Requirements-  
* 3 to 6 years of DevOps industry experience
* Familiar with Linux, command line, bash scripting, yaml
* Experience with cloud and on-premise containerized infrastructure built with Docker, Kubernetes, Helm,
* Terraform, Packer, GitHub, and Min.IO
* Experience working with AWS cloud architecture and services such as VPC, EKS, EC2, S3, RDS
* Experience with PostgreSQL and AWS storage encryption, data at rest, and data in transit
* Familiarity defining and executing CI/CD pipelines with tools like Docker, GitHub, CircleCI
* Experience with monitoring services like DataDog is preferred

description:
Johnson & Johnson Robotics and Digital Solutions company, is recruiting for a
Software DevOps Engineer position located in Redwood City, CA.

Do you seek big, complex, ambiguous problems? Are you passionate about having
a significant impact on the experience, effectiveness, and efficiency of your
colleagues through innovative technology solutions?

Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our
employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity
employer.

Johnson & Johnson Robotics & Digital Solutions is a technology company
defining the future of medical intervention. By combining advancements in
medical robotics, instrumentation, navigation and data science, Johnson &
Johnson is building a platform technology capable of expanding the
applicability of robotics to a spectrum of medical procedures.

Position overview

Johnson & Johnson Robotics & Digital Solutions is looking for a Devops
Engineer to join a team of hardworking roboticists and software engineers who
are trying to solve some of the hardest problems in medicine today.

We are looking for an engineer to work on our growing build and automation
infrastructure that will enable new generations of platform capability. The
right candidate should be an experienced devops engineer or IT professional
who enjoys working on build and deployment infrastructure. Good command of
python and shell scripting are required as well as strong communication and
presentation skills. You will have an opportunity to lead projects from
concept to release. Engage engineers from other teams to learn what they need
and build amazing tools to make them more efficient and effective in their
day-to-day work. Your work will enable the team to design, build and service
next-generation of medical device technology faster.

Qualifications

* 
Minimum requirements

* Bachelor of Science in computer science or a similar engineering degree
* 1 year of administering Devops and/or IT infrastructures
* 1 year of Python and shell scripting experience
* Experience working with version control systems (in particular GIT)
* Power-user of Linux operating system
* Experience with CI/CD tools and build systems (Jenkins, Gitlab and similar)
* Experience working with AWS infrastructure (EC2, VPC, networking etc)

Preferred requirements

* Hands on experience building and deploying build and release infrastructures for development teams
* Experience working with Docker and Docker registries
* Experience servicing IT requests from engineering teams and a strong tack record of delivering results
* Ability to conceptualize software tools based on customer needs gathering
* Experience setting up networking and tool infrastructures inside companies

Work environment

This position operates in a professional office environment. This role
routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, and
photocopiers.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All
qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age,
national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated
against on the basis of disability.

Primary Location 
United States-California-Redwood City-150 Shoreline Dr 
Organization 
Auris Health, Inc. (6267) 
Job Function 
R&D 
Requisition ID 
2206059843W

description:
Responsibilities

Play a key role in the delivery of world-class patient care. Leverage
innovative technology to advance high-quality care. Take your career in a
rewarding new direction. At UCLA Health, you can do all this and more.

Under the direction of the Cloud Platform Services Manager, the Cloud DevOps
Engineer will be responsible for cloud infrastructure and application design
and implementation, DevOps optimizations, and 3rd party integrations. You will
apply DevSecOps principles to cloud infrastructure and is responsible for the
construction of landing zones and deployment of respective capabilities.
Additional responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Infrastructure production
* Security issues, and their underlying causes
* Maintaining and supporting current environments while identifying and executing system architecture and process improvements
* Building tooling to enable faster deployments and reliable rollbacks
* Write code and design processes to improve the delivery of our cloud instances and applications

Qualifications

Required  
* Extensive professional experience with Azure in a production environment (network, security, applications, serverless, and containers)
* Knowledgeable in cloud networking - security, identity and access management, DNS, etc.
* Eble to work with Terraform at an Enterprise level
* Strong experience with Linux system administration
* Experience with Configuration Management systems (i.e., Puppet, Ansible, Chef).
* Proven track record of supporting production systems, and able to effectively coordinate cloud infrastructure service requests and incident response
* Strong sense of ownership and can prioritize and work on tasks independently

Highly preferred  

* Professional experience with AWS.
* Experience with CI/CD systems such as Github Actions, CodeBuild/CodePipeline, or Azure DevOps
* Familiarity with Docker and Containerization of applications
* History of working in a HIPAA compliant environment

UCLA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,
color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,
disability, or protected Veteran status.

description:
RM - DevOps Engineer

100 % Remote

12+Months

Looking for only US Citizen and client is ready to provide security
clearance

Job Description

Obtain Federal Homeland Security Presidential Directive 12 “HSPD-12”
clearance while on the project.

· Expert knowledge on AWS and Terraform is a must

· Intake and resolution of production support requests such as: production
application break-fixes using Terra-Form, Ansible, and Puppet.

· Develop and deploy application upgrades based on a mutually agreed upon
release plan and time window, familiar with build systems
(Jenkins/Gitlab/BitBucket)

· Provide maintenance to comply with client security standards.

· Develop application enhancements based on Telecommunication’s application
roadmap working with modularized architect and Kubernetes

· Maintain operational documentation for the applications.

· Postgre Client knowledge

Job Type: Contract

Pay: Up to $60.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* This is 100 % Remote role and we are looking for only US Citizens. Please confirm your visa status.

Experience:

* Devops Engineer: 4 years (Preferred)
* AWS: 2 years (Preferred)
* Terraform: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

description:
See yourself at Twilio

Join the team as our next DevOps Engineer!

Who we are & why we're hiring

Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help
companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer
experiences.

Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we're on a journey to becoming
a globally antiracist company that supports diversity, equity & inclusion
wherever we do business. We employ thousands of Twilions worldwide, and we're
looking for more builders, creators, and visionaries to help fuel our growth
momentum.

About the job

This position is needed to support the hands-on operational team responsible
for design, implementation and management of our datacenter footprint across
the US and EU. We are building a world-class platform to enable Twilio's
developers to quickly deploy reliable, scalable, and secure products to Twilio
customers. As Twilio continues to grow, the team is leading the expansion of
our datacenter footprint across the globe.

Responsibilities

In this role, you'll:

* Build out world class data center facilities that support our customers worldwide
* Develop automation for processes within the team
* Identify and drive areas of improvement within our Data center management practices.
* Foster an inclusive environment and imports team members to succeed and grow.

Qualifications

Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly.
Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage
everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having
"desired" qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants
with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or
hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering
Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the
table!

Required:

* Experience with large scale datacenter projects & infrastructure rollouts
* Hands-on operational experience in a data center facility. Installation of equipment in racks, attaching connections to power and network infrastructure. Ability to coordinate these activities remotely via remote hands services.
* An understanding of computer science fundamentals and practical experience developing distributed systems.
* A passion for automation and DevOps--blending operational excellence with development best practices.
* Deep familiarity with Linux (CentOS/RHEL preferred), bash scripting, service configuration and management.
* Proficiency with one or more programming languages. Go, Ruby, Python are preferred.

Desired:

* Experience creating declarative APIs to handle physical infrastructure in a hybrid cloud environment.
* Past development projects involving backend databases or interacting with other systems via API.
* Experience providing infrastructure as a service leveraging configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible, CFEngine, etc.

Location

This role will be remote, and ideally based in the central/eastern/mountain
time zones in the USA.

What We Offer

There are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to
competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness
leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary
by location.

Twilio thinks big. Do you?

We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are
always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody
our values -- something we call Twilio Magic. Additionally, we empower
employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their
volunteering and donation efforts.

So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be
the best version of yourself, apply now!

If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open
positions.

Please note this role is open to candidates outside of Colorado as well. The
information below is provided for those hired in Colorado only.

If you are a Colorado applicant:

* The estimated pay range for this role, based in Colorado, is $99,360 - $124,200.
* Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Twilio's equity plan.

The successful candidate's starting salary will be determined based on
permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and
geographic location within the state. This role is also eligible to
participate in Twilio's equity plan and for the following benefits: health
care insurance, 401(k) retirement account, paid sick time, paid personal time
off, paid parental leave.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Twilio is proud to be
an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not
discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including
pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical
conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age,
status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability,
genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally
protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal
histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.
Additionally, Twilio participates in the E-Verify program in certain
locations, as required by law.

Twilio is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified
individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application
procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability,
please contact us at accommodation@twilio.com.

description:
What you will do:

· Be an impactful member of the Software Development team by supporting all
efforts to simplify and enhance the client experience.

· Ensure accurate and efficient execution and adherence to business and
technical requirements through detailed coding and performing unit and
software integration testing.

· Improve new and existing software by performing coding, testing, debugging,
designing and writing programs according to functional and non-functional
requirements.

· Validate software adherence with development standards by providing
knowledgeable input while leading code review sessions.

· Guide the development of software by creating and maintaining accurate
technical documentation.

· Resolve incidents and issues for production applications and web services in
accordance with identified service level agreements (SLAs) by serving as the
final escalation point for clients.

· Influence future system designs by managing system analysis and identifying
and recommending design and requirements.

· Maximize the efficiency of various systems by collaborating with internal
clients and technical and architecture teams to resolve software issues and
implement, monitor and test new software.

· Enhance department performance metrics through hands-on coaching and
mentoring of less experienced team members.

· Mitigate risks by following established configuration and change control
processes.

Required keys for success:

· Six+ years of experience with major database management systems.

· Six+ years of experience with coding, testing and design.

· Six or more years of experience with software development methodologies.

· Expert in Voice, Data, Video and wireless technologies.

· In-depth understanding of software design patterns and principles.

· History of identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the
actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the
system.

· Proven ability to deal with ambiguous or incomplete information when
evaluating alternatives and making recommendations.

· Track record of working with teams and managing individual tasks with the
ability to pick up complex concepts and processes quickly.

· Creative and abstract thinking skills that can envision and design
innovative solutions to business opportunities and challenges.

· Solid ability to design, develop and deploy solutions and to deliver
projects on time with minimal direction.

· Extensive technical knowledge of Information Technology field and computer
systems.

· Demonstrated ability to take the lead on the most complex projects with
experience sharing knowledge, resolving conflict and creating a consensus.

· Effective written and spoken English communication skills with all levels of
an organization.

How you will stand out from the crowd:

· Expert scripting ability using various languages, including Python, Django,
JSON, XML and Bash.

· Experience using source control tools, such as Git/GitLab.

· History of working in a Gitflow development workflow.

· Understanding of server and database configurations, including Oracle, MySQL
and Postgres.

· Working Knowledge of web services, simple network management protocol (SNMP)
and transmission control protocol/ user datagram protocol (TCP/UDP).

· Skilled in operating systems, including RedHat and CentOS.

· InfoVista InSight and Spirent VisionWorks/Analytics experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
Job Description Summary

Looking for someone who has prior DevOps CI/CD pipeline implementation
experience using Ansible, git and gitrunner. Also, contributes to the
adaption, and/or implementation and post implementation support of short- and
long-term software solutions to business and technology needs. Reviews system
requirements and business processes; tests, debugs and implements software
solutions. Works independently in a fast paced environment on moderately
complex issues.

Essential Job Functions

* Provides software support or technical support services typically in a defined moderately complex project
* Conducts a wide range of moderately complex technical analyses to ensure that software meets or exceeds specified standards and end-user requirements
* Reviews system requirements and business processes; debugs and implements software solutions. Makes recommendations on process improvements
* Determines software support requirements
* Reviews software policies, standards and procedures and make recommendations for change.
* Leads users in the planning of user acceptance testing, alpha and beta testing
* Creates test data files with valid and invalid records to thoroughly test program logic and verify system flow
* Manage environments, Implement/Deploy software upgrade to various environments and support post implementation.

Required Skills:

* Has work experience in working in Agile based development
* Has work experience on any Cloud platform with Kubernetes and Openshift
* Windows 2016+ working experience
* Has fail knowledge of Java based code to debug the code and then work with dev to address the issues
* Familiar with VM's, Vlan, F5, Firewall concepts
* Good hands on experience in Powershell, Python, Ansible, GitHub
* Hands on experience with Git
* Hands on experience with Ansible and gitlab runner
* Hands on experience on Splunk and writing custom queries to support application monitoring
* Monitoring tool hands on experience for tools like Dynatace, Appdynamics
* Understand the WAF security implementation
* Well versed with Network terminology, Firewall
* Hands on experience in writing SQL scripts

Other Job Duties

* Creates Support approach, Estimation, Software Deployment Guide, Supplemental or non- functional specification
* Defines and documents software installation and configuration processes.
* Coordinates and communicates applications support activities with key stakeholders
* Reviews platform requirements and coordinates with vendors and other IT groups in building/maintaining hardware, 3rd party software, patches and network related components to comply with IT standards and procedures.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

Required Experience

* Requires practical knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience.
* Requires 4+ years minimum prior relevant experience.

Education

* Bachelor's Degree

Thanx and regards

Pinky

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $50.00 - $60.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: One location

description:
We are currently looking for a full-time DevOps Engineer to support the
infrastructure needs of our growing team. In this 
role, you'll be the second DevOps hire and will work directly with our lead
DevOps Engineer to maintain 
the reliability, security, scalability and deployment of our platform.  

Responsibilities  

* Build, integrate, test, monitor and deploy code across multiple cloud and on-premise environments
* Build tooling to assist with maintenance, upgrades, deployments and monitoring of AWS and on-premise
* environments.
* Assist with provisioning and setting up new AWS environments for dedicated cloud installations.
* Help maintain data security policies and best practices by designing and implementing secure, immutable
* infrastructure through infrastructure as code and thoughtful security practices compatible with external standards(SOC2)

Requirements-  
* 3 to 6 years of DevOps industry experience
* Familiar with Linux, command line, bash scripting, yaml
* Experience with cloud and on-premise containerized infrastructure built with Docker, Kubernetes, Helm,
* Terraform, Packer, GitHub, and Min.IO
* Experience working with AWS cloud architecture and services such as VPC, EKS, EC2, S3, RDS
* Experience with PostgreSQL and AWS storage encryption, data at rest, and data in transit
* Familiarity defining and executing CI/CD pipelines with tools like Docker, GitHub, CircleCI
* Experience with monitoring services like DataDog is preferred

description:
Equivalent Experience  

Description: 
Actalent is offering an extraordinary opportunity to be part of a small,
innovative team with a low process, high throughput culture. The team is 
working on Defense Orchestrator, which manages policy and configuration of
Security Business Group's firewalls. We are looking for an energetic 
DevOps engineer to contribute to all parts of our infrastructure stack. The
DevOps Engineer will be responsible for the production process, including 
continuous delivery of features, infrastructure automation, configuration
management, high availability, and related tooling. Candidates will also be 
expected to contribute to software development and testing. 
Responsibilities 
Participate as a technical contributor on a fast paced project team of
engineers involved in the development of SaaS security products; 
Continuously evolve cloud infrastructure, making it more resilient, scalable
and secure; 
Aggressively automate any and all manual procedures; 
Partner with the engineering organization to converge on common infrastructure
setup, tooling and deployment processes; 
Research and recommend technologies to help further product goals; 
Create innovative solutions for complex technical problems; 
Respond to and resolve infrastructure related escalations. 
Manage and participate in on-call rotation, rotated through engineering team 
Interface with the greater technical support team  

Skills: 
devops, object oriented development, aws, deployment, release management  

Top Skills Details: 
devops,object oriented development  

Additional Skills & Qualifications: 
Required Experience and Skills 
Proven ability to manage builds, release, and deployment in a SaaS environment
with a strict SLA; 
Extensive and proven experience with running production software in AWS; 
Strong working knowledge of Linux based systems; 
SaaS deployment and upgrade automation using configuration management tools
such as Chef and/or Puppet; 
Infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform and CloudFormation; 
Automated application of configuration changes across multi-use environments
(dev, test, staging, prod, etc); 
Create and manage a safe deployment procedure of new product changes across
multiple environments; 
Ability to build SaaS monitoring solutions that detect and automatically
remediate system faults; 
Setting up, configuring, maintaining and evolving a continuous delivery
environment using CI tools such as Jenkins/TeamCity/Bamboo/etc; 
General purpose language such as Ruby/Python plus shell scripting. 
SaaS operations such as maintenance, escalations & triage; 
Debugging and troubleshooting in a distributed environment; 
BS/CS with 5+ years of DevOps experience. 
Desired Experience and Skills 
Agile software development; 
Development experience in an object oriented language; 
Team player, with strong communication skills.  

Experience Level: 
Expert Level  

About Actalent: 
Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and
services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to
help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are
making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and
sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes
consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous
development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company
of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions.  

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all
applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national
origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity,
genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

An employer is looking for a highly skilled Technical Support Analyst to join
one of our largest national healthcare clients for a remote contract
opportunity. In this role you will work to support their growing application
development team focused on medical record management. This team supports
internal employees using this application on a day to day basis. In this
position you will be writing stored procedures, running queries, doing
performance tuning and mapping data. This role will also include doing some
DevOps work, including participating in deployments and building out
configurations. You'll be supporting a few different teams in this role,
including their internal development team along with their client.  

Responsibilities:  

* Serves as a key resource on complex and/or critical issues.
* Solves complex problems and develops innovative solutions.
* Performs complex conceptual analyses.
* Reviews work performed by others and provides recommendations for improvement.
* Forecasts and plans resource requirements.
* Authorizes deviations from standards.
* Motivates and inspires other team members.

* 
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
* 5-7 years of technical application support experience, using Service Now and/or equivalent
* Knowledge of FTP/SFTP and file transfer protocols
* Basic knowledge of Unix/Linux commands and shell scripting.
* Experience in DevOps activities
* Knowledge of writing SQL queries, database tables and views

* 
DESIRED SKILLS

Previous Healthcare experience

description:
Department Summary  

DISH is transforming the future of connectivity. We're doing it by building
the country's first virtualized, standalone 5G wireless network from scratch.
The foundation of a connected world, it's a network free of the limitations of
the past, and flexible enough to satisfy all the social, economic and
transformative needs of the changing world.  

Job Duties and Responsibilities  

DISH Wireless is seeking a CI/CD DevOps Engineer II to build and manage the
automation process for the continuous delivery (CI), continuous delivery (CD),
and continuous validation (CV) of the 5G Network functions. This person would
work closely with network functions ISVs, testers, and DISH's engineering &
operations teams to integrate, test, and deploy the artifacts necessary to
realize zero-touch operations of DISH's 5G network.  

Day-to-day job responsibilities:  

* Design, develop and maintain features and functionalities of DISH 5G Network CI/CD pipelines 
* Configure and manage the tools necessary to successfully deploy new features into the 5G network 
* Create the necessary feedback loops to communicate the status of the pipeline to the stakeholders 
* Configure and maintain the Git Repo, Docker registry, CI tool, configuration and deployment tools 
* 5. Learn, evaluate and implement new technologies to further our quality and delivery capabilities 
* Work in a Scrum team to add functionalities to the CI/CD process 
* Work within an Agile development framework to deliver high-quality software 
* Create process to analyze logs as a way to determine the health of the feature deployment 
* Design and develop state-of-the-art approaches to solving complex quality issues 
* Communicate clearly with Product Owners, Developers and management to establish understanding of issues to address and proposed solutions 

LI-HMM

Skills, Experience and Requirements  

The successful CI/CD DevOps Engineer II will have:  

* The ideal candidate has 2-4 years of experience in a related role with mid- to large-sized companies and has demonstrated the following: 
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical degree 
* At least 2 years of experience using Cloud technologies such as AWS, VMC, GCP, and/or Azure 
* At least 2 years of experience using CI/CD and DevOps tools such as Java, Java Script, Python, Grafana, Gitlab, GitLab-CI, Jira, Kubernetes, Docker, Ansible, Splunk 
* Experience deploying Cloud Native Applications, building and managing microservices, and creating tools to monitor real time metrics in the pipeline 
* Experience deploying Docker containers in multiple Kubernetes clusters using deployment strategies such as Blue/Green, Canary, Rolling 
* Experience building pipelines as code using YAML specs 
* Experience using Jira, Confluence, or similar bug tracking and documentation tools 
* Demonstrated ability to identify, troubleshoot, diagnose and fully define problems 

Salary Range  

Compensation: $75,600.00/Year - $124,200.00/Year 
Benefits  

From versatile health perks to new career opportunities, check out our
benefits on our careers website .  

Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may
include a drug test.

description:
Come join Tyler Technologies as a DevOps Engineer! The Tyler Cloud Platform
team is looking for Engineers to build and run the services and infrastructure
that power the platform.  

This position will work an evening schedule to improve our team 's ability
to support our clients as broadly throughout the day as possible.  

We are hiring high quality engineers with a diverse set of experiences and
skill sets for positions on the cloud platform team delivering the vision of
Connected Communities. The strongest candidates will have a solid operations
expertise and demonstrated software development experience on large scale
cloud infrastructure. Our clients count on us to provide exceptional
availability, scalability, and security for services and infrastructure. As an
DevOps Engineer, you'll be on a team of engineers whose mission it is to build
and improve Tyler's most critical cloud services.  

Are you up to the challenge?

As a part of Tyler's corporate staff, you will make an impact on outcomes that
affect various areas of the company. Your work will ultimately support our
team members, clients, stakeholders, and the public sector.

Location

Remote

Responsibilities

* Architect, author, champion, and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, and security of Tyler's Cloud Platform services.
* _Design, build_* _ and manage_ systems, infrastructure and applications through automation that support self sufficiency
* Deploy, support, and monitor new and existing services, platforms, and application stacks
* Use scalable testing to measure, report, tune, and optimize system performance
* _Develop tools to improve our ability to rapidly deploy and effectively monitor services in a large-scale Kubernetes environment._
* Participate in periodic on-call duties
* Recommend new solutions and technologies
* Collaborate with team and others to share operational best practices
* Function well in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Cover after hours support needs with core hours from 5pm to 1am Pacific Time, M-F
* Provide an escalation path to the rest of the team after hours.

Qualifications

* 3+ years in a UNIX-based large-scale web operations role.
* _5+ years programming experience in Python, Perl, Node, Java/Scala, or C#_
* 3+ years designing and implementing, large-scale AWS production workloads
* _Experience with large scale Kubernetes architectures and configuration_
* Expert scripting knowledge, specifically for systems automation
* UNIX/Linux systems administration background
* Knowledge of most of these: data structures, relational and non-relational databases, networking, Linux internals, file systems, web architecture, and related topics
* Ability to guide technical teams through design and implementation across an organization
* Previous experience working an evening shift with geographically distributed coworkers.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills (including listening, speaking, and writing) and ability to work well in a diverse, team-focused environment with other DevOps, Engineers, Product Managers, etc.

Preferred Experience
* Experienced in configuration and deployment of containers at scale in AWS EKS, ECS, and Fargate
* Experienced in configuration, management, and monitoring of DataDog
* Experience authoring infrastructure using tools such as cloud-formation or terraform
* Experienced in configuration and management of CI/CD tooling like Github Actions, Jenkins or CircleCI
* Experienced database engineer with MySQL, specifically Aurora

State Specific Salary Range Disclosure Requirements for Colorado,

Connecticut, and Nevada

Salary will generally fall between $55,537 - $100,000 before adjustment for
geographic differences. Recruiter can confirm if position is incentive
eligible.

Great Place to Work & Grow Your Career

Come join us as we transform the public sector! Our mission, vision, and
values guide everything we do. We're also frequently recognized as a great
workplace locally and nationally. See our many awards and accolades.

Taking Care of You & Your Family

Your health and well-being are important to us. That's why we invest in our
team members by offering competitive benefits to support their health and
financial wellness. Learn more about how we care for our people.

Tyler is subject to regulations, guidelines, and/or client requirements
relating to the qualifications of Tyler personnel performing certain client
work. Because of the nature of this position, it is a requirement that the
candidate can successfully pass a federal background check at the time an
offer is extended and over the course of employment with Tyler.

Job Description:

* 
Essential Job Functions

* Solid understanding of source management, application lifecycle management, build management and package management tools TFS, Azure DevOps/VSTS, Visual Studio, Maven.
* Experienced in leading efforts to implement continuous improvements to all areas of pipeline automation and infrastructure services in order to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of overall DevOps capability.

* Knowledge of cloud environments.

Basic Qualifications
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience

* 6+ years of IT technical experience in product design and support

* 3+ years of experience as a DevOps engineer integrating tools like Jenkins, or other deployment tools

Other Qualifications

{"advice": "Take care of the people that made what Gainwell is today. Specifically, those that endured the past 10yrs with negligent predecessors (not including EDS), not treating them like people, and not paying them a fair salary. If you have employees that are top notch, you should get their salary at the midpoint for their range or you will end up losing people that have a long history with the systems we implement and maintain, otherwise you will lose them.", "cons": "The cons... Well, if you were part of EDS back in 2009 when HP bought the company, everything went downhill from there. We went from EDS to HP to HPE and spun off to CSC and became DXC.

The best thing about DXC selling off the healthcare and life sciences to a joint venture capitalist company is that we were freed from years of employee neglect, no bonus or salary increases.

Gainwell is still working to get peoples salaries to where they should be and have made significant progress in doing that.

Coming into Gainwell now, make sure you get top dollar for your skills and negotiate. We need ~3k people for all the work in the pipeline.", "countHelpful": 9, "employerResponses": [], "employmentStatus": "REGULAR", "featured": null, "isCurrentJob": true, "jobTitle": {"text": "Advisor, Project Management"}, "lengthOfEmployment": 20, "pros": "Gainwell is privately owned and was purchased from DXC. The company's focus is on healthcare solutions for Medicaid, Pharmacy Benefit Manager, and Data Analytics. The company is about 18 months old and is doing great things in the healthcare market space.

They are very focused on the employee experience. The promote a real work-life balance and provide many perks (not benefits) that are free, fun, and really useful to the employee.

The company is always looking for people will skills in healthcare systems, Medicare and Medicaid. If you are coming into Gainwell as a new employee, they do pay a premium for good talent.

The health benefits are good and typically year after year you would see the increased cost of healthcare benefits passed onto the employee. Gainwell is self-insured and has taken on the bulk of the increase rather than pass it on to the employee.

It is a great place to work and most of us work remotely from home and there are some office spaces depending on where you live.

We also have Flex vacation, no set number of days or weeks. You can take time off when you need it or want it. there are some guidelines around it but you can easily take 4-5 weeks a year being a 1st year employee.", "ratingBusinessOutlook": "POSITIVE", "ratingCareerOpportunities": 5, "ratingCeo": "APPROVE", "ratingCompensationAndBenefits": 4, "ratingCultureAndValues": 5, "ratingOverall": 5, "ratingRecommendToFriend": "POSITIVE", "ratingSeniorLeadership": 5, "ratingWorkLifeBalance": 5, "reviewDateTime": "2022-04-19T14:27:27.157", "reviewId": 62990269, "summary": "Healthcare and Medicaid Solutions"}
