description:
WE ARE UNABLE TO OFFER SPONSORSHIP OR THIRD PARTY REPRESENTATION FOR THIS
POSITION

Consultis, a premier Technical Solutions Provider and IT Staffing Firm with
the single focus of pairing the right candidate with the right employment
opportunity is currently searching for a DevOps Engineer (Hybrid onsite)
for a Direct Hire (FTE) opening with our South Florida based client.

Position Overview:

You will be a part of the Infrastructure & Operations team. You will play a
key role in promoting and assisting in evolving DevOps with best practices and
continuous process improvements to establish a mature DevOps
environment/program and DevOps governance. You will work with a DevOps team in
administration and management of automated build/release management tools and
oversee continuous integration and delivery pipeline. You will be expected to
demonstrate your leadership mindset, solid operational experience, ability to
problem-solve, knowledge of latest industry trends, and be highly innovative.
You will partner with development and quality engineering management and other
technical staff in the application design for software as a service delivery.
You will work on projects requiring technical decision making and providing
input to delivery schedules. You will ensure ongoing application support for
development and live production systems by diagnosing and resolving highly
complex issues. You will identify, recommend, and implement options for
improving performance, maintainability, and operability. You will also update
existing practices and procedures.

Requirements/Responsibilities:

* Possess expert technical understanding of the intersection of development and operations (DevOps), monitoring and management tools, and deployment processes and tools.
* Work to develop and build a highly effective and mature DevOps system.
* Work with supervisor to assign and monitor work of junior technical personnel, ensuring that application infrastructure development and deployment is done in the best possible way, and implements quality control and review systems throughout the development and deployment processes.
* Identify, evaluate, and execute preventive measures to minimize/avoid impact to the customer’s experience.
* Implement proactive monitoring, alerting, trend analysis.
* Perform analysis and approval of new code through security and performance gates that you will design and develop for feature-complete software. Be an advocate for security and performance standards in the organization.
* Lead and inspire a team of DevOps engineers.
* Lead the team’s adherence to ITIL and other audited regulatory compliance (PII) programs.
* Update management in case of critical incidents and act as a point of contact for other related communications.
* Work within IT and Technical Operations, business stakeholders and with vendors, to successfully identify, prioritize, and resolve issues and provide subject matter expertise for enhancements, developments, and operational improvements.
* Ensure system technical specifications, process, procedures, runbooks, SOPs, and infrastructure requirements definitions based on conceptual design are maintained and high-quality for all technical and non-technical deliverables to a wider organizational audience.
* Work to ensure the development of our SaaS public and private cloud infrastructure are conducted in cost-conscious ways, using 'infrastructure as code' and automated environment provisioning tools and techniques.
* Participate in the full software and infrastructure development life cycle process including requirements analysis and design implementation.
* Perform leadership work to accomplish tasks and projects within defined timelines and in a professional manner in alignment with active standards.
* Keep abreast of technical trends and develops and incorporates them within assignments as appropriate, and recommend improvements and changes to supervisor and team.
* Assist project teams with technical issues in the planning phase of sites or project development efforts.
* Work with team members and other systems engineers to make improvements.

Required Qualification or Skills:
* 3+ years of experience in a Senior DevOps Engineer or similar role.
* 3-5 years of experience working within a modern web-based environment. 
* Cloud provider experience (i.e., AWS).
* Proficiency in building pipelines using a CI/CD tool such as AWS.
* Strong knowledge of security practices, TLS, and data encryption (AWS KMS or similar).
* Knowledge of the Kubernetes ecosystem and experience creating and troubleshooting Kubernetes workloads.
* Experience with scripting languages such as Bash and Python. 
* Understanding of security controls and configurations for SOC2 compliance.
* Experience with Atlassian tools Jira and Confluence.
* Must understand and be able to support Agile methodology.
* Able to quickly identify and drive to the optimal solution when presented with a series of constraints.
* College degree preferred.
* A demonstrated leadership mindset with solid operational experience.

WE ARE UNABLE TO OFFER SPONSORSHIP OR THIRD PARTY REPRESENTATION FOR THIS
POSITION

description:
Do you have the skills--and drive--to join a tech team that's working to
digitally transform a trillion-dollar industry? From test-driving the latest
technologies to creating intuitive consumer apps, Liberty Mutual is constantly
innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind
for our customers worldwide.

As a software engineer on this Customer Success team at Liberty Mutual, you'll
apply your talents in an agile environment that has the creative energy of a
start-up--and the full backing and comprehensive benefits of a Fortune 100
company.

Note: This is a range posting - Software/Sr. Software Engineer - and the final
offer will be based on the candidate's skills and experiences.

Responsibilities:

* Provide technical support to Liberty Mutual's product development teams as they use our CI/CD tool suite to build and deploy code to our internal and cloud computing environments.
* Guide developers to self-service options for resolving issues.
* Troubleshoot CI/CD platform and infrastructure automation errors, provide solutions and escalate issues as needed.
* Interface with and direct customers to other teams as needed.
* Observe trends in ticket types or questions asked and engage with product teams to provide solutions for known issues.
* Learn the inner workings of our end-to-end CI/CD software delivery environment and innovative public cloud infrastructure automation.
* Improve the developer experience: reduce obstacles and provide solutions.
* Develop automation to provide fast resolution for common inquiries.
* Create self-service documentation and utilities.
* We encourage innovative ideas to improve our development community's experience.
* Demonstrated success in Jenkins, JIRA, AWS, Pipelines
* Familiarity with CI/CD deployment tools and agile software development practices is desired, including Jira, GitHub, Bamboo, Jenkins, Artifactory, AWS, Azure, GCP Cloud Foundry
* Experience working in an agile environment utilizing Scrum, Kanban or XP.
* Strong oral and written communication skills--and a knack for explaining your decision-making process to non-engineers.
* A collaborative, adaptable working style, demonstrated initiative and the ability to prioritize your time and efforts.
* A Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline, or equivalent experience.
* Troubleshooting complex systems, and needing an understanding of cloud computing, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud engineering best practices.

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently
pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness,
inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of
roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding
profession.  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great
Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of
the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's
2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of
America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New
Graduates--as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn
more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit:
https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and
we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-
being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:
https://LMI.co/Benefits  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate
discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual
orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status,
pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or
local law.

Bachelor's Degree

description:
The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for assisting the Company in the
configuration, administration, monitoring and maintenance Company’s existing
and future software server, software, network and associated technologies with
an emphasis on employing cloud based service providers and operating a hybrid
architecture consisting of internal, external, and partner based technology
resources.

Required Qualifications

· The DevOps Engineer will create, deploy, monitor, scale and secure
infrastructure and applications with focus on automating as much as possible.

· This role will work with other engineers to evolve the company's CI/CD
capabilities and will play a key role in the implementation of DevOps
processes and tooling

· This role is key to helping the teams in the engineering organization be
successful in their jobs

· Ensure availability, performance, scalability, and security of deployed
infrastructure

· Build and maintain operations software which automates the configuration,
provisioning, deployment, and monitoring of our core products

· Build and maintain our production infrastructure to ensure ongoing
reliability while maximizing development team efficiency

· Develop automation frameworks for public cloud infrastructure deployments

· Monitor, troubleshoot and debug infrastructure, network, operating system,
and system performance issues

· Maintenance, management, and streamlining of all our CI/CD processes

· Participate in architecture planning sessions with development team

· Work closely with developers and QA teams to understand how to improve their
processes and deliver high quality software more effectively.

Position Qualifications

· A minimum of 4 years of experience with system administration on Linux
machines

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Docker or other containerization
technologies

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Terraform

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using AWS

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Kubernetes

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Jenkins or similar CI/CD Tools

· Experience with Ansible, Helm, and Git

· Experience with Cloud Networking and Load Balancer Technologies (AWS ELB,
HAProxy, etc.)

· Experience with maintaining monitoring tools like Grafana, Prometheus,
InfluxDB, and Telegraf

· Ability to critically think and provide solutions to problems you have not
encountered before

· Fluency in at least two programming languages (i.e. Ruby, Python, etc.)

· Experience with continuous integration / deployment (CI/CD) in a high
availability environment

· Ability to work effectively with distributed teams using collaboration tools
and without face-to-face communication

The selected candidate will join a team who values work life balance and
professional growth equally. You will be supported as you continue to grow in
your career and will be given every resource to succeed. Interested candidates
are encouraged to apply directly.

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

description:
Sr. DevOps Engineer 
Full Time 
Remote

Salary - $130 to $140K Year

Work for a well - established record management firm located in the Florida
area!

Summary:

The Senior DevOps Engineer position operates as a critical role within the
engineering team and the company's software development lifecycle applying
industry standard software engineering and Agile development principles to
architect, build, deploy, and monitor software on the company's cloud hosted
microservices platform. This position is responsible for designing and
deploying the platform components that accelerate delivery of the company's
software to clients and markets. This senior role is responsible for
designing, architecting, and implementing all aspects of Infrastructure as
Code (IaC), including Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
pipelines and cloud services that comprise our platform and related software
products. Additionally, this position is responsible for the automated Release
Management process. This position works closely with the front-end, back-end,
and site reliability development roles to ensure the platform operates at or
above industry standards for security, reliability, and performance. Finally,
this position is responsible for continually researching, evaluating, and
recommending new frameworks and technologies that can protect or expand the
company's product and technology competitive advantage.

Education and/or Experience

· BS/BA in MIS, Computer Science or science related field required

· 2-3 years of experience in architecting and coding microservices in AWS
required

· 2-3 years of experience managing Kubernetes clusters

· 2-3 years of experience creating and maintaining DevOps pipelines

· 2-3 years of experience working with serverless event driven technologies

· 4+ years of experience in back-end/automation development required

· AWS Professional or Specialty certification required

· Kubernetes CKA certification preferred

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

· Strong knowledge of and ability to configure, install and automate AWS
services

· Strong knowledge of industry standard development practices, particularly in
IaC, security, reliability, and performance disciplines

· Strong knowledge of at least one programming language

· Awareness of critical concepts in DevOps and Agile principles

· Intermediate knowledge of networking including basic subnet masking

· Excellent organizational, interpersonal, written, and verbal communication
skills

Responsibilities

· Work effectively in agile frameworks with product and engineering team

· Responsible for all aspects of platform design and deploy documentation
including security, reliability, and performance monitoring.

· Codify and maintain all enterprise architecture (infrastructure as code)

· Strive for continuous improvement and build continuous integration,
continuous development, and constant deployment pipelines

· Mentor all members of the engineering team to expand their knowledge and
skills regarding platform engineering best practices, techniques, and
technologies.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Azure: 3 years (Preferred)
* AWS: 3 years (Preferred)
* Kubernetes: 3 years (Preferred)
* DevOps: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

description:
eNGINE builds Technical Teams. We are a Solutions and Placement firm
shaped by decades of interaction with Technical professionals. Our inspiration
is continuous learning and engagement with the markets we serve, the talent we
represent, and the teams we build. Our Consulting Workforce is encouraged to
enjoy career fulfillment in the form of challenging projects, schedule
flexibility, and paid training/certifications. Successful outcomes start and
finish with eNGINE.

eNGINE is hiring a pair of 100% remote DevOps Engineers with a focus on
DACPAC deployments & Azure DevOps pipelines for an initial customer engagement
with one of our healthcare vertical customers.

You'll be part of a team responsible for creating & deploying sustainable
CI/CD solutions in collaboration with architecture & engineering teams.

What we need:

* 3+ years of Azure pipeline experience (YAML & DevOps Classic)
* 2+ years of Ansible/Chef/Puppet experience in an enterprise enviornment
* 2+ years of Powershell / Python experience
* 2+ years of experience with SQL Server & SQL Server Data Tools
* Experience with blue/green deployment strategies
* Must be willing to work Eastern Standard Time (EST) hours

For finer details on this role, please apply today!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $135,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Azure: 3 years (Required)
* Microsoft SQL Server: 4 years (Required)
* CI/CD: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

description:
Technical Analyst - DevOps

K3 helps companies easily manage complex data streams and integrations without
having to rely on developers. We’re focused on enterprises with increasing
amounts of data to manage, the need to move fast, and deliver sustainable
solutions. K3 gives users a seat at the table in these complex environments.
We have had great success on Wall St. and are now increasingly solving similar
problems in new domains.

Our Technical Analysts wear many hats. They assist on customer projects and
training, run our infrastructure in AWS, investigate bugs, and guide our
product roadmap.

We are currently looking for analysts with a focus on DevOps in AWS.

* Help manage our infrastructure on AWS - (ec2/RDS/ElasticBeanstalk/CloudFormation and more)
* Support project teams with AWS deployments and maintenance
* Maintain knowledge base for internal and customer consumption
* Automate software deployment, configuration, and monitoring processes
* Troubleshoot customer technical and data issues

Being a technical analyst at BroadPeak is as much about communication and
thoughtfulness as it is about technology. In this role you need to be
relentless in figuring out how new things work.

Skills Required:

* MUST enjoy discovering the details of complex systems and understanding how they work.
* MUST have demonstrated experience in AWS DevOps technologies
* Communication of technical details to a less technical people
* Comfortable working from the command line
* Experience with Linux environments
* You get a buzz from an environment that goes from fast to slow to fast again
* “Select * from” is the start of a wonderful investigative journey

About Us

Our headquarters are in NYC but we have always worked in a distributed manner.

We measure goals and delivery, not time spent at a desk.

We have a "no policy" holiday. Just get your stuff done.

Our people work on multiple areas, continuously refine processes, and
participate in the financial success of the company.

This job is based in NYC in our Flatiron district office but would be remote
for the time being.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,286.00 - $116,923.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

COVID-19 considerations: 
We are all fully working remotely for the time being. Remote working was a
seamless shift for us.

Experience:

* AWS: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Department Summary  

DISH is transforming the future of connectivity. We're doing it by building
the country's first virtualized, standalone 5G wireless network from scratch.
The foundation of a connected world, it's a network free of the limitations of
the past, and flexible enough to satisfy all the social, economic and
transformative needs of the changing world.  

Job Duties and Responsibilities  

DISH Wireless is seeking a CI/CD DevOps Engineer II to build and manage the
automation process for the continuous delivery (CI), continuous delivery (CD),
and continuous validation (CV) of the 5G Network functions. This person would
work closely with network functions ISVs, testers, and DISH's engineering &
operations teams to integrate, test, and deploy the artifacts necessary to
realize zero-touch operations of DISH's 5G network.  

Day-to-day job responsibilities:  

* Design, develop and maintain features and functionalities of DISH 5G Network CI/CD pipelines 
* Configure and manage the tools necessary to successfully deploy new features into the 5G network 
* Create the necessary feedback loops to communicate the status of the pipeline to the stakeholders 
* Configure and maintain the Git Repo, Docker registry, CI tool, configuration and deployment tools 
* 5. Learn, evaluate and implement new technologies to further our quality and delivery capabilities 
* Work in a Scrum team to add functionalities to the CI/CD process 
* Work within an Agile development framework to deliver high-quality software 
* Create process to analyze logs as a way to determine the health of the feature deployment 
* Design and develop state-of-the-art approaches to solving complex quality issues 
* Communicate clearly with Product Owners, Developers and management to establish understanding of issues to address and proposed solutions 

LI-HMM

Skills, Experience and Requirements  

The successful CI/CD DevOps Engineer II will have:  

* The ideal candidate has 2-4 years of experience in a related role with mid- to large-sized companies and has demonstrated the following: 
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical degree 
* At least 2 years of experience using Cloud technologies such as AWS, VMC, GCP, and/or Azure 
* At least 2 years of experience using CI/CD and DevOps tools such as Java, Java Script, Python, Grafana, Gitlab, GitLab-CI, Jira, Kubernetes, Docker, Ansible, Splunk 
* Experience deploying Cloud Native Applications, building and managing microservices, and creating tools to monitor real time metrics in the pipeline 
* Experience deploying Docker containers in multiple Kubernetes clusters using deployment strategies such as Blue/Green, Canary, Rolling 
* Experience building pipelines as code using YAML specs 
* Experience using Jira, Confluence, or similar bug tracking and documentation tools 
* Demonstrated ability to identify, troubleshoot, diagnose and fully define problems 

Salary Range  

Compensation: $75,600.00/Year - $124,200.00/Year 
Benefits  

From versatile health perks to new career opportunities, check out our
benefits on our careers website .  

Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may
include a drug test.

description:
Company Description

Job Description

Love cutting-edge tech? We do too.

We may be the most important Internet company you've never heard of, and at
Epsilon we do more than collect and store data. We help some of the world's
biggest brands solve meaningful problems on a massive scale--and have fun
doing it.

As a member of the Linux Systems Engineering team, you will work in a group
that is focused on efficiency, project work, compliance, standards,
situational awareness and readiness. You'll be a critical part of a fast-
moving, innovative team, providing support and expertise where needed. You
will work independently with little to no guidance in some situations as well
as working with the team in full collaboration.

What You'll Do:

* Participate in engineering, deploying, and maintaining solutions and services for internal customers.
* Act as a technical liaison to one or more internal company divisions.
* Investigate and troubleshoot TIER 3 issues with network, server, and application infrastructure.
* Communicate issues to stakeholders effectively and in a timely fashion.
* Provide documentation of configuration and troubleshooting procedures to facilitate other team members and teams within the IT organization.
* Provide after-hours support when required, and respond to outages, incidents, and alerts.

About You :
* Able to do your best work in a team setting and autonomously
* Well-developed interpersonal skills.
* Owns a problem to the end
* Proud to share in team's success
* Wants to grow a career with a great company.

* 
What You'll Bring:
* BS in Computer Science or related technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
* At least two years of professional experience building, configuring, and administering CentOS/RHEL in an enterprise environment.
* Detail oriented and highly observant, with excellent organization and time management skills.
* Highly effective communicator for both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Excellent data analysis skills.
* Excellent Linux command line skills.
* Experience with writing and testing programs with interpreted languages such as Python, Perl, or Ruby.
* Experience with automation and configuration (Puppet, Ansible, Salt, etc).
* Working knowledge of the Git version control system.
* Experience with building Docker images and orchestrating containers (Swarm/Kubernetes).
* Ability to troubleshoot difficult problems within OS, network, and application layers.
* Ability to produce results amid multiple shifting/competing priorities.
* Independent worker, requiring little day-to-day direction from management.
* Agile experience a plus (Kanban, Scrum, etc)

Qualifications

Additional Information

When you 're one of us, you get to run with the best. For decades, we've
been helping marketers from the world's top brands personalize experiences for
millions of people with our cutting-edge technology, solutions and services.
Epsilon's best-in-class identity gives brands a clear, privacy-safe view of
their customers, which they can use across our suite of digital media,
messaging and loyalty solutions. We process 400+ billion consumer actions each
day and hold many patents of proprietary technology, including real-time
modeling languages and consumer privacy advancements. Thanks to the work of
every employee, Epsilon has been consistently recognized as industry-leading
by Forrester, Adweek and the MRC. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe,
Epsilon is a global company with more than 8,000 employees around the world.
Check out a few of these resources to learn more about what makes Epsilon so
EPIC:

* Culture: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/our-culture-epsilon
* DE&I: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/diversity-equity-inclusion
* CSR: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility
* Life at Epsilon: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/epic-blog

Great People Deserve Great Benefits

We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the
world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect
competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to
advance your career.

Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon's policy is not to
discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived
race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national
origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion,
creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including
transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other
characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Epsilon
also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these
protected categories.

Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to
complete the application process.

LI-AM1

description:
Description

Who We *Are

Insurity is a leading property and casualty insurance software and data
analytics providers, working with some of the world's largest insurers,
brokers, and MGAs, including 15 of the top 25 P&C carriers in the US. With
1400+ team members globally, 7 office locations, and 300+ customers, we have a
deep understanding of the insurance business, unparalleled technology
expertise, and a singular focus of delivering a simplified insurance
experience to our customers.

Insurity 's next DevOps Specialist

As part of the DevOps Development team, our DevOps Specialist will help mature
and improve our existing product build, packaging, and deployment processes.
They will also collaborate and help pave the way to adopt new processes using
a wide variety of tools including Azure DevOps, TFS, PowerShell, c#, APIs,
Azure - and many more - that deploy to Azure, AWS, internal, and client-hosted
platforms. It's rare we do the same thing twice - but if so, we automate it!
We are all about making our existing processes better while adopting current
and emerging tools to make everyone's lives easier. We are a team of
experienced and sharp developers with a DevOps mentality.

What You 'll Do

* Learn multiple platforms, technologies, and languages (i.e. Azure, Azure DevOps, AWS, PowerShell, c#) to create new code, scripts, and processes
* Write, understand, and modify scripting languages - PowerShell is our primary language, but if you have experience with bash, etc. you can learn PowerShell
* Work on identified pain spots in the organization and utilize the latest tools to automate and simplify them
* Have your hands in different Insurity products every month
* Live the 'DevOps Culture' - spread knowledge, train others, and help bring new tools and concepts to the organization

Administration

* Act as a mentor to team members
* Understands the major components of the system and their purpose
* Can quickly narrow down point(s) of failure by their symptoms and can offer recommendations to resolve
* Understands windows components, their purpose and basic knowledge of their features, and how to use them
* Has a grasp of certificates, their purposes, and how to apply them

Build and Deployment

* Set up new servers, install features, roles, products (i.e., SQL Server, SSRS)TFS, Timesheet, etc.
* Understands the software build and packaging process, makes small modifications as necessary
* Is able to build major versions and service packs
* Understand and implement the deployment process then modify the scripts/process as needed
* Safekeep software release versions and packages

Who You Are

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience considered
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Able to think critically, get into the details, and change directions rapidly
* Flexible, open-minded, with a passion for learning new tools
* Able to give and receive feedback in a constructive manner
* Excellent ability to handle multiple contending priorities and effectively plan your work accordingly

Demonstrated aptitude with the following technologies:

* Hosted Azure DevOps, On-Prem TFS 2017, 2019
* Jenkins concepts/knowledge useful but not required
* Source control systems - Git (TFS, ADO, BitBucket), TFVC
* CI/CD
* Kubernetes / Containers
* SQL Server
* .net / MVC knowledge a plus

Where: This role can be performed either remotely or based in our Hartford
office. Note: This role is expected to begin remotely due to COVID-19.

Our Benefits

Collaborative Culture | Flexible Hours | Growth Opportunities

Day 1 Health Insurance Coverage | Open PTO

Does Insurity sound like the right place for you? Send us your application and
a cover letter highlighting what sets you apart from the nice-to-haves and
makes you a must-have for our team!

Thank you for your interest in Insurity! Please understand that due to the
volume of applicants we receive, only selected candidates will be contacted.

Insurity is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable
accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to
perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges
of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  

LI-REMOTE

description:
We help the world run better

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by
building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the
foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences,
values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused
work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong
focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual
contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply
now!

* 
What you will do

SAP were original pioneers in the creation of integrated enterprise software.
2022 is our 50th year and we continue to invest in teams that deliver new and
exciting solutions with the remit to be creative and have innovation at the
centre of everything you do.

Our DevOps Engineers are problem solvers that have a real interest enabling
innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on
building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces
differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose- driven and
future-focused work

The Multicloud Hyperscaler DevOps†team play a critical central role within
SAPis global public cloud transition. The team of Cloud DevOps Engineers are
at the heart of the processes that empower SAP to develop and deliver high
quality products quickly. Working with our lines of business, you will help
build and run our next-generation multicloud technologies at global scale. If
you are an experienced DevOps Engineer with a passion for delivering
innovative IT services and value-creation, a career at SAP may be right for
you!

* 
What you bring

* You will need to have knowledge in one or more of Cloud environments such as
AWS, GCP or Azure and prior experience.
* 3+ years public cloud operations support in AWS, GCP, or Azure and Azure AD
* Experience in supporting enterprise environments, including customer relationship management
* Design and build advanced automations with a focus on more efficient operations and governance at enterprise scale
* Understanding of cloud based identity services and federation
* Documentation of solutions (e.g. configuration and setup)
* IaC -Infrastructure as Code (we use Terraform)
* Python / Bash / PowerShell (for scripting / automation)
* CI / CD (we use GitHub actions)
* Working in an Agile environment and a solid understanding of Agile methodologies
* Version control (we use GitHub), code reviews and good software working practices

* 
Meet your team

The SAP Multicloud team have a focus on delivering for our people while
delivering for the business. We have real diversity across our team, and also
in the topics we work on, so there are always fantastic opportunities to build
the career you want.

LI-Hybrid

We build breakthroughs together

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more
efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for
leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to
become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related
services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience
management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000
employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly
collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether
connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every
challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs,
together.

We win with inclusion

SAP's culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible
working models help ensure that everyone - regardless of background - feels
included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by
the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company,
and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize
their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and
creating a better and more equitable world. 
SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action
employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and
provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental
disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and
are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or
to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to
Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com. 
For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee
Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral
Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender
(including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity
or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

Requisition ID: 344545 | Work Area: Software-Development Operations | Expected

description:
Finagraph is leading a new wave of innovation in FinTech that is transforming
the way financial services are offered to businesses. We continue to add some
of the world’s largest brands to our list of customers and these customers are
taking mission-critical dependencies on our cutting-edge technology. We are
expanding our team and looking for exceptional teammates that can help us grow
and make broad contributions to accelerate this industry’s transformation.

We are currently seeking a talented, results-oriented DevOps Engineer who is
experienced with all aspects of an Azure based SAAS offering.

At Finagraph, you won’t just be a spoke in the wheel. We are large enough to
make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. We are an
organization where every person matters. You’ll be a critical part of the
business where everyone contributes to the solutions that our customers love.
In addition to the day-to-day management of operations you’ll have the
opportunity to influence software design and implement parts of our solution.

What you will be doing:

* Infrastructure setup, provisioning and planning
* Environment standardization
* Platform configuration management
* CI/CD architecture
* Service tool implementation
* Implementation and monitoring of security testing
* Regular security audits and oversight
* Threat management and response

About you:
* At least 3-5 years of progressive experience and accrued good judgment with Azure provisioning, managing, and supporting cloud infrastructure for scalability and high availability.
* Passionate about delivering rich, high performing solutions that delight customers.
* Experience using and managing observability and monitoring tools supporting the operational and security health of services running in Azure
* Experience developing tools and infrastructure CI/CD pipelines for developer productivity running in Azure DevOps
* Experience with troubleshooting/incident management for cloud native services
* Demonstrable experience with scripting languages such as PowerShell
* Functional knowledge of 1 or more high level programming languages, preferably C#
* Infrastructure as Code methods and tools (ARM Templates, Bicep, etc.,)
* CI/CD - Azure DevOps, Git etc.,
* Ability to debate issues and not people.
* Ability to make complicated things simple 
* Self-awareness that allows you to thrive in an agile work environment where everybody is wearing a lot of hats.

Benefits and Perks:
* Remote position with a talented team.
* Comprehensive health benefit plan that has a rich provider network
* Unlimited vacation policy
* Peer bonus program
* Regular team events
* Vacation reimbursement benefit

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to undergo a background check? Y/N

Work Location: Remote

Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

* 8+ years of relevant experience
* AWS hands-on experience required.
* Hands-on experience in building application CI/CD pipeline using GitLab, expertise in setting up CI/CD
* Should be hands-on with application build automation tool Maven/Gradle
* Experience in writing Groovy/Python Scripts for executing commands on GitLab/Jenkins for building/deploying application
* Experience in working with application Git/BitBucket - branching strategy
* Experience in using Sonar for continuous inspection of application code to detect bugs, code smells, and security vulnerabilities 
* Experience in using Nexus Artifact repository & Component lifecycle management for a given application
* Experience in automating application deployments, some exposure to application deployment to AWS Infrastructure
* Experience with full SDLC lifecycle, taking from Dev to Release
* Experience with Urban Code Deployment (UCD)
* Excellent communication, and documentation skills
* Professional demeanor
* Must be well versed in creating CI/CD pipelines, and building docker containers.

* 
EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field 
* AWS Solution Architect Associate or Developer Associate certification desired

* 
Skills:
* GitLab
* Jenkins
* Python

description:
Hybrid working model

Position Summary:

The CoE DevOps Solution Architect provides accountability for the technical
solutions from the Modern Engineering Center of Excellence to ensure that the
new technology, processes, and ways of working within IT align with IT
strategy, increase our security posture, and drive higher quality products.
Modern Engineering is our adoption of DevSecOps processes and tools. The CoE
DevOps Architect is responsible for the technical thought leadership of modern
product development technology and supporting DevSecOps processes across the
company, addressing people, process, and tool aspects of organizational
change. Primary responsibilities include developing holistic architecture for
all Modern Engineering platforms (including Continuous Integration /
Continuous Delivery (CI/CD), Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC), Continuous
Security, Infrastructure Immutability, Automated Testing, and Observability),
overseeing output of other technical resources (e.g., CoE Security Architect,
CoE Quality Architect, CoE DevOps Engineer), and leading the technical
implementation of the Modern Engineering solutions across the company. The
ability to build collaborative stakeholder relationships is a must.

Duties:

* Serve as technical authority for IT on the Modern Engineering solutions
* Serve as subject matter expert for modern product development and tooling landscape; stay current on market trends and research
* Work directly with breadth of stakeholders across the organization (from individual contributors through senior leadership) by leading and being accountable for the design and delivery of advanced cloud and DevSecOps solutions
* Educate stakeholders from the business and IT on services offered by Azure DevOps, AWS, and other SaaS solution providers and how to best leverage the services for improved business performance
* Facilitate leadership alignment on Modern Engineering vision, strategy, and methods
* Define future state application and reference architecture, operations models, and technical requirements of cloud ecosystem in accordance with leading practices from industry and AWS Well-Architected Framework
* Design, architect, and manage all Modern Engineering platforms and environments for scale across the IT organization
* Perform and follow strong software coding practices
* Iteratively improve deployment methodologies through process streamlining and automation
* Work with the CoE and Delivery Teams to define automation strategy tools and deployment, and build and maintain solutions
* Evaluate benefits and risks of a solution’s feasibility and functionality
* Lead and coordinate technical reviews (architectural, security, compliance, etc.)
* Consult on and evangelize the behavior change and mindset shifts required of people resources to implement new architecture and processes
* Partner with other CoE members and HR to account for effort associated with culture change as part of implementation strategies
* Model desired culture including open knowledge sharing, proactive cross-functional collaboration, and adaptive learning via continuous improvement
* Define, review, and implement Modern Engineering Standards
* Define, update and document technical Procedures related to software development best practices
* Provide collateral support, including architectural guidelines, design guidelines, coding guidelines, test guidelines, handover guidelines
* Develop project case studies, training materials and technical guidance for teams within the company
* Assist with estimating work efforts required for each phase of a project
* Structure work efforts and determine engagement model of technical architects from CoE and IT Delivery Teams (teams using scrum or Kanban to manage workload in conjunction with Agile Framework)
* Review and approve technical output of other CoE technical resources (e.g., CoE Security Architect, CoE Quality Architect, CoE DevOps Engineer)
* Contribute to and enhance Security Standards and Procedures for Modern Engineering solutions
* Accountable for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, and maintenance of CI/CD infrastructure. This may include provisioning of AWS instances, configuring servers, streamlining deployments, scaling out servers
* Monitor and consult on all network, security, and other services to meet the organization's current and future requirements
* Manage current state and future state Modern Engineering tooling including configuration, maintenance, and upgrades
* Implement key performance indicators (KPI) to monitor process health and service metrics
* Facilitate compliance with internal and external audit and regulatory requirements

Requirements:

* 10+ years of broadened software engineering and architecture experience preferred
* 5+ years of demonstrable software engineering and DevOps experience
* Must demonstrate accountability, sound decision making, and analytical thoroughness
* Hands-on experience designing and implementing end-to-end CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Azure DevOps Preferred)
* Hands-on AWS and Azure public cloud experience in a production environment (e.g., network, security, deployment, automation, serverless technologies)
* Hands-on experience with Configuration Management and Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, GCP Deployment Manager, Azure ARM) and/or
* Hands-on experience to common container and container orchestration solutions (e.g. Docker Enterprise, Kubernetes, AWS ECS)
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience required. Computer Science or related field preferred
* Certification on AWS and Azure DevOps platforms preferred

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Behaviors:

* Experience working with and integrating system components into other vendor solutions
* Experience with the products and solutions of open-source, cloud, and SaaS ecosystems
* Experience working within an Agile/Scrum framework
* Experience collaborating across multiple functional/technical teams to deliver a project
* Ability to design optimally durable and consistent patterns for distributed systems
* Ability to communicate with customers on a business level and translate their needs into a technical solution
* Ability to adapt to organizational change and advocate for the required culture change within the organization
* Strong emotional intelligence to identify the behavioral and cultural indicators to team effectiveness
* Consultative, collaborative approach to solving complex problems, with customer service skills
* Invigorated by new challenges and ability to professionally challenge the status quo
* Passionate about developing the skills of team members through technical and professional mentoring
* Demonstrated growth mindset, enthusiastic about learning new technologies quickly and applying the gained knowledge to address business problems
* Self-starter; ability to proactively define work and deliver results

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $114,398.41 - $192,927.55 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

* Chicago, IL 60601: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

* Software engineering: 10 years (Preferred)
* DevOps: 5 years (Preferred)
* CI/CD: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: One location

description:
About Net Health 
 * _Belong. Thrive. Make a Difference._* 
Are you looking for a meaningful and satisfying career where you have endless
opportunities to grow and be financially rewarded? Net Health may be the
perfect place for you. 
A high-growth and profitable company, we help caregivers harness data for
human health. We also honor and respect the needs of our Net Health family and
staff, which is why we offer a work-from-anywhere environment and unlimited
PTO. Our welcoming and collaborative culture paired with progressive benefits
makes Net Health the ultimate career home! 
As a leading-edge SaaS company in healthcare, we deliver solutions that help
patients get better, faster, and live more fulfilling lives. Our software and
predictive analytics cover the continuum of care, from hospital-to-home,
across various medical specialties. Come join us and start the next chapter of
your exciting career while helping others to live better lives. 
 * _World-Class Benefits That Reflect Our World-Class Culture._* 
Click Here to Learn More!:  

WorkFromAnywhere #UnlimitedPTO #ComprehensiveBenefitsPackage

EmployeeResourceGroups #CasualDressCode #PrioritizedEmployeeWellness

DiversityAndInclusion #AVoice #NewHireSupport #CareerDevelopment

EducationalAssistance #EmployeeReferralBonus #ProgressiveParentalLeave

Net Health, a leading developer of specialized EMRs across various markets, is
looking for an experienced DBA who can help support our development teams as
they build apps and services using data at scale across multiple product
lines. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of Relational Database
systems, with some exposure to the DevOps methodology, nosql/document
databases, and containerization. The candidate should be as comfortable
designing tables and indexes as they are advising development teams on the
tradeoffs between standard row based data stores, columnar database systems,
or document based databases. 
 Purpose: The Devops DBA will be responsible for working with development
teams to design and build resilient, well-performing data environments that
meet our application needs in the most efficient, economic way possible.

* Essential Job Functions: 

* Work with a cross functional team in an Agile/Scrum process to refine stories into work product that meets Net Health’s standards for quality, performance, and usefulness within project timelines.
* Be able to translate stories into needed data stores, tables, queries, and processes required to meet story needs.
* Make sure projects are built for easy verification by automated testing and easy integration into CI/CD Pipelines
* Ability to turn feedback from internal stakeholders into meaningful courses of action
* Troubleshoot and tune poorly performing queries
* Monitor usage in production environments and design and execute plans to meet our SLOs around performance.
* Troubleshoot problems and provide options for possible solutions
* Pick up new technology, frameworks, data stores, apis, and sdks with minimal oversight
* Participate in code reviews

* Specialized Knowledge, Equipment/ Software Requirements: 

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field
* Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences
* 4-5 years’ experience running production RDBMS (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc…) at scale.
* 4-5 years’ experience working with development teams designing resilient, well–performing database environments
* 2-3 year’s experience working with data systems in public cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP, etc…)
* 2-3 years’ experience with scripting language (powershell, bash, python, etc…)
* 2-3 years’ experience integrating database changes into CI/CD pipelines

* Nice to Have: 

* Experience with running databases on containers
* Experience with kubernetes
* Experience with modern source control tools and practices

Additional Info: 
EEO Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for
employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. 
 Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee
may perform other related duties as requested to meet the ongoing needs of the
organization. 
 Colorado Pay Law: If you are a Colorado resident and this role is
available in Colorado or remote, you may be eligible to receive additional
information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will
provide upon request. Please send an email to Recruiting@NetHealth.com

Job Type: Full-time

description:
What you will do:

· Be an impactful member of the Software Development team by supporting all
efforts to simplify and enhance the client experience.

· Ensure accurate and efficient execution and adherence to business and
technical requirements through detailed coding and performing unit and
software integration testing.

· Improve new and existing software by performing coding, testing, debugging,
designing and writing programs according to functional and non-functional
requirements.

· Validate software adherence with development standards by providing
knowledgeable input while leading code review sessions.

· Guide the development of software by creating and maintaining accurate
technical documentation.

· Resolve incidents and issues for production applications and web services in
accordance with identified service level agreements (SLAs) by serving as the
final escalation point for clients.

· Influence future system designs by managing system analysis and identifying
and recommending design and requirements.

· Maximize the efficiency of various systems by collaborating with internal
clients and technical and architecture teams to resolve software issues and
implement, monitor and test new software.

· Enhance department performance metrics through hands-on coaching and
mentoring of less experienced team members.

· Mitigate risks by following established configuration and change control
processes.

Required keys for success:

· Six+ years of experience with major database management systems.

· Six+ years of experience with coding, testing and design.

· Six or more years of experience with software development methodologies.

· Expert in Voice, Data, Video and wireless technologies.

· In-depth understanding of software design patterns and principles.

· History of identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the
actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the
system.

· Proven ability to deal with ambiguous or incomplete information when
evaluating alternatives and making recommendations.

· Track record of working with teams and managing individual tasks with the
ability to pick up complex concepts and processes quickly.

· Creative and abstract thinking skills that can envision and design
innovative solutions to business opportunities and challenges.

· Solid ability to design, develop and deploy solutions and to deliver
projects on time with minimal direction.

· Extensive technical knowledge of Information Technology field and computer
systems.

· Demonstrated ability to take the lead on the most complex projects with
experience sharing knowledge, resolving conflict and creating a consensus.

· Effective written and spoken English communication skills with all levels of
an organization.

How you will stand out from the crowd:

· Expert scripting ability using various languages, including Python, Django,
JSON, XML and Bash.

· Experience using source control tools, such as Git/GitLab.

· History of working in a Gitflow development workflow.

· Understanding of server and database configurations, including Oracle, MySQL
and Postgres.

· Working Knowledge of web services, simple network management protocol (SNMP)
and transmission control protocol/ user datagram protocol (TCP/UDP).

· Skilled in operating systems, including RedHat and CentOS.

· InfoVista InSight and Spirent VisionWorks/Analytics experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

* 8+ years of relevant experience
* AWS hands-on experience required.
* Hands-on experience in building application CI/CD pipeline using GitLab, expertise in setting up CI/CD
* Should be hands-on with application build automation tool Maven/Gradle
* Experience in writing Groovy/Python Scripts for executing commands on GitLab/Jenkins for building/deploying application
* Experience in working with application Git/BitBucket - branching strategy
* Experience in using Sonar for continuous inspection of application code to detect bugs, code smells, and security vulnerabilities 
* Experience in using Nexus Artifact repository & Component lifecycle management for a given application
* Experience in automating application deployments, some exposure to application deployment to AWS Infrastructure
* Experience with full SDLC lifecycle, taking from Dev to Release
* Experience with Urban Code Deployment (UCD)
* Excellent communication, and documentation skills
* Professional demeanor
* Must be well versed in creating CI/CD pipelines, and building docker containers.

* 
EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field 
* AWS Solution Architect Associate or Developer Associate certification desired

* 
Skills:
* GitLab
* Jenkins
* Python

description:
About Caption Health 
Caption Health’s mission is to detect disease early – when there is the
highest potential for impact – by leveraging artificial intelligence and
ultrasound. Our breakthrough AI platform enables any healthcare professional
to perform high-quality ultrasound exams for early disease detection, in
convenient and lower-cost outpatient settings including patients’ homes. It
was recognized as one of TIME’s 100 Best Inventions of 2021 and one of Fast
Company’s Next Big Things in Health Tech.

Through our work with health plans, providers, patients, and industry
partners, we are transforming care, expanding access, and reducing costs.

To learn more, visit captionhealth.com.

Job Summary:

The DevOps Engineer is responsible for designing and managing the cloud
infrastructure needed to support all Caption Health products. Duties include
deploying product updates, identifying production issues and implementing
integrations that meet our customers' needs. The role will have a large impact
on team productivity and as such requires an understanding of the software
development lifecycle and various automation tools for developing digital
pipelines (CI/ CD pipelines).

Duties/Responsibilities:

* Manage the Azure and GCP cloud infrastructure tools and data with a bias towards automation and scaling
* Maintain, improve, and monitor data ingestion and processing pipelines
* Manage and improve container orchestration and deployment strategies
* Develop tools to manage continuous integration, software stack support, code quality and coverage
* Ensure and develop tools for monitoring security, privacy, and integrity of data and other resources
* Consult with application teams on architecture, performance, and access control design
* Perform other duties as needed

Required Skill/Abilities:
* 3+ years of experience with Azure cloud infrastructure development and administration
* Experience with scripting languages
* Experience with continuous integration tools (e.g. Github Actions, Jenkins) and best practices for codebase management
* Experience with Docker and Kubernetes container strategies and orchestration
* Experience with FaaS/serverless environments (e.g. AWS Lambda, Cloud Run, Kubeless)
* Good verbal and written communications
* Proactive and assertive in driving solutions/solving issues
* Bonus: Experience with Google Cloud (GCP)
* Bonus: Experience with network security and management of sensitive data
* Bonus: Experience working in startups
* Bonus: Experience working in healthcare or regulated environments

Caption Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly
pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Caption Health does not make hiring or
employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious
belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity,
sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other
basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by
Company policy. Caption Health. strives for a healthy and safe workplace and
strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair
Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its
internal policy.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations: 
Caption Health requires all employees to be fully vaccinated at the time of
hire. Will you be able to meet this requirement?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Kubernetes: 3 years (Preferred)
* Azure Cloud Infrastructue: 3 years (Required)
* Docker: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

See yourself at Twilio

Join the team as our next DevOps Engineer!

Who we are & why we're hiring

Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help
companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer
experiences.

Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we're on a journey to becoming
a globally antiracist company that supports diversity, equity & inclusion
wherever we do business. We employ thousands of Twilions worldwide, and we're
looking for more builders, creators, and visionaries to help fuel our growth
momentum.

About the job

This position is needed to support the hands-on operational team responsible
for design, implementation and management of our datacenter footprint across
the US and EU. We are building a world-class platform to enable Twilio's
developers to quickly deploy reliable, scalable, and secure products to Twilio
customers. As Twilio continues to grow, the team is leading the expansion of
our datacenter footprint across the globe.

Responsibilities

In this role, you'll:

* Build out world class data center facilities that support our customers worldwide
* Develop automation for processes within the team
* Identify and drive areas of improvement within our Data center management practices.
* Foster an inclusive environment and imports team members to succeed and grow.

Qualifications

Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly.
Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage
everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having
"desired" qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants
with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or
hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering
Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the
table!

Required:

* Experience with large scale datacenter projects & infrastructure rollouts
* Hands-on operational experience in a data center facility. Installation of equipment in racks, attaching connections to power and network infrastructure. Ability to coordinate these activities remotely via remote hands services.
* An understanding of computer science fundamentals and practical experience developing distributed systems.
* A passion for automation and DevOps--blending operational excellence with development best practices.
* Deep familiarity with Linux (CentOS/RHEL preferred), bash scripting, service configuration and management.
* Proficiency with one or more programming languages. Go, Ruby, Python are preferred.

Desired:

* Experience creating declarative APIs to handle physical infrastructure in a hybrid cloud environment.
* Past development projects involving backend databases or interacting with other systems via API.
* Experience providing infrastructure as a service leveraging configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible, CFEngine, etc.

Location

This role will be remote, and ideally based in the central/eastern/mountain
time zones in the USA.

What We Offer

There are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to
competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness
leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary
by location.

Twilio thinks big. Do you?

We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are
always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody
our values -- something we call Twilio Magic. Additionally, we empower
employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their
volunteering and donation efforts.

So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be
the best version of yourself, apply now!

If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open
positions.

Please note this role is open to candidates outside of Colorado as well. The
information below is provided for those hired in Colorado only.

If you are a Colorado applicant:

* The estimated pay range for this role, based in Colorado, is $99,360 - $124,200.
* Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Twilio's equity plan.

The successful candidate's starting salary will be determined based on
permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and
geographic location within the state. This role is also eligible to
participate in Twilio's equity plan and for the following benefits: health
care insurance, 401(k) retirement account, paid sick time, paid personal time
off, paid parental leave.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Twilio is proud to be
an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not
discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including
pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical
conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age,
status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability,
genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally
protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal
histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.
Additionally, Twilio participates in the E-Verify program in certain
locations, as required by law.

Twilio is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified
individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application
procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability,
please contact us at accommodation@twilio.com.

Great perks, pay, work/life balance", "ratingBusinessOutlook": "POSITIVE", "ratingCareerOpportunities": 5, "ratingCeo": "APPROVE", "ratingCompensationAndBenefits": 5, "ratingCultureAndValues": 5, "ratingOverall": 4, "ratingRecommendToFriend": "POSITIVE", "ratingSeniorLeadership": 3, "ratingWorkLifeBalance": 5, "reviewDateTime": "2022-06-07T12:35:21.303", "reviewId": 65217863, "summary": "Great Place to Work"}, {"advice": "Stop hiring so many contractors - and I'd recommend looking at the demographics of your contract employees for some insight. How many of them are women? What are they paid in comparison to your FTE's? 

The treatment of contractors here has left a bad taste in people's mouths, and I would recommend avoiding the pitfalls of other big tech companies that also hire a lot of contractors and treat them just as poorly.

If you want Twilio to have a good reputation, more than just your customers need to have a positive take on the company, and your employees are the last people you want to complain about the company.  We know tech companies hire lots of contractors, and while it's legal in this country, you're only hurting yourself by 1) not offering more FTE positions for contractors to apply to, and 2) maintaining a large number of a contracted workforce that is overworked and underpaid.", "cons": "Don't expect to stay. 

There were promises as contractors that we would be converted to full time employees (FTE's) when we were hired so long as we proved we could do the work, then it was completely switched on a dime with no warning. To be 'up to snuff' legally, they finally said contractors will not be converted, and will need to apply and go through the interview process for any FTE recruiting coordinator positions - so they were extremely misleading on how they recruited/hired a lot of us.

Management did not go up to bat for us when this was announced - they said "any of us can be fired at any time" and that we should always have our resumes up to date, which is true - but they actively avoided apologizing or advocating for us at any point from here on out (they basically held the door open for us to leave).

As a contractor you'll be asked to work a lot of overtime as the interview volume is insanely high, you'll literally be at your computer moving 100mph for a minimum of 8+ hours a day in order for scheduling metrics to be met. You get no PTO or anything as a contractor, and contracts start at 6 months with the opportunity to be extended to a year. description:
Great Day Improvements, a top 10 home remodeling company, is experiencing
double digit growth and is undergoing a digital transformation of the
business.

Our success has allowed us to make significant investments in the business to
further fuel our growth, including a technology-enabled end-to-end customer
experience platform.

We are looking for key DevOps engineers who want to make our vision a reality.
The right individuals are energized by building and creating, not just
managing tickets. You will have the chance to support a technology platform
from the ground up, alongside a team of highly skilled and dedicated
engineers.

We are committed to investing in our future and in our people. Join us at this
exciting stage in our business!

The DevOps engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, testing,
publishing, and documenting an enterprise level cloud application. 
Primary Job Duties 
· Work with technical engineers at large to understand its CI/CD and release
management needs to be able to transform those understandings into solution
requirements.

· Implement and maintain various aspects of CI/CD release cycle using CLI
scripting, tools, and datasets

· Must understand application architecture and configuration structure very
well

· Design continuous integration, continuous testing, continuous delivery, and
configuration management for enterprise software solutions,
monitoring/observability, and cloud platforms, and provide technical oversight
of DevOps implementation and delivery.

· APM - Monitor distributed application clusters in multiple environments
(dev, uat, prod etc...)

· Managing IDP: security catalogs, roles and ACL descriptors in IDP solution

· Admin cloud infrastructure (block storage, compute, network topologies)

· Identify and evaluate the value of emerging technology 
Skills 
· 3+ years API deploy/development with any modern tech stack (e.g., .NET,
Java, Node, Elixir etc...)

· Web/Http APIS: reverse proxy, SSL termination, balancing and related topics

· Base IP networking: net classes, NAT, subnets, masking etc.

· Security: OAuth/OpenIDC management, roles, ACLs

· Command Line Interface scripting / CLI tools in Linux/Bash experience is
required

· Basic understanding of distributed architecture topics: queues, events,
APIS/services

· Base knowledge of databases, RDBMS, NoSQL/Document. Replication and sharding

· Strong Communication skills with ability to work within a distributed team
in the USA

· Documentation skills are required

· Knowledge of modern frameworks/languages is a big plus (e.g., .NET, Java,
Node, Python)

· Knowledge of cloud service providers is a plus: AWS, GCP, Azure et.al.

· GitHub et.al projects/demos/Portfolio is a major plus

About Great Day Improvements, LLC

Great Day Improvements is a vertically integrated, direct-to-consumer provider
of branded premium building products, including Patio Enclosures brand
sunrooms and screen rooms; Stanek brand windows and patio doors; Apex Energy
Solutions energy efficient windows and doors; and Hartshorn Custom Contracting
pool enclosures and lanais. In the last 5 years, Great Day Improvements has
more than quadrupled in size and footprint, expanding its workforce to over
740 employees across 62 metropolitan markets throughout the United States. The
company has been named to REMODELING Magazine’s 550 List and Qualified
Remodeler’s Top 500 List, and is among Inc. Magazine’s fastest growing private
companies. Great Day Improvements has an excellent reputation with an A rating
from the BBB and an overall Google rating of 4.6 with over 2,300 reviews. To
learn more, visit www.patioenclosures.com, www.stanekwindows.com,
www.greatdayimprovements.com, www.hccscreens.com www.apexenergygroup.com

Equal Employment Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without
regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected
veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Right to Work

In compliance with federal law, all personals hired will be required to verify
identify and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the
required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Command line scripting: 3 years (Preferred)
* AWS/GCP/AZURE CLI as code (not using UI): 3 years (Preferred)
* Software configuration: 3 years (Preferred)
* Networking knowledge (IP/NAT, HTTPs/balancing, routing, SSL): 3 years (Preferred)
* APM: Logging/Telemetry/Alerting: 3 years (Preferred)
* Deploy: CI/CD: 3 years (Preferred)
