description:
Responsibilities:

The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for driving continuous integration and
software delivery that unifies development and operations teams for faster
business results. As the DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for driving
continuous integration and software delivery that unifies development and
operations teams for faster business results. This is a hands-on role where
you’ll be responsible for working on complex, major or highly visible tasks in
support of multiple projects that require multiple areas of expertise. This
role will support multiple applications and provide expertise in multiple
technical environments and knowledge of one or more business areas.

In addition, you will be responsible for the following tasks:

* Design, develop and maintain automation framework for iterative software development and testing. Provide operational support, and develop solutions that provide monitoring, logging and alerting capabilities.
* Manage CI/CD infrastructure using Jenkins, SonarQube, Fortify, and UFT, including patching and security updates on the infrastructure.
* Develop and maintain build scripts to automate deployments for multiple environments including dev/test, QA, and production.
* Work with QA team to integrate automated testing into CI/CD pipeline.
* Manage promoting Logic Apps and APIM between environments using ARM templates.
* Transition java web apps to containers.
* Build and maintain Kubernetes infrastructure and manage integrations with APIM/WAF.
* Participate in architecture review, reviewing technology designs and best practices

Requirements:

* Strong communication and presentation skills.
* 3+ years of hands-on experience with MS Azure technologies, specifically ARM templates and deployment scripting.
* Experience with Azure GovCloud a plus.
* 3+ years of hands-on CI/CD engineering experience working with scripting and build management tools for a variety of frameworks and technologies, including Angular, Java, C#/.NET, Bash, Groovy, Gradle, and Maven.
* Hands-on experience working on Windows, and Linux distributions (CentOS and Ubuntu)
* Hands-on experience working in Agile and DevOps cultures and teams with a keen focus on process improvement and automation through internal and external collaboration.
* Hands-on experience with containers and container platforms such as Docker and Kubernetes.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $145,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* DevOps: 5 years (Required)
* Azure: 3 years (Preferred)
* AZURE Arm templates: 3 years (Preferred)
* CI/CD Engineering: 3 years (Preferred)
* build tools(ex.: Angular, Java, C#/.NET, Bash, Groovy, Gradle: 2 years (Preferred)
* Windows, and Linux distributions (CentOS and Ubuntu): 1 year (Preferred)

Security clearance:

* Secret (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Equivalent Experience  

Description:

This role can sit 100% remote anywhere in the US (except CA, CT, CO, NY)

Client is a leader in health services for federal employees and related
customers, serving our chosen markets with low-cost offerings and best-in-
class customer care, sustained by a nimble and efficient organization.

The Engineer's role is to ensure the stable operations of rapid software
development. This includes configuring the required infrastructure and
automated pipelines to assist developers.

The Engineer is a self-starter, able to work with minimal direction from
management, but collaboratively with other DevOps engineers and cross-
functional teams. Understands the need for lateral thinking and displays
willingness to adapt to new ways of doing business.

Skills:

Azure, Cloud, Devops, Kubernetes

Top Skills Details:

Azure,Cloud

Additional Skills & Qualifications:

SKILLS

* Assist in developing and supporting automated processes focused on the following practices: Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, and Continuous Testing
* Assist other department engineers in creating practical demonstrations of proposed solutions and demonstrating them to other members of the team
* Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions
* Work with cross-functional teams to maintain hardware and software needed for projects to be completed efficiently
* Perform various routines as prescribed by team lead
* Ensure adherence to defined Azure DevOps standards
* Requires three years of technical professional experience
* Requires a minimum of two years of professional work experience with Azure DevOps
* Demonstrable experience with version control using Git
* Understanding of Azure DevOps security best practices and governance
* Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams to support execution of project tasks
* Current understanding of best practices regarding system security measures
* Experience with software engineering preferred
* PowerShell scripting preferred
* Experience with containerization utilizing Kubernetes preferred
* Ability to support Azure DevOps activities outside of normal business hours
* Excellent verbal and written skills
* High-level understanding of system integration working with various operating systems and their implications
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering is preferred
* Additional years of qualifying work experience may be considered in lieu of formal education.
* Microsoft DevOps Certification preferred

Experience Level:

Intermediate Level

About TEKsystems:

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions
to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000
strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500,
across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack
Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with
progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership.
TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all
applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national
origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity,
genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

description:
Sr. Analyst, IT - Finance Systems – HFM DevOps

Chicago, Pittsburgh, Remote

Do you want to work for a top 5 Food & Beverage company in the world? Do you
want to be a part of a Finance IT division that is rapidly expanding and can
offer multiple promotions and growth opportunities throughout your career?
Then apply to Kraft Heinz today to be a part of the greatness and you will see
how you valued you are in a company and in your career!

Position Summary

This high performing leader will partner with the various Finance
organizations within Kraft Heinz to build process and technology capabilities
that support their growth and strategic agenda. For this role to be a fit, you
must be a skilled relationship builder with the ability to work in fast paced
and ever-changing environments. This role will support business users and
overall operations in HFM and FDMEE space. This role will require close
collaboration with different teams and need to work as a team member of
Finance IT team.

Primary Responsibilities

* Responsible for administration of Hyperion Financial management and FDMEE applications.
* Manage month end close process to close books.
* Provide end user support, troubleshoot issue, and train end users.
* Maintain batch processes for data load and consolidations.
* Implement HFM and FDMEE system changes related to rules, reports, mappings etc.
* Act as primary liaison between Data Governance, Data Assurance, FP&A;, Controllers, and vendor teams to support Finance IT Systems operations.
* Maintain system documentation and controls on system changes and processes.
* Drive implementation of a strong control environment and robust processes.
* Ready to learn and contribute towards other Hyperion HFM and EPM initiatives as assigned.
* Mentor and support junior resources.
* Focus on continuous improvements and process automations to automate data loads and consolidation processes.
* Track deliverables and report status to management.
* Ability to work well under pressure; manage tight deadlines and situations where conflicting priorities arise.

Qualifications
* Minimum Bachelor’s Degree
* HFM/FDMEE Certification is plus

Domain Expertise

* Minimum of 4 years of functional and/or technical HFM and FDMEE
* Experience using Oracle Hyperion Suite of products (Planning / ePBCS).
* Knowledge of Data Management and EPM Automate
* Experience using Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), is a plus
* Can prioritize and balance multiple priorities
* Azure / Snowflake experience is a plus

Individual Skills

* Strong attention to detail
* Foundational scripting language experience (DOS & SQL)
* Strong leader, collaborator, team player, and individual contributor
* Strong communication skills with comfort in speaking with and presenting to IT leadership
* Strong Power Point and Excel user

Mindset & Behaviors

* Passion to challenge the status quo and find new solutions and drive out of the box ideas – loves and embraces change
* Believes in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust
* Not afraid to “roll up sleeves”; seeks to go beyond comfort to learn & pushes teams to do the same
* Empowers others to fail, learn, and grow with an experimental mindset to drive innovation

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

Experience:

* Oracle EPM: 4 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* HFM/FDMEE Certification (Preferred)

description:
As a crucial member of a driven, multidisciplinary engineering team, the
DevOps Engineer will work alongside the Software, Robotics, Systems,
Applications and Test Engineers. They will be responsible for developing and
maintaining software tools that automate and streamline the software
development, QA, documentation, release, and deployment processes.

Responsibilities

* Participate as a multidisciplinary engineering team member.
* Develop and maintain software build servers.
* Independently develop new tooling and automation to streamline the development, testing, and deployment processes.
* Maintain existing automated CI/CD infrastructure
* Remove blockages related to configuration and dependency management
* Maintain state of the art software release process to support our expanding software deployment community.

Requirements
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar field with 3-5 years of relevant experience.
* Strong working knowledge of the Windows and Linux operating system
* Experience with a variety of scripting languages including Groovy, Python, and Bash
* Knowledge of multiple C++ build systems including cmake and qmake
* Experience with C++ code analysis tools
* Experience with Git and Github
* Strong understanding of containerization using Docker
* Experience developing and maintaining automated CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins
* Experience with Atlassian software tools a plus: Jira and Confluence
* Strong written and oral communication skills.

To apply, please send your resume, salary requirements, and cover letter as
PDF documents. The candidate must be eligible to work in the United States.
This position is based Plymouth, MA.

vacation, holiday, and sick leave.

description:
Responsibilities:

* Lead the creation of a cloud-first software source code management and build/deployment pipeline in Azure DevOps, focused primarily on the integration of a large acquisition but looking forward to all of nThrive
* Establish and maintain pipeline templates, collaborating with participating development teams to understand and document requirements
* Design, document, and support practices for deployment both of and to Azure resources, including VM’s, VM Scale Sets, AKS, Azure Functions, and Azure App Services.
* Design and document security requirements to govern access to and usage of the CI/CD pipeline
* Lead pilots and proofs-of-concept for CI/CD-related integrations such as SAST and SCA scans
* Evolve current practices and establish new guidelines to adopt IaC methodology, including cost management and security best-practices
* Ensure that policies and practices support the diversity of technology platforms and languages that exists within nThrive today, including both .NET and Java applications that reside both on-prem and within Azure
* Monitor and maintain environments and delivery pipelines
* Consult and help design Azure environment

* 3+ years of experience in software development
* 3+ years of experience in an architect role responsible for overseeing design, pattern development, and tool selection for managing Azure resources
* 2+ years of experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines deploying to Azure resources, including IaaS and PaaS models and using zero downtime (rolling, blue-green, etc.)
* Excellent communication skills and experience interacting both with upper management as well as individual contributors
* Strong ability to document architectural patterns and decisions through appropriate tools (diagrams, wiki articles, samples, etc.)

* Azure DevOps

description:
Who We *Are

Insurity is a leading property and casualty insurance software and data
analytics providers, working with some of the world's largest insurers,
brokers, and MGAs, including 15 of the top 25 P&C carriers in the US. With
1400+ team members globally, 7 office locations, and 300+ customers, we have a
deep understanding of the insurance business, unparalleled technology
expertise, and a singular focus of delivering a simplified insurance
experience to our customers.

Insurity 's next DevOps Specialist

As part of the DevOps Development team, our DevOps Specialist will help mature
and improve our existing product build, packaging, and deployment processes.
They will also collaborate and help pave the way to adopt new processes using
a wide variety of tools including Azure DevOps, TFS, PowerShell, c#, APIs,
Azure - and many more - that deploy to Azure, AWS, internal, and client-hosted
platforms. It's rare we do the same thing twice - but if so, we automate it!
We are all about making our existing processes better while adopting current
and emerging tools to make everyone's lives easier. We are a team of
experienced and sharp developers with a DevOps mentality.

What You 'll Do

* Learn multiple platforms, technologies, and languages (i.e. Azure, Azure DevOps, AWS, PowerShell, c#) to create new code, scripts, and processes
* Write, understand, and modify scripting languages - PowerShell is our primary language, but if you have experience with bash, etc. you can learn PowerShell
* Work on identified pain spots in the organization and utilize the latest tools to automate and simplify them
* Have your hands in different Insurity products every month
* Live the 'DevOps Culture' - spread knowledge, train others, and help bring new tools and concepts to the organization

Administration

* Act as a mentor to team members
* Understands the major components of the system and their purpose
* Can quickly narrow down point(s) of failure by their symptoms and can offer recommendations to resolve
* Understands windows components, their purpose and basic knowledge of their features, and how to use them
* Has a grasp of certificates, their purposes, and how to apply them

Build and Deployment

* Set up new servers, install features, roles, products (i.e., SQL Server, SSRS)TFS, Timesheet, etc.
* Understands the software build and packaging process, makes small modifications as necessary
* Is able to build major versions and service packs
* Understand and implement the deployment process then modify the scripts/process as needed
* Safekeep software release versions and packages

Who You Are

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience considered
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Able to think critically, get into the details, and change directions rapidly
* Flexible, open-minded, with a passion for learning new tools
* Able to give and receive feedback in a constructive manner
* Excellent ability to handle multiple contending priorities and effectively plan your work accordingly

Demonstrated aptitude with the following technologies:

* Hosted Azure DevOps, On-Prem TFS 2017, 2019
* Jenkins concepts/knowledge useful but not required
* Source control systems - Git (TFS, ADO, BitBucket), TFVC
* CI/CD
* Kubernetes / Containers
* SQL Server
* .net / MVC knowledge a plus

Where: This role can be performed either remotely or based in our Hartford
office. Note: This role is expected to begin remotely due to COVID-19.

Our Benefits

Collaborative Culture | Flexible Hours | Growth Opportunities

Day 1 Health Insurance Coverage | Open PTO

Does Insurity sound like the right place for you? Send us your application and
a cover letter highlighting what sets you apart from the nice-to-haves and
makes you a must-have for our team!

Thank you for your interest in Insurity! Please understand that due to the
volume of applicants we receive, only selected candidates will be contacted.

Insurity is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable
accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to
perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges
of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  

LI-REMOTE

description:

Engineer. This is a permanent role and will be 100% remote working. Please
note, however, that the company is based on the east coast and does require
someone to be on the same time zone. Candidates, therefore, must be based in
an EST zone.

This is a senior role and requires an individual who can operate independently
if required and make key decisions relating to the DevOps environment. You
must have a strong background in DevOps as well as an understanding of
software engineering and development principles.

Responsibilities will include:

* managing the build and release environment.
* supporting the high availability of cloud hosted platforms.
* develop scripts to automate DevOps functions, automating test tool configuration, automating and monitoring the platform environment.
* helping define future DevOps plans and strategy

The successful DevOps Engineer should have:

* Azure DevOps experience or similar.
* Experience of at least one PCP, ideally Azure or AWS, but also GCP.
* A good foundation in engineering. An understanding of a development language ( C#. GoLang, Python or Java).

Do you have the skills--and drive--to join a tech team that's working to
digitally transform a trillion-dollar industry? From test-driving the latest
technologies to creating intuitive consumer apps, Liberty Mutual is constantly
innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind
for our customers worldwide.

As a software engineer on this Customer Success team at Liberty Mutual, you'll
apply your talents in an agile environment that has the creative energy of a
start-up--and the full backing and comprehensive benefits of a Fortune 100
company.

Note: This is a range posting - Software/Sr. Software Engineer - and the final
offer will be based on the candidate's skills and experiences.

Responsibilities:

* Provide technical support to Liberty Mutual's product development teams as they use our CI/CD tool suite to build and deploy code to our internal and cloud computing environments.
* Guide developers to self-service options for resolving issues.
* Troubleshoot CI/CD platform and infrastructure automation errors, provide solutions and escalate issues as needed.
* Interface with and direct customers to other teams as needed.
* Observe trends in ticket types or questions asked and engage with product teams to provide solutions for known issues.
* Learn the inner workings of our end-to-end CI/CD software delivery environment and innovative public cloud infrastructure automation.
* Improve the developer experience: reduce obstacles and provide solutions.
* Develop automation to provide fast resolution for common inquiries.
* Create self-service documentation and utilities.
* We encourage innovative ideas to improve our development community's experience.
* Demonstrated success in Jenkins, JIRA, AWS, Pipelines
* Familiarity with CI/CD deployment tools and agile software development practices is desired, including Jira, GitHub, Bamboo, Jenkins, Artifactory, AWS, Azure, GCP Cloud Foundry
* Experience working in an agile environment utilizing Scrum, Kanban or XP.
* Strong oral and written communication skills--and a knack for explaining your decision-making process to non-engineers.
* A collaborative, adaptable working style, demonstrated initiative and the ability to prioritize your time and efforts.
* A Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline, or equivalent experience.
* Troubleshooting complex systems, and needing an understanding of cloud computing, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud engineering best practices.

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently
pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness,
inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of
roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding
profession.  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great
Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of
the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's
2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of
America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New
Graduates--as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn
more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit:
https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and
we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-
being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:
https://LMI.co/Benefits  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate
discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual
orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status,
pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or
local law.

description:
About Caption Health 
Caption Health’s mission is to detect disease early – when there is the
highest potential for impact – by leveraging artificial intelligence and
ultrasound. Our breakthrough AI platform enables any healthcare professional
to perform high-quality ultrasound exams for early disease detection, in
convenient and lower-cost outpatient settings including patients’ homes. It
was recognized as one of TIME’s 100 Best Inventions of 2021 and one of Fast
Company’s Next Big Things in Health Tech.

Through our work with health plans, providers, patients, and industry
partners, we are transforming care, expanding access, and reducing costs.

To learn more, visit captionhealth.com.

Job Summary:

The DevOps Engineer is responsible for designing and managing the cloud
infrastructure needed to support all Caption Health products. Duties include
deploying product updates, identifying production issues and implementing
integrations that meet our customers' needs. The role will have a large impact
on team productivity and as such requires an understanding of the software
development lifecycle and various automation tools for developing digital
pipelines (CI/ CD pipelines).

Duties/Responsibilities:

* Manage the Azure and GCP cloud infrastructure tools and data with a bias towards automation and scaling
* Maintain, improve, and monitor data ingestion and processing pipelines
* Manage and improve container orchestration and deployment strategies
* Develop tools to manage continuous integration, software stack support, code quality and coverage
* Ensure and develop tools for monitoring security, privacy, and integrity of data and other resources
* Consult with application teams on architecture, performance, and access control design
* Perform other duties as needed

Required Skill/Abilities:
* 3+ years of experience with Azure cloud infrastructure development and administration
* Experience with scripting languages
* Experience with continuous integration tools (e.g. Github Actions, Jenkins) and best practices for codebase management
* Experience with Docker and Kubernetes container strategies and orchestration
* Experience with FaaS/serverless environments (e.g. AWS Lambda, Cloud Run, Kubeless)
* Good verbal and written communications
* Proactive and assertive in driving solutions/solving issues
* Bonus: Experience with Google Cloud (GCP)
* Bonus: Experience with network security and management of sensitive data
* Bonus: Experience working in startups
* Bonus: Experience working in healthcare or regulated environments

Caption Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly
pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Caption Health does not make hiring or
employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious
belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity,
sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other
basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by
Company policy. Caption Health. strives for a healthy and safe workplace and
strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair
Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its
internal policy.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations: 
Caption Health requires all employees to be fully vaccinated at the time of
hire. Will you be able to meet this requirement?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Kubernetes: 3 years (Preferred)
* Azure Cloud Infrastructue: 3 years (Required)
* Docker: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

DevOps Solution Architect  

Job Description  

You're raising the stakes for your career to do more. Learn more. Impact more.
Here, your innovation, ideas, and technical curiosity will help us deliver
better care for billions of people worldwide. You'll put your professional
expertise, talent, and drive to work by building and managing the technology
behind our portfolio of iconic brands.  

The Kimberly-Clark Information Technology Solutions (ITS) function is looking
for a DevOps Solution Architect who will be a leader with an established
record of DevOps organizational transformation and cloud adoption with
enterprise level customers. We'll lean on you to also have technical depth
across the Full DevOps Spectrum along with leading and advising higher level
executives, evangelizing enterprise cloud based DevOps transformations, and
pioneering the latest DevOps industry standards.  

As DevOps Solution Architect you will be accountable for leading and
establishing the DevOps practice. Educating, influencing and collaborating
with other solution engineers as well as engineering end-to-end solution in
the areas of automated build, deployment, monitoring and server
infrastructure.  

You'll need the ability to quickly understand development lifecycle needs. The
ability to not only code and configure tools, but also assemble and integrate
technology across disparate platforms is critical to success. This includes a
deep understanding of systems, data structures, modern scripting and
enterprise level languages as well as open source tools that can and should be
leveraged to solve problems.  

You'll collaborate with IT and business resources, requiring the ability to
present technical details to a non-technical audience.  

Duties and Responsibilities:  

Demonstrate proficiency in multiple DevOps related tools and technologies.  

* Own the quality of DevOps architecture and design, Lead and contribute to define industry standards and DevOps offerings and functionally decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions.
* Assist in the career development of others, actively mentoring individuals and the Amazon developer community on advanced technical issues and helping managers guide the career growth of their team members.
* Exert technical influence over multiple teams, increasing their productivity and effectiveness by sharing your deep knowledge and experience.
* Lead technical and design discussions with Executives to help enterprises speed their adoption of new technologies and practices, implement efficient end-to-end provisioning of automation solutions.
* Serve as a thought leader and SME for DevOps industry trends, new and existing technology offerings, and architectural concept, implementing DevOps best practices and provide architectural governance.
* Hands on experienceof continuous integration, continuous delivery, automated testing and all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle as well as in technical documentation skills
* Define and Experience with Application Lifecycle Management tools and Source Control systems, such as GIT,Azure DevOps/VSTS, static code analysis for codes quality and security -using SonarQube and Checkmarx
* Exposure to configuration management tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, or similar, Docker & Kubernetes and strong Scripting experience in PowerShell or any other scripting languages, integrate systems using a wide variety of protocols like REST, SOAP, MQ, TCP/IP, JSON and others

Required Qualifications:  

* 12+ years of IT experience with 10+ years of software development or application or object-oriented language
* 3+ years of experience as a technical advisor.
* 3 + years of Experience on Azure DevOps tool in terms of building Build and Deployment pipelines
* Experience in cloudarchitecture and design with more than 6 years of experience in automating IT administration, IT processes, or business processes, deploying applications and provisioning infrastructure.
* Architectural leadership experience with microservices and distributed applications, such as containers, Kubernetes, and/or serverless technology, SDLC and delivery using Agile practices.
* Proven knowledge in any of the Code Review and Security tools, say SonarQube, Checkmarx, HCL Appscan, scripting languages like PowerShell, testing methodologies and tools like Selenium, Worksoft Certify and Unit Testing frameworks
* Experience in automating / integrating a broad range of systems and services using Terraform for any of the cloud Platforms like Azure or GCP
* Experience with project management and workflow tools such as Agile, Jira, Azure Boards, open-source technologies, and cloud services.
* Solid leadership, partnership, and communication skills, working with IT architecture with focus on reusability and automation
* Ability to coordinate with all levels of the firm to design and deliver technical solutions to business problems.

About Us  

Huggies®. Kleenex®. Cottonelle®. Scott®. Kotex®. Poise®. Depend®. 25% of
people in the world use Kimberly-Clark products every day, and it takes the
best people to make that happen.  

We're founded on 150 years of market leadership, and we're always looking for
new and better ways to perform, especially when it comes to product and
process innovation. Our customers are always looking for new and better. Our
competitors won't stop evolving. And our communities demand responsible
corporate practices. We need bold, transformative ideas from people who can
turn them into reality. That means there's no time like the present to make an
impact at Kimberly-Clark. It's all here for you at Kimberly-Clark .  

About You  

You were made to do this work: designing new technologies, diving into data,
optimizing digital experiences, and constantly developing better, faster ways
to get results. You want to be part of a performance culture dedicated to
building technology for a purpose that matters. You want to work in an
environment that promotes sustainability, inclusion, wellbeing, and career
development.  

You love what you do, especially when your work makes a difference. At
Kimberly-Clark, we're constantly exploring new ideas on how, when, and where
we can best achieve results. When you join our team, you'll experience Flex
That Works: flexible (hybrid) work arrangements that empower you to have
purposeful time in the office and partner with your leader to make flexibility
work for both you and the business.  

We always ask, "How can we improve this?" and we're looking for like-minded
people. This is one business that's not chained to the status quo. "Good
enough" isn't good enough here. We stay ahead by keeping on top of trends,
recognizing market gaps and looking to fill those gaps in ways that give us an
advantage. In our diverse workforce, we encourage and guide each other to
explore new ground, glad for the unique perspectives and skills every person
brings. Join us in our rewarding and profitable journey.  

Total Benefits  

Here are a few of the benefits you'd enjoy. For a complete overview, see
www.mykcbenefits.com .  

Great support for good health with medical, dental, and vision coverage
options. No waiting periods or pre-existing condition restrictions. Access to
an on-site fitness center, occupational health nurse, and allowances for high-
quality safety equipment.  

Flexible Savings and spending accounts to maximize health care options and
stretch dollars when caring for yourself or dependents.  

Diverse income protection insurance options to protect yourself and your
family in case of illness, injury, or other unexpected events.  

Additional programs and support to continue your education, adopt a child,
relocate, or even find temporary childcare.  

To Be Considered  

Click the Apply button and complete the online application process. A member
of our recruiting team will review your application and follow up if you seem
like a great fit for this role.  

In the meantime, check out the careers website . You'll want to review this
and come prepared with relevant questions if and when you pass GO and begin
interviews.  

And finally, the fine print...  

For Kimberly-Clark to grow and prosper, we must be an inclusive organization
that applies the diverse experiences and passions of its team members to
brands that make life better for people all around the world. We actively seek
to build a workforce that reflects the experiences of our consumers. When you
bring your original thinking to Kimberly-Clark, you fuel the continued success
of our enterprise. We are a committed equal opportunity employer, and all
qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected
veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, pregnancy, genetic
information, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of
work performed by employees assigned to this classification. Statements are
not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties,
responsibilities and skills required for this position.  

K-C requires that an employee have authorization to work in the country in
which the role is based. In the event an applicant does not have current work
authorization, K-C will determine, in its sole discretion, whether to sponsor
an individual for work authorization. However, based on immigration
requirements, not all roles are suitable for sponsorship. This position is
subject to drug and alcohol testing, including pre-employment testing.  

Travel may include less than 10% of work time. Travel may also include travel
via aircrafts and motor vehicles to various locations, if applicable. Varying
working conditions may include prolonged sitting, typing and viewing
computer/laptop screens, along with occasional bending, reaching, lifting,
carrying, climbing, twisting, stooping, walking and standing.  

LI-remote

Global VISA and Relocation Specifications:  

Primary Location  

USA-GA-Atlanta-Roswell  

Additional Locations  

USA-IL-Chicago, USA-TN-Knoxville, USA-TX-Dallas, USA-WI-Neenah  

Worker Type  

Employee  

Worker Sub-Type  

Regular  

Time Type  

Full time

description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

An employer is looking for a highly skilled Technical Support Analyst to join
one of our largest national healthcare clients for a remote contract
opportunity. In this role you will work to support their growing application
development team focused on medical record management. This team supports
internal employees using this application on a day to day basis. In this
position you will be writing stored procedures, running queries, doing
performance tuning and mapping data. This role will also include doing some
DevOps work, including participating in deployments and building out
configurations. You'll be supporting a few different teams in this role,
including their internal development team along with their client.  

Responsibilities:  

* Serves as a key resource on complex and/or critical issues.
* Solves complex problems and develops innovative solutions.
* Performs complex conceptual analyses.
* Reviews work performed by others and provides recommendations for improvement.
* Forecasts and plans resource requirements.
* Authorizes deviations from standards.
* Motivates and inspires other team members.

* 
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
* 5-7 years of technical application support experience, using Service Now and/or equivalent
* Knowledge of FTP/SFTP and file transfer protocols
* Basic knowledge of Unix/Linux commands and shell scripting.
* Experience in DevOps activities
* Knowledge of writing SQL queries, database tables and views

* 
DESIRED SKILLS

Previous Healthcare experience

description:
Company Overview

Wherever you work and whatever role you fill, when you represent the
Bridgestone name you know that you are a valued teammate who is part of our
larger mission to "Serve Society with Superior Quality." We start by offering
each teammate more than just a salary. We provide formal training, competitive
performance incentives, paid vacation and holidays, healthcare packages for
full-time and part-time employees, and a 401k plan to help build your future.

We believe people can only provide superior service and quality to others when
they are allowed to bring their whole selves to work and know they are
supported. We believe in championing all perspectives, individuals and teams
because we understand the importance of seeing the world and our business
through many different lenses. We are building a team as diverse as the world
we serve. So, show us what you're made of. Show us the smart stuff, the tough
stuff, the bold, beautiful and brave stuff. Because who you are is what we
need.

Bridgestone Americas, Inc. is headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee and is the
U.S. subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation headquartered in Japan. Bridgestone
Americas and its subsidiaries develop, manufacture and market a wide range of
Bridgestone, Firestone and associate brand products to address the needs of a
broad range of customers and industries.

Job Category

Information Technology

Position Summary

Bridgestone is leading the industry in developing a global marketplace that
hosts products and service offerings from multiple sellers in one centralized
digital platform. The BS Marketplace will drive value to the concierge vision
and strategy that BS is undertaking, as we transform into a mobility solutions
enterprise.  

The DevOps Engineer is part of the Cloud COE and is responsible for building
and operating fast, scalable workflows and applications. The successful
candidate will possess a solid understanding of cloud technology, including
AWS and have the ability to help an architect design and lead the DevOps
transformational journey. The focus of this position will be towards building
scalable, available, and secure cloud solutions, based on Bridgestone
standards, availability of services, cost, network, security, storage, and
governance considerations.

Responsibilities

* Creates a new CI/CD process for application or product from scratch, taking into account trade-offs specific for the product and technology choices that have been made
* Selects and incorporates new technologies into the pipeline and provide insight into development and operations tasks performed by other teams
* Incorporates entire application lifecycle in automation, including end-to-end and performance testing, automated remediation of issues, auditable release tracking process
* Delivers implementation of Revision/Source Control and Configuration Management 
* Responsible for maintaining tools related to monitoring, bug tracking, and testing
* Delivers the development of automated solutions to monitor and support software development and release processes
* Supports development teams to drive, design, implement and maintain end-to-end DevOps automation from build, implement, deploy, operate and maintaining the CI/CD pipeline
* Leverages DevOps Automation tools to support engineering team in improving the CI/CD deployment pipeline, and to extend the functionality of IT infrastructure making use of APIs and open source tools with sound knowledge of Python programming, web programming and designs that scale
* Educates teammates to design and implement based on DevOps practices

Minimum Qualifications

* Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
* Deep understanding of Cloud computing technologies and workload transition challenges
* Knowledge of AWS Well Architected Framework and Cloud industry standards and best practices
* Prior programming background in at least one language: C++, Java, Python, Ruby, etc.
* Knowledge of development processes and methodologies
* Deep knowledge of Automation services like - Lambda, API Gateway, CodeBuild, CodeDeploy, CodePipeline
* Knowledge of DevOps tooling landscape and experience integrating various DevOps tools together to provide end to end application lifecycle management
* Strong scripting skills, i.e., Powershell, Python, Bash, Ruby, Perl, etc.
* Understanding of tagging
* Deep understanding of Service-Oriented Architectures
* Experience with various DevSecOps tools
* Bachelors' degree with 5+ years of experience (or equivalent work/life/military experience)
* AWS Certified DevOps Engineer - Associate (Preferred)

Bridgestone is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative
Action employer. It is our policy to consider for employment all individuals
regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or
mental disability, race, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender
identity and/or expression, genetic information, veteran status, or any other
characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

Employment Eligibility

If hired, a Form I-9 Employment Eligibility Verification must be completed at
the start of employment. Temporary work authorization or the need for
sponsorship may disqualify you from employment.

description:
WE ARE UNABLE TO OFFER SPONSORSHIP OR THIRD PARTY REPRESENTATION FOR THIS
POSITION

Consultis, a premier Technical Solutions Provider and IT Staffing Firm with
the single focus of pairing the right candidate with the right employment
opportunity is currently searching for a DevOps Engineer (Hybrid onsite)
for a Direct Hire (FTE) opening with our South Florida based client.

Position Overview:

You will be a part of the Infrastructure & Operations team. You will play a
key role in promoting and assisting in evolving DevOps with best practices and
continuous process improvements to establish a mature DevOps
environment/program and DevOps governance. You will work with a DevOps team in
administration and management of automated build/release management tools and
oversee continuous integration and delivery pipeline. You will be expected to
demonstrate your leadership mindset, solid operational experience, ability to
problem-solve, knowledge of latest industry trends, and be highly innovative.
You will partner with development and quality engineering management and other
technical staff in the application design for software as a service delivery.
You will work on projects requiring technical decision making and providing
input to delivery schedules. You will ensure ongoing application support for
development and live production systems by diagnosing and resolving highly
complex issues. You will identify, recommend, and implement options for
improving performance, maintainability, and operability. You will also update
existing practices and procedures.

Requirements/Responsibilities:

* Possess expert technical understanding of the intersection of development and operations (DevOps), monitoring and management tools, and deployment processes and tools.
* Work to develop and build a highly effective and mature DevOps system.
* Work with supervisor to assign and monitor work of junior technical personnel, ensuring that application infrastructure development and deployment is done in the best possible way, and implements quality control and review systems throughout the development and deployment processes.
* Identify, evaluate, and execute preventive measures to minimize/avoid impact to the customer’s experience.
* Implement proactive monitoring, alerting, trend analysis.
* Perform analysis and approval of new code through security and performance gates that you will design and develop for feature-complete software. Be an advocate for security and performance standards in the organization.
* Lead and inspire a team of DevOps engineers.
* Lead the team’s adherence to ITIL and other audited regulatory compliance (PII) programs.
* Update management in case of critical incidents and act as a point of contact for other related communications.
* Work within IT and Technical Operations, business stakeholders and with vendors, to successfully identify, prioritize, and resolve issues and provide subject matter expertise for enhancements, developments, and operational improvements.
* Ensure system technical specifications, process, procedures, runbooks, SOPs, and infrastructure requirements definitions based on conceptual design are maintained and high-quality for all technical and non-technical deliverables to a wider organizational audience.
* Work to ensure the development of our SaaS public and private cloud infrastructure are conducted in cost-conscious ways, using 'infrastructure as code' and automated environment provisioning tools and techniques.
* Participate in the full software and infrastructure development life cycle process including requirements analysis and design implementation.
* Perform leadership work to accomplish tasks and projects within defined timelines and in a professional manner in alignment with active standards.
* Keep abreast of technical trends and develops and incorporates them within assignments as appropriate, and recommend improvements and changes to supervisor and team.
* Assist project teams with technical issues in the planning phase of sites or project development efforts.

* Experience with scripting languages such as Bash and Python. 
* Understanding of security controls and configurations for SOC2 compliance.
* Experience with Atlassian tools Jira and Confluence.
* Must understand and be able to support Agile methodology.
* Able to quickly identify and drive to the optimal solution when presented with a series of constraints.
* College degree preferred.
* A demonstrated leadership mindset with solid operational experience.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Insight Global is looking for a Manager of DevOps & Cloud Engineering, this
plays a key role for the enterprise as a member of ITSD through hands-on
management and optimization of the continuous integration and continuous
delivery (CI/CD) pipeline resulting in the quick and safe release of
incremental software improvements into production. DevOps techniques are
continuously applied by this role in order to avoid deployment pipeline
congestion between various build versions across multiple environments. The
ideal candidate will have experience designing, developing, and optimizing
release management processes in both premise and cloud-based environments.
Also, Extensive infrastructure, application, integration, data and security
technology expertise along with a passion for innovation and hands-on software
development leadership is essential.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

* at least 5 years of DevOps Engineering experience
* strong background with Kubernetes, Jenkins, CD/CI pipelines, Docker
* experienced with Containerization 
* previous expereince programming with java, spring, groovy and Angular
* strong project expereince supporting migration from On-prem to Cloud platforms

Insight Global and the Account Manager role is probably the most "noble" sales role you can have. I say that because you are selling the company's staffing services and building meaningful relationships with clients in order to stimulate and contribute to the growth of the job market. That doesn't mean that it doesn't come without it's challenges.

For my first two years of account management I struggled, and I struggled real hard. I felt like I was going on an infinite number of client meetings and never seeing any return on my investment of effort. I was bending over backwards for bad business too because it was all I could get at the time. And despite all of this, I also got the feedback from my leadership that my biggest strong suit was my ability to build relationships and genuine relationships at that, and that success will come soon. 

Success unfortunately didn’t come soon. And I continued to struggle and was constantly finding myself below my growth line. And that feeling of being stuck and frustrated were everyday emotions. But Insight Global cared about me. They wrapped their arms around me and provided me with additional support and training. description:
Credit Acceptance is proud to be an award-winning company with local and
national workplace recognition in multiple categories! Our world-class culture
is shaped by dedicated Team Members who share a drive to succeed as
professionals and together as a company. A great product, amazing people and
our stable financial history have made us one of the largest used car finance
companies nationally. 
Our IT and Analytics Team Members utilize the latest technology to develop,
monitor, and maintain complex practices that help optimize our success. Our
Team Members value being challenged, are encouraged to express their ideas,
and have the flexibility to enjoy work life balance. We build intrinsic value
by partnering with all functions of our business to support their success and
make strategic business decisions. We focus on professional development and
continuous improvement while enjoying a casual work environment and Great
Place to Work culture! 
As a DevOps, Supervisor, you will lead a technical team responsible for all
DevOps platforms. You will also support the enterprise deployment pipelines
and secure code repository. You will help build a learning culture within the
team and drive team engagement. You will ensure best practices for delivering,
maintaining, and monitoring the code, data, and mobile pipeline. You will help
the team understand, filter, and prioritize new work. You will coordinate
efforts with cross-functional teams to deliver quality solutions. You will
identify and drive improvement in team processes. You will assist in
performing the work as well as mentoring the team. 
This Supervisor of DevOps is part of the IT Operations team. 
Outcomes and Activities: 
DevOps

* This position will work from home; occasional planned travel to an office location may be required. However, this position is permitted to work at an office if requested by the team member.
* Works collaboratively with PMO, Product, Stakeholders, and IT team members to achieve company objectives.
* Defines and enforces standards, procedures and methodologies for effective operation, performance, security, and recovery of all enterprise application systems.
* Oversees process to promote software packages from non-production to production environments.
* Supports the implementation of deployment pipelines for all enterprise applications.
* Understands, filters, and prioritizes new work for the team and supports the execution of the work.
* Addresses or escalates risks to scope, timeline, and budget for work.
* Maintains a backlog of work that clearly describes tasks. Keeps the backlog clean.
* Coordinates remediation efforts for pipeline incidents or outages.
* Drives strategic efforts to reduce the likelihood and impact of application issues.
* Improves team processes by identifying areas of opportunity and mentoring team to resolve.
* Monitors the health of the team, while recognizing and acting on coaching opportunities to increase team health.
* Supports the team in the development of their skills.

Other

* Serves as a 24/7 escalation point for the team.

Competencies: The following items detail how you will be successful in this
role.

* Impact Analysis: Understand the rationale behind and how changes impact the enterprise and/or applications and across the technical ecosystem.
* Solution Design: Ability to translate high level requirements to create and implement designs that meet the needs of the customer, are technically sound, maintainable, and cost effective. Ability to identify missing or ambiguous requirements. Ability to design at both high and low levels of abstraction, understand complex requirements and translate into understandable solutions. Ability to accurately estimate based on requirements.
* Technical Domain: Understand the technical domain, including the application architecture, design, and data of the application they support and systems to which it interfaces.
* Testing Techniques: Understand the range of testing techniques available well enough to select the most effective test procedures.

Requirements:

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
* Minimum 5 years of experience in DevOps, Application Development, or related IT field
* Strong experience leading a technical team or leading technical projects

Preferred Experience:

* Experience with Linux and/or Windows environments and commands
* Experience with test automation frameworks (JUnit API, Robot, Cucumber, SpecFlow, etc.)
* Experience configuring and maintaining database versioning tools (Red Gate, Datical, etc.)
* Experience with application & infrastructure monitoring for performance and availability (DynaTrace, SPLUNK, etc.)
* Experience managing source code solutions & branching strategies (BitBucket, GitHub Enterprise, Subversion, Team Foundation Version Control, etc.)
* Demonstrated experience designing and implementing technology enabled solutions
* Experience within a Java / C++ environment
* Experience working with cloud-based technologies, such as Azure DevOps or AWS
* Experience with automation technologies and scripting languages

Targeted Compensation: $105,000 - $140,000 base salary + an annual bonus plan 
This position is not currently open to individuals who require sponsorship now
or in the future to work legally for Credit Acceptance, such as H-1b / H-4 or
F-1 OPT visa holders. 
INDCSLP

* Direct by effectively communicating and conveying courage

To create an environment where people do their best work, we focus on the

* Train team members and focus on developing talent
* Performance Manage by ensuring accountability and driving results
* Create the Right Environment by establishing trust and managing conflict
* Maintain the Right Number of team members needed to build an effective team

Expectations:

* Attendance as required by department

Advice!

for you long term. If you are actively looking or starting to explore new
opportunities, send us your application! 
P.S. 
We have great details around our stats, success, history and more. We’re proud
of our culture and are happy to share why – let’s talk! 
Required degrees must have been earned at institutions of Higher Education
which are accredited by the Council for Higher Education Accreditation or
equivalent. 
Credit Acceptance is dedicated to providing an inclusive environment for all.
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and value a culturally
diverse workforce. We believe in ensuring all team members demonstrate mutual
respect for one another. All qualified applicants will receive consideration
for employment without regard to protected characteristics like age, race,
color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,
veteran or disability status. 
California Residents: Please click here 
for the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) notice regarding the personal
information Credit Acceptance may collect from you.

description:
DevSecOps Engineer: 
- This role will focus on our pipelines security focus, handling
vulnerabilities, patching, implementing Twistlock and Checkmarx
recommendations for our developers.

* Work within a team to plan, deploy, and maintain critical business applications prod/non-prod AWS environments.
* Design and implement appropriate environments for those applications, engineer suitable release management procedures and provide production support.
* Influence other teams and broader Engineering groups in adopting Cloud technologies, processes, and best practices.
* Work with DevOps leaders in other groups to define and align on standard operating procedures and best practices.
* Automate the provisioning of environments using Ansible, Packer and Terraform.
* Create application deployment pipelines with GitLab CI, Jenkins, and Helm.
* Design and implement strategy to ensure all platform data is highly available and replicated
* Troubleshoot problems, involving the appropriate resources and driving resolution of issues with a focus on minimizing impact to our customers.
* Participate in the Agile DevOps design, development, testing, and release of new capabilities and features with focus on release and post-production support.
* Drive improvements to processes and design enhancements to automation to continuously improve the production environment.
* Work with Risk Management and Compliance teams to ensure target services are hardened and secure.
* Identify reoccurring issues and work with Technology and Business partners to remediate using leading industry processes.
* Frequent technologies used in this role would be: AWS, Ansible, Docker, Gitlab, Jenkins, Kubernetes, and Linux Shell Scripting.

Basic Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree.
* At least 3 years of experience with AWS.
* At least 2 years of experience in automated delivery and developing automation workflows and routines.
* At least 2 years of experience in infrastructure design, implementation and delivery.
* At least 1 year of experience in containerizing applications with Docker and deploying them to Kubernetes.

Preferred Qualifications:

* Certified AWS Architect.
* Experience with Kubernetes cluster administration and Stateful Sets.
* Experience with Open Source tools such as Ansible, Gitlab CI, Helm, Jenkins and Terraform.
* 1+ years of experience working with Agile Development Practices.
* 2+ years of programming experience with automation or development in Python, Ruby, or equivalent.
* 3+ years of experience Production Support experience in Linux environments.
* 3+ years of experience in technology delivery in a DevOps / Cloud Engineering environment.
* Strong grasp of automation and monitoring tools (ability to automate repeatable tasks via scripting).
* Ability to define and deploy monitoring, metrics, and logging systems.

Minimum of 3 years of experience required due to job requirements.

description:
Company Description

Job Description

Love cutting-edge tech? We do too.

We may be the most important Internet company you've never heard of, and at
Epsilon we do more than collect and store data. We help some of the world's
biggest brands solve meaningful problems on a massive scale--and have fun
doing it.

As a member of the Linux Systems Engineering team, you will work in a group
that is focused on efficiency, project work, compliance, standards,
situational awareness and readiness. You'll be a critical part of a fast-
moving, innovative team, providing support and expertise where needed. You
will work independently with little to no guidance in some situations as well
as working with the team in full collaboration.

What You'll Do:

* Participate in engineering, deploying, and maintaining solutions and services for internal customers.
* Act as a technical liaison to one or more internal company divisions.
* Investigate and troubleshoot TIER 3 issues with network, server, and application infrastructure.
* Communicate issues to stakeholders effectively and in a timely fashion.
* Provide documentation of configuration and troubleshooting procedures to facilitate other team members and teams within the IT organization.
* Provide after-hours support when required, and respond to outages, incidents, and alerts.

About You :
* Able to do your best work in a team setting and autonomously
* Well-developed interpersonal skills.
* Owns a problem to the end
* Proud to share in team's success
* Wants to grow a career with a great company.

* 
What You'll Bring:
* BS in Computer Science or related technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
* At least two years of professional experience building, configuring, and administering CentOS/RHEL in an enterprise environment.
* Detail oriented and highly observant, with excellent organization and time management skills.
* Highly effective communicator for both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Excellent data analysis skills.
* Excellent Linux command line skills.
* Experience with writing and testing programs with interpreted languages such as Python, Perl, or Ruby.
* Experience with automation and configuration (Puppet, Ansible, Salt, etc).
* Working knowledge of the Git version control system.
* Experience with building Docker images and orchestrating containers (Swarm/Kubernetes).
* Ability to troubleshoot difficult problems within OS, network, and application layers.
* Ability to produce results amid multiple shifting/competing priorities.
* Independent worker, requiring little day-to-day direction from management.
* Agile experience a plus (Kanban, Scrum, etc)

Qualifications

Additional Information

When you 're one of us, you get to run with the best. For decades, we've
been helping marketers from the world's top brands personalize experiences for
millions of people with our cutting-edge technology, solutions and services.
Epsilon's best-in-class identity gives brands a clear, privacy-safe view of
their customers, which they can use across our suite of digital media,
messaging and loyalty solutions. We process 400+ billion consumer actions each
day and hold many patents of proprietary technology, including real-time
modeling languages and consumer privacy advancements. Thanks to the work of
every employee, Epsilon has been consistently recognized as industry-leading
by Forrester, Adweek and the MRC. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe,
Epsilon is a global company with more than 8,000 employees around the world.
Check out a few of these resources to learn more about what makes Epsilon so
EPIC:

* Culture: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/our-culture-epsilon
* DE&I: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/diversity-equity-inclusion
* CSR: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility
* Life at Epsilon: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/epic-blog

Great People Deserve Great Benefits

We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the
world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect
competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to
advance your career.

Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon's policy is not to
discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived
race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national
origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion,
creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including
transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other
characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Epsilon
also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these
protected categories.

Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to
complete the application process.

LI-AM1

description:
Great Day Improvements, a top 10 home remodeling company, is experiencing
double digit growth and is undergoing a digital transformation of the
business.

Our success has allowed us to make significant investments in the business to
further fuel our growth, including a technology-enabled end-to-end customer
experience platform.

We are looking for key DevOps engineers who want to make our vision a reality.
The right individuals are energized by building and creating, not just
managing tickets. You will have the chance to support a technology platform
from the ground up, alongside a team of highly skilled and dedicated
engineers.

We are committed to investing in our future and in our people. Join us at this
exciting stage in our business!

The DevOps engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, testing,
publishing, and documenting an enterprise level cloud application. 
Primary Job Duties 
· Work with technical engineers at large to understand its CI/CD and release
management needs to be able to transform those understandings into solution
requirements.

· Implement and maintain various aspects of CI/CD release cycle using CLI
scripting, tools, and datasets

· Must understand application architecture and configuration structure very
well

· Design continuous integration, continuous testing, continuous delivery, and
configuration management for enterprise software solutions,
monitoring/observability, and cloud platforms, and provide technical oversight
of DevOps implementation and delivery.

· APM - Monitor distributed application clusters in multiple environments
(dev, uat, prod etc...)

· Managing IDP: security catalogs, roles and ACL descriptors in IDP solution

· Admin cloud infrastructure (block storage, compute, network topologies)

· Identify and evaluate the value of emerging technology 
Skills 
· 3+ years API deploy/development with any modern tech stack (e.g., .NET,
Java, Node, Elixir etc...)

· Web/Http APIS: reverse proxy, SSL termination, balancing and related topics

· Base IP networking: net classes, NAT, subnets, masking etc.

· Security: OAuth/OpenIDC management, roles, ACLs

· Command Line Interface scripting / CLI tools in Linux/Bash experience is
required

· Basic understanding of distributed architecture topics: queues, events,
APIS/services

· Base knowledge of databases, RDBMS, NoSQL/Document. Replication and sharding

· Strong Communication skills with ability to work within a distributed team
in the USA

· Documentation skills are required

· Knowledge of modern frameworks/languages is a big plus (e.g., .NET, Java,
Node, Python)

· Knowledge of cloud service providers is a plus: AWS, GCP, Azure et.al.

· GitHub et.al projects/demos/Portfolio is a major plus

About Great Day Improvements, LLC

Great Day Improvements is a vertically integrated, direct-to-consumer provider
of branded premium building products, including Patio Enclosures brand
sunrooms and screen rooms; Stanek brand windows and patio doors; Apex Energy
Solutions energy efficient windows and doors; and Hartshorn Custom Contracting
pool enclosures and lanais. In the last 5 years, Great Day Improvements has
more than quadrupled in size and footprint, expanding its workforce to over
740 employees across 62 metropolitan markets throughout the United States. The
company has been named to REMODELING Magazine’s 550 List and Qualified
Remodeler’s Top 500 List, and is among Inc. Magazine’s fastest growing private
companies. Great Day Improvements has an excellent reputation with an A rating
from the BBB and an overall Google rating of 4.6 with over 2,300 reviews. To
learn more, visit www.patioenclosures.com, www.stanekwindows.com,
www.greatdayimprovements.com, www.hccscreens.com www.apexenergygroup.com

Equal Employment Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without
regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected
veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Right to Work

In compliance with federal law, all personals hired will be required to verify
identify and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the
required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Command line scripting: 3 years (Preferred)
* AWS/GCP/AZURE CLI as code (not using UI): 3 years (Preferred)
* Software configuration: 3 years (Preferred)
* Networking knowledge (IP/NAT, HTTPs/balancing, routing, SSL): 3 years (Preferred)
* APM: Logging/Telemetry/Alerting: 3 years (Preferred)
* Deploy: CI/CD: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote
