description:
Company Description: 
pureIntegration, a technology consulting firm with 17+ years of experience
servicing fortune 100 clients,* is seeking highly energetic, positive and
collaborative AWS Cloud DevOps Engineers with a passion for driving
improved processes, high reliability, and great developer experiences. As a
Cloud Engineer, your role will be comprised of creating and designing elegant
and maintainable solutions to complex cloud problems, and driving engineering
and automation for public cloud services within a dynamic enterprise looking
to reshape how software services are delivered in their industry.* 
 Job Description: * 
 This role requires the ability to research, propose and prototype new
principles, cloud technologies and concepts, and integrate them using common
DevOps practices and tooling. A successful candidate in this position will
have demonstrable experience in cloud technologies focused on AWS. This will
understand the interdependencies between services within AWS, how they are
provisioned, their purpose, and how the are integrated into enterprise level
solutions. 
 If this sounds like you, and you want to join a team who is leading change
their industry, apply today! 
 Location: Position is remote. Client site is in Washington DC.* 
 Work Arrangement: 1099 Contract Role or W2 Fulltime 
* 
 Work Authorization: EAD, GC, US Citizens. We Do Not Accept H1B Visas. We
Do Not accept C2C relationships* 
 Responsibilities: * 
 The role of a cloud engineer entails design and buildout of automation
platforms utilizing Infrastructure as Code methodologies to Provision, Deploy
and manage Cloud infrastructure for App teams to consume. The candidate will
innovate by identifying opportunities for proactive and reactive (self-
healing) automation solutions for Cloud services adopted within the
enterprise. The candidate will design and execute new initiatives to
standardize systems, automate designs, build tooling, and optimize operations
to reduce implementation cycle times, eliminate service downtime, optimize
performance, and ensure that all security and compliance requirements are
fully governed. 
 Skills and Requirements: * 

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field, or relevant work experience.
* 5+ years demonstrable, professional Cloud infrastructure experience in AWS
* 5+ years of experience with AWS Connect, Lambda, S3, Dynamo DB and other AWS services
* Strong critical thinking, decision making and problem solving skills
* Understanding of Infrastructure as Code and practical application of IaC in providing best practice to application engineering teams
* Experience in implementing provision of services utilizing Terraform (open source, Enterprise or Cloud)
* 3+ years of experience in a DevOps oriented team utilizing Agile Scrum methodology
* Experience managing code and dependencies in Azure DevOps, GIT along with other configuration management best practices
* Experience with Cloud Formation and AWS APIs
* Proven experience performing root cause analysis in complex and distributed systems and environments
* Ability to join a 24/7 Level 3 on-call support on a rotational basis

Additional Information: * 
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO
guidelines.
* Are you self-motivated, collaborative, and client-focused? Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding career? Then pureIntegration would love to hear from you! Your career journey starts here!

pureIntegration, a systems integration company headquartered in the
Washington DC area, serves clients in the fastest growing industries –
communications, media, and entertainment. Our industry-focused offerings and
collaborative client approach has resulted in a 97% client satisfaction
rating. 
As a leading service organization, we recognize our most valuable assets
are our people, both as individuals and how they come together as a whole. As
such, we encourage our team members to become fearless in exploring ideas and
opportunities to act on them. 
In over 17 years of Digital Transformation consulting and professional
services, pureIntegration has successfully designed, integrated, and deployed
winning solutions at scale which have resulted in measurable performance
increases. Most importantly, we have done it while maintaining 97% client
satisfaction for the past 17 years. With a rich heritage in Communications,
Media and Entertainment, our diverse and expanding portfolio includes Fortune
500 enterprises spanning Utilities, Manufacturing, Insurance, CPG, Healthcare,
Logistics and other select verticals. 
*pureIntegration is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE), qualified
applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color,
religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran
status. 
* Location: IO, Chevy Chase, MD

Location: IO, Chevy Chase, MD

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80.00 - $90.00 per hour

description:
The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for assisting the Company in the
configuration, administration, monitoring and maintenance Company’s existing
and future software server, software, network and associated technologies with
an emphasis on employing cloud based service providers and operating a hybrid
architecture consisting of internal, external, and partner based technology
resources.

Required Qualifications

· The DevOps Engineer will create, deploy, monitor, scale and secure
infrastructure and applications with focus on automating as much as possible.

· This role will work with other engineers to evolve the company's CI/CD
capabilities and will play a key role in the implementation of DevOps
processes and tooling

· This role is key to helping the teams in the engineering organization be
successful in their jobs

· Ensure availability, performance, scalability, and security of deployed
infrastructure

· Build and maintain operations software which automates the configuration,
provisioning, deployment, and monitoring of our core products

· Build and maintain our production infrastructure to ensure ongoing
reliability while maximizing development team efficiency

· Develop automation frameworks for public cloud infrastructure deployments

· Monitor, troubleshoot and debug infrastructure, network, operating system,
and system performance issues

· Maintenance, management, and streamlining of all our CI/CD processes

· Participate in architecture planning sessions with development team

· Work closely with developers and QA teams to understand how to improve their
processes and deliver high quality software more effectively.

Position Qualifications

· A minimum of 4 years of experience with system administration on Linux
machines

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Docker or other containerization
technologies

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Terraform

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using AWS

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Kubernetes

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Jenkins or similar CI/CD Tools

· Experience with Ansible, Helm, and Git

· Experience with Cloud Networking and Load Balancer Technologies (AWS ELB,
HAProxy, etc.)

· Experience with maintaining monitoring tools like Grafana, Prometheus,
InfluxDB, and Telegraf

· Ability to critically think and provide solutions to problems you have not
encountered before

· Fluency in at least two programming languages (i.e. Ruby, Python, etc.)

· Experience with continuous integration / deployment (CI/CD) in a high
availability environment

· Ability to work effectively with distributed teams using collaboration tools
and without face-to-face communication

The selected candidate will join a team who values work life balance and
professional growth equally. You will be supported as you continue to grow in
your career and will be given every resource to succeed. Interested candidates
are encouraged to apply directly.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
Sr. DevOps Engineer 
Full Time 
Remote

Salary - $130 to $140K Year

Work for a well - established record management firm located in the Florida
area!

Summary:

The Senior DevOps Engineer position operates as a critical role within the
engineering team and the company's software development lifecycle applying
industry standard software engineering and Agile development principles to
architect, build, deploy, and monitor software on the company's cloud hosted
microservices platform. This position is responsible for designing and
deploying the platform components that accelerate delivery of the company's
software to clients and markets. This senior role is responsible for
designing, architecting, and implementing all aspects of Infrastructure as
Code (IaC), including Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
pipelines and cloud services that comprise our platform and related software
products. Additionally, this position is responsible for the automated Release
Management process. This position works closely with the front-end, back-end,
and site reliability development roles to ensure the platform operates at or
above industry standards for security, reliability, and performance. Finally,
this position is responsible for continually researching, evaluating, and
recommending new frameworks and technologies that can protect or expand the
company's product and technology competitive advantage.

Education and/or Experience

· BS/BA in MIS, Computer Science or science related field required

· 2-3 years of experience in architecting and coding microservices in AWS
required

· 2-3 years of experience managing Kubernetes clusters

· 2-3 years of experience creating and maintaining DevOps pipelines

· 2-3 years of experience working with serverless event driven technologies

· 4+ years of experience in back-end/automation development required

· AWS Professional or Specialty certification required

· Kubernetes CKA certification preferred

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

· Strong knowledge of and ability to configure, install and automate AWS
services

· Strong knowledge of industry standard development practices, particularly in
IaC, security, reliability, and performance disciplines

· Strong knowledge of at least one programming language

· Awareness of critical concepts in DevOps and Agile principles

· Intermediate knowledge of networking including basic subnet masking

· Excellent organizational, interpersonal, written, and verbal communication
skills

Responsibilities

· Work effectively in agile frameworks with product and engineering team

· Responsible for all aspects of platform design and deploy documentation
including security, reliability, and performance monitoring.

· Codify and maintain all enterprise architecture (infrastructure as code)

· Strive for continuous improvement and build continuous integration,
continuous development, and constant deployment pipelines

· Mentor all members of the engineering team to expand their knowledge and
skills regarding platform engineering best practices, techniques, and
technologies.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Azure: 3 years (Preferred)
* AWS: 3 years (Preferred)
* Kubernetes: 3 years (Preferred)
* DevOps: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

description:
JOB TITLE: Development Operations Engineer 
 LOCATION: Remote / Austin , Texas 
 DURATION: 6 Months contract on w2 (Possible extension) 
 Unfortunately we cannot work on a C2C basis and are seeking candidates who
can work on our W2

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Lead tools and build-release activities for infotainment software
(images/packages) on single or multiple hardware boards with latest multi-core
multimedia SOC.

Lead and set technical direction for tools, build-release-test automation and
cloud-backend services.

Be responsible for developing tools & automation solutions for CI / CD / CT
workflow, including software updates and manufacturing support.

Develop integrated tools and processes to work in conjunction with JAMA, JIRA,
GIT, and other repositories to provide a seamless CI / CD / CT workflow.

Develop the tools, plug-ins and solutions necessary for CI / CD / CT workflow
using Jenkins, AWS, Docker, REST APIs and other microservices.

Work with other cross-functional teams and convert business requirements into
engineering requirements for development operations.

Be responsible for tool/software development and maintenance, adhering to
appropriate internal & external safety/security standards.

Be a dynamic cross-functional technical leader enabling other dependent teams
(like software, hardware and application).

Identify and set new technical directions to improve development process and
FULFILL company / group vision. this is what you'll need:

5+ years of experience with embedded or Linux software development using
C/C++.

5+ years of experience with auto build tools (like make, Waf etc.,), Jenkins,
AWS, Linux-server installation and maintenance.

5+ years of experience with scripting languages like Python and/or Shell.

5+ years of experience in one or more areas - chat-ops, OTA servers, micro-
services and cloud backend operations.

5+ years of experience with SQL or other non-relational databases.

Ability to be creative/resourceful - to work in a fast-paced start-up
environment.

Additional preferred skills: - Strong experience with developing tools for
software products using

Android / Linux / QNX.

Ability and experience to design and develop application tools (running on
windows/mac/Linux) for manufacturing and software update (OTA).

Automotive - software development , tools and build-release engineering
experience.

Windows POWERSHELL and automation experience.

description:
Who We *Are

Insurity is a leading property and casualty insurance software and data
analytics providers, working with some of the world's largest insurers,
brokers, and MGAs, including 15 of the top 25 P&C carriers in the US. With
1400+ team members globally, 7 office locations, and 300+ customers, we have a
deep understanding of the insurance business, unparalleled technology
expertise, and a singular focus of delivering a simplified insurance
experience to our customers.

Insurity 's next DevOps Specialist

As part of the DevOps Development team, our DevOps Specialist will help mature
and improve our existing product build, packaging, and deployment processes.
They will also collaborate and help pave the way to adopt new processes using
a wide variety of tools including Azure DevOps, TFS, PowerShell, c#, APIs,
Azure - and many more - that deploy to Azure, AWS, internal, and client-hosted
platforms. It's rare we do the same thing twice - but if so, we automate it!
We are all about making our existing processes better while adopting current
and emerging tools to make everyone's lives easier. We are a team of
experienced and sharp developers with a DevOps mentality.

What You 'll Do

* Learn multiple platforms, technologies, and languages (i.e. Azure, Azure DevOps, AWS, PowerShell, c#) to create new code, scripts, and processes
* Write, understand, and modify scripting languages - PowerShell is our primary language, but if you have experience with bash, etc. you can learn PowerShell
* Work on identified pain spots in the organization and utilize the latest tools to automate and simplify them
* Have your hands in different Insurity products every month
* Live the 'DevOps Culture' - spread knowledge, train others, and help bring new tools and concepts to the organization

Administration

* Act as a mentor to team members
* Understands the major components of the system and their purpose
* Can quickly narrow down point(s) of failure by their symptoms and can offer recommendations to resolve
* Understands windows components, their purpose and basic knowledge of their features, and how to use them
* Has a grasp of certificates, their purposes, and how to apply them

Build and Deployment

* Set up new servers, install features, roles, products (i.e., SQL Server, SSRS)TFS, Timesheet, etc.
* Understands the software build and packaging process, makes small modifications as necessary
* Is able to build major versions and service packs
* Understand and implement the deployment process then modify the scripts/process as needed
* Safekeep software release versions and packages

Who You Are

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience considered
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Able to think critically, get into the details, and change directions rapidly
* Flexible, open-minded, with a passion for learning new tools
* Able to give and receive feedback in a constructive manner
* Excellent ability to handle multiple contending priorities and effectively plan your work accordingly

Demonstrated aptitude with the following technologies:

* Hosted Azure DevOps, On-Prem TFS 2017, 2019
* Jenkins concepts/knowledge useful but not required
* Source control systems - Git (TFS, ADO, BitBucket), TFVC
* CI/CD
* Kubernetes / Containers
* SQL Server
* .net / MVC knowledge a plus

Where: This role can be performed either remotely or based in our Hartford
office. Note: This role is expected to begin remotely due to COVID-19.

Our Benefits

Collaborative Culture | Flexible Hours | Growth Opportunities

Day 1 Health Insurance Coverage | Open PTO

Does Insurity sound like the right place for you? Send us your application and
a cover letter highlighting what sets you apart from the nice-to-haves and
makes you a must-have for our team!

Thank you for your interest in Insurity! Please understand that due to the
volume of applicants we receive, only selected candidates will be contacted.

Insurity is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable
accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to
perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges
of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  

LI-REMOTE

description:
Description

If you are a person who is curious, eager to learn and welcomes a challenge,
this is the role for you! In this position, you will be responsible for
release management, audit management, non-OS patching. upgrades, secops/pen
testing from detailed specifications including analysis, coding, testing and
documenting processes, routines, and applications. You will also be
responsible for participating in the preparation of specifications from which
programs will be written. This role will offer you the opportunity to learn
and gain experience from a world-class organization working closely with other
developers to solve complex data challenges to resolve business needs.

Responsibilities

* Create and/or modify programs to adapt to changes in needs and requirements, adhering to defined specifications and meeting timelines.
* Handle assignments with increased complexity and scope.
* Read, understand, and troubleshoot coded computer instructions and how they translate into data.
* Review, test and validate coded program routines and data making revisions and eliminating errors in processing
* Assist in gathering, documenting, and refining business, data, and system specifications from business users and translating them to database developers and analyst.
* Develop an understanding of release management, audit management, non-OS upgrading/patching, SecOps/pen-testing
* Develop an understanding of systems and technology used within the company.
* Develop an understanding of the content of policies written by the company.
* Develop an understanding of the pharmacy industry and the organizational relationships of the company.

Requires Qualifications:

* The successful candidate will be highly motivated, and self-starting.
* The successful candidate must be comfortable working in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
* Experience working in a Healthcare company is desirable.
* Experience with and knowledge of presentation and public speaking skills.
* Demonstrated ability/willingness/eagerness to learn new technologies
* Demonstrated openness for learning, growth, and coaching by peers and more senior-level teammates
* General knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
* Demonstrated ability to do effective problem-solving and troubleshooting
* Perform tasks within predefined guidelines and procedures as assigned by the manager or project team.

Education and/or Experience:

* 0 to 2 years of relevant experience.
* Demonstrated/Qualified technical area of study.
* Ability to successfully work in a team environment.

Desired Computer Skills:

* Knowledge of/familiarity with Powershell, Visual Studio, C#, ASP.NET, Transact SQL, and other programming languages.
* Knowledge of/familiarity with web services, SQL Server, and other Microsoft technologies a plus.
* Knowledge of/Familiarity with Web.API, REST services, JSON, XML, and HL7 are a plus.
* Knowledge of/Familiarity with IIS, GIT, TeamCity, Octopus, Apple/Google App Store is a significant plus.

Additional Information

Work-At-Home Requirements

* WAH requirements: Must have the ability to provide a high-speed DSL or cable modem for a home office. Associates or contractors who live and work from home in the state of California will be provided payment for their internet expense.
* A minimum standard speed for optimal performance of 25x10 (25mpbs download x 10mpbs upload) is required.
* Satellite and Wireless Internet service is NOT allowed for this role.
* A dedicated space lacking ongoing interruptions to protect member PHI / HIPAA information.
* All locations considered with an understanding/agreement that a majority of the working hours/day must overlap with Eastern Time zone working hours"

description:
Do you have the skills--and drive--to join a tech team that's working to
digitally transform a trillion-dollar industry? From test-driving the latest
technologies to creating intuitive consumer apps, Liberty Mutual is constantly
innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind
for our customers worldwide.

As a software engineer on this Customer Success team at Liberty Mutual, you'll
apply your talents in an agile environment that has the creative energy of a
start-up--and the full backing and comprehensive benefits of a Fortune 100
company.

Note: This is a range posting - Software/Sr. Software Engineer - and the final
offer will be based on the candidate's skills and experiences.

Responsibilities:

* Provide technical support to Liberty Mutual's product development teams as they use our CI/CD tool suite to build and deploy code to our internal and cloud computing environments.
* Guide developers to self-service options for resolving issues.
* Troubleshoot CI/CD platform and infrastructure automation errors, provide solutions and escalate issues as needed.
* Interface with and direct customers to other teams as needed.
* Observe trends in ticket types or questions asked and engage with product teams to provide solutions for known issues.
* Learn the inner workings of our end-to-end CI/CD software delivery environment and innovative public cloud infrastructure automation.
* Improve the developer experience: reduce obstacles and provide solutions.
* Develop automation to provide fast resolution for common inquiries.
* Create self-service documentation and utilities.
* We encourage innovative ideas to improve our development community's experience.
* Demonstrated success in Jenkins, JIRA, AWS, Pipelines
* Familiarity with CI/CD deployment tools and agile software development practices is desired, including Jira, GitHub, Bamboo, Jenkins, Artifactory, AWS, Azure, GCP Cloud Foundry
* Experience working in an agile environment utilizing Scrum, Kanban or XP.
* Strong oral and written communication skills--and a knack for explaining your decision-making process to non-engineers.
* A collaborative, adaptable working style, demonstrated initiative and the ability to prioritize your time and efforts.
* A Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline, or equivalent experience.
* Troubleshooting complex systems, and needing an understanding of cloud computing, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud engineering best practices.

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently
pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness,
inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of
roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding
profession.  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great
Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of
the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's
2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of
America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New
Graduates--as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn
more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit:
https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and
we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-
being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:
https://LMI.co/Benefits  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate
discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual
orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status,
pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or
local law.

description:
JOB TITLE: Development Operations Engineer 
 LOCATION: Remote / Austin , Texas 
 DURATION: 6 Months contract on w2 (Possible extension) 
 Unfortunately we cannot work on a C2C basis and are seeking candidates who
can work on our W2

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Lead tools and build-release activities for infotainment software
(images/packages) on single or multiple hardware boards with latest multi-core
multimedia SOC.

Lead and set technical direction for tools, build-release-test automation and
cloud-backend services.

Be responsible for developing tools & automation solutions for CI / CD / CT
workflow, including software updates and manufacturing support.

Develop integrated tools and processes to work in conjunction with JAMA, JIRA,
GIT, and other repositories to provide a seamless CI / CD / CT workflow.

Develop the tools, plug-ins and solutions necessary for CI / CD / CT workflow
using Jenkins, AWS, Docker, REST APIs and other microservices.

Work with other cross-functional teams and convert business requirements into
engineering requirements for development operations.

Be responsible for tool/software development and maintenance, adhering to
appropriate internal & external safety/security standards.

Be a dynamic cross-functional technical leader enabling other dependent teams
(like software, hardware and application).

Identify and set new technical directions to improve development process and
FULFILL company / group vision. this is what you'll need:

5+ years of experience with embedded or Linux software development using
C/C++.

5+ years of experience with auto build tools (like make, Waf etc.,), Jenkins,
AWS, Linux-server installation and maintenance.

5+ years of experience with scripting languages like Python and/or Shell.

5+ years of experience in one or more areas - chat-ops, OTA servers, micro-
services and cloud backend operations.

5+ years of experience with SQL or other non-relational databases.

Ability to be creative/resourceful - to work in a fast-paced start-up
environment.

Additional preferred skills: - Strong experience with developing tools for
software products using

Android / Linux / QNX.

Ability and experience to design and develop application tools (running on
windows/mac/Linux) for manufacturing and software update (OTA).

Automotive - software development , tools and build-release engineering
experience.

Windows POWERSHELL and automation experience.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: Up to $60.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* DevOps: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

description:
Oddball believes that the best products are built when engineers understand
and value the things they are working on. We value learning and growth and the
ability to make a big impact at a small company. We believe that we can make
big changes happen and improve the daily lives of millions of people by
bringing quality software to the federal space.

We are hiring for a DevOps engineer to work on a program that will make a
positive impact on millions of Americans' daily lives. As an early hire on a
small team, you'll have a huge stake in what we build and how we work.

What you'll be doing:

Working hand in hand with great DevOps engineers to create and execute
software development plans and strategies in support of large-scale platform
and API initiatives in the federal space. This will include developing and
implementing algorithms, database design, automated testing, and quality
control of software development.

We are looking for someone with the following skillset:

* In-depth experience with config management tools like: Jenkins, Chef, Ansible, Puppet, SaltStack,
* 3+ years experience creating and supporting AWS environments
* 3+ years experience with engineering, integrating or testing production IT infrastructure platforms using Kubernetes and Openshift
* 2+ years experience developing and improving CI/CD scripts and services for development and deployment
* Experience supporting web technologies and websites running Apache or NGINX
* 3+ years experience with Linux operating systems including installing, configuring and troubleshooting
* Experience in SQL architecture such as MySQL, PostgreSQL or MS-SQL
* Desire and ability to mentor and train other engineers
* A Bachelor's Degree is required with a minimum of 8 years experience

Salary

This is a salaried role. As part of your benefits package, Oddball provides a
monthly continuing education stipend and a tech stipend.

Must be located within the United States.

Clearances

Ability to obtain low-level federal clearance is required

Oddball is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against
applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition,
legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual
orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including
pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or
other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or
physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application
process should contact an Oddball HR representative to request such an
accommodation.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* AWS: 3 years (Preferred)
* CI/CD: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

Requisition ID: R10055473

* Category: Engineering 
* Location: Linthicum, Maryland, United States of America 
* Citizenship Required: United States Citizenship 
* Clearance Type: SCI 
* Telecommute: No- Teleworking not available for this position 
* Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America) 
* Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time 
* Positions Available: 1  

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on
revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and
for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to
be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history
- from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to
landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a
pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the
way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and
bringing your whole self to work -- and we have an insatiable drive to do what
others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history,
they're making history.

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on
revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and
for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to
be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history
- from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to
landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a
pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the
way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and
bringing your whole self to work -- and we have an insatiable drive to do what
others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history,
they're making history.

The Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) Advanced Processing Solutions
Business pushes the boundaries of innovation, redefines the leading edge of
exotic new technologies, and drives advances in the sciences. One of our most
challenging new fields is Transformational Computing, which combines the
unique properties of superconductivity and quantum mechanics to develop
radical new energy-efficient computing systems. Our team is chartered with
providing the skills to transform computing beyond Moore's Law, advancing
development of computer architectures, processing/memory subsystems, and
large-scale high-performance computing systems. You will work in a fast-paced
team environment alongside a broad array of scientists and engineers to make
these processing solutions a reality and deliver remarkable new advantages to
the warfighter.

Northrop Grumman Mission Systems Sector (NGMS) is a leading global provider of
secure software-defined, hardware enabled mission systems. Our company is
pioneering capabilities in a wide variety of sectors that keep our nation and
our allies' safe from undersea to space and cyberspace. NGMS is seeking
Software Engineers with demonstrated ability to lead development of new
technologies to support our innovative Transformational Computing team to help
develop software in support of emerging supercomputing technologies.

The software engineers will be developing and supporting the next-generation
supercomputing capabilities including simulations, algorithms, test
automation, and data management and analysis capabilities. As a Senior
Principal Software Engineer at Northrop Grumman, you will have a challenging
and rewarding opportunity to be a part of our Enterprise-wide digital
transformation. Using Model-based Engineering, DevSecOps and Agile practices
we continue to evolve how we deliver critical national defense products and
capabilities for the warfighter. Our success is grounded in our ability to
embrace change, move quickly and continuously drive innovation. The successful
candidate will be collaborative, open, transparent, and team-oriented with a
focus on team empowerment & shared responsibility, flexibility, continuous
learning, and a culture of automation.

The selected individual requires expert level software development skills and
will be responsible for leading design teams in all phases of the software
development lifecycle including design, development, and test. Candidates
should have a solid foundation with best practices in software design,
Continuous Integration / Continuous Deliver (CI/CD) tools and processes, and
object-oriented programming. Candidates should be familiar with the Agile
methodology of software development.

All job functions require close teamwork across functional disciplines and
integrated product teams in a fast-paced environment. This program area is
expanding which offers the potential for future growth opportunities
(technical lead, software architect, etc.) for candidates who successfully
demonstrate exceptional performance and leadership. This requisition may be
filled at a higher grade based on qualifications listed below.

This position requires onsite work at our Linthicum, MD location.

Basic Qualifications:

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Sciences, Information Technology, or comparable degree
* A minimum of 2 years of experience in DevOps
* A minimum of 2 years of experience in the software development
* Experience with automation programming languages (Python, Ruby, C#, Java, JavaScript….)
* Experience with the agile software development lifecycle
* Experience with CI/CD tool integration

Preferred Qualifications:
* Capable of effective communication in a highly technical environment
* Experience with full stack web development and RESTful web services
* Experience with relational and/or noSQL databases
* Experience with Docker
* Cross-functional leadership skills
* Knowledge with build tools/frameworks
* Knowledge with automated testing tools/frameworks
* Knowledge with OS and MW technologies
* Experience with UI design and development
* Experience with test automation and instrument control
* Experience with continuous integration tools such as GoCD, Jenkins, Artifactory and version control tools such as Git
* 2 years of experience leading, managing, coaching, & mentoring technology
* Previous consulting and professional services experience & IT industry experience
* Active TS/SCI Clearance

Salary Range: $78,600 USD - $118,000 USD

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay.
Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as
allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or
Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition,
Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance
coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays
and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.  

The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top
priority. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their
COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the
future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious
accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on
the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order
14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/.

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We
are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making

description:
DEVOPS ENGINEER

Bolt On Technology is the leader in the development of shop management
software for the automotive repair and maintenance industry. We work hard to
create software solutions that solve real-world problems for shop owners,
advisors, and technicians while simplifying the complicated world of auto
repair for their customers. Our partnerships with industry-leading software
companies enable us to develop best practices and solutions that have a
positive impact on both the repair shop and the vehicle owner.

Bolt On’s innovative software solutions make it easy for shop owners,
advisors, and techs to work together to make their auto repair shop more
efficient, profitable, and customer-focused. Our presence in the market is
forever growing and our product base expanding, causing a strong need for
additional passionate and self-motived new business development professionals.

* What You’ll Do: 

* Report to the Sr. Director of Engineering
* Monitor security, scalability, and performance
* Set up threshold alerts for production systems
* Set up monitoring and metrics for production systems (CloudWatch, CloudTrail)
* Support 6-month roadmap infrastructure build-outs
* Ensure CI/CD and logging tools are properly managed and up to date.
* Work with your fellow engineers to define and build deployment, configuration, and monitoring requirements
* Assist in creating and maintaining tools and automation to drive reliability and quality
* Manage code releases, updates, and related processes.
* Ability to be on-call in OpsGenie for Code Reds / Production Incidents
* Work with the Sr. Director of Engineering on:
* Technology Roadmapping, Cost Optimization, IT-Governance, Org Security

What You’ll Need:

* 3+ years of DevOps engineering experience
* Strong debugging and systems analysis skills to be able to identify and quickly resolve/mitigate issues
* Experience with scripting languages (shell scripting, python, groovy, etc).
* Experience in at least a few things within our existing technology stack:
* Nginx, PHP, Node.js, MySQL, Redis, Apache, Elastic Search
* Docker, Containers, Serverless, Networking, Kubernetes/Fargate
* Experience with AWS and its primary services and configuration(s)
* Ability to write and modify Cloudformation
* Experience with configuring, maintaining, and running monitoring platforms
* Experience with maintaining database systems (RDS, DynamoDB, DocumentDB), etc.
* Ability to be flexible, set priorities, and meet deadlines in a changing environment
* A passion for learning new skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical problems.

4 key metrics that must be met in order for you to be successful:

* Deployment Frequency (the frequency at which new releases go to production)
* Every week on Tuesdays
* Automation steps for scheduled releases are available
* Lead Time For Changes (the time until a commit goes to production)
* Less than 24 hours after the green light for release
* Mean Time to Restore (the time it takes to resolve a service impairment in production)
* Less than 4hrs
* Will have full availability of development department for code reds
* Change Failure Rate (the ratio of deployments to production that leads to errors and successful deployments)
* < 15% in first 3 months
* < 0-10% after first 3 months

What We Offer:
* Competitive salaries
* Medical, dental, and vision benefits
* Company-paid life insurance
* Flexible schedules
* Unlimited PTO and 80 hours of sick leave
* Parental leave
* 7 company paid holidays

Career Advancement: This is a growing company with opportunities to
advance. We promote from within, so show us what you can do and grow your
career along with us!

_ 
The job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive
listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the
employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may
be assigned at any time with or without notice. Bolt On Technology is an equal
opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without
attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity,
national origin, veteran or disability status._

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

description:
JOB TITLE: Development Operations Engineer 
 LOCATION: Remote / Austin , Texas 
 DURATION: 6 Months contract on w2 (Possible extension) 
 Unfortunately we cannot work on a C2C basis and are seeking candidates who
can work on our W2

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Lead tools and build-release activities for infotainment software
(images/packages) on single or multiple hardware boards with latest multi-core
multimedia SOC.

Lead and set technical direction for tools, build-release-test automation and
cloud-backend services.

Be responsible for developing tools & automation solutions for CI / CD / CT
workflow, including software updates and manufacturing support.

Develop integrated tools and processes to work in conjunction with JAMA, JIRA,
GIT, and other repositories to provide a seamless CI / CD / CT workflow.

Develop the tools, plug-ins and solutions necessary for CI / CD / CT workflow
using Jenkins, AWS, Docker, REST APIs and other microservices.

Work with other cross-functional teams and convert business requirements into
engineering requirements for development operations.

Be responsible for tool/software development and maintenance, adhering to
appropriate internal & external safety/security standards.

Be a dynamic cross-functional technical leader enabling other dependent teams
(like software, hardware and application).

Identify and set new technical directions to improve development process and
FULFILL company / group vision. this is what you'll need:

5+ years of experience with embedded or Linux software development using
C/C++.

5+ years of experience with auto build tools (like make, Waf etc.,), Jenkins,
AWS, Linux-server installation and maintenance.

5+ years of experience with scripting languages like Python and/or Shell.

5+ years of experience in one or more areas - chat-ops, OTA servers, micro-
services and cloud backend operations.

5+ years of experience with SQL or other non-relational databases.

Ability to be creative/resourceful - to work in a fast-paced start-up
environment.

Additional preferred skills: - Strong experience with developing tools for
software products using

Android / Linux / QNX.

Ability and experience to design and develop application tools (running on
windows/mac/Linux) for manufacturing and software update (OTA).

Automotive - software development , tools and build-release engineering
experience.

Windows POWERSHELL and automation experience.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: Up to $60.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* DevOps: 5 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

description:
Our Fortune 100 client near Cleveland is looking for a Systems Engineer to
assist in supporting IT technology strategies, such as continuous delivery for
business agility, end-to-end application development and deployment processes,
and the administration of such supporting tools. In this role, you’ll be
responsible for defining and implementing robust, scalable, pragmatic and
realistic build and deployment solutions that work for our customers. You will
work closely with our engineers on a variety of assignments that help improve
the usage and scalability of the tools we support, specifically, with a focus
on Azure DevOps and GitHub. Experience with enterprise level system
engineering, Microsoft Azure DevOps (formerly TFS), GitHub, or Artifactory are
highly desired, along with working knowledge of Splunk, Git, CI/CD pipelines
and supporting tools. This is a fully remote position and high likelihood of
going beyond the initial 12 month contract. Candidates must be willing to work
EST or MST hours and live and work in the contiguous 48 states.

Come join an industry leading company with a large IT shop and great work
culture. Apply today!

* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Vision insurance

description:
Responsibilities:

The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for driving continuous integration and
software delivery that unifies development and operations teams for faster
business results. As the DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for driving
continuous integration and software delivery that unifies development and
operations teams for faster business results. This is a hands-on role where
you’ll be responsible for working on complex, major or highly visible tasks in
support of multiple projects that require multiple areas of expertise. This
role will support multiple applications and provide expertise in multiple
technical environments and knowledge of one or more business areas.

In addition, you will be responsible for the following tasks:

* Design, develop and maintain automation framework for iterative software development and testing. Provide operational support, and develop solutions that provide monitoring, logging and alerting capabilities.
* Manage CI/CD infrastructure using Jenkins, SonarQube, Fortify, and UFT, including patching and security updates on the infrastructure.
* Develop and maintain build scripts to automate deployments for multiple environments including dev/test, QA, and production.
* Work with QA team to integrate automated testing into CI/CD pipeline.
* Manage promoting Logic Apps and APIM between environments using ARM templates.
* Transition java web apps to containers.
* Build and maintain Kubernetes infrastructure and manage integrations with APIM/WAF.
* Participate in architecture review, reviewing technology designs and best practices

Requirements:

* Strong communication and presentation skills.
* 3+ years of hands-on experience with MS Azure technologies, specifically ARM templates and deployment scripting.
* Experience with Azure GovCloud a plus.
* 3+ years of hands-on CI/CD engineering experience working with scripting and build management tools for a variety of frameworks and technologies, including Angular, Java, C#/.NET, Bash, Groovy, Gradle, and Maven.
* Hands-on experience working on Windows, and Linux distributions (CentOS and Ubuntu)
* Hands-on experience working in Agile and DevOps cultures and teams with a keen focus on process improvement and automation through internal and external collaboration.
* Hands-on experience with containers and container platforms such as Docker and Kubernetes.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $145,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* DevOps: 5 years (Required)
* Azure: 3 years (Preferred)
* AZURE Arm templates: 3 years (Preferred)
* CI/CD Engineering: 3 years (Preferred)
* build tools(ex.: Angular, Java, C#/.NET, Bash, Groovy, Gradle: 2 years (Preferred)
* Windows, and Linux distributions (CentOS and Ubuntu): 1 year (Preferred)

Security clearance:

* Secret (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Requisition ID: R10055473

* Category: Engineering 
* Location: Linthicum, Maryland, United States of America 
* Citizenship Required: United States Citizenship 
* Clearance Type: SCI 
* Telecommute: No- Teleworking not available for this position 
* Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America) 
* Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time 
* Positions Available: 1  

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on
revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and
for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to
be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history
- from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to
landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a
pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the
way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and
bringing your whole self to work -- and we have an insatiable drive to do what
others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history,
they're making history.

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on
revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and
for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to
be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history
- from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to
landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a
pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the
way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and
bringing your whole self to work -- and we have an insatiable drive to do what
others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history,
they're making history.

The Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) Advanced Processing Solutions
Business pushes the boundaries of innovation, redefines the leading edge of
exotic new technologies, and drives advances in the sciences. One of our most
challenging new fields is Transformational Computing, which combines the
unique properties of superconductivity and quantum mechanics to develop
radical new energy-efficient computing systems. Our team is chartered with
providing the skills to transform computing beyond Moore's Law, advancing
development of computer architectures, processing/memory subsystems, and
large-scale high-performance computing systems. You will work in a fast-paced
team environment alongside a broad array of scientists and engineers to make
these processing solutions a reality and deliver remarkable new advantages to
the warfighter.

Northrop Grumman Mission Systems Sector (NGMS) is a leading global provider of
secure software-defined, hardware enabled mission systems. Our company is
pioneering capabilities in a wide variety of sectors that keep our nation and
our allies' safe from undersea to space and cyberspace. NGMS is seeking
Software Engineers with demonstrated ability to lead development of new
technologies to support our innovative Transformational Computing team to help
develop software in support of emerging supercomputing technologies.

The software engineers will be developing and supporting the next-generation
supercomputing capabilities including simulations, algorithms, test
automation, and data management and analysis capabilities. As a Senior
Principal Software Engineer at Northrop Grumman, you will have a challenging
and rewarding opportunity to be a part of our Enterprise-wide digital
transformation. Using Model-based Engineering, DevSecOps and Agile practices
we continue to evolve how we deliver critical national defense products and
capabilities for the warfighter. Our success is grounded in our ability to
embrace change, move quickly and continuously drive innovation. The successful
candidate will be collaborative, open, transparent, and team-oriented with a
focus on team empowerment & shared responsibility, flexibility, continuous
learning, and a culture of automation.

The selected individual requires expert level software development skills and
will be responsible for leading design teams in all phases of the software
development lifecycle including design, development, and test. Candidates
should have a solid foundation with best practices in software design,
Continuous Integration / Continuous Deliver (CI/CD) tools and processes, and
object-oriented programming. Candidates should be familiar with the Agile
methodology of software development.

All job functions require close teamwork across functional disciplines and
integrated product teams in a fast-paced environment. This program area is
expanding which offers the potential for future growth opportunities
(technical lead, software architect, etc.) for candidates who successfully
demonstrate exceptional performance and leadership. This requisition may be
filled at a higher grade based on qualifications listed below.

This position requires onsite work at our Linthicum, MD location.

Basic Qualifications:

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Sciences, Information Technology, or comparable degree
* A minimum of 2 years of experience in DevOps
* A minimum of 2 years of experience in the software development
* Experience with automation programming languages (Python, Ruby, C#, Java, JavaScript….)
* Experience with the agile software development lifecycle
* Experience with CI/CD tool integration

Preferred Qualifications:
* Capable of effective communication in a highly technical environment
* Experience with full stack web development and RESTful web services
* Experience with relational and/or noSQL databases
* Experience with Docker
* Cross-functional leadership skills
* Knowledge with build tools/frameworks
* Knowledge with automated testing tools/frameworks
* Knowledge with OS and MW technologies
* Experience with UI design and development
* Experience with test automation and instrument control
* Experience with continuous integration tools such as GoCD, Jenkins, Artifactory and version control tools such as Git
* 2 years of experience leading, managing, coaching, & mentoring technology
* Previous consulting and professional services experience & IT industry experience
* Active TS/SCI Clearance

Salary Range: $78,600 USD - $118,000 USD

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay.
Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as
allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or
Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition,
Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance
coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays
and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.  

The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top
priority. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their
COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the
future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious
accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on
the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order
14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/.

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We
are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making
decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual
orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran
status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and
Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO.
U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

description:
What you will do:

· Be an impactful member of the Software Development team by supporting all
efforts to simplify and enhance the client experience.

· Ensure accurate and efficient execution and adherence to business and
technical requirements through detailed coding and performing unit and
software integration testing.

· Improve new and existing software by performing coding, testing, debugging,
designing and writing programs according to functional and non-functional
requirements.

· Validate software adherence with development standards by providing
knowledgeable input while leading code review sessions.

· Guide the development of software by creating and maintaining accurate
technical documentation.

· Resolve incidents and issues for production applications and web services in
accordance with identified service level agreements (SLAs) by serving as the
final escalation point for clients.

· Influence future system designs by managing system analysis and identifying
and recommending design and requirements.

· Maximize the efficiency of various systems by collaborating with internal
clients and technical and architecture teams to resolve software issues and
implement, monitor and test new software.

· Enhance department performance metrics through hands-on coaching and
mentoring of less experienced team members.

· Mitigate risks by following established configuration and change control
processes.

Required keys for success:

· Six+ years of experience with major database management systems.

· Six+ years of experience with coding, testing and design.

· Six or more years of experience with software development methodologies.

· Expert in Voice, Data, Video and wireless technologies.

· In-depth understanding of software design patterns and principles.

· History of identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the
actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the
system.

· Proven ability to deal with ambiguous or incomplete information when
evaluating alternatives and making recommendations.

· Track record of working with teams and managing individual tasks with the
ability to pick up complex concepts and processes quickly.

· Creative and abstract thinking skills that can envision and design
innovative solutions to business opportunities and challenges.

· Solid ability to design, develop and deploy solutions and to deliver
projects on time with minimal direction.

· Extensive technical knowledge of Information Technology field and computer
systems.

· Demonstrated ability to take the lead on the most complex projects with
experience sharing knowledge, resolving conflict and creating a consensus.

· Effective written and spoken English communication skills with all levels of
an organization.

How you will stand out from the crowd:

· Expert scripting ability using various languages, including Python, Django,
JSON, XML and Bash.

· Experience using source control tools, such as Git/GitLab.

· History of working in a Gitflow development workflow.

· Understanding of server and database configurations, including Oracle, MySQL
and Postgres.

· Working Knowledge of web services, simple network management protocol (SNMP)
and transmission control protocol/ user datagram protocol (TCP/UDP).

· Skilled in operating systems, including RedHat and CentOS.

· InfoVista InSight and Spirent VisionWorks/Analytics experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
Technical Analyst - DevOps

K3 helps companies easily manage complex data streams and integrations without
having to rely on developers. We’re focused on enterprises with increasing
amounts of data to manage, the need to move fast, and deliver sustainable
solutions. K3 gives users a seat at the table in these complex environments.
We have had great success on Wall St. and are now increasingly solving similar
problems in new domains.

Our Technical Analysts wear many hats. They assist on customer projects and
training, run our infrastructure in AWS, investigate bugs, and guide our
product roadmap.

We are currently looking for analysts with a focus on DevOps in AWS.

* Help manage our infrastructure on AWS - (ec2/RDS/ElasticBeanstalk/CloudFormation and more)
* Support project teams with AWS deployments and maintenance
* Maintain knowledge base for internal and customer consumption
* Automate software deployment, configuration, and monitoring processes
* Troubleshoot customer technical and data issues

Being a technical analyst at BroadPeak is as much about communication and
thoughtfulness as it is about technology. In this role you need to be
relentless in figuring out how new things work.

Skills Required:

* MUST enjoy discovering the details of complex systems and understanding how they work.
* MUST have demonstrated experience in AWS DevOps technologies
* Communication of technical details to a less technical people
* Comfortable working from the command line
* Experience with Linux environments
* You get a buzz from an environment that goes from fast to slow to fast again
* “Select * from” is the start of a wonderful investigative journey

About Us

Our headquarters are in NYC but we have always worked in a distributed manner.

We measure goals and delivery, not time spent at a desk.

We have a "no policy" holiday. Just get your stuff done.

Our people work on multiple areas, continuously refine processes, and
participate in the financial success of the company.

This job is based in NYC in our Flatiron district office but would be remote
for the time being.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,286.00 - $116,923.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

COVID-19 considerations: 
We are all fully working remotely for the time being. Remote working was a
seamless shift for us.

Experience:

* AWS: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Get to know The Pok emon Company International

The Pokemon Company International, a subsidiary of The Pokemon Company in
Japan, manages the property outside of Asia and is responsible for brand
management, licensing, marketing, the Pokemon Trading Card Game, the animated
TV series, home entertainment, and the official Pokemon website. Pokemon was
launched in Japan in 1996 and today is one of the most popular children's
entertainment properties in the world.

Learn more online at Pokemon.com and on Facebook (facebook.com/pokemon),
YouTube (youtube.com/pokemon), Twitter (twitter.com/pokemon), and Instagram
(instagram.com/pokemon).

Get to know the role

Job Title: DevOps Data Platform Engineer I

Job Summary: The Data Platform Engineer will focus on enabling the business to
make data-driven decisions by; improving and maintaining a cloud-based data
platform, facilitating collaboration with stakeholders and application
developers, as well as consulting for design of data models and evangelization
of data solutions / best practices.

FLSA Classification (US Only): Exempt

People Manager: No

_What you 'll do _

* Interface with other technology teams via agile practices to develop extract-transform-load pipelines (eg. Spark/pyspark), as well as unit tests.
* Refine version-controlled pipelines with unit testing, CI/CD and optimizations.
* Drive design improvements of schemas, data lake and data warehouse solutions in collaboration with stakeholders.
* Partner with Development and Test teams to enable automated self-service pipelines using Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Design for data integrity and security through all environments as well as the data lifecycle.
* Create and monitor pipeline health metrics to ensure optimal performance and reduce any downtime.
* Stay current with the data engineering technologies and trends to continually grow/enhance your skillset and provide value to our partner development teams.

_What you 'll bring _

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis or a related field preferred, or equivalent education/experience.
* 2 years of relevant experience in data engineering development or data analysis.
* Beginner to Intermediate experience as primary contributor in Spark application development.
* Intermediate experience in creating and curating BI support datasets.
* Familiarity with query languages, such as SQL.
* Familiarity using IaC via cloud technologies such as CloudFormation and/or Terraform.
* Demonstrable experience proactively communicating, creating/updating documentation and presenting data to peers and stakeholders.
* Familiarity with Databricks, Scala and/or python a plus.

How you 'll be successful

* Passion for Pokemon: Develops an understanding of the Pokemon brand, the impact it has on our people, culture, business, fans, and communities, and applying that knowledge and passion to everything you do.
* Challenging the Expected: Approaches challenges with curiosity and creativity, embracing the possibility of failure as an opportunity to learn something new, develop innovative ideas, solve complex problems and identify unique opportunities.
* Integrity and Respect: Demonstrates integrity and respect by leading with empathy, listening to others, seeking out different perspectives, and taking personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and results.
* Dedicated to Quality: Takes ownership to maintain and promote high standards, looks for new ways to learn and improve, and embraces a growth mindset to seek and apply feedback from others in an effort to continuously improve.
* Building Relationships: Develops and strengthens relationships, adopting a "team first" mentality and working collaboratively to solve problems and meet shared goals.
* Delighting Customers: Listens and understands the interests and needs of our customers and stakeholders, making them feel heard and important, and embracing these learnings to continue delivering a unique Pokemon experience.

What to expect

* An employee first culture
* Company events that celebrate the spirit of Pokemon
* Competitive cash-based compensation programs
* 100% employer-paid healthcare premiums for you
* Generous paid family leave
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Employer-paid long and short-term income protection insurance
* Fitness reimbursement
* Commuter benefit
* LinkedIn learning

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of
work being performed by people assigned to this role. They are not to be
construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills
required. Employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal
responsibilities from time to time, as needed. For roles in the United
Kingdom, candidates will need the right to work. In some cases, and for some
roles, the Company may be able to arrange a visa. For roles in Ireland, this
role requires candidates to have the right to live and work in the Republic of
Ireland. However, we welcome applications from all nationalities and may
consider supporting an employment permit application, in appropriate and
suitable cases.

LI-KC1 #LI-Hybrid

description:
eNGINE builds Technical Teams. We are a Solutions and Placement firm
shaped by decades of interaction with Technical professionals. Our inspiration
is continuous learning and engagement with the markets we serve, the talent we
represent, and the teams we build. Our Consulting Workforce is encouraged to
enjoy career fulfillment in the form of challenging projects, schedule
flexibility, and paid training/certifications. Successful outcomes start and
finish with eNGINE.

eNGINE is hiring a pair of 100% remote DevOps Engineers with a focus on
DACPAC deployments & Azure DevOps pipelines for an initial customer engagement
with one of our healthcare vertical customers.

You'll be part of a team responsible for creating & deploying sustainable
CI/CD solutions in collaboration with architecture & engineering teams.

What we need:

* 3+ years of Azure pipeline experience (YAML & DevOps Classic)
* 2+ years of Ansible/Chef/Puppet experience in an enterprise enviornment
* 2+ years of Powershell / Python experience
* 2+ years of experience with SQL Server & SQL Server Data Tools
* Experience with blue/green deployment strategies
* Must be willing to work Eastern Standard Time (EST) hours

For finer details on this role, please apply today!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $135,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Azure: 3 years (Required)
* Microsoft SQL Server: 4 years (Required)
* CI/CD: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

description:
Johnson & Johnson Robotics and Digital Solutions company, is recruiting for a
Software DevOps Engineer position located in Redwood City, CA.

Do you seek big, complex, ambiguous problems? Are you passionate about having
a significant impact on the experience, effectiveness, and efficiency of your
colleagues through innovative technology solutions?

Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our
employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity
employer.

Johnson & Johnson Robotics & Digital Solutions is a technology company
defining the future of medical intervention. By combining advancements in
medical robotics, instrumentation, navigation and data science, Johnson &
Johnson is building a platform technology capable of expanding the
applicability of robotics to a spectrum of medical procedures.

Position overview

Johnson & Johnson Robotics & Digital Solutions is looking for a Devops
Engineer to join a team of hardworking roboticists and software engineers who
are trying to solve some of the hardest problems in medicine today.

We are looking for an engineer to work on our growing build and automation
infrastructure that will enable new generations of platform capability. The
right candidate should be an experienced devops engineer or IT professional
who enjoys working on build and deployment infrastructure. Good command of
python and shell scripting are required as well as strong communication and
presentation skills. You will have an opportunity to lead projects from
concept to release. Engage engineers from other teams to learn what they need
and build amazing tools to make them more efficient and effective in their
day-to-day work. Your work will enable the team to design, build and service
next-generation of medical device technology faster.

Qualifications

* 
Minimum requirements

* Bachelor of Science in computer science or a similar engineering degree
* 1 year of administering Devops and/or IT infrastructures
* 1 year of Python and shell scripting experience
* Experience working with version control systems (in particular GIT)
* Power-user of Linux operating system
* Experience with CI/CD tools and build systems (Jenkins, Gitlab and similar)
* Experience working with AWS infrastructure (EC2, VPC, networking etc)

Preferred requirements

* Hands on experience building and deploying build and release infrastructures for development teams
* Experience working with Docker and Docker registries
* Experience servicing IT requests from engineering teams and a strong tack record of delivering results
* Ability to conceptualize software tools based on customer needs gathering
* Experience setting up networking and tool infrastructures inside companies

Work environment

This position operates in a professional office environment. This role
routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, and
photocopiers.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All
qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age,
national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated
against on the basis of disability.

Primary Location 
United States-California-Redwood City-150 Shoreline Dr 
Organization 
Auris Health, Inc. (6267) 
Job Function 
R&D

description:
Remote DevOps Engineer

If you are a DevOps Engineer with Azure and Docker/Kubernetes experience,
please read on!  

-100% Remote | Full-Time/Permanent-  

$140k Base with 10% bonus | 18 Days PTO starting | 401k matching  

Over the last 50 years we have become one of the nation's largest providers of
pharmacy tech services to more than 800 hospitals and healthcare facilities
nationwide!  

You will help design, deploy, and maintain the infrastructure and systems that
support ours services in Azure following core DevOps principles (speed,
stability, observability, security, and reproducibility).

What You Will Be Doing

* Development of Kubernetes application deployments for existing Docker-based workloads
* Designing, building, and implementing CI/CD processes/tools and training other Engineering teams in the implementation and use of these processes/tools
* Create and maintain efficient workflow management within our software development life cycle
* Build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations
* Drive process changes and help craft how the future of DevOps should look at our company

What You Need for this Position

* Azure
* Docker
* Kubernetes
* CI/CD

Plus Skills:  

* Azure Data Factory
* Terraform
* Azure App Service, Event Hubs, Azure SQL, Data Warehouse, Data Factory...

- Azure Networking - Azure Virtual Networks, Firewall, VPN, NSG, and App
Service Environment

What's In It for You

$140k Base with 10% bonus!  

* 401k matching
* 18 Days PTO starting
* Full benefits including medical, dental, and vision
* Opportunity for professional growth
* Awesome Glassdoor review
* Great company culture and work-life balance!
* Much more!

So, if you are a Remote DevOps Engineer with experience, please apply today!

Colorado employees will receive paid sick leave. For additional information
about available benefits, please contact James Shramek

* Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without
regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected
veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired
will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United
States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification
document form upon hire.
