description:
Equivalent Experience  

Description: 
Actalent is offering an extraordinary opportunity to be part of a small,
innovative team with a low process, high throughput culture. The team is 
working on Defense Orchestrator, which manages policy and configuration of
Security Business Group's firewalls. We are looking for an energetic 
DevOps engineer to contribute to all parts of our infrastructure stack. The
DevOps Engineer will be responsible for the production process, including 
continuous delivery of features, infrastructure automation, configuration
management, high availability, and related tooling. Candidates will also be 
expected to contribute to software development and testing. 
Responsibilities 
Participate as a technical contributor on a fast paced project team of
engineers involved in the development of SaaS security products; 
Continuously evolve cloud infrastructure, making it more resilient, scalable
and secure; 
Aggressively automate any and all manual procedures; 
Partner with the engineering organization to converge on common infrastructure
setup, tooling and deployment processes; 
Research and recommend technologies to help further product goals; 
Create innovative solutions for complex technical problems; 
Respond to and resolve infrastructure related escalations. 
Manage and participate in on-call rotation, rotated through engineering team 
Interface with the greater technical support team  

Skills: 
devops, object oriented development, aws, deployment, release management  

Top Skills Details: 
devops,object oriented development  

Additional Skills & Qualifications: 
Required Experience and Skills 
Proven ability to manage builds, release, and deployment in a SaaS environment
with a strict SLA; 
Extensive and proven experience with running production software in AWS; 
Strong working knowledge of Linux based systems; 
SaaS deployment and upgrade automation using configuration management tools
such as Chef and/or Puppet; 
Infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform and CloudFormation; 
Automated application of configuration changes across multi-use environments
(dev, test, staging, prod, etc); 
Create and manage a safe deployment procedure of new product changes across
multiple environments; 
Ability to build SaaS monitoring solutions that detect and automatically
remediate system faults; 
Setting up, configuring, maintaining and evolving a continuous delivery
environment using CI tools such as Jenkins/TeamCity/Bamboo/etc; 
General purpose language such as Ruby/Python plus shell scripting. 
SaaS operations such as maintenance, escalations & triage; 
Debugging and troubleshooting in a distributed environment; 
BS/CS with 5+ years of DevOps experience. 
Desired Experience and Skills 
Agile software development; 
Development experience in an object oriented language; 
Team player, with strong communication skills.  

Experience Level: 
Expert Level  

About Actalent: 
Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and
services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to
help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are
making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and
sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes
consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous
development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company
of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions.  

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all
applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national
origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity,
genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

description:
As CACI IIG continue to grow in the UK, we are looking expand our team of

experienced DevOps Engineers

Due to the industries we work in, we require all our team to be able to obtain
security clearance. To qualify for this, you must be a British passport holder
and have lived permanently in the UK for the last 5 years.

* Date posted: 7 July
* Location: Remote, Flexible
* Salary: £45,000 to £75,000
* Job type: Full time

Interested? Then please apply by emailing your CV to Richard Davies at
rdavies@caci.co.uk  

Who we are:

We are the Information Intelligence Group (IIG) of CACI UK and we are looking
for a DevOps Engineer to join our team. Founded in 2006, CACI IIG is an
exciting, growing and progressive business unit within CACI UK. We currently
have over 280 intelligent, professional and engaging staff. Through a rigorous
emphasis on quality, the company has grown considerably to become one of the
UK's most well-respected Software Engineering consultancies.

The Role:

As a DevOps Engineer at CACI, you will have the opportunity to work on a
variety of interesting and challenging projects for our Public Sector,
Government & Defence clients. Below is a flavour of some of the tasks you may
be asked to undertake:

* Working closely with (or embed into) multi-skilled feature teams to efficiently and securely develop, test, deploy, release operate and monitor software products
* Design and operate automated CICD pipelines
* Design and operate shared Platform services for Deployment, Operation and Monitoring
* Design and Operate Platform services for containerised products
* Write and deploy Infrastructure as Code (IaC)
* Deploy and operate products in public and private cloud environments (AWZ, Azure, On-Prem)
* Support and advise teams as they onboard products to shared platform services

The Fit:

Our DevOps Engineers enjoy working on a variety of fascinating and complex
projects, and our team has a proactive and 'can-do' attitude to our work. We
pride ourselves on keeping up with emerging technologies and delivering best-
practice. DevOps is a fast moving and wide area, so it is important that you
enjoy learning and continuous improvement.

You will ideally have experience to:

* Developing and deploying secure products using appropriate technology and patterns
* Familiarity with key AWS and/or Azure concepts and technologies
* Designing and operating highly available shared solutions
* Working across the full Software Development Lifecycle
* Working in agile environments using methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban
* Working with high-level stakeholders -both internally and externally.
* Exposure to the some of the following technologies: Gitlab, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Packer, Vault, Serverless, Elastic Stack, Prometheus, Grafana, Artifactory & Nexus

Benefits:

The DevOps Engineer role is an excellent opportunity, and CACI reward their
staff well with a competitive salary and impressive benefits package which
includes:

* Flexi-time: 37.5 hour weeks to structure how you want with working from home available
* Learning: Budget for conferences, training courses and other materials
* Social: Fantastic culture with monthly social events
* Future You: Matched pension and health care package

We understand the importance of getting to know your colleagues. Whole company
meetings are held every quarter, and a training/work brief weekend is held
once a year, amongst many other social events.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all
suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability,
religion/belief, sexual orientation or age

Interested? Then please apply by emailing your CV to Richard Davies at

rdavies@caci.co.uk

description:
Come join Tyler Technologies as a DevOps Engineer! The Tyler Cloud Platform
team is looking for Engineers to build and run the services and infrastructure
that power the platform.  

This position will work an evening schedule to improve our team 's ability
to support our clients as broadly throughout the day as possible.  

We are hiring high quality engineers with a diverse set of experiences and
skill sets for positions on the cloud platform team delivering the vision of
Connected Communities. The strongest candidates will have a solid operations
expertise and demonstrated software development experience on large scale
cloud infrastructure. Our clients count on us to provide exceptional
availability, scalability, and security for services and infrastructure. As an
DevOps Engineer, you'll be on a team of engineers whose mission it is to build
and improve Tyler's most critical cloud services.  

Are you up to the challenge?

As a part of Tyler's corporate staff, you will make an impact on outcomes that
affect various areas of the company. Your work will ultimately support our
team members, clients, stakeholders, and the public sector.

Location

Remote

Responsibilities

* Architect, author, champion, and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, and security of Tyler's Cloud Platform services.
* _Design, build_* _ and manage_ systems, infrastructure and applications through automation that support self sufficiency
* Deploy, support, and monitor new and existing services, platforms, and application stacks
* Use scalable testing to measure, report, tune, and optimize system performance
* _Develop tools to improve our ability to rapidly deploy and effectively monitor services in a large-scale Kubernetes environment._
* Participate in periodic on-call duties
* Recommend new solutions and technologies
* Collaborate with team and others to share operational best practices
* Function well in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Cover after hours support needs with core hours from 5pm to 1am Pacific Time, M-F
* Provide an escalation path to the rest of the team after hours.

Qualifications

* 3+ years in a UNIX-based large-scale web operations role.
* _5+ years programming experience in Python, Perl, Node, Java/Scala, or C#_
* 3+ years designing and implementing, large-scale AWS production workloads
* _Experience with large scale Kubernetes architectures and configuration_
* Expert scripting knowledge, specifically for systems automation
* UNIX/Linux systems administration background
* Knowledge of most of these: data structures, relational and non-relational databases, networking, Linux internals, file systems, web architecture, and related topics
* Ability to guide technical teams through design and implementation across an organization
* Previous experience working an evening shift with geographically distributed coworkers.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills (including listening, speaking, and writing) and ability to work well in a diverse, team-focused environment with other DevOps, Engineers, Product Managers, etc.

Preferred Experience
* Experienced in configuration and deployment of containers at scale in AWS EKS, ECS, and Fargate
* Experienced in configuration, management, and monitoring of DataDog
* Experience authoring infrastructure using tools such as cloud-formation or terraform
* Experienced in configuration and management of CI/CD tooling like Github Actions, Jenkins or CircleCI
* Experienced database engineer with MySQL, specifically Aurora

State Specific Salary Range Disclosure Requirements for Colorado,

Connecticut, and Nevada

Salary will generally fall between $55,537 - $100,000 before adjustment for
geographic differences. Recruiter can confirm if position is incentive
eligible.

Great Place to Work & Grow Your Career

Come join us as we transform the public sector! Our mission, vision, and
values guide everything we do. We're also frequently recognized as a great
workplace locally and nationally. See our many awards and accolades.

Taking Care of You & Your Family

Your health and well-being are important to us. That's why we invest in our
team members by offering competitive benefits to support their health and
financial wellness. Learn more about how we care for our people.

Tyler is subject to regulations, guidelines, and/or client requirements
relating to the qualifications of Tyler personnel performing certain client
work. Because of the nature of this position, it is a requirement that the
candidate can successfully pass a federal background check at the time an
offer is extended and over the course of employment with Tyler.

description:
Link 2 Solutions LLC have been engaged by a long standing client of 10 years
to identify high quality candidates for a new “ Junior DevOps Engineer
position ”. The position is 90% virtual and the ideal candidate will live
within 60 minutes drive of downtown Orlando.

* _PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ARE A CANDIDATE WHO DOES NOT CURRENTLY LIVE WITHIN 60 MINUTES OF DOWNTOWN ORLANDO._

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: -
* Deep knowledge and experience developing automation solutions to enable software build and release processes
* 1-3 years of demonstrated experience with:
* Building pipelines using one or more CI/CD platforms:
* Azure DevOps, TeamCity, Jenkins, GitLab, GoCD, Octopus, AWS CodeCommit/CodeDeploy…
* Android CI/CD pipelines a plus (Gradle, Maven, …)
* Source control tools (Git, TFS, …)
* Package management systems (yarn, npm, Nuget Server, Azure Artifacts …)
* Configuration management tools and best practices
* Writing automation using modern scripting language (Powershell, Python, JavaScript, …)
* Fluency working in Windows environments
* Providing visibility into build/release environments through telemetry platforms, reports and alerts
* Evolving processes and tools to support applications in production environments
* Developing tool integrations through use of APIs and scripting
* Docker containerization
* Ability to collaborate exceptionally well with developers, ops and QA roles in Agile team environment
* Strong problem solver
* Passion to learn what makes the business tick
* Desire to continually improve all things DevOps
* Open willingness to help teach others ops best practices and automation

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* DevOps: 1 year (Required)
* Cloud Engineers: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

description:
Software Engineer

This person will perform duties related to application development and
operational support. Overseeing environments’ health and facilitation of high
priority incidents to improve the state of service availability and
continuity. Develop processes and activities that focus on restoring service
after an incident occurs. Understand the interactions between systems, the
applications and services hosted and evaluate the impact of changes and
additions. Perform analysis on existing systems to ensure performance and
reliability, enhance scalability, meet security requirements and interoperable
and maintainable technology portfolio. Design, develop, modify, and/or test
software applications for the healthcare industry.

Primary Responsibilities:

* Perform all phases of software engineering including requirements analysis, application design code development and testing
* Partner with engineering / product management groups and represent operations, influence capability prioritization process with reliability challenges and operational investments
* Ability to work in a DevOps frame of work and responsibilities
* Collaborate with System Analysts and Product Owners to align business requirements to the functionality of the application
* Troubleshoot production support issues post-deployment and come up with solutions as required
* Monitor and assess end to end performance on services by understanding all infrastructure components within the service chain
* Utilize ITSM tools to manage high priority incidents and reference problems, changes and configuration items
* Utilize infrastructure and application tools (Splunk, Grafana, and Micro Focus BSM) to monitor the health of large scale systems
* Utilize ChatOps and ChatBot technologies
* Identify opportunities to automate routine tasks

Requirements
* 4+ years of relevant application development and DevOps processing experience
* Knowledge of monitoring tools, automation scripts, and overall automation to reduce manual efforts
* Experience working with Open Source technology such as Git/GitHub, OpenShift, Kubernetes.
* Experience working with Python, JavaScript, HTML.
* Experience working in an Agile CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery) development environment
* Experience with writing batch files, PowerShell scripts or UNIX shell scripts
* Excellent written communication skills and ability to document technical content
* 4 year degree in computer science or equivalent experience

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: From $65.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: One location

description:
DevOps Engineer (Python) ( Full-Time ) ( Remote ) 
Location: Remote 
Salary: $170K - $180K + Bonus an Stock Options  

Must Haves:

* In-depth knowledge of Linux both on the command line and fundamental operating system concepts
* Strong Python coding skills
* Experience using Ansible to automate tasks

Requirements

You Should Have

* 7+ years of relevant work experience
* In-depth knowledge of Linux both on the command line and fundamental operating system concepts
* Strong Python coding skills
* Experience using Ansible to automate tasks
* Familiarity with both the Java language and the JVM
* Working knowledge of relational databases and SQL
* Experience working on mission-critical production systems
* Experience with real time application & infrastructure monitoring systems
* Experience working with and building CI/CD pipelines
* Experience with blockchain technologies is a huge plus
* A customer-focused mindset and ability to prioritize among competing demands
* Intellectual curiosity and the drive to continuously improve the environment
* Excellent troubleshooting and debugging skills
* Effective communication skills, especially the ability to translate technical jargon and concepts into terms intelligible to a layperson
* Ability to remain calm under pressure
* Sense of humor is a must!

description:
Do you have the skills--and drive--to join a tech team that's working to
digitally transform a trillion-dollar industry? From test-driving the latest
technologies to creating intuitive consumer apps, Liberty Mutual is constantly
innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind
for our customers worldwide.

As a software engineer on this Customer Success team at Liberty Mutual, you'll
apply your talents in an agile environment that has the creative energy of a
start-up--and the full backing and comprehensive benefits of a Fortune 100
company.

Note: This is a range posting - Software/Sr. Software Engineer - and the final
offer will be based on the candidate's skills and experiences.

Responsibilities:

* Provide technical support to Liberty Mutual's product development teams as they use our CI/CD tool suite to build and deploy code to our internal and cloud computing environments.
* Guide developers to self-service options for resolving issues.
* Troubleshoot CI/CD platform and infrastructure automation errors, provide solutions and escalate issues as needed.
* Interface with and direct customers to other teams as needed.
* Observe trends in ticket types or questions asked and engage with product teams to provide solutions for known issues.
* Learn the inner workings of our end-to-end CI/CD software delivery environment and innovative public cloud infrastructure automation.
* Improve the developer experience: reduce obstacles and provide solutions.
* Develop automation to provide fast resolution for common inquiries.
* Create self-service documentation and utilities.
* We encourage innovative ideas to improve our development community's experience.
* Demonstrated success in Jenkins, JIRA, AWS, Pipelines
* Familiarity with CI/CD deployment tools and agile software development practices is desired, including Jira, GitHub, Bamboo, Jenkins, Artifactory, AWS, Azure, GCP Cloud Foundry
* Experience working in an agile environment utilizing Scrum, Kanban or XP.
* Strong oral and written communication skills--and a knack for explaining your decision-making process to non-engineers.
* A collaborative, adaptable working style, demonstrated initiative and the ability to prioritize your time and efforts.
* A Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline, or equivalent experience.
* Troubleshooting complex systems, and needing an understanding of cloud computing, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud engineering best practices.

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently
pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness,
inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of
roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding
profession.  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great
Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of
the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's
2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of
America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New
Graduates--as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn
more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit:
https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and
we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-
being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:
https://LMI.co/Benefits  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate
discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual
orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status,
pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or
local law.

Bachelor's Degree 
15

description:
RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Kforce has a client in Atlanta, GA that is seeking to bring on an experienced
DevOps Engineer.  

Responsibilities Include:  

* DevOps Engineer will analyze current technology utilized and develop steps and processes to improve and expand upon them
* Establish milestones for necessary contributions from departments and develop processes to facilitate their collaboration
* Assist other department engineers in creating practical demonstrations of proposed solutions and demonstrating them to other members of the team
* Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including materials, manpower and time necessary
* Provide clear goals for all areas of a project and develop steps to oversee their timely execution
* As a DevOps Engineer, you will work closely with engineering professionals within the company to maintain hardware and software needed for projects to be completed efficiently
* Mentor and train other engineers throughout the company on the importance of DevOps

REQUIREMENTS:  

* Jenkins
* Kubernetes
* Splunk
* Cloud (GCP preferred but not required)

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,
color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national
origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

description:
About Net Health 
 * _Belong. Thrive. Make a Difference._* 
Are you looking for a meaningful and satisfying career where you have endless
opportunities to grow and be financially rewarded? Net Health may be the
perfect place for you. 
A high-growth and profitable company, we help caregivers harness data for
human health. We also honor and respect the needs of our Net Health family and
staff, which is why we offer a work-from-anywhere environment and unlimited
PTO. Our welcoming and collaborative culture paired with progressive benefits
makes Net Health the ultimate career home! 
As a leading-edge SaaS company in healthcare, we deliver solutions that help
patients get better, faster, and live more fulfilling lives. Our software and
predictive analytics cover the continuum of care, from hospital-to-home,
across various medical specialties. Come join us and start the next chapter of
your exciting career while helping others to live better lives. 
 * _World-Class Benefits That Reflect Our World-Class Culture._* 
Click Here to Learn More!:  

WorkFromAnywhere #UnlimitedPTO #ComprehensiveBenefitsPackage

EmployeeResourceGroups #CasualDressCode #PrioritizedEmployeeWellness

DiversityAndInclusion #AVoice #NewHireSupport #CareerDevelopment

EducationalAssistance #EmployeeReferralBonus #ProgressiveParentalLeave

Net Health, a leading developer of specialized EMRs across various markets, is
looking for an experienced DBA who can help support our development teams as
they build apps and services using data at scale across multiple product
lines. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of Relational Database
systems, with some exposure to the DevOps methodology, nosql/document
databases, and containerization. The candidate should be as comfortable
designing tables and indexes as they are advising development teams on the
tradeoffs between standard row based data stores, columnar database systems,
or document based databases. 
 Purpose: The Devops DBA will be responsible for working with development
teams to design and build resilient, well-performing data environments that
meet our application needs in the most efficient, economic way possible.

* Essential Job Functions: 

* Work with a cross functional team in an Agile/Scrum process to refine stories into work product that meets Net Health’s standards for quality, performance, and usefulness within project timelines.
* Be able to translate stories into needed data stores, tables, queries, and processes required to meet story needs.
* Make sure projects are built for easy verification by automated testing and easy integration into CI/CD Pipelines
* Ability to turn feedback from internal stakeholders into meaningful courses of action
* Troubleshoot and tune poorly performing queries
* Monitor usage in production environments and design and execute plans to meet our SLOs around performance.
* Troubleshoot problems and provide options for possible solutions
* Pick up new technology, frameworks, data stores, apis, and sdks with minimal oversight
* Participate in code reviews

* Specialized Knowledge, Equipment/ Software Requirements: 

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field
* Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences
* 4-5 years’ experience running production RDBMS (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc…) at scale.
* 4-5 years’ experience working with development teams designing resilient, well–performing database environments
* 2-3 year’s experience working with data systems in public cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP, etc…)
* 2-3 years’ experience with scripting language (powershell, bash, python, etc…)
* 2-3 years’ experience integrating database changes into CI/CD pipelines

* Nice to Have: 

* Experience with running databases on containers
* Experience with kubernetes
* Experience with modern source control tools and practices

Additional Info: 
EEO Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for
employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. 
 Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee
may perform other related duties as requested to meet the ongoing needs of the
organization. 
 Colorado Pay Law: If you are a Colorado resident and this role is
available in Colorado or remote, you may be eligible to receive additional
information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will
provide upon request. Please send an email to Recruiting@NetHealth.com

Job Type: Full-time

description:
Job Description: Required  

* Bachelor in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields
* Familiar with Linux and comfortable working in Linux environment
* 1+ year of experience working with Bash and Python
* Familiar with docker containers
* Familiar with git, Jenkins, and CI/CD pipelines
* Familiar with basics of computer hardware (CPU, GPU, Memory, Network, etc.)

DevOps engineering with some sys admin skills  

Good to have  

* Linux customization and troubleshooting experience
* Advanced knowledge of Python
* Knowledge of Jinja template engine
* Knowledge of SaltStack
* Knowledge of OpenQA
* Familiarity with typical server/HPC hardware (Server CPUs and motherboards, Server GPUs, Infiniband, etc.)

Day-to-day tasks include:  

* Maintaining build servers and associated docker containers, and fixing any issues that might arise related to them
* Maintaining and improving CLIENT's base Linux image and all related scripts (Bash and Python) that is used by multiple teams across CLIENT for creating customized Linux images
* Developing new Salt states and improving existing ones which will be used across various programs at CLIENT for creating customized Linux images
* Automating, maintaining, and improving build and test environments for various common repositories used by different programs at CLIENT

description:
Oddball believes that the best products are built when engineers understand
and value the things they are working on. We value learning and growth and the
ability to make a big impact at a small company. We believe that we can make
big changes happen and improve the daily lives of millions of people by
bringing quality software to the federal space.

We are hiring for a DevOps engineer to work on a program that will make a
positive impact on millions of Americans' daily lives. As an early hire on a
small team, you'll have a huge stake in what we build and how we work.

What you'll be doing:

Working hand in hand with great DevOps engineers to create and execute
software development plans and strategies in support of large-scale platform
and API initiatives in the federal space. This will include developing and
implementing algorithms, database design, automated testing, and quality
control of software development.

We are looking for someone with the following skillset:

* In-depth experience with config management tools like: Jenkins, Chef, Ansible, Puppet, SaltStack,
* 3+ years experience creating and supporting AWS environments
* 3+ years experience with engineering, integrating or testing production IT infrastructure platforms using Kubernetes and Openshift
* 2+ years experience developing and improving CI/CD scripts and services for development and deployment
* Experience supporting web technologies and websites running Apache or NGINX
* 3+ years experience with Linux operating systems including installing, configuring and troubleshooting
* Experience in SQL architecture such as MySQL, PostgreSQL or MS-SQL
* Desire and ability to mentor and train other engineers
* A Bachelor's Degree is required with a minimum of 8 years experience

Salary

This is a salaried role. As part of your benefits package, Oddball provides a
monthly continuing education stipend and a tech stipend.

Must be located within the United States.

Clearances

Ability to obtain low-level federal clearance is required

Oddball is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against
applicants based on race, religion, color, disability, medical condition,
legally protected genetic information, national origin, gender, sexual
orientation, marital status, gender identity or expression, sex (including
pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), age, veteran status or
other legally protected characteristics. Any applicant with a mental or
physical disability who requires an accommodation during the application
process should contact an Oddball HR representative to request such an
accommodation.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* AWS: 3 years (Preferred)
* CI/CD: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

We are looking for a RobotOps engineer (DevOps engineer in Robotics)! You
should have experience in developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines, creating
solid automation and tooling to magnify team impact, and bring a passion for
working with robots.

NVIDIA's ISAAC Robotics Platform binds together high-fidelity visual and
physical simulation, a high-quality development platform, hundreds of
optimized algorithms to tackle hard problems in computer vision and artificial
intelligence, and a small but powerful computational platform to form the
brain of intelligent machines. Our team consists of experts from all over the
world and dozens of different fields, and together we want to change the way
robots are programmed.

What you'll be doing:

* Design and scale CI pipelines for building robotics autonomy packages 
* Manage contributions and releases to publicly maintained repositories 
* Drive automated CD flows for deploying to diverse robots 
* Debug pipelines for benchmarking and simulation regression 
* Maintaining team development environment and workflows 
* Integration of deliverables and artifacts from other teams 

What we need to see:

* BS degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science or related field 
* 2+ years of experience 
* Dedicated and self-motivated with a passion for automation, development processes, and code quality 
* Experience in developing CI/CD solutions for mid-sized projects 
* Solid understanding of virtualization/containerization (Docker) 
* Good programming skills in Python and Bash 
* Understanding of C++, build toolchains, code coverage tools, and git 
* Proficient with Linux distros (kernel, system administration, networking) 
* Excellent attention to detail and a strong desire to seize optimization opportunities 
* Flexibility to adapt quickly, learn fast & debug complex system issues 

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

* Expertise with ROS2 build tools (colcon, ament, cmake), Jenkins, GitLab/GitHub 
* Previous work on embedded platforms and MLOps 
* Experience with Jenkins, GitLab, GitHub, Jira 
* Strong visualization and dashboarding skills to communicate status and open issues 
* Demonstrated success of leveraging automation to magnify the impact of a team 

What We Do:

NVIDIA Isaac ROS

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world's most desirable
employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in
the world working for us. If you are creative and autonomous, we want to hear
from you!

The Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act requires that NVIDIA provide the
compensation range and benefits offered for this position if performed in
Colorado. The base salary range for this position in Colorado is $126,000.00 -
173,250.00 USD.

NVIDIA also offers a comprehensive benefits package. We provide health care
coverage, dental and vision, 401(K), including company matching and after tax
contributions, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance
Program (EAP), company paid holidays, paid sick leave, vacation leave,
professional time off, life and disability protection. Employees in eligible
sales and positions may also be eligible for commission.

Base pay is based on market location and may vary based on factors including
experience, skills, education, and other job-related reasons.

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an
equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and
future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and
promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin,
gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran
status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

description:
About this Role

The DevOps Engineer is critical to the project’s overall success, from
planning to supporting primary KPIs such as customer satisfaction and
productivity. A DevOps Engineer has an essential role in integrating the
project functions and resources across the product life cycle, right from
planning, building, testing, and deployment to support. DevOps Engineers are
conversant with all the technical as well as IT operations aspects for
integrated operations.

Working as a DevOps Engineer at PropStream, you’ll bring positive energy,
dynamic, detail-oriented, pride, and passion to automating the development and
cloud infrastructure processes. You’ll be developing and deploying complex
infrastructures and technical solutions.

Responsibilities:

* Design and build scalable, reliable, and secure cloud infrastructure
* Provision, configure and maintain AWS cloud infrastructure defined as code (CDK)
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for reliable deployments and rollbacks as needed
* Triage incidents affecting application performance, uptime, and infrastructure health
* Promote and develop DevOps best practices by collaborating with developers/managers during various phases of development
* Improve site performance and reliability with a focus on high availability, security, and scalability through effective monitoring, alerting, automation, and infrastructure reviews
* Ensure monitoring and health of resources deployed
* Defining and setting development, test, release, update, and support process for DevOps operation
* Troubleshooting techniques and finding code bugs
* Monitoring the processes during the entire lifecycle for its adherence and updating or creating new processes for improvement and minimizing wastage
* Document procedures used during deployment cycles
* Implement clean and maintainable infrastructure-as-code that adheres to industry best practices

Requirements:
* 3+ years experience in AWS
* 2+ years experience in DevOps pipeline development
* A desire to write tools and applications to automate work rather than doing things manually
* CI/CD Automation experience with configuration/deployment management systems such as, Terraform, AWS Cloud Formation, Jenkins, Git or other such tools
* AWS and CodeDeploy experience preferred
* Experience with the following or similar languages: Python, Java, PostgreSQL
* Experience with Linux OS
* Proficient with Git and Git workflows
* Working knowledge of containerization (Docker) and supporting technologies a plus
* Strong verbal and written communication
* Ability to meet deadlines and adapt to changing conditions
* Able to multi-task, well organized, and a self-starter
* Be on weekend on-call rotations with other DevOps engineers

About the Company

PropStream was founded in 2006 and has become the leading real estate data
solution to real

estate investors, agents, and service providers providing the data and tools
they need to

identify new opportunities and effectively grow their businesses. In November
2021,

PropStream became part of the Stewart Title family (NYSE: STC) yet continues
to operate as an

independent entity.

Headquartered in Lake Forest, CA, PropStream currently maintains a remote and
hybrid-

friendly working environment. Our team is diverse, innovative, dynamic, and
has a passion for

providing an exceptional customer experience in everything that we do.

Benefits Package

PropStream provides a competitive and comprehensive benefits package
including, but not

limited to, paid medical and dental benefits, PTO, bonus potential, and
internal advancement

opportunities.

The salary for this position is DOE.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401K with company match
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Flexible Work Environment:
* We offer our employees flexibility in their work location. Whether you prefer to work onsite at our headquarters office in Lake Forest, CA, work fully remote from your home, or a hybrid solution, we have a place for you.

Please note: All remote work must be performed within the United States.

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on
a full-time

basis now and in the future. We are unable to sponsor currently. 

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* On call
* Weekend availability

Experience:

* AWS: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

firstPRO is seeking a qualified DevOps Engineer for our client, a
global financial services organization located out of Pennsylvania. They are
seeking someone with experience in designing efficient and robust solutions
that maintain/improve the state of architecture.

DevOps Engineer

Job Details

· Compensation: $90 - $95/hour with benefits (Health, Dental, Vision)

· Location: 100% Remote

· Type: Contract to Hire

· Schedule: Monday through Friday, 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM

Job Responsibilities

· Become a valued partner by anticipating and proposing alternative solutions
to help business extend their reach.

· Develop PowerBI dashboards, demonstrating metrics, and visuals

· Develop senior relationships to gain and utilize a deep understanding of the
business wins to transform current business models with innovative technology
solutions.

· Run the technology in line with the bank’s policies and architecture
standards to ensure risks are understood, communicated, and effectively
mitigated.

· Champion technology excellence, practice, and innovative technologies to
automate, simplify and innovate the technology landscape.

· Have significantly demonstrated hands-on experience of managing and
developing technology solutions to multiple internal clients.

· Be entrepreneurial, highly motivated, and self-directed with a strong
delivery mindset.

· Be able to articulate complex technical problems and their solutions simply.

· Be passionate about building and leading, high-performing delivery teams and
proposing and achieving successful outcomes for a significant asset management
business.

Job Requirements

· PowerBI is a deal breaker

· SQL is the #2 most important tech

· Ability to take BA requests and create them into PowerBI reports and
dashboards

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $90.00 - $95.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

* Philadelphia, PA: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: One location

description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Insight Global is looking for a Manager of DevOps & Cloud Engineering, this
plays a key role for the enterprise as a member of ITSD through hands-on
management and optimization of the continuous integration and continuous
delivery (CI/CD) pipeline resulting in the quick and safe release of
incremental software improvements into production. DevOps techniques are
continuously applied by this role in order to avoid deployment pipeline
congestion between various build versions across multiple environments. The
ideal candidate will have experience designing, developing, and optimizing
release management processes in both premise and cloud-based environments.
Also, Extensive infrastructure, application, integration, data and security
technology expertise along with a passion for innovation and hands-on software
development leadership is essential.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

* at least 5 years of DevOps Engineering experience
* strong background with Kubernetes, Jenkins, CD/CI pipelines, Docker
* experienced with Containerization 
* previous expereince programming with java, spring, groovy and Angular
* strong project expereince supporting migration from On-prem to Cloud platforms

{"advice": "I love that the company provides the Account Managers who are struggling with support, but I would say that the sense of urgency could improve.", "cons": "Just like anyone, I have struggled at Insight Global. I'll go into some more details, but the one bit of advice I will give to you when joining the company is to make sure that you are motivated and fulfilled by sales. Insight Global and the Account Manager role is probably the most "noble" sales role you can have. I say that because you are selling the company's staffing services and building meaningful relationships with clients in order to stimulate and contribute to the growth of the job market. That doesn't mean that it doesn't come without it's challenges.

For my first two years of account management I struggled, and I struggled real hard. I felt like I was going on an infinite number of client meetings and never seeing any return on my investment of effort. I was bending over backwards for bad business too because it was all I could get at the time. And despite all of this, I also got the feedback from my leadership that my biggest strong suit was my ability to build relationships and genuine relationships at that, and that success will come soon. 

Success unfortunately didn’t come soon. And I continued to struggle and was constantly finding myself below my growth line. And that feeling of being stuck and frustrated were everyday emotions. But Insight Global cared about me. They wrapped their arms around me and provided me with additional support and training. Shortly after that, I began seeing success and breaking milestones.", "countHelpful": 6, "employerResponses": [{"response": "Thank you for taking the time to share your experience! It means a lot to us and our Insight Global community.", "responseDateTime": "2022-06-14T10:59:00.853", "userJobTitle": "Social Media & Review Strategist "}], "employmentStatus": "REGULAR", "featured": null, "isCurrentJob": true, "jobTitle": {"text": "Account Manager"}, "lengthOfEmployment": 6, "pros": "I've been with Insight Global since 2017. In that time, I have paid witness to some very pivotal and drastic positive transformations that the company as a whole has made. If you are hired at Insight Global today, you'll truly feel taken care of both personally and professionally. IG is a people-first company, and the purpose that they claim is to grow their people so that they can be the light for the world. But it wasn't always this way. In 2017, leadership and executives finally faced the reality that the culture was broken.

The 8 core values that they claimed were simply just words on a wall. The company lacked a purpose bigger than themselves, and their own people were firing them, one after another. IG had truly lost their way. It wasn't until Bert Bean was promoted to CEO that the most significant changes were immediately implanted to make long-lasting improvements. And he did just that, leading the company culture transformation, where the company went from an attrition model of survival of the fittest, to a development model where everyone matters. That culture of development permeated into every team and corner of the company.

You'll definitely feel a sense of belonging. The people at Insight Global genuinely care about one another (in and outside of the office) which has created more of a family rather than a business. I would say that if you are interested in joining Insight Global for expedited career advancements, networking, meaningful relationships, and growth it will be the best decision you'll probably ever make. description:
Johnson & Johnson Robotics and Digital Solutions company, is recruiting for a
Software DevOps Engineer position located in Redwood City, CA.

Do you seek big, complex, ambiguous problems? Are you passionate about having
a significant impact on the experience, effectiveness, and efficiency of your
colleagues through innovative technology solutions?

Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our
employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity
employer.

Johnson & Johnson Robotics & Digital Solutions is a technology company
defining the future of medical intervention. By combining advancements in
medical robotics, instrumentation, navigation and data science, Johnson &
Johnson is building a platform technology capable of expanding the
applicability of robotics to a spectrum of medical procedures.

Position overview

Johnson & Johnson Robotics & Digital Solutions is looking for a Devops
Engineer to join a team of hardworking roboticists and software engineers who
are trying to solve some of the hardest problems in medicine today.

We are looking for an engineer to work on our growing build and automation
infrastructure that will enable new generations of platform capability. The
right candidate should be an experienced devops engineer or IT professional
who enjoys working on build and deployment infrastructure. Good command of
python and shell scripting are required as well as strong communication and
presentation skills. You will have an opportunity to lead projects from
concept to release. Engage engineers from other teams to learn what they need
and build amazing tools to make them more efficient and effective in their
day-to-day work. Your work will enable the team to design, build and service
next-generation of medical device technology faster.

Qualifications

* 
Minimum requirements

* Bachelor of Science in computer science or a similar engineering degree
* 1 year of administering Devops and/or IT infrastructures
* 1 year of Python and shell scripting experience
* Experience working with version control systems (in particular GIT)
* Power-user of Linux operating system
* Experience with CI/CD tools and build systems (Jenkins, Gitlab and similar)
* Experience working with AWS infrastructure (EC2, VPC, networking etc)

Preferred requirements

* Hands on experience building and deploying build and release infrastructures for development teams
* Experience working with Docker and Docker registries
* Experience servicing IT requests from engineering teams and a strong tack record of delivering results
* Ability to conceptualize software tools based on customer needs gathering
* Experience setting up networking and tool infrastructures inside companies

Work environment

This position operates in a professional office environment. This role
routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, and
photocopiers.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All
qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age,
national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated
against on the basis of disability.

United States-California-Redwood City-150 Shoreline Dr 
Organization

description:
Get to know The Pok emon Company International

The Pokemon Company International, a subsidiary of The Pokemon Company in
Japan, manages the property outside of Asia and is responsible for brand
management, licensing, marketing, the Pokemon Trading Card Game, the animated
TV series, home entertainment, and the official Pokemon website. Pokemon was
launched in Japan in 1996 and today is one of the most popular children's
entertainment properties in the world.

Learn more online at Pokemon.com and on Facebook (facebook.com/pokemon),
YouTube (youtube.com/pokemon), Twitter (twitter.com/pokemon), and Instagram
(instagram.com/pokemon).

Get to know the role

Job Title: DevOps Data Platform Engineer I

Job Summary: The Data Platform Engineer will focus on enabling the business to
make data-driven decisions by; improving and maintaining a cloud-based data
platform, facilitating collaboration with stakeholders and application
developers, as well as consulting for design of data models and evangelization
of data solutions / best practices.

FLSA Classification (US Only): Exempt

People Manager: No

_What you 'll do _

* Interface with other technology teams via agile practices to develop extract-transform-load pipelines (eg. Spark/pyspark), as well as unit tests.
* Refine version-controlled pipelines with unit testing, CI/CD and optimizations.
* Drive design improvements of schemas, data lake and data warehouse solutions in collaboration with stakeholders.
* Partner with Development and Test teams to enable automated self-service pipelines using Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Design for data integrity and security through all environments as well as the data lifecycle.
* Create and monitor pipeline health metrics to ensure optimal performance and reduce any downtime.
* Stay current with the data engineering technologies and trends to continually grow/enhance your skillset and provide value to our partner development teams.

_What you 'll bring _

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis or a related field preferred, or equivalent education/experience.
* 2 years of relevant experience in data engineering development or data analysis.
* Beginner to Intermediate experience as primary contributor in Spark application development.
* Intermediate experience in creating and curating BI support datasets.
* Familiarity with query languages, such as SQL.
* Familiarity using IaC via cloud technologies such as CloudFormation and/or Terraform.
* Demonstrable experience proactively communicating, creating/updating documentation and presenting data to peers and stakeholders.
* Familiarity with Databricks, Scala and/or python a plus.

How you 'll be successful

* Passion for Pokemon: Develops an understanding of the Pokemon brand, the impact it has on our people, culture, business, fans, and communities, and applying that knowledge and passion to everything you do.
* Challenging the Expected: Approaches challenges with curiosity and creativity, embracing the possibility of failure as an opportunity to learn something new, develop innovative ideas, solve complex problems and identify unique opportunities.
* Integrity and Respect: Demonstrates integrity and respect by leading with empathy, listening to others, seeking out different perspectives, and taking personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and results.
* Dedicated to Quality: Takes ownership to maintain and promote high standards, looks for new ways to learn and improve, and embraces a growth mindset to seek and apply feedback from others in an effort to continuously improve.
* Building Relationships: Develops and strengthens relationships, adopting a "team first" mentality and working collaboratively to solve problems and meet shared goals.
* Delighting Customers: Listens and understands the interests and needs of our customers and stakeholders, making them feel heard and important, and embracing these learnings to continue delivering a unique Pokemon experience.

What to expect

* An employee first culture
* Company events that celebrate the spirit of Pokemon
* Competitive cash-based compensation programs
* 100% employer-paid healthcare premiums for you
* Generous paid family leave
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Employer-paid long and short-term income protection insurance
* Fitness reimbursement
* Commuter benefit
* LinkedIn learning

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of
work being performed by people assigned to this role. They are not to be
construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills
required. Employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal
responsibilities from time to time, as needed. For roles in the United
Kingdom, candidates will need the right to work. In some cases, and for some
roles, the Company may be able to arrange a visa. For roles in Ireland, this
role requires candidates to have the right to live and work in the Republic of
Ireland. However, we welcome applications from all nationalities and may
consider supporting an employment permit application, in appropriate and
suitable cases.

description:
Technical Analyst - DevOps

K3 helps companies easily manage complex data streams and integrations without
having to rely on developers. We’re focused on enterprises with increasing
amounts of data to manage, the need to move fast, and deliver sustainable
solutions. K3 gives users a seat at the table in these complex environments.
We have had great success on Wall St. and are now increasingly solving similar
problems in new domains.

Our Technical Analysts wear many hats. They assist on customer projects and
training, run our infrastructure in AWS, investigate bugs, and guide our
product roadmap.

We are currently looking for analysts with a focus on DevOps in AWS.

* Help manage our infrastructure on AWS - (ec2/RDS/ElasticBeanstalk/CloudFormation and more)
* Support project teams with AWS deployments and maintenance
* Maintain knowledge base for internal and customer consumption
* Automate software deployment, configuration, and monitoring processes
* Troubleshoot customer technical and data issues

Being a technical analyst at BroadPeak is as much about communication and
thoughtfulness as it is about technology. In this role you need to be
relentless in figuring out how new things work.

Skills Required:

* MUST enjoy discovering the details of complex systems and understanding how they work.
* MUST have demonstrated experience in AWS DevOps technologies
* Communication of technical details to a less technical people
* Comfortable working from the command line
* Experience with Linux environments
* You get a buzz from an environment that goes from fast to slow to fast again
* “Select * from” is the start of a wonderful investigative journey

About Us

Our headquarters are in NYC but we have always worked in a distributed manner.

We measure goals and delivery, not time spent at a desk.

We have a "no policy" holiday. Just get your stuff done.

Our people work on multiple areas, continuously refine processes, and
participate in the financial success of the company.

This job is based in NYC in our Flatiron district office but would be remote
for the time being.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,286.00 - $116,923.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

COVID-19 considerations: 
We are all fully working remotely for the time being. Remote working was a
seamless shift for us.

Experience:

* AWS: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Need only W2 Candidates.

Good hands on work experience using AWS 
Good work experience using Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins, Terraform 
Strong Linux administration and troubleshooting skills. 
Good work experience with managing infrastructure, automation and monitoring 
working knowledge GIT, GitHub, DevOps (CICD, Jenkins) 
Develops, deploys, and maintains incremental software updates, ensuring
stability and reliability. 
Programming background and skills on Scripting / Java programming 
Very strong Object-Oriented Analysis and Design skills, using common design
patterns. 
Experience with test-driven development 
Excellent debugging, critical thinking, and communication skills 
Independent problem-solving skills

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $87,278.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

* Dallas, TX: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to work on W2?

Work Location: One location

RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Kforce has a client in Atlanta, GA that is seeking to bring on an experienced
DevOps Engineer.  

Responsibilities Include:  

* DevOps Engineer will analyze current technology utilized and develop steps and processes to improve and expand upon them
* Establish milestones for necessary contributions from departments and develop processes to facilitate their collaboration
* Assist other department engineers in creating practical demonstrations of proposed solutions and demonstrating them to other members of the team
* Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions including materials, manpower and time necessary
* Provide clear goals for all areas of a project and develop steps to oversee their timely execution
* As a DevOps Engineer, you will work closely with engineering professionals within the company to maintain hardware and software needed for projects to be completed efficiently
* Mentor and train other engineers throughout the company on the importance of DevOps

REQUIREMENTS:  

* Jenkins
* Kubernetes
* Splunk
* Cloud (GCP preferred but not required)

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,
color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national
origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

description:
Remote DevOps Engineer

If you are a DevOps Engineer with Azure and Docker/Kubernetes experience,
please read on!  

-100% Remote | Full-Time/Permanent-  

$140k Base with 10% bonus | 18 Days PTO starting | 401k matching  

Over the last 50 years we have become one of the nation's largest providers of
pharmacy tech services to more than 800 hospitals and healthcare facilities
nationwide!  

You will help design, deploy, and maintain the infrastructure and systems that
support ours services in Azure following core DevOps principles (speed,
stability, observability, security, and reproducibility).

What You Will Be Doing

* Development of Kubernetes application deployments for existing Docker-based workloads
* Designing, building, and implementing CI/CD processes/tools and training other Engineering teams in the implementation and use of these processes/tools
* Create and maintain efficient workflow management within our software development life cycle
* Build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations
* Drive process changes and help craft how the future of DevOps should look at our company

What You Need for this Position

* Azure
* Docker
* Kubernetes
* CI/CD

Plus Skills:  

* Azure Data Factory
* Terraform
* Azure App Service, Event Hubs, Azure SQL, Data Warehouse, Data Factory...

- Azure Networking - Azure Virtual Networks, Firewall, VPN, NSG, and App
Service Environment

What's In It for You

$140k Base with 10% bonus!  

* 401k matching
* 18 Days PTO starting
* Full benefits including medical, dental, and vision
* Opportunity for professional growth
* Awesome Glassdoor review
* Great company culture and work-life balance!
* Much more!

So, if you are a Remote DevOps Engineer with experience, please apply today!

Colorado employees will receive paid sick leave. For additional information
about available benefits, please contact James Shramek

* Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without
regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected
veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired
will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United
States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification
document form upon hire.

description:
Do you have the skills--and drive--to join a tech team that's working to
digitally transform a trillion-dollar industry? From test-driving the latest
technologies to creating intuitive consumer apps, Liberty Mutual is constantly
innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind
for our customers worldwide.

As a software engineer on this Customer Success team at Liberty Mutual, you'll
apply your talents in an agile environment that has the creative energy of a
start-up--and the full backing and comprehensive benefits of a Fortune 100
company.

Note: This is a range posting - Software/Sr. Software Engineer - and the final
offer will be based on the candidate's skills and experiences.

Responsibilities:

* Provide technical support to Liberty Mutual's product development teams as they use our CI/CD tool suite to build and deploy code to our internal and cloud computing environments.
* Guide developers to self-service options for resolving issues.
* Troubleshoot CI/CD platform and infrastructure automation errors, provide solutions and escalate issues as needed.
* Interface with and direct customers to other teams as needed.
* Observe trends in ticket types or questions asked and engage with product teams to provide solutions for known issues.
* Learn the inner workings of our end-to-end CI/CD software delivery environment and innovative public cloud infrastructure automation.
* Improve the developer experience: reduce obstacles and provide solutions.
* Develop automation to provide fast resolution for common inquiries.
* Create self-service documentation and utilities.
* We encourage innovative ideas to improve our development community's experience.
* Demonstrated success in Jenkins, JIRA, AWS, Pipelines
* Familiarity with CI/CD deployment tools and agile software development practices is desired, including Jira, GitHub, Bamboo, Jenkins, Artifactory, AWS, Azure, GCP Cloud Foundry
* Experience working in an agile environment utilizing Scrum, Kanban or XP.
* Strong oral and written communication skills--and a knack for explaining your decision-making process to non-engineers.
* A collaborative, adaptable working style, demonstrated initiative and the ability to prioritize your time and efforts.
* A Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline, or equivalent experience.
* Troubleshooting complex systems, and needing an understanding of cloud computing, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud engineering best practices.

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently
pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness,
inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of
roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding
profession.  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great
Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of
the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's
2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of
America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New
Graduates--as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn
more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit:
https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and
we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-
being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:
https://LMI.co/Benefits  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate
discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual
orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status,
pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or
local law.

Bachelor's Degree 
15

description:
Company Description: 
pureIntegration, a technology consulting firm with 17+ years of experience
servicing fortune 100 clients,* is seeking highly energetic, positive and
collaborative AWS Cloud DevOps Engineers with a passion for driving
improved processes, high reliability, and great developer experiences. As a
Cloud Engineer, your role will be comprised of creating and designing elegant
and maintainable solutions to complex cloud problems, and driving engineering
and automation for public cloud services within a dynamic enterprise looking
to reshape how software services are delivered in their industry.* 
 Job Description: * 
 This role requires the ability to research, propose and prototype new
principles, cloud technologies and concepts, and integrate them using common
DevOps practices and tooling. A successful candidate in this position will
have demonstrable experience in cloud technologies focused on AWS. This will
understand the interdependencies between services within AWS, how they are
provisioned, their purpose, and how the are integrated into enterprise level
solutions. 
 If this sounds like you, and you want to join a team who is leading change
their industry, apply today! 
 Location: Position is remote. Client site is in Washington DC.* 
 Work Arrangement: 1099 Contract Role or W2 Fulltime 
* 
 Work Authorization: EAD, GC, US Citizens. We Do Not Accept H1B Visas. We
Do Not accept C2C relationships* 
 Responsibilities: * 
 The role of a cloud engineer entails design and buildout of automation
platforms utilizing Infrastructure as Code methodologies to Provision, Deploy
and manage Cloud infrastructure for App teams to consume. The candidate will
innovate by identifying opportunities for proactive and reactive (self-
healing) automation solutions for Cloud services adopted within the
enterprise. The candidate will design and execute new initiatives to
standardize systems, automate designs, build tooling, and optimize operations
to reduce implementation cycle times, eliminate service downtime, optimize
performance, and ensure that all security and compliance requirements are
fully governed. 
 Skills and Requirements: * 

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related field, or relevant work experience.
* 5+ years demonstrable, professional Cloud infrastructure experience in AWS
* 5+ years of experience with AWS Connect, Lambda, S3, Dynamo DB and other AWS services
* Strong critical thinking, decision making and problem solving skills
* Understanding of Infrastructure as Code and practical application of IaC in providing best practice to application engineering teams
* Experience in implementing provision of services utilizing Terraform (open source, Enterprise or Cloud)
* 3+ years of experience in a DevOps oriented team utilizing Agile Scrum methodology
* Experience managing code and dependencies in Azure DevOps, GIT along with other configuration management best practices
* Experience with Cloud Formation and AWS APIs
* Proven experience performing root cause analysis in complex and distributed systems and environments
* Ability to join a 24/7 Level 3 on-call support on a rotational basis

Additional Information: * 
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO
guidelines.
* Are you self-motivated, collaborative, and client-focused? Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding career? Then pureIntegration would love to hear from you! Your career journey starts here!

pureIntegration, a systems integration company headquartered in the
Washington DC area, serves clients in the fastest growing industries –
communications, media, and entertainment. Our industry-focused offerings and
collaborative client approach has resulted in a 97% client satisfaction
rating. 
As a leading service organization, we recognize our most valuable assets
are our people, both as individuals and how they come together as a whole. As
such, we encourage our team members to become fearless in exploring ideas and
opportunities to act on them. 
In over 17 years of Digital Transformation consulting and professional
services, pureIntegration has successfully designed, integrated, and deployed
winning solutions at scale which have resulted in measurable performance
increases. Most importantly, we have done it while maintaining 97% client
satisfaction for the past 17 years. With a rich heritage in Communications,
Media and Entertainment, our diverse and expanding portfolio includes Fortune
500 enterprises spanning Utilities, Manufacturing, Insurance, CPG, Healthcare,
Logistics and other select verticals. 
*pureIntegration is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE), qualified
applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color,
religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran
status. 
* Location: IO, Chevy Chase, MD

Location: IO, Chevy Chase, MD

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80.00 - $90.00 per hour
