description:
Responsibilities:

* Lead the creation of a cloud-first software source code management and build/deployment pipeline in Azure DevOps, focused primarily on the integration of a large acquisition but looking forward to all of nThrive
* Establish and maintain pipeline templates, collaborating with participating development teams to understand and document requirements
* Design, document, and support practices for deployment both of and to Azure resources, including VM’s, VM Scale Sets, AKS, Azure Functions, and Azure App Services.
* Design and document security requirements to govern access to and usage of the CI/CD pipeline
* Lead pilots and proofs-of-concept for CI/CD-related integrations such as SAST and SCA scans
* Evolve current practices and establish new guidelines to adopt IaC methodology, including cost management and security best-practices
* Ensure that policies and practices support the diversity of technology platforms and languages that exists within nThrive today, including both .NET and Java applications that reside both on-prem and within Azure
* Monitor and maintain environments and delivery pipelines
* Consult and help design Azure environment

Requirements:

* 3+ years of experience in software development
* 3+ years of experience in an architect role responsible for overseeing design, pattern development, and tool selection for managing Azure resources
* 2+ years of experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines deploying to Azure resources, including IaaS and PaaS models and using zero downtime (rolling, blue-green, etc.)
* Excellent communication skills and experience interacting both with upper management as well as individual contributors
* Strong ability to document architectural patterns and decisions through appropriate tools (diagrams, wiki articles, samples, etc.)
* Experience working with teams in designing and implementing solutions using the following technologies:
* Azure DevOps
* Microsoft .NET (Framework, Core, .NET 5)
* Java/Spring
* Azure (both IaaS and PaaS hosting)
* Microsoft SQL Server
* Infrastructure-as-code (ARM, Terraform , Bicep)
* CI/CD/GitOps concepts

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $150,000.00 - $175,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Relocation assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you need sponsorship?

Experience:

* Devops Architect: 4 years (Preferred)
* Azure DevOps: 4 years (Preferred)
* Software development: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

Get to know The Pok emon Company International

The Pokemon Company International, a subsidiary of The Pokemon Company in
Japan, manages the property outside of Asia and is responsible for brand
management, licensing, marketing, the Pokemon Trading Card Game, the animated
TV series, home entertainment, and the official Pokemon website. Pokemon was
launched in Japan in 1996 and today is one of the most popular children's
entertainment properties in the world.

Learn more online at Pokemon.com and on Facebook (facebook.com/pokemon),
YouTube (youtube.com/pokemon), Twitter (twitter.com/pokemon), and Instagram
(instagram.com/pokemon).

Get to know the role

Job Title: DevOps Data Platform Engineer I

Job Summary: The Data Platform Engineer will focus on enabling the business to
make data-driven decisions by; improving and maintaining a cloud-based data
platform, facilitating collaboration with stakeholders and application
developers, as well as consulting for design of data models and evangelization
of data solutions / best practices.

FLSA Classification (US Only): Exempt

People Manager: No

_What you 'll do _

* Interface with other technology teams via agile practices to develop extract-transform-load pipelines (eg. Spark/pyspark), as well as unit tests.
* Refine version-controlled pipelines with unit testing, CI/CD and optimizations.
* Drive design improvements of schemas, data lake and data warehouse solutions in collaboration with stakeholders.
* Partner with Development and Test teams to enable automated self-service pipelines using Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Design for data integrity and security through all environments as well as the data lifecycle.
* Create and monitor pipeline health metrics to ensure optimal performance and reduce any downtime.
* Stay current with the data engineering technologies and trends to continually grow/enhance your skillset and provide value to our partner development teams.

_What you 'll bring _

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis or a related field preferred, or equivalent education/experience.
* 2 years of relevant experience in data engineering development or data analysis.
* Beginner to Intermediate experience as primary contributor in Spark application development.
* Intermediate experience in creating and curating BI support datasets.
* Familiarity with query languages, such as SQL.
* Familiarity using IaC via cloud technologies such as CloudFormation and/or Terraform.
* Demonstrable experience proactively communicating, creating/updating documentation and presenting data to peers and stakeholders.
* Familiarity with Databricks, Scala and/or python a plus.

How you 'll be successful

* Passion for Pokemon: Develops an understanding of the Pokemon brand, the impact it has on our people, culture, business, fans, and communities, and applying that knowledge and passion to everything you do.
* Challenging the Expected: Approaches challenges with curiosity and creativity, embracing the possibility of failure as an opportunity to learn something new, develop innovative ideas, solve complex problems and identify unique opportunities.
* Integrity and Respect: Demonstrates integrity and respect by leading with empathy, listening to others, seeking out different perspectives, and taking personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and results.
* Dedicated to Quality: Takes ownership to maintain and promote high standards, looks for new ways to learn and improve, and embraces a growth mindset to seek and apply feedback from others in an effort to continuously improve.
* Building Relationships: Develops and strengthens relationships, adopting a "team first" mentality and working collaboratively to solve problems and meet shared goals.
* Delighting Customers: Listens and understands the interests and needs of our customers and stakeholders, making them feel heard and important, and embracing these learnings to continue delivering a unique Pokemon experience.

What to expect

* An employee first culture
* Company events that celebrate the spirit of Pokemon
* Competitive cash-based compensation programs
* 100% employer-paid healthcare premiums for you
* Generous paid family leave
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Employer-paid long and short-term income protection insurance
* Fitness reimbursement
* Commuter benefit
* LinkedIn learning

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of
work being performed by people assigned to this role. They are not to be
construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills
required. Employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal
responsibilities from time to time, as needed. For roles in the United
Kingdom, candidates will need the right to work. In some cases, and for some
roles, the Company may be able to arrange a visa. For roles in Ireland, this
role requires candidates to have the right to live and work in the Republic of
Ireland. However, we welcome applications from all nationalities and may
consider supporting an employment permit application, in appropriate and
suitable cases.

* Lead the creation of a cloud-first software source code management and build/deployment pipeline in Azure DevOps, focused primarily on the integration of a large acquisition but looking forward to all of nThrive
* Establish and maintain pipeline templates, collaborating with participating development teams to understand and document requirements

* Lead pilots and proofs-of-concept for CI/CD-related integrations such as SAST and SCA scans

* Ensure that policies and practices support the diversity of technology platforms and languages that exists within nThrive today, including both .NET and Java applications that reside both on-prem and within Azure
* Monitor and maintain environments and delivery pipelines

Requirements:

* 3+ years of experience in an architect role responsible for overseeing design, pattern development, and tool selection for managing Azure resources

DevOps Solution Architect  

Job Description  

You're raising the stakes for your career to do more. Learn more. Impact more.
Here, your innovation, ideas, and technical curiosity will help us deliver
better care for billions of people worldwide. You'll put your professional
expertise, talent, and drive to work by building and managing the technology
behind our portfolio of iconic brands.  

The Kimberly-Clark Information Technology Solutions (ITS) function is looking
for a DevOps Solution Architect who will be a leader with an established
record of DevOps organizational transformation and cloud adoption with
enterprise level customers. We'll lean on you to also have technical depth
across the Full DevOps Spectrum along with leading and advising higher level
executives, evangelizing enterprise cloud based DevOps transformations, and
pioneering the latest DevOps industry standards.  

As DevOps Solution Architect you will be accountable for leading and
establishing the DevOps practice. Educating, influencing and collaborating
with other solution engineers as well as engineering end-to-end solution in
the areas of automated build, deployment, monitoring and server
infrastructure.  

You'll need the ability to quickly understand development lifecycle needs. The
ability to not only code and configure tools, but also assemble and integrate
technology across disparate platforms is critical to success. This includes a
deep understanding of systems, data structures, modern scripting and
enterprise level languages as well as open source tools that can and should be
leveraged to solve problems.  

You'll collaborate with IT and business resources, requiring the ability to
present technical details to a non-technical audience.  

Duties and Responsibilities:  

Demonstrate proficiency in multiple DevOps related tools and technologies.  

* Own the quality of DevOps architecture and design, Lead and contribute to define industry standards and DevOps offerings and functionally decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions.
* Assist in the career development of others, actively mentoring individuals and the Amazon developer community on advanced technical issues and helping managers guide the career growth of their team members.
* Exert technical influence over multiple teams, increasing their productivity and effectiveness by sharing your deep knowledge and experience.
* Lead technical and design discussions with Executives to help enterprises speed their adoption of new technologies and practices, implement efficient end-to-end provisioning of automation solutions.
* Serve as a thought leader and SME for DevOps industry trends, new and existing technology offerings, and architectural concept, implementing DevOps best practices and provide architectural governance.
* Hands on experienceof continuous integration, continuous delivery, automated testing and all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle as well as in technical documentation skills
* Define and Experience with Application Lifecycle Management tools and Source Control systems, such as GIT,Azure DevOps/VSTS, static code analysis for codes quality and security -using SonarQube and Checkmarx
* Exposure to configuration management tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, or similar, Docker & Kubernetes and strong Scripting experience in PowerShell or any other scripting languages, integrate systems using a wide variety of protocols like REST, SOAP, MQ, TCP/IP, JSON and others

Required Qualifications:  

* 12+ years of IT experience with 10+ years of software development or application or object-oriented language
* 3+ years of experience as a technical advisor.
* 3 + years of Experience on Azure DevOps tool in terms of building Build and Deployment pipelines
* Experience in cloudarchitecture and design with more than 6 years of experience in automating IT administration, IT processes, or business processes, deploying applications and provisioning infrastructure.
* Architectural leadership experience with microservices and distributed applications, such as containers, Kubernetes, and/or serverless technology, SDLC and delivery using Agile practices.
* Proven knowledge in any of the Code Review and Security tools, say SonarQube, Checkmarx, HCL Appscan, scripting languages like PowerShell, testing methodologies and tools like Selenium, Worksoft Certify and Unit Testing frameworks
* Experience in automating / integrating a broad range of systems and services using Terraform for any of the cloud Platforms like Azure or GCP
* Experience with project management and workflow tools such as Agile, Jira, Azure Boards, open-source technologies, and cloud services.
* Solid leadership, partnership, and communication skills, working with IT architecture with focus on reusability and automation
* Ability to coordinate with all levels of the firm to design and deliver technical solutions to business problems.

About Us  

Huggies®. Kleenex®. Cottonelle®. Scott®. Kotex®. Poise®. Depend®. 25% of
people in the world use Kimberly-Clark products every day, and it takes the
best people to make that happen.  

We're founded on 150 years of market leadership, and we're always looking for
new and better ways to perform, especially when it comes to product and
process innovation. Our customers are always looking for new and better. Our
competitors won't stop evolving. And our communities demand responsible
corporate practices. We need bold, transformative ideas from people who can
turn them into reality. That means there's no time like the present to make an
impact at Kimberly-Clark. It's all here for you at Kimberly-Clark .  

About You  

You were made to do this work: designing new technologies, diving into data,
optimizing digital experiences, and constantly developing better, faster ways
to get results. You want to be part of a performance culture dedicated to
building technology for a purpose that matters. You want to work in an
environment that promotes sustainability, inclusion, wellbeing, and career
development.  

You love what you do, especially when your work makes a difference. At
Kimberly-Clark, we're constantly exploring new ideas on how, when, and where
we can best achieve results. When you join our team, you'll experience Flex
That Works: flexible (hybrid) work arrangements that empower you to have
purposeful time in the office and partner with your leader to make flexibility
work for both you and the business.  

We always ask, "How can we improve this?" and we're looking for like-minded
people. This is one business that's not chained to the status quo. "Good
enough" isn't good enough here. We stay ahead by keeping on top of trends,
recognizing market gaps and looking to fill those gaps in ways that give us an
advantage. In our diverse workforce, we encourage and guide each other to
explore new ground, glad for the unique perspectives and skills every person
brings. Join us in our rewarding and profitable journey.  

Total Benefits  

Here are a few of the benefits you'd enjoy. For a complete overview, see
www.mykcbenefits.com .  

Great support for good health with medical, dental, and vision coverage
options. No waiting periods or pre-existing condition restrictions. Access to
an on-site fitness center, occupational health nurse, and allowances for high-
quality safety equipment.  

Flexible Savings and spending accounts to maximize health care options and
stretch dollars when caring for yourself or dependents.  

Diverse income protection insurance options to protect yourself and your
family in case of illness, injury, or other unexpected events.  

Additional programs and support to continue your education, adopt a child,
relocate, or even find temporary childcare.  

To Be Considered  

Click the Apply button and complete the online application process. A member
of our recruiting team will review your application and follow up if you seem
like a great fit for this role.  

In the meantime, check out the careers website . You'll want to review this
and come prepared with relevant questions if and when you pass GO and begin
interviews.  

And finally, the fine print...  

For Kimberly-Clark to grow and prosper, we must be an inclusive organization
that applies the diverse experiences and passions of its team members to
brands that make life better for people all around the world. We actively seek
to build a workforce that reflects the experiences of our consumers. When you
bring your original thinking to Kimberly-Clark, you fuel the continued success
of our enterprise. We are a committed equal opportunity employer, and all
qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected
veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, pregnancy, genetic
information, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of
work performed by employees assigned to this classification. Statements are
not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties,
responsibilities and skills required for this position.  

K-C requires that an employee have authorization to work in the country in
which the role is based. In the event an applicant does not have current work
authorization, K-C will determine, in its sole discretion, whether to sponsor
an individual for work authorization. However, based on immigration
requirements, not all roles are suitable for sponsorship. This position is
subject to drug and alcohol testing, including pre-employment testing.  

Travel may include less than 10% of work time. Travel may also include travel
via aircrafts and motor vehicles to various locations, if applicable. Varying
working conditions may include prolonged sitting, typing and viewing
computer/laptop screens, along with occasional bending, reaching, lifting,
carrying, climbing, twisting, stooping, walking and standing.  

LI-remote

description:
Job Description

DevOps Support Engineer

Are you looking to help some of the most innovative engineers in the world?
Help them be more productive? Help them focus on developing amazing products
while using outstanding tools and systems? Do you enjoy diagnosing
sophisticated environmental issues with the CI/CD tool chain?

If so, we would love to have you apply for this role as a DevOps Support
Engineer reporting into the Engineering Systems and Tools team! Your main
focus will be on developing and administering Git, Subversion, ElectricFlow,
CloudBees CI and JFrog Artifactory/Insight. This is a hands-on role.

You will work with internal customers, assessing the current state of
processes, defining, and developing solutions. You will support all
administrative functions associated with the CI/CD toolchain. You will deliver
training and demos to teams on the new features and functionality available.
You will also address technical problems in a fast-paced environment.

You will be responsible for developing, evolving, and deploying all the
capabilities of our CI/CD tool suite. This role focuses on facilitating the
best use of these tools across the Bose Engineering organization, assisting
teams in getting the most value..

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field.

Experience with Rest API's, Perl, and Python

Expertise with Git, SVN, Jenkins, Artifactory desired

Proven experience in MySQL or other relational database

Experience with Linux desired. Solid grasp of the SDLC

Ability to work with all levels of the organization.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do
not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex,
gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran
status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with
disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job
application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to
receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to
request accommodation.

LI-SK1

Bose is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and
diversity. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color,
religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information,
national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally
protected characteristics. For additional information, please review: (1) the
EEO is the Law Poster
(http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCPEEOSupplementFinalJRFQA508c.pdf);
and (2) its Supplements
(http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm). Please note,
the company's pay transparency is available at
http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/pdf/EO13665PrescribedNondiscriminationPostingLanguageJRFQA508c.pdf.
Bose is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to
individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because
of a disability for any part of the application or employment process, please
send an e-mail to Wellbeing@bose.com and let us know the nature of your
request and your contact information.

description:
AWS DevOps Engineer (REMOTE)  

Position Description 
CGI has an immediate need for an AWS DevOps Engineer to join our financial
services team in one of our selected CGI locations. Due to the current
COVID-19 status, candidates will not be required to work within the physical
work location at this time. When COVID-19 restrictions are lifted, they will
be required to be located within the proximity of the assigned CGI location.  

This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced team environment
supporting one of the largest leaders in the secondary mortgage industry. We
take an innovative approach to supporting our client, working side-by-side in
an agile environment using emerging technologies.  

* We partner with 15 of the top 20 banks globally, and our top 10 banking clients have worked with us for an average of 26 years!
* We have over 73,000+ CGI Members in 40 countries and over 5k+ loyal Clients who are leveraging our end-to-end services across the globe

Project Pitch 
This position is a part of the strategic initiatives projects in Capital
Markets area working on the latest tech stack. Join a fast paced team to grow
your career. High aptitude, desire to grow and the right attitude are key to
success in this role.  

Your future duties and responsibilities  

* Build and deploy CICD pipeline using GitLab with multiple technologies like AWS
* Participate in technical design and choose the right tools such as AWS, Tomcat, WebLogic, and Spring Boot application
* Implement standards, processes, and controls for release and deployment activities in DevOps space

Required qualifications to be successful in this role  

* 8+ years of relevant experience
* AWS hands-on experience required.
* Hands-on experience in building application CI/CD pipeline using GitLab, expertise in setting up CI/CD
* Should be hands on with application build automation tool Maven/Gradle
* Experience in writing Groovy/Python Scripts for executing commands on GitLab/Jenkins for build/deploying application
* Experience in working with application Git/BitBucket - branching strategy
* Experience in using Sonar for continuous inspection of application code to detect bugs, code smells and security vulnerabilities
* Experience in using Nexus Artifact repository & Component lifecycle management for given application
* Experience in automating application deployments, some exposure to application deployment to AWS Infrastructure
* Experience with full SDLC lifecycle, taking from Dev to Release
* Experience with Urban Code Deployment (UCD)
* Excellent communication, and documentation skills
* Professional demeanor
* Must be well versed in creating CI/CD pipelines, build docker containers

Desired Skillset 
AWS, CI/CD  

EDUCATION REQUIREMENT 
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field 
AWS Solution Architect Associate or Developer Associate certification desired  

li-df1

dice

Insights you can act on  

While technology is at the heart of our clients' digital transformation, we
understand that people are at the heart of business success.  

When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues
and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and
sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI
shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to
build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it
has brought us to where we are today - one of the world's largest independent
providers of IT and business consulting services.  

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a
work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more
inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower
all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any
point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to
assist.  

Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI - where your ideas and
actions make a difference.  

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national
origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military
and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual
orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status,
political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected
status or characteristics.  

CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with
disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S.,
please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at
USEmploymentCompliance@cgi.com . You will need to reference the requisition
number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be
routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this
email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an
accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do
not include a requisition number will not be returned.  

We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be
directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service
members.  

All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to
successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation
components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US
government security clearance held. CGI will consider for employment qualified
applicants with arrests and conviction records in accordance with all local
regulations and ordinances.  

CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees
or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their
own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who
have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants
as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other
employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to
compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal
complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding,
hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or
(c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information.  

Skills

* Python 
* DevOps
* GitLab

description:
The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for assisting the Company in the
configuration, administration, monitoring and maintenance Company’s existing
and future software server, software, network and associated technologies with
an emphasis on employing cloud based service providers and operating a hybrid
architecture consisting of internal, external, and partner based technology
resources.

Required Qualifications

· The DevOps Engineer will create, deploy, monitor, scale and secure
infrastructure and applications with focus on automating as much as possible.

· This role will work with other engineers to evolve the company's CI/CD
capabilities and will play a key role in the implementation of DevOps
processes and tooling

· This role is key to helping the teams in the engineering organization be
successful in their jobs

· Ensure availability, performance, scalability, and security of deployed
infrastructure

· Build and maintain operations software which automates the configuration,
provisioning, deployment, and monitoring of our core products

· Build and maintain our production infrastructure to ensure ongoing
reliability while maximizing development team efficiency

· Develop automation frameworks for public cloud infrastructure deployments

· Monitor, troubleshoot and debug infrastructure, network, operating system,
and system performance issues

· Maintenance, management, and streamlining of all our CI/CD processes

· Participate in architecture planning sessions with development team

· Work closely with developers and QA teams to understand how to improve their
processes and deliver high quality software more effectively.

Position Qualifications

· A minimum of 4 years of experience with system administration on Linux
machines

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Docker or other containerization
technologies

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Terraform

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using AWS

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Kubernetes

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Jenkins or similar CI/CD Tools

· Experience with Ansible, Helm, and Git

· Experience with Cloud Networking and Load Balancer Technologies (AWS ELB,
HAProxy, etc.)

· Experience with maintaining monitoring tools like Grafana, Prometheus,
InfluxDB, and Telegraf

· Ability to critically think and provide solutions to problems you have not
encountered before

· Fluency in at least two programming languages (i.e. Ruby, Python, etc.)

· Experience with continuous integration / deployment (CI/CD) in a high
availability environment

· Ability to work effectively with distributed teams using collaboration tools
and without face-to-face communication

The selected candidate will join a team who values work life balance and
professional growth equally. You will be supported as you continue to grow in
your career and will be given every resource to succeed. Interested candidates
are encouraged to apply directly.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

description:
Link 2 Solutions LLC have been engaged by a long standing client of 10 years
to identify high quality candidates for a new “ Junior DevOps Engineer
position ”. The position is 90% virtual and the ideal candidate will live
within 60 minutes drive of downtown Orlando.

* _PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ARE A CANDIDATE WHO DOES NOT CURRENTLY LIVE WITHIN 60 MINUTES OF DOWNTOWN ORLANDO._

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: -
* Deep knowledge and experience developing automation solutions to enable software build and release processes
* 1-3 years of demonstrated experience with:
* Building pipelines using one or more CI/CD platforms:
* Azure DevOps, TeamCity, Jenkins, GitLab, GoCD, Octopus, AWS CodeCommit/CodeDeploy…
* Android CI/CD pipelines a plus (Gradle, Maven, …)
* Source control tools (Git, TFS, …)
* Package management systems (yarn, npm, Nuget Server, Azure Artifacts …)
* Configuration management tools and best practices
* Writing automation using modern scripting language (Powershell, Python, JavaScript, …)
* Fluency working in Windows environments
* Providing visibility into build/release environments through telemetry platforms, reports and alerts
* Evolving processes and tools to support applications in production environments
* Developing tool integrations through use of APIs and scripting
* Docker containerization
* Ability to collaborate exceptionally well with developers, ops and QA roles in Agile team environment
* Strong problem solver
* Passion to learn what makes the business tick
* Desire to continually improve all things DevOps
* Open willingness to help teach others ops best practices and automation

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* DevOps: 1 year (Required)
* Cloud Engineers: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

description:
We help the world run better

Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by
building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the
foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences,
values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused
work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong
focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual
contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply
now!

* 
What you will do

SAP were original pioneers in the creation of integrated enterprise software.
2022 is our 50th year and we continue to invest in teams that deliver new and
exciting solutions with the remit to be creative and have innovation at the
centre of everything you do.

Our DevOps Engineers are problem solvers that have a real interest enabling
innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on
building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces
differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose- driven and
future-focused work

The Multicloud Hyperscaler DevOps†team play a critical central role within
SAPis global public cloud transition. The team of Cloud DevOps Engineers are
at the heart of the processes that empower SAP to develop and deliver high
quality products quickly. Working with our lines of business, you will help
build and run our next-generation multicloud technologies at global scale. If
you are an experienced DevOps Engineer with a passion for delivering
innovative IT services and value-creation, a career at SAP may be right for
you!

* 
What you bring

* You will need to have knowledge in one or more of Cloud environments such as
AWS, GCP or Azure and prior experience.
* 3+ years public cloud operations support in AWS, GCP, or Azure and Azure AD
* Experience in supporting enterprise environments, including customer relationship management
* Design and build advanced automations with a focus on more efficient operations and governance at enterprise scale
* Understanding of cloud based identity services and federation
* Documentation of solutions (e.g. configuration and setup)
* IaC -Infrastructure as Code (we use Terraform)
* Python / Bash / PowerShell (for scripting / automation)
* CI / CD (we use GitHub actions)
* Working in an Agile environment and a solid understanding of Agile methodologies
* Version control (we use GitHub), code reviews and good software working practices

* 
Meet your team

The SAP Multicloud team have a focus on delivering for our people while
delivering for the business. We have real diversity across our team, and also
in the topics we work on, so there are always fantastic opportunities to build
the career you want.

LI-Hybrid

We build breakthroughs together

SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more
efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for
leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to
become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related
services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience
management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000
employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly
collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether
connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every
challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs,
together.

We win with inclusion

SAP's culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible
working models help ensure that everyone - regardless of background - feels
included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by
the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company,
and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize
their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and
creating a better and more equitable world. 
SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action
employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and
provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental
disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and
are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or
to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to
Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com. 
For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee
Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral
Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender
(including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity
or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.

Requisition ID: 344545 | Work Area: Software-Development Operations | Expected
Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full
Time | Additional Locations: Virtual - USA #LI-Hybrid

description:
Job Description:

* 
Essential Job Functions

* Solid understanding of source management, application lifecycle management, build management and package management tools TFS, Azure DevOps/VSTS, Visual Studio, Maven.
* Experienced in leading efforts to implement continuous improvements to all areas of pipeline automation and infrastructure services in order to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of overall DevOps capability.
* Experience with secure scripting/coding, collaboration across multiple product development teams and complex troubleshooting across multiple infrastructure teams.
* Knowledge of cloud environments.
* Knowledge in various branching/merging methodologies and release procedures.

Basic Qualifications
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Bachelor's degree in software engineering, information systems, computer science, or related field preferred
* 6+ years of IT technical experience in product design and support
* 3+ years of experience with automation, cloud, CI/CD or DevOps specific role.
* 3+ years of experience as a DevOps engineer integrating tools like Jenkins, or other deployment tools
* Knowledge of C# and .Net technology
* Shell, Perl, PowerShell, Ruby, etc
* Experience in IaC tools like Ansible and Terraform

Other Qualifications
* Good organization skills to balance and prioritize work
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills
* Good presentation and communication skills to communicate with clients, support personnel and management
* Ability to adapt to changing situations, handle multiple tasks simultaneously and to switch between tasks quickly
* Ability to anticipate problems, deal with and resolve ambiguity and take decisive action
* Ability to work with relational databases
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Willingness to travel

Work Environment
* Office environment
* Other US locations may be considered
* Remote work may be considered

{"advice": "Take care of the people that made what Gainwell is today. Specifically, those that endured the past 10yrs with negligent predecessors (not including EDS), not treating them like people, and not paying them a fair salary. If you have employees that are top notch, you should get their salary at the midpoint for their range or you will end up losing people that have a long history with the systems we implement and maintain, otherwise you will lose them.", "cons": "The cons... Well, if you were part of EDS back in 2009 when HP bought the company, everything went downhill from there. We went from EDS to HP to HPE and spun off to CSC and became DXC.

The best thing about DXC selling off the healthcare and life sciences to a joint venture capitalist company is that we were freed from years of employee neglect, no bonus or salary increases.

Gainwell is still working to get peoples salaries to where they should be and have made significant progress in doing that.

Coming into Gainwell now, make sure you get top dollar for your skills and negotiate. We need ~3k people for all the work in the pipeline.", "countHelpful": 9, "employerResponses": [], "employmentStatus": "REGULAR", "featured": null, "isCurrentJob": true, "jobTitle": {"text": "Advisor, Project Management"}, "lengthOfEmployment": 20, "pros": "Gainwell is privately owned and was purchased from DXC. The company's focus is on healthcare solutions for Medicaid, Pharmacy Benefit Manager, and Data Analytics. The company is about 18 months old and is doing great things in the healthcare market space.

They are very focused on the employee experience. The promote a real work-life balance and provide many perks (not benefits) that are free, fun, and really useful to the employee.

The company is always looking for people will skills in healthcare systems, Medicare and Medicaid. If you are coming into Gainwell as a new employee, they do pay a premium for good talent.

The health benefits are good and typically year after year you would see the increased cost of healthcare benefits passed onto the employee. Gainwell is self-insured and has taken on the bulk of the increase rather than pass it on to the employee.

It is a great place to work and most of us work remotely from home and there are some office spaces depending on where you live.

We also have Flex vacation, no set number of days or weeks. You can take time off when you need it or want it. there are some guidelines around it but you can easily take 4-5 weeks a year being a 1st year employee.", "ratingBusinessOutlook": "POSITIVE", "ratingCareerOpportunities": 5, "ratingCeo": "APPROVE", "ratingCompensationAndBenefits": 4, "ratingCultureAndValues": 5, "ratingOverall": 5, "ratingRecommendToFriend": "POSITIVE", "ratingSeniorLeadership": 5, "ratingWorkLifeBalance": 5, "reviewDateTime": "2022-04-19T14:27:27.157", "reviewId": 62990269, "summary": "Healthcare and Medicaid Solutions"}

description:
About Net Health 
 * _Belong. Thrive. Make a Difference._* 
Are you looking for a meaningful and satisfying career where you have endless
opportunities to grow and be financially rewarded? Net Health may be the
perfect place for you. 
A high-growth and profitable company, we help caregivers harness data for
human health. We also honor and respect the needs of our Net Health family and
staff, which is why we offer a work-from-anywhere environment and unlimited
PTO. Our welcoming and collaborative culture paired with progressive benefits
makes Net Health the ultimate career home! 
As a leading-edge SaaS company in healthcare, we deliver solutions that help
patients get better, faster, and live more fulfilling lives. Our software and
predictive analytics cover the continuum of care, from hospital-to-home,
across various medical specialties. Come join us and start the next chapter of
your exciting career while helping others to live better lives. 
 * _World-Class Benefits That Reflect Our World-Class Culture._* 
Click Here to Learn More!:  

WorkFromAnywhere #UnlimitedPTO #ComprehensiveBenefitsPackage

EmployeeResourceGroups #CasualDressCode #PrioritizedEmployeeWellness

DiversityAndInclusion #AVoice #NewHireSupport #CareerDevelopment

EducationalAssistance #EmployeeReferralBonus #ProgressiveParentalLeave

Net Health, a leading developer of specialized EMRs across various markets, is
looking for an experienced DBA who can help support our development teams as
they build apps and services using data at scale across multiple product
lines. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of Relational Database
systems, with some exposure to the DevOps methodology, nosql/document
databases, and containerization. The candidate should be as comfortable
designing tables and indexes as they are advising development teams on the
tradeoffs between standard row based data stores, columnar database systems,
or document based databases. 
 Purpose: The Devops DBA will be responsible for working with development
teams to design and build resilient, well-performing data environments that
meet our application needs in the most efficient, economic way possible.

* Essential Job Functions: 

* Work with a cross functional team in an Agile/Scrum process to refine stories into work product that meets Net Health’s standards for quality, performance, and usefulness within project timelines.
* Be able to translate stories into needed data stores, tables, queries, and processes required to meet story needs.
* Make sure projects are built for easy verification by automated testing and easy integration into CI/CD Pipelines
* Ability to turn feedback from internal stakeholders into meaningful courses of action
* Troubleshoot and tune poorly performing queries
* Monitor usage in production environments and design and execute plans to meet our SLOs around performance.
* Troubleshoot problems and provide options for possible solutions
* Pick up new technology, frameworks, data stores, apis, and sdks with minimal oversight
* Participate in code reviews

* Specialized Knowledge, Equipment/ Software Requirements: 

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field
* Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences
* 4-5 years’ experience running production RDBMS (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc…) at scale.
* 4-5 years’ experience working with development teams designing resilient, well–performing database environments
* 2-3 year’s experience working with data systems in public cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP, etc…)
* 2-3 years’ experience with scripting language (powershell, bash, python, etc…)
* 2-3 years’ experience integrating database changes into CI/CD pipelines

* Nice to Have: 

* Experience with running databases on containers
* Experience with kubernetes
* Experience with modern source control tools and practices

Additional Info: 
EEO Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for
employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. 
 Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee
may perform other related duties as requested to meet the ongoing needs of the
organization. 
 Colorado Pay Law: If you are a Colorado resident and this role is
available in Colorado or remote, you may be eligible to receive additional
information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will
provide upon request. Please send an email to Recruiting@NetHealth.com

Job Type: Full-time

description:
G * _et to know The Pok emon Company International_

__ The Pokemon Company International, a subsidiary of The Pokemon Company in
Japan, manages the property outside of Asia and is responsible for brand
management, licensing, marketing, the Pokemon Trading Card Game, the animated
TV series, home entertainment, and the official Pokemon website. Pokemon was
launched in Japan in 1996 and today is one of the most popular children's
entertainment properties in the world.

Learn more online at Pokemon.com and on Facebook (facebook.com/pokemon),
YouTube (youtube.com/pokemon), Twitter (twitter.com/pokemon), and Instagram
(instagram.com/pokemon).

Get to know the role

Job Title: Manager, DevOps

Job Summary:

The Manager, DevOps Tools is responsible for the day-to-day operations of the
Tools Engineering team. This role will oversee the support, administration and
engineering of JIRA and Confluence as our primary service offerings, as well
as other tools leveraged by the TPCi Technology teams to build, test, and
release features for Pokemon.com and other digital products. They will lead
internal DevOps Tools projects and initiatives in addition to managing the
backlog, sprints, roadmap, and budget while staying current on technology and
trends that relate to Tools' service offerings.

FLSA Classification (US Only): Exempt

People Manager: No

_What you 'll do _

* Recruit, develop, mentor, coach and inspire a team of Tools Administrators and Engineers, while also building a culture of collaboration, making data-driven decisions and continuous learning.
* Create personalized development plans for members of your team to enable opportunities for growth and new capabilities.
* Manage relationships with internal stakeholders to ensure alignment on priorities and effective collaboration on projects.
* Partner with our technical leads to solve complicated problems, identify and reinforce technical direction, and establish clear priorities.
* Support the team by managing workload, prioritizing tasks, escalations, unblocking impediments
* Ensure the high standards for the operability of our Tools offerings are met by managing the maintenance, patching, upgrades and performance observability of Tools
* Provide guidance and oversight of the team supporting the Tools Support service desk
* Lead the efforts to evaluate, test, install and configure 3rd party add-ons for our tools to provide enhanced functionality.
* Proactively identify potential tools solutions to meet the Technology Teams' requirements in support of build, test and release of digital products
* Manage and lead Proof of Concept efforts for new tools' evaluations

_What you 'll bring _

* Six+ (6+) years of relevant professional experience, plus one (1) year of management experience.
* Experience with CI/CD pipeline tools and technology such as Perforce, Bitbucket, Terraform, Docker, Ansible, Jenkins, and Artifactory.
* Experience working in an agile/scrum environment and the ability to lead the teams backlog refinement, planning, and retrospectives.
* Thorough understanding of the DevOps concepts & culture, with a focus on leveraging software engineering tools, methodologies and concepts.
* Functional knowledge and experience including but not limited to: Development practices, Information Security principles, Vendor Management, Executive Communications, and Data Analytics.
* Experience establishing and implementing process for user management; defining, documenting and implementing user access models across Developer and Enterprise Tools (including permissions sets, roles and profiles)
* Experience establishing and implementing a technical support model and training for users of Developer and Enterprise Tools
* Experience in identifying and implementing continuous improvement processes to optimize tools systems
* Experience using Tools/Tools usage data to guide decisions regarding the Tools' lifecycle
* Ability to effectively prioritize and support new Tools requests and/or Tools updates
* Experience identifying, researching and evaluating Development Tools for use across the Enterprise

How you 'll be successful

* Passion for Pokemon: Develops an understanding of the Pokemon brand, the impact it has on our people, culture, business, fans, and communities, and applying that knowledge and passion to everything you do.
* Challenging the Expected: Approaches challenges with curiosity and creativity, embracing the possibility of failure as an opportunity to learn something new, develop innovative ideas, solve complex problems and identify unique opportunities.
* Integrity and Respect: Demonstrates integrity and respect by leading with empathy, listening to others, seeking out different perspectives, and taking personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and results.
* Dedicated to Quality: Takes ownership to maintain and promote high standards, looks for new ways to learn and improve, and embraces a growth mindset to seek and apply feedback from others in an effort to continuously improve.
* Building Relationships: Develops and strengthens relationships, adopting a "team first" mentality and working collaboratively to solve problems and meet shared goals.
* Delighting Customers: Listens and understands the interests and needs of our customers and stakeholders, making them feel heard and important, and embracing these learnings to continue delivering a unique Pokemon experience.

What to expect

* An employee first culture
* Company events that celebrate the spirit of Pokemon
* Competitive cash-based compensation programs
* 100% employer-paid healthcare premiums for you
* Generous paid family leave
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Employer-paid long and short-term income protection insurance
* US Employees: 401k Employer Matching
* UK/IRE Employees: Pension Employer Contributions
* Fitness reimbursement
* Commuter benefit
* LinkedIn learning
* Comprehensive relocation package
* Hybrid work environment

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of
work being performed by people assigned to this role. They are not to be
construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills
required. Employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal
responsibilities from time to time, as needed. For roles in the United
Kingdom, candidates will need the right to work. In some cases, and for some
roles, the Company may be able to arrange a visa. For roles in Ireland, this
role requires candidates to have the right to live and work in the Republic of
Ireland. However, we welcome applications from all nationalities and may
consider supporting an employment permit application, in appropriate and
suitable cases.

description:
Come join Tyler Technologies as a DevOps Engineer! The Tyler Cloud Platform
team is looking for Engineers to build and run the services and infrastructure
that power the platform.  

This position will work an evening schedule to improve our team 's ability
to support our clients as broadly throughout the day as possible.  

We are hiring high quality engineers with a diverse set of experiences and
skill sets for positions on the cloud platform team delivering the vision of
Connected Communities. The strongest candidates will have a solid operations
expertise and demonstrated software development experience on large scale
cloud infrastructure. Our clients count on us to provide exceptional
availability, scalability, and security for services and infrastructure. As an
DevOps Engineer, you'll be on a team of engineers whose mission it is to build
and improve Tyler's most critical cloud services.  

Are you up to the challenge?

As a part of Tyler's corporate staff, you will make an impact on outcomes that
affect various areas of the company. Your work will ultimately support our
team members, clients, stakeholders, and the public sector.

Location

Remote

Responsibilities

* Architect, author, champion, and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, and security of Tyler's Cloud Platform services.
* _Design, build_* _ and manage_ systems, infrastructure and applications through automation that support self sufficiency
* Deploy, support, and monitor new and existing services, platforms, and application stacks
* Use scalable testing to measure, report, tune, and optimize system performance
* _Develop tools to improve our ability to rapidly deploy and effectively monitor services in a large-scale Kubernetes environment._
* Participate in periodic on-call duties
* Recommend new solutions and technologies
* Collaborate with team and others to share operational best practices
* Function well in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Cover after hours support needs with core hours from 5pm to 1am Pacific Time, M-F
* Provide an escalation path to the rest of the team after hours.

Qualifications

* 3+ years in a UNIX-based large-scale web operations role.
* _5+ years programming experience in Python, Perl, Node, Java/Scala, or C#_
* 3+ years designing and implementing, large-scale AWS production workloads
* _Experience with large scale Kubernetes architectures and configuration_
* Expert scripting knowledge, specifically for systems automation
* UNIX/Linux systems administration background
* Knowledge of most of these: data structures, relational and non-relational databases, networking, Linux internals, file systems, web architecture, and related topics
* Ability to guide technical teams through design and implementation across an organization
* Previous experience working an evening shift with geographically distributed coworkers.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills (including listening, speaking, and writing) and ability to work well in a diverse, team-focused environment with other DevOps, Engineers, Product Managers, etc.

Preferred Experience
* Experienced in configuration and deployment of containers at scale in AWS EKS, ECS, and Fargate
* Experienced in configuration, management, and monitoring of DataDog
* Experience authoring infrastructure using tools such as cloud-formation or terraform
* Experienced in configuration and management of CI/CD tooling like Github Actions, Jenkins or CircleCI
* Experienced database engineer with MySQL, specifically Aurora

State Specific Salary Range Disclosure Requirements for Colorado,

Connecticut, and Nevada

Salary will generally fall between $55,537 - $100,000 before adjustment for
geographic differences. Recruiter can confirm if position is incentive
eligible.

Great Place to Work & Grow Your Career

Come join us as we transform the public sector! Our mission, vision, and
values guide everything we do. We're also frequently recognized as a great
workplace locally and nationally. See our many awards and accolades.

Taking Care of You & Your Family

Your health and well-being are important to us. That's why we invest in our
team members by offering competitive benefits to support their health and
financial wellness. Learn more about how we care for our people.

Tyler is subject to regulations, guidelines, and/or client requirements
relating to the qualifications of Tyler personnel performing certain client
work. Because of the nature of this position, it is a requirement that the
candidate can successfully pass a federal background check at the time an
offer is extended and over the course of employment with Tyler.

description:
Piper Companies is actively seeking a DevOps Engineer to remotely join
an end-to-end payment processing company in Durham, NC. The DevOps
Engineer will be responsible for working on the dev team to scale, create,
and improve current software.  

Responsibilities of the DevOps Engineer:

* Responsible for generating code and improving on current coding.
* Working as the lead DevOps engineer.
* Monitoring of overall system health. 
* Working with a small team in a rapidly growing company. 

Qualifications of the DevOps engineer:

* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field 
* 4 + years with DevOps experience.
* Experience with AWS and AWS technologies.
* Experience with Docker and Kubernetes. 
* Experience with CI/CD and testing automation.

Compensation of the DevOps Engineer:
* Salary: $140,000 - $170,000 based on relevant experience
* Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k match up to 4%, PTO

Keywords: DevOps, DevOps engineer, engineer, remote, CI/CD, automation, start
up, AWS, docker, kubernetes, growing, ansible, containerization, kafka,
terraform, cloud, scale, create, software, software engineer

description:
Job Description:

* 
Essential Job Functions

* Solid understanding of source management, application lifecycle management, build management and package management tools TFS, Azure DevOps/VSTS, Visual Studio, Maven.
* Experienced in leading efforts to implement continuous improvements to all areas of pipeline automation and infrastructure services in order to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of overall DevOps capability.
* Experience with secure scripting/coding, collaboration across multiple product development teams and complex troubleshooting across multiple infrastructure teams.
* Knowledge of cloud environments.
* Knowledge in various branching/merging methodologies and release procedures.

Basic Qualifications
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Bachelor's degree in software engineering, information systems, computer science, or related field preferred
* 6+ years of IT technical experience in product design and support
* 3+ years of experience with automation, cloud, CI/CD or DevOps specific role.
* 3+ years of experience as a DevOps engineer integrating tools like Jenkins, or other deployment tools
* Knowledge of C# and .Net technology
* Shell, Perl, PowerShell, Ruby, etc
* Experience in IaC tools like Ansible and Terraform

Other Qualifications
* Good organization skills to balance and prioritize work
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills
* Good presentation and communication skills to communicate with clients, support personnel and management
* Ability to adapt to changing situations, handle multiple tasks simultaneously and to switch between tasks quickly
* Ability to anticipate problems, deal with and resolve ambiguity and take decisive action
* Ability to work with relational databases
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Willingness to travel

Work Environment
* Office environment
* Other US locations may be considered
* Remote work may be considered

description:
We are currently looking for a full-time DevOps Engineer to support the
infrastructure needs of our growing team. In this 
role, you'll be the second DevOps hire and will work directly with our lead
DevOps Engineer to maintain 
the reliability, security, scalability and deployment of our platform.  

Responsibilities  

* Build, integrate, test, monitor and deploy code across multiple cloud and on-premise environments
* Build tooling to assist with maintenance, upgrades, deployments and monitoring of AWS and on-premise
* environments.
* Assist with provisioning and setting up new AWS environments for dedicated cloud installations.
* Help maintain data security policies and best practices by designing and implementing secure, immutable
* infrastructure through infrastructure as code and thoughtful security practices compatible with external standards(SOC2)

Requirements-  
* 3 to 6 years of DevOps industry experience
* Familiar with Linux, command line, bash scripting, yaml
* Experience with cloud and on-premise containerized infrastructure built with Docker, Kubernetes, Helm,
* Terraform, Packer, GitHub, and Min.IO
* Experience working with AWS cloud architecture and services such as VPC, EKS, EC2, S3, RDS
* Experience with PostgreSQL and AWS storage encryption, data at rest, and data in transit
* Familiarity defining and executing CI/CD pipelines with tools like Docker, GitHub, CircleCI
* Experience with monitoring services like DataDog is preferred

description:
Greetings from Konnectingtree Inc.,

Seeking Cloud DevOps Lead for Contract to hire position. Only GC holders and
US Citizens are eligible for this position.

Required Skillsets/Work Experience in the following : 
---------------------------------------------------------- 
* 5+ years of experience with migration from private to public cloud 
* 5+ years of experience with Amazon Web Services (like EC2, ELB, CloudFormation, S3, IAM, RDS, SNS, etc.) 
* 2+ years of experience developing and maintaining infrastructure as code, ideally using Terraform 
* Experience with server-side technologies such as Apache, NodeJS, HaProxy, Tomcat & Jboss Chef/Ansible 
* Experience with OpenShift, Kubernetes, ECS, EKS 
* DBMS experience in MySQL, Cassandra & Oracle 
* Experience with IBM MQ, RabbitMQ, Kafka. 
* Experience with Dynatrace, Splunk. DNS management (PDNS and Route53 experience) 
* Shell scripting (Python, PowerShell, Bash, etc.)

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $50.00 - $55.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Informatica: 1 year (Preferred)
* SQL: 1 year (Preferred)
* Data warehouse: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: One location

Job description:

Understanding customer requirements and project KPIs

* Implementing various development, testing, automation tools, and IT infrastructure
* Planning the team structure, activities, and involvement in project management activities.
* Managing stakeholders and external interfaces
* Setting up tools and required infrastructure
* Defining and setting development, test, release, update, and support processes for DevOps operation
* Have the technical skill to review, verify, and validate the software code developed in the project.
* Troubleshooting techniques and fixing the code bugs
* Monitoring the processes during the entire lifecycle for its adherence and updating or creating new processes for improvement and minimizing the wastage
* Encouraging and building automated processes wherever possible
* Identifying and deploying cybersecurity measures by continuously performing vulnerability assessment and risk management
* Incidence management and root cause analysis
* Coordination and communication within the team and with customers
* Selecting and deploying appropriate CI/CD tools
* Strive for continuous improvement and build continuous integration, continuous development, and constant deployment pipeline (CI/CD Pipeline)
* Mentoring and guiding the team members
* Monitoring and measuring customer experience and KPIs
* Managing periodic reporting on the progress to the management and the customer

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50.00 - $65.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

* New York, NY: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

* Azure: 1 year (Preferred)
* Python: 1 year (Preferred)
* Kubernetes: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: One location

Speak with the employer

description:
Link 2 Solutions LLC have been engaged by a long standing client of 10 years
to identify high quality candidates for a new “ Junior DevOps Engineer
position ”. The position is 90% virtual and the ideal candidate will live
within 60 minutes drive of downtown Orlando.

* _PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ARE A CANDIDATE WHO DOES NOT CURRENTLY LIVE WITHIN 60 MINUTES OF DOWNTOWN ORLANDO._

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: -
* Deep knowledge and experience developing automation solutions to enable software build and release processes
* 1-3 years of demonstrated experience with:
* Building pipelines using one or more CI/CD platforms:
* Azure DevOps, TeamCity, Jenkins, GitLab, GoCD, Octopus, AWS CodeCommit/CodeDeploy…
* Android CI/CD pipelines a plus (Gradle, Maven, …)
* Source control tools (Git, TFS, …)
* Package management systems (yarn, npm, Nuget Server, Azure Artifacts …)
* Configuration management tools and best practices
* Writing automation using modern scripting language (Powershell, Python, JavaScript, …)
* Fluency working in Windows environments
* Providing visibility into build/release environments through telemetry platforms, reports and alerts
* Evolving processes and tools to support applications in production environments
* Developing tool integrations through use of APIs and scripting
* Docker containerization
* Ability to collaborate exceptionally well with developers, ops and QA roles in Agile team environment
* Strong problem solver
* Passion to learn what makes the business tick
* Desire to continually improve all things DevOps
* Open willingness to help teach others ops best practices and automation

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* DevOps: 1 year (Required)
* Cloud Engineers: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

description:

Location: Remote 
Salary: $170K - $180K + Bonus an Stock Options  

Must Haves:

* In-depth knowledge of Linux both on the command line and fundamental operating system concepts
* Strong Python coding skills
* Experience using Ansible to automate tasks

Requirements

You Should Have

* 7+ years of relevant work experience
* In-depth knowledge of Linux both on the command line and fundamental operating system concepts
* Strong Python coding skills

* Familiarity with both the Java language and the JVM
* Working knowledge of relational databases and SQL

* Ability to remain calm under pressure
* Sense of humor is a must!

description:
The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for assisting the Company in the
configuration, administration, monitoring and maintenance Company’s existing
and future software server, software, network and associated technologies with
an emphasis on employing cloud based service providers and operating a hybrid
architecture consisting of internal, external, and partner based technology
resources.

Required Qualifications

· The DevOps Engineer will create, deploy, monitor, scale and secure
infrastructure and applications with focus on automating as much as possible.

· This role will work with other engineers to evolve the company's CI/CD
capabilities and will play a key role in the implementation of DevOps
processes and tooling

· This role is key to helping the teams in the engineering organization be
successful in their jobs

· Ensure availability, performance, scalability, and security of deployed
infrastructure

· Build and maintain operations software which automates the configuration,
provisioning, deployment, and monitoring of our core products

· Build and maintain our production infrastructure to ensure ongoing
reliability while maximizing development team efficiency

· Develop automation frameworks for public cloud infrastructure deployments

· Monitor, troubleshoot and debug infrastructure, network, operating system,
and system performance issues

· Maintenance, management, and streamlining of all our CI/CD processes

· Participate in architecture planning sessions with development team

· Work closely with developers and QA teams to understand how to improve their
processes and deliver high quality software more effectively.

Position Qualifications

· A minimum of 4 years of experience with system administration on Linux
machines

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Docker or other containerization
technologies

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Terraform

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using AWS

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Kubernetes

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Jenkins or similar CI/CD Tools

· Experience with Ansible, Helm, and Git

· Experience with Cloud Networking and Load Balancer Technologies (AWS ELB,
HAProxy, etc.)

· Experience with maintaining monitoring tools like Grafana, Prometheus,
InfluxDB, and Telegraf

· Ability to critically think and provide solutions to problems you have not
encountered before

· Fluency in at least two programming languages (i.e. Ruby, Python, etc.)

· Experience with continuous integration / deployment (CI/CD) in a high
availability environment

· Ability to work effectively with distributed teams using collaboration tools
and without face-to-face communication

The selected candidate will join a team who values work life balance and
professional growth equally. You will be supported as you continue to grow in
your career and will be given every resource to succeed. Interested candidates
are encouraged to apply directly.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote
