description:
The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for assisting the Company in the
configuration, administration, monitoring and maintenance Company’s existing
and future software server, software, network and associated technologies with
an emphasis on employing cloud based service providers and operating a hybrid
architecture consisting of internal, external, and partner based technology
resources.

Required Qualifications

· The DevOps Engineer will create, deploy, monitor, scale and secure
infrastructure and applications with focus on automating as much as possible.

· This role will work with other engineers to evolve the company's CI/CD
capabilities and will play a key role in the implementation of DevOps
processes and tooling

· This role is key to helping the teams in the engineering organization be
successful in their jobs

· Ensure availability, performance, scalability, and security of deployed
infrastructure

· Build and maintain operations software which automates the configuration,
provisioning, deployment, and monitoring of our core products

· Build and maintain our production infrastructure to ensure ongoing
reliability while maximizing development team efficiency

· Develop automation frameworks for public cloud infrastructure deployments

· Monitor, troubleshoot and debug infrastructure, network, operating system,
and system performance issues

· Maintenance, management, and streamlining of all our CI/CD processes

· Participate in architecture planning sessions with development team

· Work closely with developers and QA teams to understand how to improve their
processes and deliver high quality software more effectively.

Position Qualifications

· A minimum of 4 years of experience with system administration on Linux
machines

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Docker or other containerization
technologies

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Terraform

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using AWS

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Kubernetes

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Jenkins or similar CI/CD Tools

· Experience with Ansible, Helm, and Git

· Experience with Cloud Networking and Load Balancer Technologies (AWS ELB,
HAProxy, etc.)

· Experience with maintaining monitoring tools like Grafana, Prometheus,
InfluxDB, and Telegraf

· Ability to critically think and provide solutions to problems you have not
encountered before

· Fluency in at least two programming languages (i.e. Ruby, Python, etc.)

· Experience with continuous integration / deployment (CI/CD) in a high
availability environment

· Ability to work effectively with distributed teams using collaboration tools
and without face-to-face communication

The selected candidate will join a team who values work life balance and
professional growth equally. You will be supported as you continue to grow in
your career and will be given every resource to succeed. Interested candidates
are encouraged to apply directly.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
Sr. DevOps Engineer 
Full Time 
Remote

Salary - $130 to $140K Year

Work for a well - established record management firm located in the Florida
area!

Summary:

The Senior DevOps Engineer position operates as a critical role within the
engineering team and the company's software development lifecycle applying
industry standard software engineering and Agile development principles to
architect, build, deploy, and monitor software on the company's cloud hosted
microservices platform. This position is responsible for designing and
deploying the platform components that accelerate delivery of the company's
software to clients and markets. This senior role is responsible for
designing, architecting, and implementing all aspects of Infrastructure as
Code (IaC), including Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
pipelines and cloud services that comprise our platform and related software
products. Additionally, this position is responsible for the automated Release
Management process. This position works closely with the front-end, back-end,
and site reliability development roles to ensure the platform operates at or
above industry standards for security, reliability, and performance. Finally,
this position is responsible for continually researching, evaluating, and
recommending new frameworks and technologies that can protect or expand the
company's product and technology competitive advantage.

Education and/or Experience

· BS/BA in MIS, Computer Science or science related field required

· 2-3 years of experience in architecting and coding microservices in AWS
required

· 2-3 years of experience managing Kubernetes clusters

· 2-3 years of experience creating and maintaining DevOps pipelines

· 2-3 years of experience working with serverless event driven technologies

· 4+ years of experience in back-end/automation development required

· AWS Professional or Specialty certification required

· Kubernetes CKA certification preferred

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

· Strong knowledge of and ability to configure, install and automate AWS
services

· Strong knowledge of industry standard development practices, particularly in
IaC, security, reliability, and performance disciplines

· Strong knowledge of at least one programming language

· Awareness of critical concepts in DevOps and Agile principles

· Intermediate knowledge of networking including basic subnet masking

· Excellent organizational, interpersonal, written, and verbal communication
skills

Responsibilities

· Work effectively in agile frameworks with product and engineering team

· Responsible for all aspects of platform design and deploy documentation
including security, reliability, and performance monitoring.

· Codify and maintain all enterprise architecture (infrastructure as code)

· Strive for continuous improvement and build continuous integration,
continuous development, and constant deployment pipelines

· Mentor all members of the engineering team to expand their knowledge and
skills regarding platform engineering best practices, techniques, and
technologies.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Azure: 3 years (Preferred)
* AWS: 3 years (Preferred)
* Kubernetes: 3 years (Preferred)
* DevOps: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

description:
What you will do:

· Be an impactful member of the Software Development team by supporting all
efforts to simplify and enhance the client experience.

· Ensure accurate and efficient execution and adherence to business and
technical requirements through detailed coding and performing unit and
software integration testing.

· Improve new and existing software by performing coding, testing, debugging,
designing and writing programs according to functional and non-functional
requirements.

· Validate software adherence with development standards by providing
knowledgeable input while leading code review sessions.

· Guide the development of software by creating and maintaining accurate
technical documentation.

· Resolve incidents and issues for production applications and web services in
accordance with identified service level agreements (SLAs) by serving as the
final escalation point for clients.

· Influence future system designs by managing system analysis and identifying
and recommending design and requirements.

· Maximize the efficiency of various systems by collaborating with internal
clients and technical and architecture teams to resolve software issues and
implement, monitor and test new software.

· Enhance department performance metrics through hands-on coaching and
mentoring of less experienced team members.

· Mitigate risks by following established configuration and change control
processes.

Required keys for success:

· Six+ years of experience with major database management systems.

· Six+ years of experience with coding, testing and design.

· Six or more years of experience with software development methodologies.

· Expert in Voice, Data, Video and wireless technologies.

· In-depth understanding of software design patterns and principles.

· History of identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the
actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the
system.

· Proven ability to deal with ambiguous or incomplete information when
evaluating alternatives and making recommendations.

· Track record of working with teams and managing individual tasks with the
ability to pick up complex concepts and processes quickly.

· Creative and abstract thinking skills that can envision and design
innovative solutions to business opportunities and challenges.

· Solid ability to design, develop and deploy solutions and to deliver
projects on time with minimal direction.

· Extensive technical knowledge of Information Technology field and computer
systems.

· Demonstrated ability to take the lead on the most complex projects with
experience sharing knowledge, resolving conflict and creating a consensus.

· Effective written and spoken English communication skills with all levels of
an organization.

How you will stand out from the crowd:

· Expert scripting ability using various languages, including Python, Django,
JSON, XML and Bash.

· Experience using source control tools, such as Git/GitLab.

· History of working in a Gitflow development workflow.

· Understanding of server and database configurations, including Oracle, MySQL
and Postgres.

· Working Knowledge of web services, simple network management protocol (SNMP)
and transmission control protocol/ user datagram protocol (TCP/UDP).

· Skilled in operating systems, including RedHat and CentOS.

· InfoVista InSight and Spirent VisionWorks/Analytics experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
Teramind is a hybrid, global workforce building the next-generation Insider
Risk Management and User Behavior Analytics platform.

Join our team of innovators who are redefining insider risk management through
cutting edge technology. More than 10,000 organizations across the globe use
Teramind to mitigate insider threats and protect their sensitive company data
with the most robust, enterprise-grade software on the market.

As a global team, Teramind embraces an inclusive and flexible work environment
and team culture. We win together, learn from each other and respect each
other while delivering best-in-class security solutions.

About the role

This is an opportunity to manage a critical function within Teramind. As a
Senior DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for optimizing and maintaining
parts of our cloud, development, and on-premise infrastructure.

Expert-level Linux, docker, and python is a requirement to succeed in this
job.

This is a remote job. Work from anywhere.

Your day-to-day

* Evaluate system performance, identify points for optimization, write situational playbooks
* Find outliers, evaluate bug bounty reports
* Deploy and test new systems that contribute to our security posture
* Liaise with management and the development teams to improve our processes

What you bring to the team
* 4+ years of hands-on DevOps / Linux administration experience
* Expert-level Linux, docker, and python
* Solid knowledge CI/CD, microservice architecture
* Intermediate+ experience with PaaS such as Azure, AWS, OCI, etc.

This is a remote job. Work from anywhere!

We’re a global, distributed team looking for the finest talent. We’ve been
thriving as a fully-remote team since 2014. To us, remote work means
flexibility and having truly diverse, global teams.

What We Give:

At Teramind, we’re a collaborative, forward-thinking team where new ideas come
to life, experience is valued and talent is incubated.

* High-quality health benefits
* Retirement Plan with employer match
* Career-growth opportunities
* Flexible Time Off and Paid Time Off benefits
* Professional development budget

About our recruitment process

We don’t expect a perfect fit for every requirement we’ve outlined. If you can
see yourself contributing to the team, we want to hear your story.

You can expect up to 3 interviews on Zoom. In some scenarios we’re able to
streamline the process to have minimal rounds. Director-level roles and above
should expect a more thorough process., with multiple rounds of interviews.

All roles require background checks.

Teramind is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, religion,
color, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression,
sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

Experience:

* Linux: 3 years (Required)
* Python: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

Overview:

Are you curious about how modern software projects are developed, built, and
tested? Do you have a desire to design and implement new processes and tools
that create efficient build and test environments across a full gamut of
desktop and mobile platforms? The ArcGIS Runtime DevOps team is eager to add a
software development engineer to our team that has a passion for driving
efficiencies in development & production environments using the latest cross-
platform techniques, technologies, and frameworks.

Who are we:

The ArcGIS Runtime DevOps team develops the infrastructure and automation
processes that support development, building & testing the ArcGIS Runtime
Native APIs across a multitude of operating systems and industry standard
platforms. Each API is unique, and we strive to find the tools and practices
that can be implemented and normalized across our fabric of supported
platforms. We enjoy being able to work alongside a large development team,
providing best practice solutions that resolve impediments and improve
efficiency. We place an emphasis on teamwork and personal growth through
overlapping responsibilities, and friendly communication.

Responsibilities:

* Develop automation for build and test workflows
* Develop innovative solutions for data capture, visualization, and alerting
* Collaborate to implement continuous integration best practices on a modern codebase

Requirements:

* Curiosity for exploring a wide assortment of platforms and technologies
* Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
* Comfortable scripting cross-platform workflows
* Strong written and spoken communication skills
* Ability to clearly document work for others
* Passion for supporting others
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related experience

Recommended Qualifications:

* Technologies: Jenkins, GitHub, Docker, OpenShift, Ansible, Artifactory
* Languages: Python, Bash, Groovy
* Concepts: Configuration as code, Continuous integration and testing, elastic infrastructure, build pipelines, package management
* Cross operating system knowledge: Ubuntu, MacOS, Windows
* Platform knowledge: C++, Java, .Net, Qt, Swift, Kotlin, Unity, Unreal Engine
* Version control: Git

The Company:

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of
everything we do. Esri's geographic information system (GIS) technology
inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to
save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the
changing world around them.  

Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in
today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional
benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs,
opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.  

Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will
receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion,
sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status,
protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process,
please email askcareers@esri.com and let us know the nature of your request
and your contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning
a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail
address.

description:
Get to know The Pok emon Company International

The Pokemon Company International, a subsidiary of The Pokemon Company in
Japan, manages the property outside of Asia and is responsible for brand
management, licensing, marketing, the Pokemon Trading Card Game, the animated
TV series, home entertainment, and the official Pokemon website. Pokemon was
launched in Japan in 1996 and today is one of the most popular children's
entertainment properties in the world.

Learn more online at Pokemon.com and on Facebook (facebook.com/pokemon),
YouTube (youtube.com/pokemon), Twitter (twitter.com/pokemon), and Instagram
(instagram.com/pokemon).

Get to know the role

Job Title: DevOps Data Platform Engineer I

Job Summary: The Data Platform Engineer will focus on enabling the business to
make data-driven decisions by; improving and maintaining a cloud-based data
platform, facilitating collaboration with stakeholders and application
developers, as well as consulting for design of data models and evangelization
of data solutions / best practices.

FLSA Classification (US Only): Exempt

People Manager: No

_What you 'll do _

* Interface with other technology teams via agile practices to develop extract-transform-load pipelines (eg. Spark/pyspark), as well as unit tests.
* Refine version-controlled pipelines with unit testing, CI/CD and optimizations.
* Drive design improvements of schemas, data lake and data warehouse solutions in collaboration with stakeholders.
* Partner with Development and Test teams to enable automated self-service pipelines using Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Design for data integrity and security through all environments as well as the data lifecycle.
* Create and monitor pipeline health metrics to ensure optimal performance and reduce any downtime.
* Stay current with the data engineering technologies and trends to continually grow/enhance your skillset and provide value to our partner development teams.

_What you 'll bring _

* Bachelor's degree in computer science, system analysis or a related field preferred, or equivalent education/experience.
* 2 years of relevant experience in data engineering development or data analysis.
* Beginner to Intermediate experience as primary contributor in Spark application development.
* Intermediate experience in creating and curating BI support datasets.
* Familiarity with query languages, such as SQL.
* Familiarity using IaC via cloud technologies such as CloudFormation and/or Terraform.
* Demonstrable experience proactively communicating, creating/updating documentation and presenting data to peers and stakeholders.
* Familiarity with Databricks, Scala and/or python a plus.

How you 'll be successful

* Passion for Pokemon: Develops an understanding of the Pokemon brand, the impact it has on our people, culture, business, fans, and communities, and applying that knowledge and passion to everything you do.
* Challenging the Expected: Approaches challenges with curiosity and creativity, embracing the possibility of failure as an opportunity to learn something new, develop innovative ideas, solve complex problems and identify unique opportunities.
* Integrity and Respect: Demonstrates integrity and respect by leading with empathy, listening to others, seeking out different perspectives, and taking personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and results.
* Dedicated to Quality: Takes ownership to maintain and promote high standards, looks for new ways to learn and improve, and embraces a growth mindset to seek and apply feedback from others in an effort to continuously improve.
* Building Relationships: Develops and strengthens relationships, adopting a "team first" mentality and working collaboratively to solve problems and meet shared goals.
* Delighting Customers: Listens and understands the interests and needs of our customers and stakeholders, making them feel heard and important, and embracing these learnings to continue delivering a unique Pokemon experience.

What to expect

* An employee first culture
* Company events that celebrate the spirit of Pokemon
* Competitive cash-based compensation programs
* 100% employer-paid healthcare premiums for you
* Generous paid family leave
* Employer-paid life insurance
* Employer-paid long and short-term income protection insurance
* Fitness reimbursement
* Commuter benefit
* LinkedIn learning

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of
work being performed by people assigned to this role. They are not to be
construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills
required. Employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal
responsibilities from time to time, as needed. For roles in the United
Kingdom, candidates will need the right to work. In some cases, and for some
roles, the Company may be able to arrange a visa. For roles in Ireland, this
role requires candidates to have the right to live and work in the Republic of
Ireland. However, we welcome applications from all nationalities and may
consider supporting an employment permit application, in appropriate and
suitable cases.

SAN FRANCISCO

$160,000- $180,000 + BENEFITS

A growing financial services start-up on a mission to use technology to
improve credit.

THE COMPANY

Forward-thinking start-up with a focus on using Machine Learning and Data
Science to create a view of an individual and their credit. A great
opportunity to work with some of the greatest minds in the field and join an
established yet innovative DevOps team.

THE ROLE

* Deploy and manage cloud services 
* Automate and streamline pipeline 
* Troubleshooting and issue resolution 
* Identify security risks and manage them within the systems 
* Scaling the company's current containers, including auto-scaling 

YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

* Proven experience with containers (Docker and Kubernetes) 
* Strong professional experience with Python 
* Terraform 
* AWS experience 
* Experience with CI/CD processes 

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your resume to Sean McDonnell via the
apply link on this page.

description:
As a crucial member of a driven, multidisciplinary engineering team, the
DevOps Engineer will work alongside the Software, Robotics, Systems,
Applications and Test Engineers. They will be responsible for developing and
maintaining software tools that automate and streamline the software
development, QA, documentation, release, and deployment processes.

Responsibilities

* Participate as a multidisciplinary engineering team member.
* Develop and maintain software build servers.
* Independently develop new tooling and automation to streamline the development, testing, and deployment processes.
* Maintain existing automated CI/CD infrastructure
* Remove blockages related to configuration and dependency management
* Maintain state of the art software release process to support our expanding software deployment community.

Requirements
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar field with 3-5 years of relevant experience.
* Strong working knowledge of the Windows and Linux operating system
* Experience with a variety of scripting languages including Groovy, Python, and Bash
* Knowledge of multiple C++ build systems including cmake and qmake
* Experience with C++ code analysis tools
* Experience with Git and Github
* Strong understanding of containerization using Docker
* Experience developing and maintaining automated CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins
* Experience with Atlassian software tools a plus: Jira and Confluence
* Strong written and oral communication skills.

To apply, please send your resume, salary requirements, and cover letter as
PDF documents. The candidate must be eligible to work in the United States.
This position is based Plymouth, MA.

Greensea (www.greensea.com) is an equal opportunity employer. We offer a
casual and fun work environment and provide our employees with training and
continuing education opportunities. Greensea offers competitive salaries and a
complete benefits package including full health insurance, 401(k), and paid
vacation, holiday, and sick leave.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Relocation assistance
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: One location

description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Insight Global is looking for a Manager of DevOps & Cloud Engineering, this
plays a key role for the enterprise as a member of ITSD through hands-on
management and optimization of the continuous integration and continuous
delivery (CI/CD) pipeline resulting in the quick and safe release of
incremental software improvements into production. DevOps techniques are
continuously applied by this role in order to avoid deployment pipeline
congestion between various build versions across multiple environments. The
ideal candidate will have experience designing, developing, and optimizing
release management processes in both premise and cloud-based environments.
Also, Extensive infrastructure, application, integration, data and security
technology expertise along with a passion for innovation and hands-on software
development leadership is essential.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

* at least 5 years of DevOps Engineering experience
* strong background with Kubernetes, Jenkins, CD/CI pipelines, Docker
* experienced with Containerization 
* previous expereince programming with java, spring, groovy and Angular
* strong project expereince supporting migration from On-prem to Cloud platforms

{"advice": "I love that the company provides the Account Managers who are struggling with support, but I would say that the sense of urgency could improve.", "cons": "Just like anyone, I have struggled at Insight Global. I'll go into some more details, but the one bit of advice I will give to you when joining the company is to make sure that you are motivated and fulfilled by sales. Insight Global and the Account Manager role is probably the most "noble" sales role you can have. I say that because you are selling the company's staffing services and building meaningful relationships with clients in order to stimulate and contribute to the growth of the job market. That doesn't mean that it doesn't come without it's challenges.

For my first two years of account management I struggled, and I struggled real hard. I felt like I was going on an infinite number of client meetings and never seeing any return on my investment of effort. I was bending over backwards for bad business too because it was all I could get at the time. And despite all of this, I also got the feedback from my leadership that my biggest strong suit was my ability to build relationships and genuine relationships at that, and that success will come soon. 

Success unfortunately didn’t come soon. And I continued to struggle and was constantly finding myself below my growth line. And that feeling of being stuck and frustrated were everyday emotions. But Insight Global cared about me. They wrapped their arms around me and provided me with additional support and training. Shortly after that, I began seeing success and breaking milestones.", "countHelpful": 6, "employerResponses": [{"response": "Thank you for taking the time to share your experience! description:
Responsibilities

Play a key role in the delivery of world-class patient care. Leverage
innovative technology to advance high-quality care. Take your career in a
rewarding new direction. At UCLA Health, you can do all this and more.

Under the direction of the Cloud Platform Services Manager, the Cloud DevOps
Engineer will be responsible for cloud infrastructure and application design
and implementation, DevOps optimizations, and 3rd party integrations. You will
apply DevSecOps principles to cloud infrastructure and is responsible for the
construction of landing zones and deployment of respective capabilities.
Additional responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Infrastructure production
* Security issues, and their underlying causes
* Maintaining and supporting current environments while identifying and executing system architecture and process improvements
* Building tooling to enable faster deployments and reliable rollbacks
* Write code and design processes to improve the delivery of our cloud instances and applications

Qualifications

Required  
* Extensive professional experience with Azure in a production environment (network, security, applications, serverless, and containers)
* Knowledgeable in cloud networking - security, identity and access management, DNS, etc.
* Eble to work with Terraform at an Enterprise level
* Strong experience with Linux system administration
* Experience with Configuration Management systems (i.e., Puppet, Ansible, Chef).
* Proven track record of supporting production systems, and able to effectively coordinate cloud infrastructure service requests and incident response
* Strong sense of ownership and can prioritize and work on tasks independently

Highly preferred  

* Professional experience with AWS.
* Experience with CI/CD systems such as Github Actions, CodeBuild/CodePipeline, or Azure DevOps
* Familiarity with Docker and Containerization of applications
* History of working in a HIPAA compliant environment

UCLA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,
color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,
disability, or protected Veteran status.

description:
Overview:

Are you curious about how modern software projects are developed, built, and
tested? Do you have a desire to design and implement new processes and tools
that create efficient build and test environments across a full gamut of
desktop and mobile platforms? The ArcGIS Runtime DevOps team is eager to add a
software development engineer to our team that has a passion for driving
efficiencies in development & production environments using the latest cross-
platform techniques, technologies, and frameworks.

Who are we:

The ArcGIS Runtime DevOps team develops the infrastructure and automation
processes that support development, building & testing the ArcGIS Runtime
Native APIs across a multitude of operating systems and industry standard
platforms. Each API is unique, and we strive to find the tools and practices
that can be implemented and normalized across our fabric of supported
platforms. We enjoy being able to work alongside a large development team,
providing best practice solutions that resolve impediments and improve
efficiency. We place an emphasis on teamwork and personal growth through
overlapping responsibilities, and friendly communication.

Responsibilities:

* Develop automation for build and test workflows
* Develop innovative solutions for data capture, visualization, and alerting
* Collaborate to implement continuous integration best practices on a modern codebase

Requirements:

* Curiosity for exploring a wide assortment of platforms and technologies
* Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
* Comfortable scripting cross-platform workflows
* Strong written and spoken communication skills
* Ability to clearly document work for others
* Passion for supporting others
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related experience

Recommended Qualifications:

* Technologies: Jenkins, GitHub, Docker, OpenShift, Ansible, Artifactory
* Languages: Python, Bash, Groovy
* Concepts: Configuration as code, Continuous integration and testing, elastic infrastructure, build pipelines, package management
* Cross operating system knowledge: Ubuntu, MacOS, Windows
* Platform knowledge: C++, Java, .Net, Qt, Swift, Kotlin, Unity, Unreal Engine
* Version control: Git

The Company:

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of
everything we do. Esri's geographic information system (GIS) technology
inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to
save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the
changing world around them.  

Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in
today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional
benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs,
opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.  

Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will
receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion,
sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status,
protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process,
please email askcareers@esri.com and let us know the nature of your request
and your contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning
a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail
address.

to identify high quality candidates for a new “ Junior DevOps Engineer
position ”. The position is 90% virtual and the ideal candidate will live
within 60 minutes drive of downtown Orlando.

description:
DEVOPS ENGINEER

Bolt On Technology is the leader in the development of shop management
software for the automotive repair and maintenance industry. We work hard to
create software solutions that solve real-world problems for shop owners,
advisors, and technicians while simplifying the complicated world of auto
repair for their customers. Our partnerships with industry-leading software
companies enable us to develop best practices and solutions that have a
positive impact on both the repair shop and the vehicle owner.

Bolt On’s innovative software solutions make it easy for shop owners,
advisors, and techs to work together to make their auto repair shop more
efficient, profitable, and customer-focused. Our presence in the market is
forever growing and our product base expanding, causing a strong need for
additional passionate and self-motived new business development professionals.

* What You’ll Do: 

* Report to the Sr. Director of Engineering
* Monitor security, scalability, and performance
* Set up threshold alerts for production systems
* Set up monitoring and metrics for production systems (CloudWatch, CloudTrail)
* Support 6-month roadmap infrastructure build-outs
* Ensure CI/CD and logging tools are properly managed and up to date.
* Work with your fellow engineers to define and build deployment, configuration, and monitoring requirements
* Assist in creating and maintaining tools and automation to drive reliability and quality
* Manage code releases, updates, and related processes.
* Ability to be on-call in OpsGenie for Code Reds / Production Incidents
* Work with the Sr. Director of Engineering on:
* Technology Roadmapping, Cost Optimization, IT-Governance, Org Security

What You’ll Need:

* 3+ years of DevOps engineering experience
* Strong debugging and systems analysis skills to be able to identify and quickly resolve/mitigate issues
* Experience with scripting languages (shell scripting, python, groovy, etc).
* Experience in at least a few things within our existing technology stack:
* Nginx, PHP, Node.js, MySQL, Redis, Apache, Elastic Search
* Docker, Containers, Serverless, Networking, Kubernetes/Fargate
* Experience with AWS and its primary services and configuration(s)
* Ability to write and modify Cloudformation
* Experience with configuring, maintaining, and running monitoring platforms
* Experience with maintaining database systems (RDS, DynamoDB, DocumentDB), etc.
* Ability to be flexible, set priorities, and meet deadlines in a changing environment
* A passion for learning new skills and the ability to troubleshoot technical problems.

4 key metrics that must be met in order for you to be successful:

* Deployment Frequency (the frequency at which new releases go to production)
* Every week on Tuesdays
* Automation steps for scheduled releases are available
* Lead Time For Changes (the time until a commit goes to production)
* Less than 24 hours after the green light for release
* Mean Time to Restore (the time it takes to resolve a service impairment in production)
* Less than 4hrs
* Will have full availability of development department for code reds
* Change Failure Rate (the ratio of deployments to production that leads to errors and successful deployments)
* < 15% in first 3 months
* < 0-10% after first 3 months

What We Offer:
* Competitive salaries
* Medical, dental, and vision benefits
* Company-paid life insurance
* Flexible schedules
* Unlimited PTO and 80 hours of sick leave
* Parental leave
* 7 company paid holidays

Career Advancement: This is a growing company with opportunities to
advance. We promote from within, so show us what you can do and grow your
career along with us!

_ 
The job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive
listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the
employee. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change or new ones may
be assigned at any time with or without notice. Bolt On Technology is an equal
opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without
attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity,
national origin, veteran or disability status._

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Vision insurance

description:
What you will do:

· Be an impactful member of the Software Development team by supporting all
efforts to simplify and enhance the client experience.

· Ensure accurate and efficient execution and adherence to business and
technical requirements through detailed coding and performing unit and
software integration testing.

· Improve new and existing software by performing coding, testing, debugging,
designing and writing programs according to functional and non-functional
requirements.

· Validate software adherence with development standards by providing
knowledgeable input while leading code review sessions.

· Guide the development of software by creating and maintaining accurate
technical documentation.

· Resolve incidents and issues for production applications and web services in
accordance with identified service level agreements (SLAs) by serving as the
final escalation point for clients.

· Influence future system designs by managing system analysis and identifying
and recommending design and requirements.

· Maximize the efficiency of various systems by collaborating with internal
clients and technical and architecture teams to resolve software issues and
implement, monitor and test new software.

· Enhance department performance metrics through hands-on coaching and
mentoring of less experienced team members.

· Mitigate risks by following established configuration and change control
processes.

Required keys for success:

· Six+ years of experience with major database management systems.

· Six+ years of experience with coding, testing and design.

· Six or more years of experience with software development methodologies.

· Expert in Voice, Data, Video and wireless technologies.

· In-depth understanding of software design patterns and principles.

· History of identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the
actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the
system.

· Proven ability to deal with ambiguous or incomplete information when
evaluating alternatives and making recommendations.

· Track record of working with teams and managing individual tasks with the
ability to pick up complex concepts and processes quickly.

· Creative and abstract thinking skills that can envision and design
innovative solutions to business opportunities and challenges.

· Solid ability to design, develop and deploy solutions and to deliver
projects on time with minimal direction.

· Extensive technical knowledge of Information Technology field and computer
systems.

· Demonstrated ability to take the lead on the most complex projects with
experience sharing knowledge, resolving conflict and creating a consensus.

· Effective written and spoken English communication skills with all levels of
an organization.

How you will stand out from the crowd:

· Expert scripting ability using various languages, including Python, Django,
JSON, XML and Bash.

· Experience using source control tools, such as Git/GitLab.

· History of working in a Gitflow development workflow.

· Understanding of server and database configurations, including Oracle, MySQL
and Postgres.

· Working Knowledge of web services, simple network management protocol (SNMP)
and transmission control protocol/ user datagram protocol (TCP/UDP).

· Skilled in operating systems, including RedHat and CentOS.

· InfoVista InSight and Spirent VisionWorks/Analytics experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
Do you have the skills--and drive--to join a tech team that's working to
digitally transform a trillion-dollar industry? From test-driving the latest
technologies to creating intuitive consumer apps, Liberty Mutual is constantly
innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind
for our customers worldwide.

As a software engineer on this Customer Success team at Liberty Mutual, you'll
apply your talents in an agile environment that has the creative energy of a
start-up--and the full backing and comprehensive benefits of a Fortune 100
company.

Note: This is a range posting - Software/Sr. Software Engineer - and the final
offer will be based on the candidate's skills and experiences.

Responsibilities:

* Provide technical support to Liberty Mutual's product development teams as they use our CI/CD tool suite to build and deploy code to our internal and cloud computing environments.
* Guide developers to self-service options for resolving issues.
* Troubleshoot CI/CD platform and infrastructure automation errors, provide solutions and escalate issues as needed.
* Interface with and direct customers to other teams as needed.
* Observe trends in ticket types or questions asked and engage with product teams to provide solutions for known issues.
* Learn the inner workings of our end-to-end CI/CD software delivery environment and innovative public cloud infrastructure automation.
* Improve the developer experience: reduce obstacles and provide solutions.
* Develop automation to provide fast resolution for common inquiries.
* Create self-service documentation and utilities.
* We encourage innovative ideas to improve our development community's experience.
* Demonstrated success in Jenkins, JIRA, AWS, Pipelines
* Familiarity with CI/CD deployment tools and agile software development practices is desired, including Jira, GitHub, Bamboo, Jenkins, Artifactory, AWS, Azure, GCP Cloud Foundry
* Experience working in an agile environment utilizing Scrum, Kanban or XP.
* Strong oral and written communication skills--and a knack for explaining your decision-making process to non-engineers.
* A collaborative, adaptable working style, demonstrated initiative and the ability to prioritize your time and efforts.
* A Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline, or equivalent experience.
* Troubleshooting complex systems, and needing an understanding of cloud computing, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud engineering best practices.

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently
pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness,
inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of
roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding
profession.  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great
Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of
the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's
2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of
America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New
Graduates--as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn
more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit:
https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and
we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-
being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:
https://LMI.co/Benefits  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate
discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual
orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status,
pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or
local law.

description:
Technical Analyst - DevOps

K3 helps companies easily manage complex data streams and integrations without
having to rely on developers. We’re focused on enterprises with increasing
amounts of data to manage, the need to move fast, and deliver sustainable
solutions. K3 gives users a seat at the table in these complex environments.
We have had great success on Wall St. and are now increasingly solving similar
problems in new domains.

Our Technical Analysts wear many hats. They assist on customer projects and
training, run our infrastructure in AWS, investigate bugs, and guide our
product roadmap.

We are currently looking for analysts with a focus on DevOps in AWS.

* Help manage our infrastructure on AWS - (ec2/RDS/ElasticBeanstalk/CloudFormation and more)
* Support project teams with AWS deployments and maintenance
* Maintain knowledge base for internal and customer consumption
* Automate software deployment, configuration, and monitoring processes
* Troubleshoot customer technical and data issues

Being a technical analyst at BroadPeak is as much about communication and
thoughtfulness as it is about technology. In this role you need to be
relentless in figuring out how new things work.

Skills Required:

* MUST enjoy discovering the details of complex systems and understanding how they work.
* MUST have demonstrated experience in AWS DevOps technologies
* Communication of technical details to a less technical people
* Comfortable working from the command line
* Experience with Linux environments
* You get a buzz from an environment that goes from fast to slow to fast again
* “Select * from” is the start of a wonderful investigative journey

About Us

Our headquarters are in NYC but we have always worked in a distributed manner.

We measure goals and delivery, not time spent at a desk.

We have a "no policy" holiday. Just get your stuff done.

Our people work on multiple areas, continuously refine processes, and
participate in the financial success of the company.

This job is based in NYC in our Flatiron district office but would be remote
for the time being.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,286.00 - $116,923.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

COVID-19 considerations: 
We are all fully working remotely for the time being. Remote working was a
seamless shift for us.

Experience:

* AWS: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Equivalent Experience  

Description:

This role can sit 100% remote anywhere in the US (except CA, CT, CO, NY)

Client is a leader in health services for federal employees and related
customers, serving our chosen markets with low-cost offerings and best-in-
class customer care, sustained by a nimble and efficient organization.

The Engineer's role is to ensure the stable operations of rapid software
development. This includes configuring the required infrastructure and
automated pipelines to assist developers.

The Engineer is a self-starter, able to work with minimal direction from
management, but collaboratively with other DevOps engineers and cross-
functional teams. Understands the need for lateral thinking and displays
willingness to adapt to new ways of doing business.

Skills:

Azure, Cloud, Devops, Kubernetes

Top Skills Details:

Azure,Cloud

Additional Skills & Qualifications:

SKILLS

* Assist in developing and supporting automated processes focused on the following practices: Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, and Continuous Testing
* Assist other department engineers in creating practical demonstrations of proposed solutions and demonstrating them to other members of the team
* Provide detailed specifications for proposed solutions
* Work with cross-functional teams to maintain hardware and software needed for projects to be completed efficiently
* Perform various routines as prescribed by team lead
* Ensure adherence to defined Azure DevOps standards
* Requires three years of technical professional experience
* Requires a minimum of two years of professional work experience with Azure DevOps
* Demonstrable experience with version control using Git
* Understanding of Azure DevOps security best practices and governance
* Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams to support execution of project tasks
* Current understanding of best practices regarding system security measures
* Experience with software engineering preferred
* PowerShell scripting preferred
* Experience with containerization utilizing Kubernetes preferred
* Ability to support Azure DevOps activities outside of normal business hours
* Excellent verbal and written skills
* High-level understanding of system integration working with various operating systems and their implications
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering is preferred
* Additional years of qualifying work experience may be considered in lieu of formal education.
* Microsoft DevOps Certification preferred

Experience Level:

Intermediate Level

About TEKsystems:

We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions
to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000
strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500,
across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack
Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with
progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership.
TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.

The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all
applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national
origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity,
genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

description:
Description

Who We *Are

Insurity is a leading property and casualty insurance software and data
analytics providers, working with some of the world's largest insurers,
brokers, and MGAs, including 15 of the top 25 P&C carriers in the US. With
1400+ team members globally, 7 office locations, and 300+ customers, we have a
deep understanding of the insurance business, unparalleled technology
expertise, and a singular focus of delivering a simplified insurance
experience to our customers.

Insurity 's next DevOps Specialist

As part of the DevOps Development team, our DevOps Specialist will help mature
and improve our existing product build, packaging, and deployment processes.
They will also collaborate and help pave the way to adopt new processes using
a wide variety of tools including Azure DevOps, TFS, PowerShell, c#, APIs,
Azure - and many more - that deploy to Azure, AWS, internal, and client-hosted
platforms. It's rare we do the same thing twice - but if so, we automate it!
We are all about making our existing processes better while adopting current
and emerging tools to make everyone's lives easier. We are a team of
experienced and sharp developers with a DevOps mentality.

What You 'll Do

* Learn multiple platforms, technologies, and languages (i.e. Azure, Azure DevOps, AWS, PowerShell, c#) to create new code, scripts, and processes
* Write, understand, and modify scripting languages - PowerShell is our primary language, but if you have experience with bash, etc. you can learn PowerShell
* Work on identified pain spots in the organization and utilize the latest tools to automate and simplify them
* Have your hands in different Insurity products every month
* Live the 'DevOps Culture' - spread knowledge, train others, and help bring new tools and concepts to the organization

Administration

* Act as a mentor to team members
* Understands the major components of the system and their purpose
* Can quickly narrow down point(s) of failure by their symptoms and can offer recommendations to resolve
* Understands windows components, their purpose and basic knowledge of their features, and how to use them
* Has a grasp of certificates, their purposes, and how to apply them

Build and Deployment

* Set up new servers, install features, roles, products (i.e., SQL Server, SSRS)TFS, Timesheet, etc.
* Understands the software build and packaging process, makes small modifications as necessary
* Is able to build major versions and service packs
* Understand and implement the deployment process then modify the scripts/process as needed
* Safekeep software release versions and packages

Who You Are

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience considered
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Able to think critically, get into the details, and change directions rapidly
* Flexible, open-minded, with a passion for learning new tools
* Able to give and receive feedback in a constructive manner
* Excellent ability to handle multiple contending priorities and effectively plan your work accordingly

Demonstrated aptitude with the following technologies:

* Hosted Azure DevOps, On-Prem TFS 2017, 2019
* Jenkins concepts/knowledge useful but not required
* Source control systems - Git (TFS, ADO, BitBucket), TFVC
* CI/CD
* Kubernetes / Containers
* SQL Server
* .net / MVC knowledge a plus

Where: This role can be performed either remotely or based in our Hartford
office. Note: This role is expected to begin remotely due to COVID-19.

Our Benefits

Collaborative Culture | Flexible Hours | Growth Opportunities

Day 1 Health Insurance Coverage | Open PTO

Does Insurity sound like the right place for you? Send us your application and
a cover letter highlighting what sets you apart from the nice-to-haves and
makes you a must-have for our team!

Thank you for your interest in Insurity! Please understand that due to the
volume of applicants we receive, only selected candidates will be contacted.

Insurity is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable
accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to
perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges
of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  

LI-REMOTE

K3 helps companies easily manage complex data streams and integrations without
having to rely on developers. We’re focused on enterprises with increasing
amounts of data to manage, the need to move fast, and deliver sustainable
solutions. K3 gives users a seat at the table in these complex environments.
We have had great success on Wall St. and are now increasingly solving similar
problems in new domains.

Our Technical Analysts wear many hats. They assist on customer projects and
training, run our infrastructure in AWS, investigate bugs, and guide our
product roadmap.

We are currently looking for analysts with a focus on DevOps in AWS.

* Help manage our infrastructure on AWS - (ec2/RDS/ElasticBeanstalk/CloudFormation and more)
* Support project teams with AWS deployments and maintenance
* Maintain knowledge base for internal and customer consumption
* Automate software deployment, configuration, and monitoring processes
* Troubleshoot customer technical and data issues

Being a technical analyst at BroadPeak is as much about communication and
thoughtfulness as it is about technology. In this role you need to be
relentless in figuring out how new things work.

Skills Required:

* MUST enjoy discovering the details of complex systems and understanding how they work.
* MUST have demonstrated experience in AWS DevOps technologies
* Communication of technical details to a less technical people
* Comfortable working from the command line
* Experience with Linux environments
* You get a buzz from an environment that goes from fast to slow to fast again
* “Select * from” is the start of a wonderful investigative journey

About Us

Our headquarters are in NYC but we have always worked in a distributed manner.

We measure goals and delivery, not time spent at a desk.

We have a "no policy" holiday. Just get your stuff done.

Our people work on multiple areas, continuously refine processes, and
participate in the financial success of the company.

This job is based in NYC in our Flatiron district office but would be remote
for the time being.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,286.00 - $116,923.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

COVID-19 considerations: 
We are all fully working remotely for the time being. Remote working was a
seamless shift for us.

Experience:

* AWS: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

We are actively recruiting a DevOps Engineer at Aledade. We're looking for our
engineers to be self-starting, and proactive; they are expected to work
collaboratively, with minimal supervision, to ensure our systems are scalable,
available, and secure. As a DevOps Engineer you are responsible for building,
maintaining and improving our AWS infrastructure. We work together with other
engineering teams including app, data architecture, and ETL to build new CI/CD
pipelines and improve existing ones, provide tools that help automate
engineering workflows, monitor systems for health and availability, and ensure
our systems are secure and HIPAA compliant.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with containers and
container orchestration, expert understanding of configuration management
tools (Ansible preferred), experience deploying highly available Postgresql
databases including setting up and administering replication, knowledge of
deploying app to Kubernetes (we use EKS), and a deep understanding of building
systems that adhere to a compliance framework such as HIPAA.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent work experience
* 3+ years experience building systems on AWS
* 3+ years experience with Ansible or other configuration management tools
* 2+ years experience deploying and administering Postgresql or other relational databases
* 1+ years experience with Kubernetes
* Experience building CI/CD pipelines in Bamboo or other CI/CD tools

Preferred "Nice to Have" Qualifications

* Experience building and managing secrets management systems such as Hashicorp Vault
* Experience with terraform or other infrastructure configuration-as-code tools (Cloud Formation)
* Experience with data engineering and ETL systems
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

All prospective hires will be required to demonstrate that they have been
fully vaccinated, including booster shots, against COVID-19 with a COVID-19
vaccine for which the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has issued a license
or an Emergency Use Authorization prior to mutually-agreed upon start date at
Aledade, unless they qualify for a medical or religious accommodation to this
vaccination requirement. In certain limited circumstances, Aledade will accept
documented proof of prior infection with COVID-19 in lieu of a booster shot.

If you are passionate about transforming the healthcare system into one that
best serves the needs of patients, doctors, and society, we 'd love for you to
join us!_

* 
Who We Are:

Aledade is a leader in population health that is using innovative, value based
solutions to transform the way physicians interact with their patients. We are
on a mission to change healthcare for the better and solve complex problems
within the healthcare system.

We follow the simple but radical idea that Aledade only succeeds when our
partner practices succeed. From our cutting-edge technology platform to
practice transformation services, we provide physicians with everything they
need to create and run an accountable care organization (ACO), revamping the
way they practice and getting them back to where they should be:
quarterbacking their patients' health care!

Our customized solutions help clinicians in communities across America
preserve their autonomy, deliver better care to their patients, reduce overall
costs, and keep independent physician practices flourishing.

* 
What Does This Mean for You?

At Aledade, you will be part of a creative culture that is driven by a passion
for tackling complex issues with respect, open-mindedness, and a desire to
learn. You will work with team members that bring a wide range of experiences,
interests, backgrounds, beliefs, and achievements to their work, united by a
shared passion for public health and a commitment to the Aledade mission.

We've recently been recognized as a Top Workplace by The Washington Post, Best
Workplace in HealthCare & Biopharma, Top 100 Best Small & Medium Workplaces,
Glassdoor Best Places to Work, a Best and Brightest Companies to Work for in
the Nation, a Tech Tribune 10 Best Tech Startups in Maryland and Bethesda,
Best Tech for Good, Best Workplaces for Millennials, Best Workplaces for
Women, Best Workplaces for Parents, Top Workplaces USA, and a Healthcare
Industry Top Workplace.

* 
That 's because the things that matter to you also matter to us!

In addition to time off to support work-life balance and enjoyment, we offer
the following comprehensive benefits package designed for the needs of our
full-time team-members:  

Flexible work schedules and ability to work remotely available for many roles

Educational Assistant Program

Robust time off plan (21 days of PTO in your first year!)

Paid Volunteer Days

11 paid holidays

12 weeks paid Parental Leave for all new parents

6 weeks paid sabbatical

Health, dental and vision insurance paid up to 80% for employees, dependents,
and domestic partners

401(k) with up to 4% match

Stock options

Monthly cell phone stipend

Jeans everyday workplace

Gender neutral bathrooms

And more!

_ 
At Aledade, we don 't just accept differences, we celebrate them! We strive to
attract, develop, and retain highly qualified individuals representing the
diverse communities where we live and work. Aledade is committed to creating a
diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Employment policies and decisions at Aledade are based on merit,
qualifications, performance, and business needs. All qualified candidates will
receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color,
national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth or medical conditions
related to pregnancy or childbirth), gender identity or expression, religion,
physical or mental disability, medical condition, legally protected genetic
information, marital status, veteran status, or sexual orientation._

description:
The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for assisting the Company in the
configuration, administration, monitoring and maintenance Company’s existing
and future software server, software, network and associated technologies with
an emphasis on employing cloud based service providers and operating a hybrid
architecture consisting of internal, external, and partner based technology
resources.

Required Qualifications

· The DevOps Engineer will create, deploy, monitor, scale and secure
infrastructure and applications with focus on automating as much as possible.

· This role will work with other engineers to evolve the company's CI/CD
capabilities and will play a key role in the implementation of DevOps
processes and tooling

· This role is key to helping the teams in the engineering organization be
successful in their jobs

· Ensure availability, performance, scalability, and security of deployed
infrastructure

· Build and maintain operations software which automates the configuration,
provisioning, deployment, and monitoring of our core products

· Build and maintain our production infrastructure to ensure ongoing
reliability while maximizing development team efficiency

· Develop automation frameworks for public cloud infrastructure deployments

· Monitor, troubleshoot and debug infrastructure, network, operating system,
and system performance issues

· Maintenance, management, and streamlining of all our CI/CD processes

· Participate in architecture planning sessions with development team

· Work closely with developers and QA teams to understand how to improve their
processes and deliver high quality software more effectively.

Position Qualifications

· A minimum of 4 years of experience with system administration on Linux
machines

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Docker or other containerization
technologies

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Terraform

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using AWS

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Kubernetes

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Jenkins or similar CI/CD Tools

· Experience with Ansible, Helm, and Git

· Experience with Cloud Networking and Load Balancer Technologies (AWS ELB,
HAProxy, etc.)

· Experience with maintaining monitoring tools like Grafana, Prometheus,
InfluxDB, and Telegraf

· Ability to critically think and provide solutions to problems you have not
encountered before

· Fluency in at least two programming languages (i.e. Ruby, Python, etc.)

· Experience with continuous integration / deployment (CI/CD) in a high
availability environment

· Ability to work effectively with distributed teams using collaboration tools
and without face-to-face communication

The selected candidate will join a team who values work life balance and
professional growth equally. You will be supported as you continue to grow in
your career and will be given every resource to succeed. Interested candidates
are encouraged to apply directly.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
Teramind is a hybrid, global workforce building the next-generation Insider
Risk Management and User Behavior Analytics platform.

Join our team of innovators who are redefining insider risk management through
cutting edge technology. More than 10,000 organizations across the globe use
Teramind to mitigate insider threats and protect their sensitive company data
with the most robust, enterprise-grade software on the market.

As a global team, Teramind embraces an inclusive and flexible work environment
and team culture. We win together, learn from each other and respect each
other while delivering best-in-class security solutions.

About the role

This is an opportunity to manage a critical function within Teramind. As a
Senior DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for optimizing and maintaining
parts of our cloud, development, and on-premise infrastructure.

Expert-level Linux, docker, and python is a requirement to succeed in this
job.

This is a remote job. Work from anywhere.

Your day-to-day

* Evaluate system performance, identify points for optimization, write situational playbooks
* Find outliers, evaluate bug bounty reports
* Deploy and test new systems that contribute to our security posture
* Liaise with management and the development teams to improve our processes

What you bring to the team
* 4+ years of hands-on DevOps / Linux administration experience
* Expert-level Linux, docker, and python
* Solid knowledge CI/CD, microservice architecture
* Intermediate+ experience with PaaS such as Azure, AWS, OCI, etc.

This is a remote job. Work from anywhere!

We’re a global, distributed team looking for the finest talent. We’ve been
thriving as a fully-remote team since 2014. To us, remote work means
flexibility and having truly diverse, global teams.

What We Give:

At Teramind, we’re a collaborative, forward-thinking team where new ideas come
to life, experience is valued and talent is incubated.

* High-quality health benefits
* Retirement Plan with employer match
* Career-growth opportunities
* Flexible Time Off and Paid Time Off benefits
* Professional development budget

About our recruitment process

We don’t expect a perfect fit for every requirement we’ve outlined. If you can
see yourself contributing to the team, we want to hear your story.

You can expect up to 3 interviews on Zoom. In some scenarios we’re able to
streamline the process to have minimal rounds. Director-level roles and above
should expect a more thorough process., with multiple rounds of interviews.

All roles require background checks.

Teramind is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, religion,
color, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression,
sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

Experience:

* Linux: 3 years (Required)
* Python: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

About Caption Health 
Caption Health’s mission is to detect disease early – when there is the
highest potential for impact – by leveraging artificial intelligence and
ultrasound. Our breakthrough AI platform enables any healthcare professional
to perform high-quality ultrasound exams for early disease detection, in
convenient and lower-cost outpatient settings including patients’ homes. It
was recognized as one of TIME’s 100 Best Inventions of 2021 and one of Fast
Company’s Next Big Things in Health Tech.

Through our work with health plans, providers, patients, and industry
partners, we are transforming care, expanding access, and reducing costs.

To learn more, visit captionhealth.com.

Job Summary:

The DevOps Engineer is responsible for designing and managing the cloud
infrastructure needed to support all Caption Health products. Duties include
deploying product updates, identifying production issues and implementing
integrations that meet our customers' needs. The role will have a large impact
on team productivity and as such requires an understanding of the software
development lifecycle and various automation tools for developing digital
pipelines (CI/ CD pipelines).

Duties/Responsibilities:

* Manage the Azure and GCP cloud infrastructure tools and data with a bias towards automation and scaling
* Maintain, improve, and monitor data ingestion and processing pipelines
* Manage and improve container orchestration and deployment strategies
* Develop tools to manage continuous integration, software stack support, code quality and coverage
* Ensure and develop tools for monitoring security, privacy, and integrity of data and other resources
* Consult with application teams on architecture, performance, and access control design
* Perform other duties as needed

Required Skill/Abilities:
* 3+ years of experience with Azure cloud infrastructure development and administration
* Experience with scripting languages
* Experience with continuous integration tools (e.g. Github Actions, Jenkins) and best practices for codebase management
* Experience with Docker and Kubernetes container strategies and orchestration
* Experience with FaaS/serverless environments (e.g. AWS Lambda, Cloud Run, Kubeless)
* Good verbal and written communications
* Proactive and assertive in driving solutions/solving issues
* Bonus: Experience with Google Cloud (GCP)
* Bonus: Experience with network security and management of sensitive data
* Bonus: Experience working in startups
* Bonus: Experience working in healthcare or regulated environments

Caption Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly
pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Caption Health does not make hiring or
employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious
belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity,
sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other
basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by
Company policy. Caption Health. strives for a healthy and safe workplace and
strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair
Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its
internal policy.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations: 
Caption Health requires all employees to be fully vaccinated at the time of
hire. Will you be able to meet this requirement?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Kubernetes: 3 years (Preferred)
* Azure Cloud Infrastructue: 3 years (Required)
* Docker: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

Responsibilities

Play a key role in the delivery of world-class patient care. Leverage
innovative technology to advance high-quality care. Take your career in a
rewarding new direction. At UCLA Health, you can do all this and more.

Under the direction of the Cloud Platform Services Manager, the Cloud DevOps
Engineer will be responsible for cloud infrastructure and application design
and implementation, DevOps optimizations, and 3rd party integrations. You will
apply DevSecOps principles to cloud infrastructure and is responsible for the
construction of landing zones and deployment of respective capabilities.
Additional responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Infrastructure production
* Security issues, and their underlying causes
* Maintaining and supporting current environments while identifying and executing system architecture and process improvements
* Building tooling to enable faster deployments and reliable rollbacks
* Write code and design processes to improve the delivery of our cloud instances and applications

Qualifications

Required  
* Extensive professional experience with Azure in a production environment (network, security, applications, serverless, and containers)
* Knowledgeable in cloud networking - security, identity and access management, DNS, etc.
* Eble to work with Terraform at an Enterprise level
* Strong experience with Linux system administration
* Experience with Configuration Management systems (i.e., Puppet, Ansible, Chef).
* Proven track record of supporting production systems, and able to effectively coordinate cloud infrastructure service requests and incident response
* Strong sense of ownership and can prioritize and work on tasks independently

Highly preferred  

* Professional experience with AWS.
* Experience with CI/CD systems such as Github Actions, CodeBuild/CodePipeline, or Azure DevOps
* Familiarity with Docker and Containerization of applications
* History of working in a HIPAA compliant environment

UCLA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,
color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,
disability, or protected Veteran status.
