description:
Come join Tyler Technologies as a DevOps Engineer! The Tyler Cloud Platform
team is looking for Engineers to build and run the services and infrastructure
that power the platform.  

This position will work an evening schedule to improve our team 's ability
to support our clients as broadly throughout the day as possible.  

We are hiring high quality engineers with a diverse set of experiences and
skill sets for positions on the cloud platform team delivering the vision of
Connected Communities. The strongest candidates will have a solid operations
expertise and demonstrated software development experience on large scale
cloud infrastructure. Our clients count on us to provide exceptional
availability, scalability, and security for services and infrastructure. As an
DevOps Engineer, you'll be on a team of engineers whose mission it is to build
and improve Tyler's most critical cloud services.  

Are you up to the challenge?

As a part of Tyler's corporate staff, you will make an impact on outcomes that
affect various areas of the company. Your work will ultimately support our
team members, clients, stakeholders, and the public sector.

Location

Remote

Responsibilities

* Architect, author, champion, and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, and security of Tyler's Cloud Platform services.
* _Design, build_* _ and manage_ systems, infrastructure and applications through automation that support self sufficiency
* Deploy, support, and monitor new and existing services, platforms, and application stacks
* Use scalable testing to measure, report, tune, and optimize system performance
* _Develop tools to improve our ability to rapidly deploy and effectively monitor services in a large-scale Kubernetes environment._
* Participate in periodic on-call duties
* Recommend new solutions and technologies
* Collaborate with team and others to share operational best practices
* Function well in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Cover after hours support needs with core hours from 5pm to 1am Pacific Time, M-F
* Provide an escalation path to the rest of the team after hours.

Qualifications

* 3+ years in a UNIX-based large-scale web operations role.
* _5+ years programming experience in Python, Perl, Node, Java/Scala, or C#_
* 3+ years designing and implementing, large-scale AWS production workloads
* _Experience with large scale Kubernetes architectures and configuration_
* Expert scripting knowledge, specifically for systems automation
* UNIX/Linux systems administration background
* Knowledge of most of these: data structures, relational and non-relational databases, networking, Linux internals, file systems, web architecture, and related topics
* Ability to guide technical teams through design and implementation across an organization
* Previous experience working an evening shift with geographically distributed coworkers.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills (including listening, speaking, and writing) and ability to work well in a diverse, team-focused environment with other DevOps, Engineers, Product Managers, etc.

Preferred Experience
* Experienced in configuration and deployment of containers at scale in AWS EKS, ECS, and Fargate
* Experienced in configuration, management, and monitoring of DataDog
* Experience authoring infrastructure using tools such as cloud-formation or terraform
* Experienced in configuration and management of CI/CD tooling like Github Actions, Jenkins or CircleCI
* Experienced database engineer with MySQL, specifically Aurora

State Specific Salary Range Disclosure Requirements for Colorado,

Connecticut, and Nevada

Salary will generally fall between $55,537 - $100,000 before adjustment for
geographic differences. Recruiter can confirm if position is incentive
eligible.

Great Place to Work & Grow Your Career

Come join us as we transform the public sector! Our mission, vision, and
values guide everything we do. We're also frequently recognized as a great
workplace locally and nationally. See our many awards and accolades.

Taking Care of You & Your Family

Your health and well-being are important to us. That's why we invest in our
team members by offering competitive benefits to support their health and
financial wellness. Learn more about how we care for our people.

Tyler is subject to regulations, guidelines, and/or client requirements
relating to the qualifications of Tyler personnel performing certain client
work. Because of the nature of this position, it is a requirement that the
candidate can successfully pass a federal background check at the time an
offer is extended and over the course of employment with Tyler.

description:
What you will do:

· Be an impactful member of the Software Development team by supporting all
efforts to simplify and enhance the client experience.

· Ensure accurate and efficient execution and adherence to business and
technical requirements through detailed coding and performing unit and
software integration testing.

· Improve new and existing software by performing coding, testing, debugging,
designing and writing programs according to functional and non-functional
requirements.

· Validate software adherence with development standards by providing
knowledgeable input while leading code review sessions.

· Guide the development of software by creating and maintaining accurate
technical documentation.

· Resolve incidents and issues for production applications and web services in
accordance with identified service level agreements (SLAs) by serving as the
final escalation point for clients.

· Influence future system designs by managing system analysis and identifying
and recommending design and requirements.

· Maximize the efficiency of various systems by collaborating with internal
clients and technical and architecture teams to resolve software issues and
implement, monitor and test new software.

· Enhance department performance metrics through hands-on coaching and
mentoring of less experienced team members.

· Mitigate risks by following established configuration and change control
processes.

Required keys for success:

· Six+ years of experience with major database management systems.

· Six+ years of experience with coding, testing and design.

· Six or more years of experience with software development methodologies.

· Expert in Voice, Data, Video and wireless technologies.

· In-depth understanding of software design patterns and principles.

· History of identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the
actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the
system.

· Proven ability to deal with ambiguous or incomplete information when
evaluating alternatives and making recommendations.

· Track record of working with teams and managing individual tasks with the
ability to pick up complex concepts and processes quickly.

· Creative and abstract thinking skills that can envision and design
innovative solutions to business opportunities and challenges.

· Solid ability to design, develop and deploy solutions and to deliver
projects on time with minimal direction.

· Extensive technical knowledge of Information Technology field and computer
systems.

· Demonstrated ability to take the lead on the most complex projects with
experience sharing knowledge, resolving conflict and creating a consensus.

· Effective written and spoken English communication skills with all levels of
an organization.

How you will stand out from the crowd:

· Expert scripting ability using various languages, including Python, Django,
JSON, XML and Bash.

· Experience using source control tools, such as Git/GitLab.

· History of working in a Gitflow development workflow.

· Understanding of server and database configurations, including Oracle, MySQL
and Postgres.

· Working Knowledge of web services, simple network management protocol (SNMP)
and transmission control protocol/ user datagram protocol (TCP/UDP).

· Skilled in operating systems, including RedHat and CentOS.

· InfoVista InSight and Spirent VisionWorks/Analytics experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
firstPRO is seeking a qualified DevOps Engineer for our client, a
global financial services organization located out of Pennsylvania. They are
seeking someone with experience in designing efficient and robust solutions
that maintain/improve the state of architecture.

DevOps Engineer

Job Details

· Compensation: $90 - $95/hour with benefits (Health, Dental, Vision)

· Location: 100% Remote

· Type: Contract to Hire

· Schedule: Monday through Friday, 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM

Job Responsibilities

· Become a valued partner by anticipating and proposing alternative solutions
to help business extend their reach.

· Develop PowerBI dashboards, demonstrating metrics, and visuals

· Develop senior relationships to gain and utilize a deep understanding of the
business wins to transform current business models with innovative technology
solutions.

· Run the technology in line with the bank’s policies and architecture
standards to ensure risks are understood, communicated, and effectively
mitigated.

· Champion technology excellence, practice, and innovative technologies to
automate, simplify and innovate the technology landscape.

· Have significantly demonstrated hands-on experience of managing and
developing technology solutions to multiple internal clients.

· Be entrepreneurial, highly motivated, and self-directed with a strong
delivery mindset.

· Be able to articulate complex technical problems and their solutions simply.

· Be passionate about building and leading, high-performing delivery teams and
proposing and achieving successful outcomes for a significant asset management
business.

Job Requirements

· PowerBI is a deal breaker

· SQL is the #2 most important tech

· Ability to take BA requests and create them into PowerBI reports and
dashboards

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $90.00 - $95.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

* Philadelphia, PA: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: One location

final escalation point for clients.

· Influence future system designs by managing system analysis and identifying
and recommending design and requirements.

· Maximize the efficiency of various systems by collaborating with internal
clients and technical and architecture teams to resolve software issues and
implement, monitor and test new software.

· Enhance department performance metrics through hands-on coaching and
mentoring of less experienced team members.

· Mitigate risks by following established configuration and change control
processes.

Required keys for success:

· Six+ years of experience with major database management systems.

· Six+ years of experience with coding, testing and design.

· Six or more years of experience with software development methodologies.

· Expert in Voice, Data, Video and wireless technologies.

· In-depth understanding of software design patterns and principles.

· History of identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the
actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the
system.

· Proven ability to deal with ambiguous or incomplete information when
evaluating alternatives and making recommendations.

· Track record of working with teams and managing individual tasks with the
ability to pick up complex concepts and processes quickly.

· Creative and abstract thinking skills that can envision and design
innovative solutions to business opportunities and challenges.

· Solid ability to design, develop and deploy solutions and to deliver
projects on time with minimal direction.

· Extensive technical knowledge of Information Technology field and computer
systems.

· Demonstrated ability to take the lead on the most complex projects with
experience sharing knowledge, resolving conflict and creating a consensus.

· Effective written and spoken English communication skills with all levels of
an organization.

How you will stand out from the crowd:

· Expert scripting ability using various languages, including Python, Django,
JSON, XML and Bash.

· Experience using source control tools, such as Git/GitLab.

· History of working in a Gitflow development workflow.

· Understanding of server and database configurations, including Oracle, MySQL
and Postgres.

· Working Knowledge of web services, simple network management protocol (SNMP)
and transmission control protocol/ user datagram protocol (TCP/UDP).

· Skilled in operating systems, including RedHat and CentOS.

· InfoVista InSight and Spirent VisionWorks/Analytics experience.

Job Type: Full-time

* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

description:
Company Description

Job Description

Love cutting-edge tech? We do too.

We may be the most important Internet company you've never heard of, and at
Epsilon we do more than collect and store data. We help some of the world's
biggest brands solve meaningful problems on a massive scale--and have fun
doing it.

As a member of the Linux Systems Engineering team, you will work in a group
that is focused on efficiency, project work, compliance, standards,
situational awareness and readiness. You'll be a critical part of a fast-
moving, innovative team, providing support and expertise where needed. You
will work independently with little to no guidance in some situations as well
as working with the team in full collaboration.

What You'll Do:

* Participate in engineering, deploying, and maintaining solutions and services for internal customers.
* Act as a technical liaison to one or more internal company divisions.
* Investigate and troubleshoot TIER 3 issues with network, server, and application infrastructure.
* Communicate issues to stakeholders effectively and in a timely fashion.
* Provide documentation of configuration and troubleshooting procedures to facilitate other team members and teams within the IT organization.
* Provide after-hours support when required, and respond to outages, incidents, and alerts.

About You :
* Able to do your best work in a team setting and autonomously
* Well-developed interpersonal skills.
* Owns a problem to the end
* Proud to share in team's success
* Wants to grow a career with a great company.

* 
What You'll Bring:
* BS in Computer Science or related technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
* At least two years of professional experience building, configuring, and administering CentOS/RHEL in an enterprise environment.
* Detail oriented and highly observant, with excellent organization and time management skills.
* Highly effective communicator for both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Excellent data analysis skills.
* Excellent Linux command line skills.
* Experience with writing and testing programs with interpreted languages such as Python, Perl, or Ruby.
* Experience with automation and configuration (Puppet, Ansible, Salt, etc).
* Working knowledge of the Git version control system.
* Experience with building Docker images and orchestrating containers (Swarm/Kubernetes).
* Ability to troubleshoot difficult problems within OS, network, and application layers.
* Ability to produce results amid multiple shifting/competing priorities.
* Independent worker, requiring little day-to-day direction from management.
* Agile experience a plus (Kanban, Scrum, etc)

Qualifications

Additional Information

When you 're one of us, you get to run with the best. For decades, we've
been helping marketers from the world's top brands personalize experiences for
millions of people with our cutting-edge technology, solutions and services.
Epsilon's best-in-class identity gives brands a clear, privacy-safe view of
their customers, which they can use across our suite of digital media,
messaging and loyalty solutions. We process 400+ billion consumer actions each
day and hold many patents of proprietary technology, including real-time
modeling languages and consumer privacy advancements. Thanks to the work of
every employee, Epsilon has been consistently recognized as industry-leading
by Forrester, Adweek and the MRC. Positioned at the core of Publicis Groupe,
Epsilon is a global company with more than 8,000 employees around the world.
Check out a few of these resources to learn more about what makes Epsilon so
EPIC:

* Culture: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/our-culture-epsilon
* DE&I: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/diversity-equity-inclusion
* CSR: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility
* Life at Epsilon: https://www.epsilon.com/us/about-us/epic-blog

Great People Deserve Great Benefits

We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the
world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect
competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to
advance your career.

Epsilon is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Epsilon's policy is not to
discriminate against any applicant or employee based on actual or perceived
race, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy), marital status, national
origin, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, religion,
creed, color, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression (including
transgender status), veteran status, genetic information, or any other
characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Epsilon
also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these
protected categories.

Epsilon will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to
complete the application process.

LI-AM1

description:
Sr. DevOps Engineer 
Full Time 
Remote

Salary - $130 to $140K Year

Work for a well - established record management firm located in the Florida
area!

Summary:

The Senior DevOps Engineer position operates as a critical role within the
engineering team and the company's software development lifecycle applying
industry standard software engineering and Agile development principles to
architect, build, deploy, and monitor software on the company's cloud hosted
microservices platform. This position is responsible for designing and
deploying the platform components that accelerate delivery of the company's
software to clients and markets. This senior role is responsible for
designing, architecting, and implementing all aspects of Infrastructure as
Code (IaC), including Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
pipelines and cloud services that comprise our platform and related software
products. Additionally, this position is responsible for the automated Release
Management process. This position works closely with the front-end, back-end,
and site reliability development roles to ensure the platform operates at or
above industry standards for security, reliability, and performance. Finally,
this position is responsible for continually researching, evaluating, and
recommending new frameworks and technologies that can protect or expand the
company's product and technology competitive advantage.

Education and/or Experience

· BS/BA in MIS, Computer Science or science related field required

· 2-3 years of experience in architecting and coding microservices in AWS
required

· 2-3 years of experience managing Kubernetes clusters

· 2-3 years of experience creating and maintaining DevOps pipelines

· 2-3 years of experience working with serverless event driven technologies

· 4+ years of experience in back-end/automation development required

· AWS Professional or Specialty certification required

· Kubernetes CKA certification preferred

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

· Strong knowledge of and ability to configure, install and automate AWS
services

· Strong knowledge of industry standard development practices, particularly in
IaC, security, reliability, and performance disciplines

· Strong knowledge of at least one programming language

· Awareness of critical concepts in DevOps and Agile principles

· Intermediate knowledge of networking including basic subnet masking

· Excellent organizational, interpersonal, written, and verbal communication
skills

Responsibilities

· Work effectively in agile frameworks with product and engineering team

· Responsible for all aspects of platform design and deploy documentation
including security, reliability, and performance monitoring.

· Codify and maintain all enterprise architecture (infrastructure as code)

· Strive for continuous improvement and build continuous integration,
continuous development, and constant deployment pipelines

· Mentor all members of the engineering team to expand their knowledge and
skills regarding platform engineering best practices, techniques, and
technologies.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Azure: 3 years (Preferred)
* AWS: 3 years (Preferred)
* Kubernetes: 3 years (Preferred)
* DevOps: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

description:
As a crucial member of a driven, multidisciplinary engineering team, the
DevOps Engineer will work alongside the Software, Robotics, Systems,
Applications and Test Engineers. They will be responsible for developing and
maintaining software tools that automate and streamline the software
development, QA, documentation, release, and deployment processes.

Responsibilities

* Participate as a multidisciplinary engineering team member.
* Develop and maintain software build servers.
* Independently develop new tooling and automation to streamline the development, testing, and deployment processes.
* Maintain existing automated CI/CD infrastructure
* Remove blockages related to configuration and dependency management
* Maintain state of the art software release process to support our expanding software deployment community.

Requirements
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar field with 3-5 years of relevant experience.
* Strong working knowledge of the Windows and Linux operating system
* Experience with a variety of scripting languages including Groovy, Python, and Bash
* Knowledge of multiple C++ build systems including cmake and qmake
* Experience with C++ code analysis tools
* Experience with Git and Github
* Strong understanding of containerization using Docker
* Experience developing and maintaining automated CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins
* Experience with Atlassian software tools a plus: Jira and Confluence
* Strong written and oral communication skills.

To apply, please send your resume, salary requirements, and cover letter as
PDF documents. The candidate must be eligible to work in the United States.
This position is based Plymouth, MA.

Greensea (www.greensea.com) is an equal opportunity employer. We offer a
casual and fun work environment and provide our employees with training and
continuing education opportunities. Greensea offers competitive salaries and a
complete benefits package including full health insurance, 401(k), and paid

description:
Requisition ID: R10055473

* Category: Engineering 
* Location: Linthicum, Maryland, United States of America 
* Citizenship Required: United States Citizenship 
* Clearance Type: SCI 
* Telecommute: No- Teleworking not available for this position 
* Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America) 
* Travel Required: Yes, 10% of the Time 
* Positions Available: 1  

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on
revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and
for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to
be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history
- from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to
landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a
pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the
way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and
bringing your whole self to work -- and we have an insatiable drive to do what
others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history,
they're making history.

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on
revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and
for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to
be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history
- from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to
landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a
pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the
way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and
bringing your whole self to work -- and we have an insatiable drive to do what
others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history,
they're making history.

The Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) Advanced Processing Solutions
Business pushes the boundaries of innovation, redefines the leading edge of
exotic new technologies, and drives advances in the sciences. One of our most
challenging new fields is Transformational Computing, which combines the
unique properties of superconductivity and quantum mechanics to develop
radical new energy-efficient computing systems. Our team is chartered with
providing the skills to transform computing beyond Moore's Law, advancing
development of computer architectures, processing/memory subsystems, and
large-scale high-performance computing systems. You will work in a fast-paced
team environment alongside a broad array of scientists and engineers to make
these processing solutions a reality and deliver remarkable new advantages to
the warfighter.

Northrop Grumman Mission Systems Sector (NGMS) is a leading global provider of
secure software-defined, hardware enabled mission systems. Our company is
pioneering capabilities in a wide variety of sectors that keep our nation and
our allies' safe from undersea to space and cyberspace. NGMS is seeking
Software Engineers with demonstrated ability to lead development of new
technologies to support our innovative Transformational Computing team to help
develop software in support of emerging supercomputing technologies.

The software engineers will be developing and supporting the next-generation
supercomputing capabilities including simulations, algorithms, test
automation, and data management and analysis capabilities. As a Senior
Principal Software Engineer at Northrop Grumman, you will have a challenging
and rewarding opportunity to be a part of our Enterprise-wide digital
transformation. Using Model-based Engineering, DevSecOps and Agile practices
we continue to evolve how we deliver critical national defense products and
capabilities for the warfighter. Our success is grounded in our ability to
embrace change, move quickly and continuously drive innovation. The successful
candidate will be collaborative, open, transparent, and team-oriented with a
focus on team empowerment & shared responsibility, flexibility, continuous
learning, and a culture of automation.

The selected individual requires expert level software development skills and
will be responsible for leading design teams in all phases of the software
development lifecycle including design, development, and test. Candidates
should have a solid foundation with best practices in software design,
Continuous Integration / Continuous Deliver (CI/CD) tools and processes, and
object-oriented programming. Candidates should be familiar with the Agile
methodology of software development.

All job functions require close teamwork across functional disciplines and
integrated product teams in a fast-paced environment. This program area is
expanding which offers the potential for future growth opportunities
(technical lead, software architect, etc.) for candidates who successfully
demonstrate exceptional performance and leadership. This requisition may be
filled at a higher grade based on qualifications listed below.

This position requires onsite work at our Linthicum, MD location.

Basic Qualifications:

* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Sciences, Information Technology, or comparable degree
* A minimum of 2 years of experience in DevOps
* A minimum of 2 years of experience in the software development
* Experience with automation programming languages (Python, Ruby, C#, Java, JavaScript….)
* Experience with the agile software development lifecycle
* Experience with CI/CD tool integration

Preferred Qualifications:
* Capable of effective communication in a highly technical environment
* Experience with full stack web development and RESTful web services
* Experience with relational and/or noSQL databases
* Experience with Docker
* Cross-functional leadership skills
* Knowledge with build tools/frameworks
* Knowledge with automated testing tools/frameworks
* Knowledge with OS and MW technologies
* Experience with UI design and development
* Experience with test automation and instrument control
* Experience with continuous integration tools such as GoCD, Jenkins, Artifactory and version control tools such as Git
* 2 years of experience leading, managing, coaching, & mentoring technology
* Previous consulting and professional services experience & IT industry experience
* Active TS/SCI Clearance

Salary Range: $78,600 USD - $118,000 USD

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay.
Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as
allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or
Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition,
Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance
coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays
and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.  

The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top
priority. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their
COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the
future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious
accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on
the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order
14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/.

Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We
are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making
decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual
orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran
status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and
Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO.
U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

description:
eNGINE builds Technical Teams. We are a Solutions and Placement firm
shaped by decades of interaction with Technical professionals. Our inspiration
is continuous learning and engagement with the markets we serve, the talent we
represent, and the teams we build. Our Consulting Workforce is encouraged to
enjoy career fulfillment in the form of challenging projects, schedule
flexibility, and paid training/certifications. Successful outcomes start and
finish with eNGINE.

eNGINE is hiring a pair of 100% remote DevOps Engineers with a focus on
DACPAC deployments & Azure DevOps pipelines for an initial customer engagement
with one of our healthcare vertical customers.

You'll be part of a team responsible for creating & deploying sustainable
CI/CD solutions in collaboration with architecture & engineering teams.

What we need:

* 3+ years of Azure pipeline experience (YAML & DevOps Classic)
* 2+ years of Ansible/Chef/Puppet experience in an enterprise enviornment
* 2+ years of Powershell / Python experience
* 2+ years of experience with SQL Server & SQL Server Data Tools
* Experience with blue/green deployment strategies
* Must be willing to work Eastern Standard Time (EST) hours

For finer details on this role, please apply today!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $135,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* Azure: 3 years (Required)
* Microsoft SQL Server: 4 years (Required)
* CI/CD: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

description:
Responsibilities

Play a key role in the delivery of world-class patient care. Leverage
innovative technology to advance high-quality care. Take your career in a
rewarding new direction. At UCLA Health, you can do all this and more.

Under the direction of the Cloud Platform Services Manager, the Cloud DevOps
Engineer will be responsible for cloud infrastructure and application design
and implementation, DevOps optimizations, and 3rd party integrations. You will
apply DevSecOps principles to cloud infrastructure and is responsible for the
construction of landing zones and deployment of respective capabilities.
Additional responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Infrastructure production
* Security issues, and their underlying causes
* Maintaining and supporting current environments while identifying and executing system architecture and process improvements
* Building tooling to enable faster deployments and reliable rollbacks
* Write code and design processes to improve the delivery of our cloud instances and applications

Qualifications

Required  
* Extensive professional experience with Azure in a production environment (network, security, applications, serverless, and containers)
* Knowledgeable in cloud networking - security, identity and access management, DNS, etc.
* Eble to work with Terraform at an Enterprise level
* Strong experience with Linux system administration
* Experience with Configuration Management systems (i.e., Puppet, Ansible, Chef).
* Proven track record of supporting production systems, and able to effectively coordinate cloud infrastructure service requests and incident response
* Strong sense of ownership and can prioritize and work on tasks independently

Highly preferred  

* Professional experience with AWS.
* Experience with CI/CD systems such as Github Actions, CodeBuild/CodePipeline, or Azure DevOps
* Familiarity with Docker and Containerization of applications
* History of working in a HIPAA compliant environment

UCLA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,
color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,
disability, or protected Veteran status.

description:
We are looking for a RobotOps engineer (DevOps engineer in Robotics)! You
should have experience in developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines, creating
solid automation and tooling to magnify team impact, and bring a passion for
working with robots.

NVIDIA's ISAAC Robotics Platform binds together high-fidelity visual and
physical simulation, a high-quality development platform, hundreds of
optimized algorithms to tackle hard problems in computer vision and artificial
intelligence, and a small but powerful computational platform to form the
brain of intelligent machines. Our team consists of experts from all over the
world and dozens of different fields, and together we want to change the way
robots are programmed.

What you'll be doing:

* Design and scale CI pipelines for building robotics autonomy packages 
* Manage contributions and releases to publicly maintained repositories 
* Drive automated CD flows for deploying to diverse robots 
* Debug pipelines for benchmarking and simulation regression 
* Maintaining team development environment and workflows 
* Integration of deliverables and artifacts from other teams 

What we need to see:

* BS degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science or related field 
* 2+ years of experience 
* Dedicated and self-motivated with a passion for automation, development processes, and code quality 
* Experience in developing CI/CD solutions for mid-sized projects 
* Solid understanding of virtualization/containerization (Docker) 
* Good programming skills in Python and Bash 
* Understanding of C++, build toolchains, code coverage tools, and git 
* Proficient with Linux distros (kernel, system administration, networking) 
* Excellent attention to detail and a strong desire to seize optimization opportunities 
* Flexibility to adapt quickly, learn fast & debug complex system issues 

Ways to stand out from the crowd:

* Expertise with ROS2 build tools (colcon, ament, cmake), Jenkins, GitLab/GitHub 
* Previous work on embedded platforms and MLOps 
* Experience with Jenkins, GitLab, GitHub, Jira 
* Strong visualization and dashboarding skills to communicate status and open issues 
* Demonstrated success of leveraging automation to magnify the impact of a team 

What We Do:

NVIDIA Isaac ROS

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world's most desirable
employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in
the world working for us. If you are creative and autonomous, we want to hear
from you!

The Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act requires that NVIDIA provide the
compensation range and benefits offered for this position if performed in
Colorado. The base salary range for this position in Colorado is $126,000.00 -
173,250.00 USD.

NVIDIA also offers a comprehensive benefits package. We provide health care
coverage, dental and vision, 401(K), including company matching and after tax
contributions, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance
Program (EAP), company paid holidays, paid sick leave, vacation leave,
professional time off, life and disability protection. Employees in eligible
sales and positions may also be eligible for commission.

Base pay is based on market location and may vary based on factors including
experience, skills, education, and other job-related reasons.

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an
equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and
future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and
promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin,
gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran
status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

description:
JOB TITLE: Development Operations Engineer 
 LOCATION: Remote / Austin , Texas 
 DURATION: 6 Months contract on w2 (Possible extension) 
 Unfortunately we cannot work on a C2C basis and are seeking candidates who
can work on our W2

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Lead tools and build-release activities for infotainment software
(images/packages) on single or multiple hardware boards with latest multi-core
multimedia SOC.

Lead and set technical direction for tools, build-release-test automation and
cloud-backend services.

Be responsible for developing tools & automation solutions for CI / CD / CT
workflow, including software updates and manufacturing support.

Develop integrated tools and processes to work in conjunction with JAMA, JIRA,
GIT, and other repositories to provide a seamless CI / CD / CT workflow.

Develop the tools, plug-ins and solutions necessary for CI / CD / CT workflow
using Jenkins, AWS, Docker, REST APIs and other microservices.

Work with other cross-functional teams and convert business requirements into
engineering requirements for development operations.

Be responsible for tool/software development and maintenance, adhering to
appropriate internal & external safety/security standards.

Be a dynamic cross-functional technical leader enabling other dependent teams
(like software, hardware and application).

Identify and set new technical directions to improve development process and
FULFILL company / group vision. this is what you'll need:

5+ years of experience with embedded or Linux software development using
C/C++.

5+ years of experience with auto build tools (like make, Waf etc.,), Jenkins,
AWS, Linux-server installation and maintenance.

5+ years of experience with scripting languages like Python and/or Shell.

5+ years of experience in one or more areas - chat-ops, OTA servers, micro-
services and cloud backend operations.

5+ years of experience with SQL or other non-relational databases.

Ability to be creative/resourceful - to work in a fast-paced start-up
environment.

Additional preferred skills: - Strong experience with developing tools for
software products using

Android / Linux / QNX.

Ability and experience to design and develop application tools (running on
windows/mac/Linux) for manufacturing and software update (OTA).

Automotive - software development , tools and build-release engineering
experience.

Windows POWERSHELL and automation experience.

description:
Company Description

As a digital business transformation partner of choice, we've spent nearly
three decades utilizing the disruptive power of technology and ingenuity to
help digitally enable our clients' business in their pursuit of next.

We bring a startup mindset and agile methods to both established companies and
the public sector to unlock value in ways that delight their customers and
improve their operational effectiveness. Our approach to transformation is
grounded in a view of both the company and the customers simultaneously, and a
unique fusing of strategy and consulting, experience and engineering with an
enduring culture of problem-solving creativity.

In the space between next and now is how. And we believe that how you seize
that space is everything.

Job Description

As a DevOps Architect you will be a part of a smart cross-functional team
delivering digital business transformation solutions to our clients. You'll
have the unique opportunity to increase the engineering team productivity by
hunting and solving opportunities within the products of some of the world's
largest brands. You'll be instrumental in helping our engineering teams to
deliver customer features faster by identifying opportunities to automate.

Your Impact:

* Build, test, and administer highly available container application platform clusters (e.g., RedHat OpenShift, Kubernetes, Docker Datacenter, etc.)
* Champion security by injecting it into the existing development workflow and every stage of software development, ensuring the entire infrastructure is secure
* Identify normal routines and repeatable tasks that are candidates for automation, and then create and support the deployment of automation using Ansible
* Work within complex software systems to isolate defects, reproduce defects, assess risk, and understand varied customer deployments
* Assist application teams with onboarding to container application platforms in areas such as resource requirements, capacity analysis, and troubleshooting support
* Azure/AWS provisioning, configuration management, storage management, network management, and virtualization
* Create the Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) automation infrastructure to support the project engineering team
* Developing and improving standards for security (via security as code) across a continuous delivery environment and cloud-based production deployments

Qualifications

Your Skills & Experience:

* Azure or AWS experience; experiences with Cloud Service continuous delivery systems
* Significant experience building automated pipelines
* Scriptwriting or application build experience in Python, Ruby, Bash, Java, Javascript, or UNIX shell
* Experience working with container technologies (such as Docker and Kubernetes)
* End-to-end understanding of CI/CD pipeline and how to assess them from a security point of view
* Experience with both Static and Dynamic Application Security Testing methodologies and tools
* Experience working with container application platform clusters
* Experience with software security, secure coding, or software assurance tools and techniques
* Experience working in an agile environment, such as Scrum, Kanban, or SAFe
* Source control experience (such as GitHub)
* Demonstrated ability to explain technical issues clearly and accurately to both technical and non-technical audiences
* Demonstrated ability to work in a collaborative team with adjusting priorities and deadlines
* Excellent problem solving, analytical skills and technical troubleshooting skills

Additional Information

Pay Range: $108,000 - $210,000

The range shown represents a grouping of relevant ranges currently in use at
Publicis Sapient. Actual range for this position may differ, depending on
location and specific skillset required for the work itself.

Benefits of Working Here:

* Flexible vacation policy; time is not limited, allocated, or accrued
* 15 paid holidays throughout the year
* Generous parental leave and new parent transition program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Corporate gift matching program

As part of our dedication to an inclusive and diverse workforce, Publicis
Sapient is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race,
color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status,
disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also
committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals
with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If
you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact
us at hiring@publicissapient.com or you may call us at +1-617-621-0200.

description:
As a crucial member of a driven, multidisciplinary engineering team, the
DevOps Engineer will work alongside the Software, Robotics, Systems,
Applications and Test Engineers. They will be responsible for developing and
maintaining software tools that automate and streamline the software
development, QA, documentation, release, and deployment processes.

Responsibilities

* Participate as a multidisciplinary engineering team member.
* Develop and maintain software build servers.
* Independently develop new tooling and automation to streamline the development, testing, and deployment processes.
* Maintain existing automated CI/CD infrastructure
* Remove blockages related to configuration and dependency management
* Maintain state of the art software release process to support our expanding software deployment community.

Requirements
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar field with 3-5 years of relevant experience.
* Strong working knowledge of the Windows and Linux operating system
* Experience with a variety of scripting languages including Groovy, Python, and Bash
* Knowledge of multiple C++ build systems including cmake and qmake
* Experience with C++ code analysis tools
* Experience with Git and Github
* Strong understanding of containerization using Docker
* Experience developing and maintaining automated CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins
* Experience with Atlassian software tools a plus: Jira and Confluence
* Strong written and oral communication skills.

To apply, please send your resume, salary requirements, and cover letter as
PDF documents. The candidate must be eligible to work in the United States.
This position is based Plymouth, MA.

Greensea (www.greensea.com) is an equal opportunity employer. We offer a
casual and fun work environment and provide our employees with training and
continuing education opportunities. Greensea offers competitive salaries and a
complete benefits package including full health insurance, 401(k), and paid
vacation, holiday, and sick leave.

Job Type: Full-time

* 401(k)

* Health insurance
* Life insurance

description:
As a crucial member of a driven, multidisciplinary engineering team, the
DevOps Engineer will work alongside the Software, Robotics, Systems,
Applications and Test Engineers. They will be responsible for developing and
maintaining software tools that automate and streamline the software
development, QA, documentation, release, and deployment processes.

Responsibilities

* Participate as a multidisciplinary engineering team member.
* Develop and maintain software build servers.
* Independently develop new tooling and automation to streamline the development, testing, and deployment processes.
* Maintain existing automated CI/CD infrastructure
* Remove blockages related to configuration and dependency management
* Maintain state of the art software release process to support our expanding software deployment community.

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar field with 3-5 years of relevant experience.
* Strong working knowledge of the Windows and Linux operating system
* Experience with a variety of scripting languages including Groovy, Python, and Bash

* Experience with C++ code analysis tools
* Experience with Git and Github
* Strong understanding of containerization using Docker
* Experience developing and maintaining automated CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins
* Experience with Atlassian software tools a plus: Jira and Confluence
* Strong written and oral communication skills.

To apply, please send your resume, salary requirements, and cover letter as
PDF documents. The candidate must be eligible to work in the United States.
This position is based Plymouth, MA.

description:
Great Day Improvements, a top 10 home remodeling company, is experiencing
double digit growth and is undergoing a digital transformation of the
business.

Our success has allowed us to make significant investments in the business to
further fuel our growth, including a technology-enabled end-to-end customer
experience platform.

We are looking for key DevOps engineers who want to make our vision a reality.
The right individuals are energized by building and creating, not just
managing tickets. You will have the chance to support a technology platform
from the ground up, alongside a team of highly skilled and dedicated
engineers.

We are committed to investing in our future and in our people. Join us at this
exciting stage in our business!

The DevOps engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, testing,
publishing, and documenting an enterprise level cloud application. 
Primary Job Duties 
· Work with technical engineers at large to understand its CI/CD and release
management needs to be able to transform those understandings into solution
requirements.

· Implement and maintain various aspects of CI/CD release cycle using CLI
scripting, tools, and datasets

· Must understand application architecture and configuration structure very
well

· Design continuous integration, continuous testing, continuous delivery, and
configuration management for enterprise software solutions,
monitoring/observability, and cloud platforms, and provide technical oversight
of DevOps implementation and delivery.

· APM - Monitor distributed application clusters in multiple environments
(dev, uat, prod etc...)

· Managing IDP: security catalogs, roles and ACL descriptors in IDP solution

· Admin cloud infrastructure (block storage, compute, network topologies)

· Identify and evaluate the value of emerging technology 
Skills 
· 3+ years API deploy/development with any modern tech stack (e.g., .NET,
Java, Node, Elixir etc...)

· Web/Http APIS: reverse proxy, SSL termination, balancing and related topics

· Base IP networking: net classes, NAT, subnets, masking etc.

· Security: OAuth/OpenIDC management, roles, ACLs

· Command Line Interface scripting / CLI tools in Linux/Bash experience is
required

· Basic understanding of distributed architecture topics: queues, events,
APIS/services

· Base knowledge of databases, RDBMS, NoSQL/Document. Replication and sharding

· Strong Communication skills with ability to work within a distributed team
in the USA

· Documentation skills are required

· Knowledge of modern frameworks/languages is a big plus (e.g., .NET, Java,
Node, Python)

· Knowledge of cloud service providers is a plus: AWS, GCP, Azure et.al.

· GitHub et.al projects/demos/Portfolio is a major plus

About Great Day Improvements, LLC

Great Day Improvements is a vertically integrated, direct-to-consumer provider
of branded premium building products, including Patio Enclosures brand
sunrooms and screen rooms; Stanek brand windows and patio doors; Apex Energy
Solutions energy efficient windows and doors; and Hartshorn Custom Contracting
pool enclosures and lanais. In the last 5 years, Great Day Improvements has
more than quadrupled in size and footprint, expanding its workforce to over
740 employees across 62 metropolitan markets throughout the United States. The
company has been named to REMODELING Magazine’s 550 List and Qualified
Remodeler’s Top 500 List, and is among Inc. Magazine’s fastest growing private
companies. Great Day Improvements has an excellent reputation with an A rating
from the BBB and an overall Google rating of 4.6 with over 2,300 reviews. To
learn more, visit www.patioenclosures.com, www.stanekwindows.com,
www.greatdayimprovements.com, www.hccscreens.com www.apexenergygroup.com

Equal Employment Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without
regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected
veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Right to Work

In compliance with federal law, all personals hired will be required to verify
identify and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the
required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

description:
Responsibilities:

The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for driving continuous integration and
software delivery that unifies development and operations teams for faster
business results. As the DevOps Engineer you will be responsible for driving
continuous integration and software delivery that unifies development and
operations teams for faster business results. This is a hands-on role where
you’ll be responsible for working on complex, major or highly visible tasks in
support of multiple projects that require multiple areas of expertise. This
role will support multiple applications and provide expertise in multiple
technical environments and knowledge of one or more business areas.

In addition, you will be responsible for the following tasks:

* Design, develop and maintain automation framework for iterative software development and testing. Provide operational support, and develop solutions that provide monitoring, logging and alerting capabilities.
* Manage CI/CD infrastructure using Jenkins, SonarQube, Fortify, and UFT, including patching and security updates on the infrastructure.
* Develop and maintain build scripts to automate deployments for multiple environments including dev/test, QA, and production.
* Work with QA team to integrate automated testing into CI/CD pipeline.
* Manage promoting Logic Apps and APIM between environments using ARM templates.
* Transition java web apps to containers.
* Build and maintain Kubernetes infrastructure and manage integrations with APIM/WAF.
* Participate in architecture review, reviewing technology designs and best practices

Requirements:

* Strong communication and presentation skills.
* 3+ years of hands-on experience with MS Azure technologies, specifically ARM templates and deployment scripting.
* Experience with Azure GovCloud a plus.
* 3+ years of hands-on CI/CD engineering experience working with scripting and build management tools for a variety of frameworks and technologies, including Angular, Java, C#/.NET, Bash, Groovy, Gradle, and Maven.
* Hands-on experience working on Windows, and Linux distributions (CentOS and Ubuntu)
* Hands-on experience working in Agile and DevOps cultures and teams with a keen focus on process improvement and automation through internal and external collaboration.
* Hands-on experience with containers and container platforms such as Docker and Kubernetes.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $145,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* DevOps: 5 years (Required)
* Azure: 3 years (Preferred)
* AZURE Arm templates: 3 years (Preferred)
* CI/CD Engineering: 3 years (Preferred)
* build tools(ex.: Angular, Java, C#/.NET, Bash, Groovy, Gradle: 2 years (Preferred)
* Windows, and Linux distributions (CentOS and Ubuntu): 1 year (Preferred)

Security clearance:

* Secret (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Required qualifications to be successful in this role:

* 8+ years of relevant experience
* AWS hands-on experience required.
* Hands-on experience in building application CI/CD pipeline using GitLab, expertise in setting up CI/CD
* Should be hands-on with application build automation tool Maven/Gradle
* Experience in writing Groovy/Python Scripts for executing commands on GitLab/Jenkins for building/deploying application
* Experience in working with application Git/BitBucket - branching strategy
* Experience in using Sonar for continuous inspection of application code to detect bugs, code smells, and security vulnerabilities 
* Experience in using Nexus Artifact repository & Component lifecycle management for a given application
* Experience in automating application deployments, some exposure to application deployment to AWS Infrastructure
* Experience with full SDLC lifecycle, taking from Dev to Release
* Experience with Urban Code Deployment (UCD)
* Excellent communication, and documentation skills
* Professional demeanor
* Must be well versed in creating CI/CD pipelines, and building docker containers.

* 
EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field 
* AWS Solution Architect Associate or Developer Associate certification desired

* 
Skills:
* GitLab
* Jenkins
* Python

description:
Sr. Analyst, IT - Finance Systems – HFM DevOps

Chicago, Pittsburgh, Remote

Do you want to work for a top 5 Food & Beverage company in the world? Do you
want to be a part of a Finance IT division that is rapidly expanding and can
offer multiple promotions and growth opportunities throughout your career?
Then apply to Kraft Heinz today to be a part of the greatness and you will see
how you valued you are in a company and in your career!

Position Summary

This high performing leader will partner with the various Finance
organizations within Kraft Heinz to build process and technology capabilities
that support their growth and strategic agenda. For this role to be a fit, you
must be a skilled relationship builder with the ability to work in fast paced
and ever-changing environments. This role will support business users and
overall operations in HFM and FDMEE space. This role will require close
collaboration with different teams and need to work as a team member of
Finance IT team.

Primary Responsibilities

* Responsible for administration of Hyperion Financial management and FDMEE applications.
* Manage month end close process to close books.
* Provide end user support, troubleshoot issue, and train end users.
* Maintain batch processes for data load and consolidations.
* Implement HFM and FDMEE system changes related to rules, reports, mappings etc.
* Act as primary liaison between Data Governance, Data Assurance, FP&A;, Controllers, and vendor teams to support Finance IT Systems operations.
* Maintain system documentation and controls on system changes and processes.
* Drive implementation of a strong control environment and robust processes.
* Ready to learn and contribute towards other Hyperion HFM and EPM initiatives as assigned.
* Mentor and support junior resources.
* Focus on continuous improvements and process automations to automate data loads and consolidation processes.
* Track deliverables and report status to management.
* Ability to work well under pressure; manage tight deadlines and situations where conflicting priorities arise.

Qualifications
* Minimum Bachelor’s Degree
* HFM/FDMEE Certification is plus

Domain Expertise

* Minimum of 4 years of functional and/or technical HFM and FDMEE
* Experience using Oracle Hyperion Suite of products (Planning / ePBCS).
* Knowledge of Data Management and EPM Automate
* Experience using Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), is a plus
* Can prioritize and balance multiple priorities
* Azure / Snowflake experience is a plus

Individual Skills

* Strong attention to detail
* Foundational scripting language experience (DOS & SQL)
* Strong leader, collaborator, team player, and individual contributor
* Strong communication skills with comfort in speaking with and presenting to IT leadership
* Strong Power Point and Excel user

Mindset & Behaviors

* Passion to challenge the status quo and find new solutions and drive out of the box ideas – loves and embraces change
* Believes in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust
* Not afraid to “roll up sleeves”; seeks to go beyond comfort to learn & pushes teams to do the same
* Empowers others to fail, learn, and grow with an experimental mindset to drive innovation

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

Experience:

* Oracle EPM: 4 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* HFM/FDMEE Certification (Preferred)

description:
Sr. DevOps Engineer 
Full Time 
Remote

Salary - $130 to $140K Year

Work for a well - established record management firm located in the Florida
area!

Summary:

The Senior DevOps Engineer position operates as a critical role within the
engineering team and the company's software development lifecycle applying
industry standard software engineering and Agile development principles to
architect, build, deploy, and monitor software on the company's cloud hosted
microservices platform. This position is responsible for designing and
deploying the platform components that accelerate delivery of the company's
software to clients and markets. This senior role is responsible for
designing, architecting, and implementing all aspects of Infrastructure as
Code (IaC), including Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
pipelines and cloud services that comprise our platform and related software
products. Additionally, this position is responsible for the automated Release
Management process. This position works closely with the front-end, back-end,
and site reliability development roles to ensure the platform operates at or
above industry standards for security, reliability, and performance. Finally,
this position is responsible for continually researching, evaluating, and
recommending new frameworks and technologies that can protect or expand the
company's product and technology competitive advantage.

Education and/or Experience

· BS/BA in MIS, Computer Science or science related field required

· 2-3 years of experience in architecting and coding microservices in AWS
required

· 2-3 years of experience managing Kubernetes clusters

· 2-3 years of experience creating and maintaining DevOps pipelines

· 2-3 years of experience working with serverless event driven technologies

· 4+ years of experience in back-end/automation development required

· AWS Professional or Specialty certification required

· Kubernetes CKA certification preferred

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

· Strong knowledge of and ability to configure, install and automate AWS
services

· Strong knowledge of industry standard development practices, particularly in
IaC, security, reliability, and performance disciplines

· Strong knowledge of at least one programming language

· Awareness of critical concepts in DevOps and Agile principles

· Intermediate knowledge of networking including basic subnet masking

· Excellent organizational, interpersonal, written, and verbal communication
skills

Responsibilities

· Work effectively in agile frameworks with product and engineering team

· Responsible for all aspects of platform design and deploy documentation
including security, reliability, and performance monitoring.

· Codify and maintain all enterprise architecture (infrastructure as code)

· Strive for continuous improvement and build continuous integration,
continuous development, and constant deployment pipelines

· Mentor all members of the engineering team to expand their knowledge and
skills regarding platform engineering best practices, techniques, and
technologies.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $130,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Azure: 3 years (Preferred)
* AWS: 3 years (Preferred)
* Kubernetes: 3 years (Preferred)
* DevOps: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

description:
Responsibilities

Play a key role in the delivery of world-class patient care. Leverage
innovative technology to advance high-quality care. Take your career in a
rewarding new direction. At UCLA Health, you can do all this and more.

Under the direction of the Cloud Platform Services Manager, the Cloud DevOps
Engineer will be responsible for cloud infrastructure and application design
and implementation, DevOps optimizations, and 3rd party integrations. You will
apply DevSecOps principles to cloud infrastructure and is responsible for the
construction of landing zones and deployment of respective capabilities.
Additional responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Infrastructure production
* Security issues, and their underlying causes
* Maintaining and supporting current environments while identifying and executing system architecture and process improvements
* Building tooling to enable faster deployments and reliable rollbacks
* Write code and design processes to improve the delivery of our cloud instances and applications

Qualifications

Required  
* Extensive professional experience with Azure in a production environment (network, security, applications, serverless, and containers)
* Knowledgeable in cloud networking - security, identity and access management, DNS, etc.
* Eble to work with Terraform at an Enterprise level
* Strong experience with Linux system administration
* Experience with Configuration Management systems (i.e., Puppet, Ansible, Chef).
* Proven track record of supporting production systems, and able to effectively coordinate cloud infrastructure service requests and incident response
* Strong sense of ownership and can prioritize and work on tasks independently

Highly preferred  

* Professional experience with AWS.
* Experience with CI/CD systems such as Github Actions, CodeBuild/CodePipeline, or Azure DevOps
* Familiarity with Docker and Containerization of applications
* History of working in a HIPAA compliant environment

UCLA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,
color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,
disability, or protected Veteran status.

* Design, develop and maintain automation framework for iterative software development and testing. Provide operational support, and develop solutions that provide monitoring, logging and alerting capabilities.
* Manage CI/CD infrastructure using Jenkins, SonarQube, Fortify, and UFT, including patching and security updates on the infrastructure.
* Develop and maintain build scripts to automate deployments for multiple environments including dev/test, QA, and production.
* Work with QA team to integrate automated testing into CI/CD pipeline.
* Manage promoting Logic Apps and APIM between environments using ARM templates.
* Transition java web apps to containers.
* Build and maintain Kubernetes infrastructure and manage integrations with APIM/WAF.
* Participate in architecture review, reviewing technology designs and best practices

Requirements:

* Strong communication and presentation skills.
* 3+ years of hands-on experience with MS Azure technologies, specifically ARM templates and deployment scripting.
* Experience with Azure GovCloud a plus.
* 3+ years of hands-on CI/CD engineering experience working with scripting and build management tools for a variety of frameworks and technologies, including Angular, Java, C#/.NET, Bash, Groovy, Gradle, and Maven.
* Hands-on experience working on Windows, and Linux distributions (CentOS and Ubuntu)
* Hands-on experience working in Agile and DevOps cultures and teams with a keen focus on process improvement and automation through internal and external collaboration.
* Hands-on experience with containers and container platforms such as Docker and Kubernetes.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $145,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* DevOps: 5 years (Required)
* Azure: 3 years (Preferred)
* AZURE Arm templates: 3 years (Preferred)
* CI/CD Engineering: 3 years (Preferred)
* build tools(ex.: Angular, Java, C#/.NET, Bash, Groovy, Gradle: 2 years (Preferred)
* Windows, and Linux distributions (CentOS and Ubuntu): 1 year (Preferred)

Security clearance:

* Secret (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Responsibilities:

* Lead the creation of a cloud-first software source code management and build/deployment pipeline in Azure DevOps, focused primarily on the integration of a large acquisition but looking forward to all of nThrive
* Establish and maintain pipeline templates, collaborating with participating development teams to understand and document requirements
* Design, document, and support practices for deployment both of and to Azure resources, including VM’s, VM Scale Sets, AKS, Azure Functions, and Azure App Services.
* Design and document security requirements to govern access to and usage of the CI/CD pipeline
* Lead pilots and proofs-of-concept for CI/CD-related integrations such as SAST and SCA scans
* Evolve current practices and establish new guidelines to adopt IaC methodology, including cost management and security best-practices
* Ensure that policies and practices support the diversity of technology platforms and languages that exists within nThrive today, including both .NET and Java applications that reside both on-prem and within Azure
* Monitor and maintain environments and delivery pipelines
* Consult and help design Azure environment

Requirements:

* 3+ years of experience in software development
* 3+ years of experience in an architect role responsible for overseeing design, pattern development, and tool selection for managing Azure resources
* 2+ years of experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines deploying to Azure resources, including IaaS and PaaS models and using zero downtime (rolling, blue-green, etc.)
* Excellent communication skills and experience interacting both with upper management as well as individual contributors
* Strong ability to document architectural patterns and decisions through appropriate tools (diagrams, wiki articles, samples, etc.)
* Experience working with teams in designing and implementing solutions using the following technologies:
* Azure DevOps
* Microsoft .NET (Framework, Core, .NET 5)
* Java/Spring
* Azure (both IaaS and PaaS hosting)
* Microsoft SQL Server
* Infrastructure-as-code (ARM, Terraform , Bicep)
* CI/CD/GitOps concepts

description:
Come join Tyler Technologies as a DevOps Engineer! The Tyler Cloud Platform
team is looking for Engineers to build and run the services and infrastructure
that power the platform.  

This position will work an evening schedule to improve our team 's ability
to support our clients as broadly throughout the day as possible.  

We are hiring high quality engineers with a diverse set of experiences and
skill sets for positions on the cloud platform team delivering the vision of
Connected Communities. The strongest candidates will have a solid operations
expertise and demonstrated software development experience on large scale
cloud infrastructure. Our clients count on us to provide exceptional
availability, scalability, and security for services and infrastructure. As an
DevOps Engineer, you'll be on a team of engineers whose mission it is to build
and improve Tyler's most critical cloud services.  

Are you up to the challenge?

As a part of Tyler's corporate staff, you will make an impact on outcomes that
affect various areas of the company. Your work will ultimately support our
team members, clients, stakeholders, and the public sector.

Location

Remote

Responsibilities

* Architect, author, champion, and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, and security of Tyler's Cloud Platform services.
* _Design, build_* _ and manage_ systems, infrastructure and applications through automation that support self sufficiency
* Deploy, support, and monitor new and existing services, platforms, and application stacks
* Use scalable testing to measure, report, tune, and optimize system performance
* _Develop tools to improve our ability to rapidly deploy and effectively monitor services in a large-scale Kubernetes environment._
* Participate in periodic on-call duties
* Recommend new solutions and technologies
* Collaborate with team and others to share operational best practices
* Function well in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Cover after hours support needs with core hours from 5pm to 1am Pacific Time, M-F
* Provide an escalation path to the rest of the team after hours.

Qualifications

* 3+ years in a UNIX-based large-scale web operations role.
* _5+ years programming experience in Python, Perl, Node, Java/Scala, or C#_
* 3+ years designing and implementing, large-scale AWS production workloads
* _Experience with large scale Kubernetes architectures and configuration_
* Expert scripting knowledge, specifically for systems automation
* UNIX/Linux systems administration background
* Knowledge of most of these: data structures, relational and non-relational databases, networking, Linux internals, file systems, web architecture, and related topics
* Ability to guide technical teams through design and implementation across an organization
* Previous experience working an evening shift with geographically distributed coworkers.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills (including listening, speaking, and writing) and ability to work well in a diverse, team-focused environment with other DevOps, Engineers, Product Managers, etc.

Preferred Experience
* Experienced in configuration and deployment of containers at scale in AWS EKS, ECS, and Fargate
* Experienced in configuration, management, and monitoring of DataDog
* Experience authoring infrastructure using tools such as cloud-formation or terraform
* Experienced in configuration and management of CI/CD tooling like Github Actions, Jenkins or CircleCI
* Experienced database engineer with MySQL, specifically Aurora

State Specific Salary Range Disclosure Requirements for Colorado,

Connecticut, and Nevada

Salary will generally fall between $55,537 - $100,000 before adjustment for
geographic differences. Recruiter can confirm if position is incentive
eligible.

Great Place to Work & Grow Your Career

Come join us as we transform the public sector! Our mission, vision, and
values guide everything we do. We're also frequently recognized as a great
workplace locally and nationally. See our many awards and accolades.

Taking Care of You & Your Family

Your health and well-being are important to us. That's why we invest in our
team members by offering competitive benefits to support their health and
financial wellness. Learn more about how we care for our people.

Tyler is subject to regulations, guidelines, and/or client requirements
relating to the qualifications of Tyler personnel performing certain client
work. Because of the nature of this position, it is a requirement that the
candidate can successfully pass a federal background check at the time an
offer is extended and over the course of employment with Tyler.
