description:
Department Summary  

DISH is transforming the future of connectivity. We're doing it by building
the country's first virtualized, standalone 5G wireless network from scratch.
The foundation of a connected world, it's a network free of the limitations of
the past, and flexible enough to satisfy all the social, economic and
transformative needs of the changing world.  

Job Duties and Responsibilities  

DISH Wireless is seeking a CI/CD DevOps Engineer II to build and manage the
automation process for the continuous delivery (CI), continuous delivery (CD),
and continuous validation (CV) of the 5G Network functions. This person would
work closely with network functions ISVs, testers, and DISH's engineering &
operations teams to integrate, test, and deploy the artifacts necessary to
realize zero-touch operations of DISH's 5G network.  

Day-to-day job responsibilities:  

* Design, develop and maintain features and functionalities of DISH 5G Network CI/CD pipelines 
* Configure and manage the tools necessary to successfully deploy new features into the 5G network 
* Create the necessary feedback loops to communicate the status of the pipeline to the stakeholders 
* Configure and maintain the Git Repo, Docker registry, CI tool, configuration and deployment tools 
* 5. Learn, evaluate and implement new technologies to further our quality and delivery capabilities 
* Work in a Scrum team to add functionalities to the CI/CD process 
* Work within an Agile development framework to deliver high-quality software 
* Create process to analyze logs as a way to determine the health of the feature deployment 
* Design and develop state-of-the-art approaches to solving complex quality issues 
* Communicate clearly with Product Owners, Developers and management to establish understanding of issues to address and proposed solutions 

LI-HMM

Skills, Experience and Requirements  

The successful CI/CD DevOps Engineer II will have:  

* The ideal candidate has 2-4 years of experience in a related role with mid- to large-sized companies and has demonstrated the following: 
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical degree 
* At least 2 years of experience using Cloud technologies such as AWS, VMC, GCP, and/or Azure 
* At least 2 years of experience using CI/CD and DevOps tools such as Java, Java Script, Python, Grafana, Gitlab, GitLab-CI, Jira, Kubernetes, Docker, Ansible, Splunk 
* Experience deploying Cloud Native Applications, building and managing microservices, and creating tools to monitor real time metrics in the pipeline 
* Experience deploying Docker containers in multiple Kubernetes clusters using deployment strategies such as Blue/Green, Canary, Rolling 
* Experience building pipelines as code using YAML specs 
* Experience using Jira, Confluence, or similar bug tracking and documentation tools 
* Demonstrated ability to identify, troubleshoot, diagnose and fully define problems 

Salary Range  

Compensation: $75,600.00/Year - $124,200.00/Year 
Benefits  

From versatile health perks to new career opportunities, check out our
benefits on our careers website .  

Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may
include a drug test.

description:
The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for assisting the Company in the
configuration, administration, monitoring and maintenance Company’s existing
and future software server, software, network and associated technologies with
an emphasis on employing cloud based service providers and operating a hybrid
architecture consisting of internal, external, and partner based technology
resources.

Required Qualifications

· The DevOps Engineer will create, deploy, monitor, scale and secure
infrastructure and applications with focus on automating as much as possible.

· This role will work with other engineers to evolve the company's CI/CD
capabilities and will play a key role in the implementation of DevOps
processes and tooling

· This role is key to helping the teams in the engineering organization be
successful in their jobs

· Ensure availability, performance, scalability, and security of deployed
infrastructure

· Build and maintain operations software which automates the configuration,
provisioning, deployment, and monitoring of our core products

· Build and maintain our production infrastructure to ensure ongoing
reliability while maximizing development team efficiency

· Develop automation frameworks for public cloud infrastructure deployments

· Monitor, troubleshoot and debug infrastructure, network, operating system,
and system performance issues

· Maintenance, management, and streamlining of all our CI/CD processes

· Participate in architecture planning sessions with development team

· Work closely with developers and QA teams to understand how to improve their
processes and deliver high quality software more effectively.

Position Qualifications

· A minimum of 4 years of experience with system administration on Linux
machines

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Docker or other containerization
technologies

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Terraform

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using AWS

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Kubernetes

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Jenkins or similar CI/CD Tools

· Experience with Ansible, Helm, and Git

· Experience with Cloud Networking and Load Balancer Technologies (AWS ELB,
HAProxy, etc.)

· Experience with maintaining monitoring tools like Grafana, Prometheus,
InfluxDB, and Telegraf

· Ability to critically think and provide solutions to problems you have not
encountered before

· Fluency in at least two programming languages (i.e. Ruby, Python, etc.)

· Experience with continuous integration / deployment (CI/CD) in a high
availability environment

· Ability to work effectively with distributed teams using collaboration tools
and without face-to-face communication

The selected candidate will join a team who values work life balance and
professional growth equally. You will be supported as you continue to grow in
your career and will be given every resource to succeed. Interested candidates
are encouraged to apply directly.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
Technical Analyst - DevOps

K3 helps companies easily manage complex data streams and integrations without
having to rely on developers. We’re focused on enterprises with increasing
amounts of data to manage, the need to move fast, and deliver sustainable
solutions. K3 gives users a seat at the table in these complex environments.
We have had great success on Wall St. and are now increasingly solving similar
problems in new domains.

Our Technical Analysts wear many hats. They assist on customer projects and
training, run our infrastructure in AWS, investigate bugs, and guide our
product roadmap.

We are currently looking for analysts with a focus on DevOps in AWS.

* Help manage our infrastructure on AWS - (ec2/RDS/ElasticBeanstalk/CloudFormation and more)
* Support project teams with AWS deployments and maintenance
* Maintain knowledge base for internal and customer consumption
* Automate software deployment, configuration, and monitoring processes
* Troubleshoot customer technical and data issues

Being a technical analyst at BroadPeak is as much about communication and
thoughtfulness as it is about technology. In this role you need to be
relentless in figuring out how new things work.

Skills Required:

* MUST enjoy discovering the details of complex systems and understanding how they work.
* MUST have demonstrated experience in AWS DevOps technologies
* Communication of technical details to a less technical people
* Comfortable working from the command line
* Experience with Linux environments
* You get a buzz from an environment that goes from fast to slow to fast again
* “Select * from” is the start of a wonderful investigative journey

About Us

Our headquarters are in NYC but we have always worked in a distributed manner.

We measure goals and delivery, not time spent at a desk.

We have a "no policy" holiday. Just get your stuff done.

Our people work on multiple areas, continuously refine processes, and
participate in the financial success of the company.

This job is based in NYC in our Flatiron district office but would be remote
for the time being.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,286.00 - $116,923.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

COVID-19 considerations: 
We are all fully working remotely for the time being. Remote working was a
seamless shift for us.

Experience:

* AWS: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Finagraph is leading a new wave of innovation in FinTech that is transforming
the way financial services are offered to businesses. We continue to add some
of the world’s largest brands to our list of customers and these customers are
taking mission-critical dependencies on our cutting-edge technology. We are
expanding our team and looking for exceptional teammates that can help us grow
and make broad contributions to accelerate this industry’s transformation.

We are currently seeking a talented, results-oriented DevOps Engineer who is
experienced with all aspects of an Azure based SAAS offering.

At Finagraph, you won’t just be a spoke in the wheel. We are large enough to
make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. We are an
organization where every person matters. You’ll be a critical part of the
business where everyone contributes to the solutions that our customers love.
In addition to the day-to-day management of operations you’ll have the
opportunity to influence software design and implement parts of our solution.

What you will be doing:

* Infrastructure setup, provisioning and planning
* Environment standardization
* Platform configuration management
* CI/CD architecture
* Service tool implementation
* Implementation and monitoring of security testing
* Regular security audits and oversight
* Threat management and response

About you:
* At least 3-5 years of progressive experience and accrued good judgment with Azure provisioning, managing, and supporting cloud infrastructure for scalability and high availability.
* Passionate about delivering rich, high performing solutions that delight customers.
* Experience using and managing observability and monitoring tools supporting the operational and security health of services running in Azure
* Experience developing tools and infrastructure CI/CD pipelines for developer productivity running in Azure DevOps
* Experience with troubleshooting/incident management for cloud native services
* Demonstrable experience with scripting languages such as PowerShell
* Functional knowledge of 1 or more high level programming languages, preferably C#
* Infrastructure as Code methods and tools (ARM Templates, Bicep, etc.,)
* CI/CD - Azure DevOps, Git etc.,
* Ability to debate issues and not people.
* Ability to make complicated things simple 
* Self-awareness that allows you to thrive in an agile work environment where everybody is wearing a lot of hats.

Benefits and Perks:
* Remote position with a talented team.
* Comprehensive health benefit plan that has a rich provider network
* Unlimited vacation policy
* Peer bonus program
* Regular team events
* Vacation reimbursement benefit

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to undergo a background check? Y/N

Work Location: Remote

* Monday to Friday

seamless shift for us.

Experience:

* AWS: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Responsibilities:

* Lead the creation of a cloud-first software source code management and build/deployment pipeline in Azure DevOps, focused primarily on the integration of a large acquisition but looking forward to all of nThrive
* Establish and maintain pipeline templates, collaborating with participating development teams to understand and document requirements
* Design, document, and support practices for deployment both of and to Azure resources, including VM’s, VM Scale Sets, AKS, Azure Functions, and Azure App Services.
* Design and document security requirements to govern access to and usage of the CI/CD pipeline
* Lead pilots and proofs-of-concept for CI/CD-related integrations such as SAST and SCA scans
* Evolve current practices and establish new guidelines to adopt IaC methodology, including cost management and security best-practices
* Ensure that policies and practices support the diversity of technology platforms and languages that exists within nThrive today, including both .NET and Java applications that reside both on-prem and within Azure
* Monitor and maintain environments and delivery pipelines
* Consult and help design Azure environment

Requirements:

* 3+ years of experience in software development
* 3+ years of experience in an architect role responsible for overseeing design, pattern development, and tool selection for managing Azure resources
* 2+ years of experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines deploying to Azure resources, including IaaS and PaaS models and using zero downtime (rolling, blue-green, etc.)
* Excellent communication skills and experience interacting both with upper management as well as individual contributors
* Strong ability to document architectural patterns and decisions through appropriate tools (diagrams, wiki articles, samples, etc.)
* Experience working with teams in designing and implementing solutions using the following technologies:
* Azure DevOps
* Microsoft .NET (Framework, Core, .NET 5)
* Java/Spring
* Azure (both IaaS and PaaS hosting)
* Microsoft SQL Server
* Infrastructure-as-code (ARM, Terraform , Bicep)
* CI/CD/GitOps concepts

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $150,000.00 - $175,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Relocation assistance
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you need sponsorship?

Experience:

* Devops Architect: 4 years (Preferred)
* Azure DevOps: 4 years (Preferred)
* Software development: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

See yourself at Twilio

Join the team as our next DevOps Engineer!

Who we are & why we're hiring

Twilio powers real-time business communications and data solutions that help
companies and developers worldwide build better applications and customer
experiences.

Although we're headquartered in San Francisco, we're on a journey to becoming
a globally antiracist company that supports diversity, equity & inclusion
wherever we do business. We employ thousands of Twilions worldwide, and we're
looking for more builders, creators, and visionaries to help fuel our growth
momentum.

About the job

This position is needed to support the hands-on operational team responsible
for design, implementation and management of our datacenter footprint across
the US and EU. We are building a world-class platform to enable Twilio's
developers to quickly deploy reliable, scalable, and secure products to Twilio
customers. As Twilio continues to grow, the team is leading the expansion of
our datacenter footprint across the globe.

Responsibilities

In this role, you'll:

* Build out world class data center facilities that support our customers worldwide
* Develop automation for processes within the team
* Identify and drive areas of improvement within our Data center management practices.
* Foster an inclusive environment and imports team members to succeed and grow.

Qualifications

Not all applicants will have skills that match a job description exactly.
Twilio values diverse experiences in other industries, and we encourage
everyone who meets the required qualifications to apply. While having
"desired" qualifications make for a strong candidate, we encourage applicants
with alternative experiences to also apply. If your career is just starting or
hasn't followed a traditional path, don't let that stop you from considering
Twilio. We are always looking for people who will bring something new to the
table!

Required:

* Experience with large scale datacenter projects & infrastructure rollouts
* Hands-on operational experience in a data center facility. Installation of equipment in racks, attaching connections to power and network infrastructure. Ability to coordinate these activities remotely via remote hands services.
* An understanding of computer science fundamentals and practical experience developing distributed systems.
* A passion for automation and DevOps--blending operational excellence with development best practices.
* Deep familiarity with Linux (CentOS/RHEL preferred), bash scripting, service configuration and management.
* Proficiency with one or more programming languages. Go, Ruby, Python are preferred.

Desired:

* Experience creating declarative APIs to handle physical infrastructure in a hybrid cloud environment.
* Past development projects involving backend databases or interacting with other systems via API.
* Experience providing infrastructure as a service leveraging configuration management tools such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible, CFEngine, etc.

Location

This role will be remote, and ideally based in the central/eastern/mountain
time zones in the USA.

What We Offer

There are many benefits to working at Twilio, including, in addition to
competitive pay, things like generous time-off, ample parental and wellness
leave, healthcare, a retirement savings program, and much more. Offerings vary
by location.

Twilio thinks big. Do you?

We like to solve problems, take initiative, pitch in when needed, and are
always up for trying new things. That's why we seek out colleagues who embody
our values -- something we call Twilio Magic. Additionally, we empower
employees to build positive change in their communities by supporting their
volunteering and donation efforts.

So, if you're ready to unleash your full potential, do your best work, and be
the best version of yourself, apply now!

If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open
positions.

Please note this role is open to candidates outside of Colorado as well. The
information below is provided for those hired in Colorado only.

If you are a Colorado applicant:

* The estimated pay range for this role, based in Colorado, is $99,360 - $124,200.
* Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Twilio's equity plan.

The successful candidate's starting salary will be determined based on
permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and
geographic location within the state. This role is also eligible to
participate in Twilio's equity plan and for the following benefits: health
care insurance, 401(k) retirement account, paid sick time, paid personal time
off, paid parental leave.

Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Twilio is proud to be
an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not
discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including
pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical
conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age,
status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability,
genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally
protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal
histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.
Additionally, Twilio participates in the E-Verify program in certain
locations, as required by law.

Twilio is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified
individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application
procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability,
please contact us at accommodation@twilio.com.

description:
Teramind is a hybrid, global workforce building the next-generation Insider
Risk Management and User Behavior Analytics platform.

Join our team of innovators who are redefining insider risk management through
cutting edge technology. More than 10,000 organizations across the globe use
Teramind to mitigate insider threats and protect their sensitive company data
with the most robust, enterprise-grade software on the market.

As a global team, Teramind embraces an inclusive and flexible work environment
and team culture. We win together, learn from each other and respect each
other while delivering best-in-class security solutions.

About the role

This is an opportunity to manage a critical function within Teramind. As a
Senior DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for optimizing and maintaining
parts of our cloud, development, and on-premise infrastructure.

Expert-level Linux, docker, and python is a requirement to succeed in this
job.

This is a remote job. Work from anywhere.

Your day-to-day

* Evaluate system performance, identify points for optimization, write situational playbooks
* Find outliers, evaluate bug bounty reports
* Deploy and test new systems that contribute to our security posture
* Liaise with management and the development teams to improve our processes

What you bring to the team
* 4+ years of hands-on DevOps / Linux administration experience
* Expert-level Linux, docker, and python
* Solid knowledge CI/CD, microservice architecture
* Intermediate+ experience with PaaS such as Azure, AWS, OCI, etc.

This is a remote job. Work from anywhere!

We’re a global, distributed team looking for the finest talent. We’ve been
thriving as a fully-remote team since 2014. To us, remote work means
flexibility and having truly diverse, global teams.

What We Give:

At Teramind, we’re a collaborative, forward-thinking team where new ideas come
to life, experience is valued and talent is incubated.

* High-quality health benefits
* Retirement Plan with employer match
* Career-growth opportunities
* Flexible Time Off and Paid Time Off benefits
* Professional development budget

About our recruitment process

We don’t expect a perfect fit for every requirement we’ve outlined. If you can
see yourself contributing to the team, we want to hear your story.

You can expect up to 3 interviews on Zoom. In some scenarios we’re able to
streamline the process to have minimal rounds. Director-level roles and above
should expect a more thorough process., with multiple rounds of interviews.

All roles require background checks.

Teramind is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, religion,
color, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression,
sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

Pay: $130,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

Experience:

* Linux: 3 years (Required)
* Python: 3 years (Preferred)

description:
What you will do:

· Be an impactful member of the Software Development team by supporting all
efforts to simplify and enhance the client experience.

· Ensure accurate and efficient execution and adherence to business and
technical requirements through detailed coding and performing unit and
software integration testing.

· Improve new and existing software by performing coding, testing, debugging,
designing and writing programs according to functional and non-functional
requirements.

· Validate software adherence with development standards by providing
knowledgeable input while leading code review sessions.

· Guide the development of software by creating and maintaining accurate
technical documentation.

· Resolve incidents and issues for production applications and web services in
accordance with identified service level agreements (SLAs) by serving as the
final escalation point for clients.

· Influence future system designs by managing system analysis and identifying
and recommending design and requirements.

· Maximize the efficiency of various systems by collaborating with internal
clients and technical and architecture teams to resolve software issues and
implement, monitor and test new software.

· Enhance department performance metrics through hands-on coaching and
mentoring of less experienced team members.

· Mitigate risks by following established configuration and change control
processes.

Required keys for success:

· Six+ years of experience with major database management systems.

· Six+ years of experience with coding, testing and design.

· Six or more years of experience with software development methodologies.

· Expert in Voice, Data, Video and wireless technologies.

· In-depth understanding of software design patterns and principles.

· History of identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the
actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the
system.

· Proven ability to deal with ambiguous or incomplete information when
evaluating alternatives and making recommendations.

· Track record of working with teams and managing individual tasks with the
ability to pick up complex concepts and processes quickly.

· Creative and abstract thinking skills that can envision and design
innovative solutions to business opportunities and challenges.

· Solid ability to design, develop and deploy solutions and to deliver
projects on time with minimal direction.

· Extensive technical knowledge of Information Technology field and computer
systems.

· Demonstrated ability to take the lead on the most complex projects with
experience sharing knowledge, resolving conflict and creating a consensus.

· Effective written and spoken English communication skills with all levels of
an organization.

How you will stand out from the crowd:

· Expert scripting ability using various languages, including Python, Django,
JSON, XML and Bash.

· Experience using source control tools, such as Git/GitLab.

· History of working in a Gitflow development workflow.

· Understanding of server and database configurations, including Oracle, MySQL
and Postgres.

· Working Knowledge of web services, simple network management protocol (SNMP)
and transmission control protocol/ user datagram protocol (TCP/UDP).

· Skilled in operating systems, including RedHat and CentOS.

· InfoVista InSight and Spirent VisionWorks/Analytics experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
Do you have the skills--and drive--to join a tech team that's working to
digitally transform a trillion-dollar industry? From test-driving the latest
technologies to creating intuitive consumer apps, Liberty Mutual is constantly
innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind
for our customers worldwide.

As a software engineer on this Customer Success team at Liberty Mutual, you'll
apply your talents in an agile environment that has the creative energy of a
start-up--and the full backing and comprehensive benefits of a Fortune 100
company.

Note: This is a range posting - Software/Sr. Software Engineer - and the final
offer will be based on the candidate's skills and experiences.

Responsibilities:

* Provide technical support to Liberty Mutual's product development teams as they use our CI/CD tool suite to build and deploy code to our internal and cloud computing environments.
* Guide developers to self-service options for resolving issues.
* Troubleshoot CI/CD platform and infrastructure automation errors, provide solutions and escalate issues as needed.
* Interface with and direct customers to other teams as needed.
* Observe trends in ticket types or questions asked and engage with product teams to provide solutions for known issues.
* Learn the inner workings of our end-to-end CI/CD software delivery environment and innovative public cloud infrastructure automation.
* Improve the developer experience: reduce obstacles and provide solutions.
* Develop automation to provide fast resolution for common inquiries.
* Create self-service documentation and utilities.
* We encourage innovative ideas to improve our development community's experience.
* Demonstrated success in Jenkins, JIRA, AWS, Pipelines
* Familiarity with CI/CD deployment tools and agile software development practices is desired, including Jira, GitHub, Bamboo, Jenkins, Artifactory, AWS, Azure, GCP Cloud Foundry
* Experience working in an agile environment utilizing Scrum, Kanban or XP.
* Strong oral and written communication skills--and a knack for explaining your decision-making process to non-engineers.
* A collaborative, adaptable working style, demonstrated initiative and the ability to prioritize your time and efforts.
* A Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline, or equivalent experience.
* Troubleshooting complex systems, and needing an understanding of cloud computing, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud engineering best practices.

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently
pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness,
inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of
roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding
profession.  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great
Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of
the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's
2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of
America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New
Graduates--as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn
more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit:
https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and
we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-
being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:
https://LMI.co/Benefits  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate
discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual
orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status,
pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or
local law.

description:
eNGINE builds Technical Teams. We are a Solutions and Placement firm
shaped by decades of interaction with Technical professionals. Our inspiration
is continuous learning and engagement with the markets we serve, the talent we
represent, and the teams we build. Our Consulting Workforce is encouraged to
enjoy career fulfillment in the form of challenging projects, schedule
flexibility, and paid training/certifications. Successful outcomes start and
finish with eNGINE.

eNGINE is hiring a pair of 100% remote DevOps Engineers with a focus on
DACPAC deployments & Azure DevOps pipelines for an initial customer engagement
with one of our healthcare vertical customers.

description:

DevOps Engineer will work alongside the Software, Robotics, Systems,
Applications and Test Engineers. They will be responsible for developing and
maintaining software tools that automate and streamline the software
development, QA, documentation, release, and deployment processes.

Responsibilities

* Participate as a multidisciplinary engineering team member.
* Develop and maintain software build servers.
* Independently develop new tooling and automation to streamline the development, testing, and deployment processes.
* Maintain existing automated CI/CD infrastructure
* Remove blockages related to configuration and dependency management
* Maintain state of the art software release process to support our expanding software deployment community.

Requirements
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar field with 3-5 years of relevant experience.
* Strong working knowledge of the Windows and Linux operating system
* Experience with a variety of scripting languages including Groovy, Python, and Bash
* Knowledge of multiple C++ build systems including cmake and qmake
* Experience with C++ code analysis tools
* Experience with Git and Github
* Strong understanding of containerization using Docker
* Experience developing and maintaining automated CI/CD pipelines in Jenkins
* Experience with Atlassian software tools a plus: Jira and Confluence
* Strong written and oral communication skills.

To apply, please send your resume, salary requirements, and cover letter as
PDF documents. The candidate must be eligible to work in the United States.
This position is based Plymouth, MA.

description:
We are currently looking for a full-time DevOps Engineer to support the
infrastructure needs of our growing team. In this 
role, you'll be the second DevOps hire and will work directly with our lead
DevOps Engineer to maintain 
the reliability, security, scalability and deployment of our platform.  

Responsibilities  

* Build, integrate, test, monitor and deploy code across multiple cloud and on-premise environments
* Build tooling to assist with maintenance, upgrades, deployments and monitoring of AWS and on-premise
* environments.
* Assist with provisioning and setting up new AWS environments for dedicated cloud installations.
* Help maintain data security policies and best practices by designing and implementing secure, immutable
* infrastructure through infrastructure as code and thoughtful security practices compatible with external standards(SOC2)

Requirements-  
* 3 to 6 years of DevOps industry experience
* Familiar with Linux, command line, bash scripting, yaml
* Experience with cloud and on-premise containerized infrastructure built with Docker, Kubernetes, Helm,
* Terraform, Packer, GitHub, and Min.IO
* Experience working with AWS cloud architecture and services such as VPC, EKS, EC2, S3, RDS
* Experience with PostgreSQL and AWS storage encryption, data at rest, and data in transit
* Familiarity defining and executing CI/CD pipelines with tools like Docker, GitHub, CircleCI
* Experience with monitoring services like DataDog is preferred

description:
The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for assisting the Company in the
configuration, administration, monitoring and maintenance Company’s existing
and future software server, software, network and associated technologies with
an emphasis on employing cloud based service providers and operating a hybrid
architecture consisting of internal, external, and partner based technology
resources.

Required Qualifications

· The DevOps Engineer will create, deploy, monitor, scale and secure
infrastructure and applications with focus on automating as much as possible.

· This role will work with other engineers to evolve the company's CI/CD
capabilities and will play a key role in the implementation of DevOps
processes and tooling

· This role is key to helping the teams in the engineering organization be
successful in their jobs

· Ensure availability, performance, scalability, and security of deployed
infrastructure

· Build and maintain operations software which automates the configuration,
provisioning, deployment, and monitoring of our core products

· Build and maintain our production infrastructure to ensure ongoing
reliability while maximizing development team efficiency

· Develop automation frameworks for public cloud infrastructure deployments

· Monitor, troubleshoot and debug infrastructure, network, operating system,
and system performance issues

· Maintenance, management, and streamlining of all our CI/CD processes

· Participate in architecture planning sessions with development team

· Work closely with developers and QA teams to understand how to improve their
processes and deliver high quality software more effectively.

Position Qualifications

· A minimum of 4 years of experience with system administration on Linux
machines

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Docker or other containerization
technologies

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using Terraform

· A minimum of 3 years of experience using AWS

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Kubernetes

· A minimum of 2 years of experience using Jenkins or similar CI/CD Tools

· Experience with Ansible, Helm, and Git

· Experience with Cloud Networking and Load Balancer Technologies (AWS ELB,
HAProxy, etc.)

· Experience with maintaining monitoring tools like Grafana, Prometheus,
InfluxDB, and Telegraf

· Ability to critically think and provide solutions to problems you have not
encountered before

· Fluency in at least two programming languages (i.e. Ruby, Python, etc.)

· Experience with continuous integration / deployment (CI/CD) in a high
availability environment

· Ability to work effectively with distributed teams using collaboration tools
and without face-to-face communication

The selected candidate will join a team who values work life balance and
professional growth equally. You will be supported as you continue to grow in
your career and will be given every resource to succeed. Interested candidates
are encouraged to apply directly.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $120,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
Remote DevOps Engineer

If you are a DevOps Engineer with Azure and Docker/Kubernetes experience,
please read on!  

-100% Remote | Full-Time/Permanent-  

$140k Base with 10% bonus | 18 Days PTO starting | 401k matching  

Over the last 50 years we have become one of the nation's largest providers of
pharmacy tech services to more than 800 hospitals and healthcare facilities
nationwide!  

You will help design, deploy, and maintain the infrastructure and systems that
support ours services in Azure following core DevOps principles (speed,
stability, observability, security, and reproducibility).

What You Will Be Doing

* Development of Kubernetes application deployments for existing Docker-based workloads
* Designing, building, and implementing CI/CD processes/tools and training other Engineering teams in the implementation and use of these processes/tools
* Create and maintain efficient workflow management within our software development life cycle
* Build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations
* Drive process changes and help craft how the future of DevOps should look at our company

What You Need for this Position

* Azure
* Docker
* Kubernetes
* CI/CD

Plus Skills:  

* Azure Data Factory
* Terraform
* Azure App Service, Event Hubs, Azure SQL, Data Warehouse, Data Factory...

- Azure Networking - Azure Virtual Networks, Firewall, VPN, NSG, and App
Service Environment

What's In It for You

$140k Base with 10% bonus!  

* 401k matching
* 18 Days PTO starting
* Full benefits including medical, dental, and vision
* Opportunity for professional growth
* Awesome Glassdoor review
* Great company culture and work-life balance!
* Much more!

So, if you are a Remote DevOps Engineer with experience, please apply today!

Colorado employees will receive paid sick leave. For additional information
about available benefits, please contact James Shramek

* Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without
regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected
veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired
will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United
States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification
document form upon hire.

description:
DevOps Solution Architect  

Job Description  

You're raising the stakes for your career to do more. Learn more. Impact more.
Here, your innovation, ideas, and technical curiosity will help us deliver
better care for billions of people worldwide. You'll put your professional
expertise, talent, and drive to work by building and managing the technology
behind our portfolio of iconic brands.  

The Kimberly-Clark Information Technology Solutions (ITS) function is looking
for a DevOps Solution Architect who will be a leader with an established
record of DevOps organizational transformation and cloud adoption with
enterprise level customers. We'll lean on you to also have technical depth
across the Full DevOps Spectrum along with leading and advising higher level
executives, evangelizing enterprise cloud based DevOps transformations, and
pioneering the latest DevOps industry standards.  

As DevOps Solution Architect you will be accountable for leading and
establishing the DevOps practice. Educating, influencing and collaborating
with other solution engineers as well as engineering end-to-end solution in
the areas of automated build, deployment, monitoring and server
infrastructure.  

You'll need the ability to quickly understand development lifecycle needs. The
ability to not only code and configure tools, but also assemble and integrate
technology across disparate platforms is critical to success. This includes a
deep understanding of systems, data structures, modern scripting and
enterprise level languages as well as open source tools that can and should be
leveraged to solve problems.  

You'll collaborate with IT and business resources, requiring the ability to
present technical details to a non-technical audience.  

Duties and Responsibilities:  

Demonstrate proficiency in multiple DevOps related tools and technologies.  

* Own the quality of DevOps architecture and design, Lead and contribute to define industry standards and DevOps offerings and functionally decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions.
* Assist in the career development of others, actively mentoring individuals and the Amazon developer community on advanced technical issues and helping managers guide the career growth of their team members.
* Exert technical influence over multiple teams, increasing their productivity and effectiveness by sharing your deep knowledge and experience.
* Lead technical and design discussions with Executives to help enterprises speed their adoption of new technologies and practices, implement efficient end-to-end provisioning of automation solutions.
* Serve as a thought leader and SME for DevOps industry trends, new and existing technology offerings, and architectural concept, implementing DevOps best practices and provide architectural governance.
* Hands on experienceof continuous integration, continuous delivery, automated testing and all phases of the Software Development Life Cycle as well as in technical documentation skills
* Define and Experience with Application Lifecycle Management tools and Source Control systems, such as GIT,Azure DevOps/VSTS, static code analysis for codes quality and security -using SonarQube and Checkmarx
* Exposure to configuration management tools such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef, or similar, Docker & Kubernetes and strong Scripting experience in PowerShell or any other scripting languages, integrate systems using a wide variety of protocols like REST, SOAP, MQ, TCP/IP, JSON and others

Required Qualifications:  

* 12+ years of IT experience with 10+ years of software development or application or object-oriented language
* 3+ years of experience as a technical advisor.
* 3 + years of Experience on Azure DevOps tool in terms of building Build and Deployment pipelines
* Experience in cloudarchitecture and design with more than 6 years of experience in automating IT administration, IT processes, or business processes, deploying applications and provisioning infrastructure.
* Architectural leadership experience with microservices and distributed applications, such as containers, Kubernetes, and/or serverless technology, SDLC and delivery using Agile practices.
* Proven knowledge in any of the Code Review and Security tools, say SonarQube, Checkmarx, HCL Appscan, scripting languages like PowerShell, testing methodologies and tools like Selenium, Worksoft Certify and Unit Testing frameworks
* Experience in automating / integrating a broad range of systems and services using Terraform for any of the cloud Platforms like Azure or GCP
* Experience with project management and workflow tools such as Agile, Jira, Azure Boards, open-source technologies, and cloud services.
* Solid leadership, partnership, and communication skills, working with IT architecture with focus on reusability and automation
* Ability to coordinate with all levels of the firm to design and deliver technical solutions to business problems.

About Us  

Huggies®. Kleenex®. Cottonelle®. Scott®. Kotex®. Poise®. Depend®. 25% of
people in the world use Kimberly-Clark products every day, and it takes the
best people to make that happen.  

We're founded on 150 years of market leadership, and we're always looking for
new and better ways to perform, especially when it comes to product and
process innovation. Our customers are always looking for new and better. Our
competitors won't stop evolving. And our communities demand responsible
corporate practices. We need bold, transformative ideas from people who can
turn them into reality. That means there's no time like the present to make an
impact at Kimberly-Clark. It's all here for you at Kimberly-Clark .  

About You  

You were made to do this work: designing new technologies, diving into data,
optimizing digital experiences, and constantly developing better, faster ways
to get results. You want to be part of a performance culture dedicated to
building technology for a purpose that matters. You want to work in an
environment that promotes sustainability, inclusion, wellbeing, and career
development.  

You love what you do, especially when your work makes a difference. At
Kimberly-Clark, we're constantly exploring new ideas on how, when, and where
we can best achieve results. When you join our team, you'll experience Flex
That Works: flexible (hybrid) work arrangements that empower you to have
purposeful time in the office and partner with your leader to make flexibility
work for both you and the business.  

We always ask, "How can we improve this?" and we're looking for like-minded
people. This is one business that's not chained to the status quo. "Good
enough" isn't good enough here. We stay ahead by keeping on top of trends,
recognizing market gaps and looking to fill those gaps in ways that give us an
advantage. In our diverse workforce, we encourage and guide each other to
explore new ground, glad for the unique perspectives and skills every person
brings. Join us in our rewarding and profitable journey.  

Total Benefits  

Here are a few of the benefits you'd enjoy. For a complete overview, see
www.mykcbenefits.com .  

Great support for good health with medical, dental, and vision coverage
options. No waiting periods or pre-existing condition restrictions. Access to
an on-site fitness center, occupational health nurse, and allowances for high-
quality safety equipment.  

Flexible Savings and spending accounts to maximize health care options and
stretch dollars when caring for yourself or dependents.  

Diverse income protection insurance options to protect yourself and your
family in case of illness, injury, or other unexpected events.  

Additional programs and support to continue your education, adopt a child,
relocate, or even find temporary childcare.  

To Be Considered  

Click the Apply button and complete the online application process. A member
of our recruiting team will review your application and follow up if you seem
like a great fit for this role.  

In the meantime, check out the careers website . You'll want to review this
and come prepared with relevant questions if and when you pass GO and begin
interviews.  

And finally, the fine print...  

For Kimberly-Clark to grow and prosper, we must be an inclusive organization
that applies the diverse experiences and passions of its team members to
brands that make life better for people all around the world. We actively seek
to build a workforce that reflects the experiences of our consumers. When you
bring your original thinking to Kimberly-Clark, you fuel the continued success
of our enterprise. We are a committed equal opportunity employer, and all
qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected
veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, pregnancy, genetic
information, citizenship status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of
work performed by employees assigned to this classification. Statements are
not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all duties,
responsibilities and skills required for this position.  

K-C requires that an employee have authorization to work in the country in
which the role is based. In the event an applicant does not have current work
authorization, K-C will determine, in its sole discretion, whether to sponsor
an individual for work authorization. However, based on immigration
requirements, not all roles are suitable for sponsorship. This position is
subject to drug and alcohol testing, including pre-employment testing.  

Travel may include less than 10% of work time. Travel may also include travel
via aircrafts and motor vehicles to various locations, if applicable. Varying
working conditions may include prolonged sitting, typing and viewing
computer/laptop screens, along with occasional bending, reaching, lifting,
carrying, climbing, twisting, stooping, walking and standing.  

LI-remote

Primary Location  

USA-GA-Atlanta-Roswell  

Additional Locations  

USA-IL-Chicago, USA-TN-Knoxville, USA-TX-Dallas, USA-WI-Neenah  

Worker Type  

Employee  

Worker Sub-Type

description:
Come join Tyler Technologies as a DevOps Engineer! The Tyler Cloud Platform
team is looking for Engineers to build and run the services and infrastructure
that power the platform.  

This position will work an evening schedule to improve our team 's ability
to support our clients as broadly throughout the day as possible.  

We are hiring high quality engineers with a diverse set of experiences and
skill sets for positions on the cloud platform team delivering the vision of
Connected Communities. The strongest candidates will have a solid operations
expertise and demonstrated software development experience on large scale
cloud infrastructure. Our clients count on us to provide exceptional
availability, scalability, and security for services and infrastructure. As an
DevOps Engineer, you'll be on a team of engineers whose mission it is to build
and improve Tyler's most critical cloud services.  

Are you up to the challenge?

As a part of Tyler's corporate staff, you will make an impact on outcomes that
affect various areas of the company. Your work will ultimately support our
team members, clients, stakeholders, and the public sector.

Location

Remote

Responsibilities

* Architect, author, champion, and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, and security of Tyler's Cloud Platform services.
* _Design, build_* _ and manage_ systems, infrastructure and applications through automation that support self sufficiency
* Deploy, support, and monitor new and existing services, platforms, and application stacks
* Use scalable testing to measure, report, tune, and optimize system performance
* _Develop tools to improve our ability to rapidly deploy and effectively monitor services in a large-scale Kubernetes environment._
* Participate in periodic on-call duties
* Recommend new solutions and technologies
* Collaborate with team and others to share operational best practices
* Function well in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Cover after hours support needs with core hours from 5pm to 1am Pacific Time, M-F
* Provide an escalation path to the rest of the team after hours.

Qualifications

* 3+ years in a UNIX-based large-scale web operations role.
* _5+ years programming experience in Python, Perl, Node, Java/Scala, or C#_
* 3+ years designing and implementing, large-scale AWS production workloads
* _Experience with large scale Kubernetes architectures and configuration_
* Expert scripting knowledge, specifically for systems automation
* UNIX/Linux systems administration background
* Knowledge of most of these: data structures, relational and non-relational databases, networking, Linux internals, file systems, web architecture, and related topics
* Ability to guide technical teams through design and implementation across an organization
* Previous experience working an evening shift with geographically distributed coworkers.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills (including listening, speaking, and writing) and ability to work well in a diverse, team-focused environment with other DevOps, Engineers, Product Managers, etc.

Preferred Experience
* Experienced in configuration and deployment of containers at scale in AWS EKS, ECS, and Fargate
* Experienced in configuration, management, and monitoring of DataDog
* Experience authoring infrastructure using tools such as cloud-formation or terraform
* Experienced in configuration and management of CI/CD tooling like Github Actions, Jenkins or CircleCI
* Experienced database engineer with MySQL, specifically Aurora

State Specific Salary Range Disclosure Requirements for Colorado,

Connecticut, and Nevada

Salary will generally fall between $55,537 - $100,000 before adjustment for
geographic differences. Recruiter can confirm if position is incentive
eligible.

Great Place to Work & Grow Your Career

Come join us as we transform the public sector! Our mission, vision, and
values guide everything we do. We're also frequently recognized as a great
workplace locally and nationally. See our many awards and accolades.

Taking Care of You & Your Family

Your health and well-being are important to us. That's why we invest in our
team members by offering competitive benefits to support their health and
financial wellness. Learn more about how we care for our people.

Tyler is subject to regulations, guidelines, and/or client requirements
relating to the qualifications of Tyler personnel performing certain client
work. Because of the nature of this position, it is a requirement that the
candidate can successfully pass a federal background check at the time an
offer is extended and over the course of employment with Tyler.

description:
Sr. Analyst, IT - Finance Systems – HFM DevOps

Chicago, Pittsburgh, Remote

Do you want to work for a top 5 Food & Beverage company in the world? Do you
want to be a part of a Finance IT division that is rapidly expanding and can
offer multiple promotions and growth opportunities throughout your career?
Then apply to Kraft Heinz today to be a part of the greatness and you will see
how you valued you are in a company and in your career!

Position Summary

This high performing leader will partner with the various Finance
organizations within Kraft Heinz to build process and technology capabilities
that support their growth and strategic agenda. For this role to be a fit, you
must be a skilled relationship builder with the ability to work in fast paced
and ever-changing environments. This role will support business users and
overall operations in HFM and FDMEE space. This role will require close
collaboration with different teams and need to work as a team member of
Finance IT team.

Primary Responsibilities

* Responsible for administration of Hyperion Financial management and FDMEE applications.
* Manage month end close process to close books.
* Provide end user support, troubleshoot issue, and train end users.
* Maintain batch processes for data load and consolidations.
* Implement HFM and FDMEE system changes related to rules, reports, mappings etc.
* Act as primary liaison between Data Governance, Data Assurance, FP&A;, Controllers, and vendor teams to support Finance IT Systems operations.
* Maintain system documentation and controls on system changes and processes.
* Drive implementation of a strong control environment and robust processes.
* Ready to learn and contribute towards other Hyperion HFM and EPM initiatives as assigned.
* Mentor and support junior resources.
* Focus on continuous improvements and process automations to automate data loads and consolidation processes.
* Track deliverables and report status to management.
* Ability to work well under pressure; manage tight deadlines and situations where conflicting priorities arise.

Qualifications
* Minimum Bachelor’s Degree
* HFM/FDMEE Certification is plus

Domain Expertise

* Minimum of 4 years of functional and/or technical HFM and FDMEE
* Experience using Oracle Hyperion Suite of products (Planning / ePBCS).
* Knowledge of Data Management and EPM Automate
* Experience using Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), is a plus
* Can prioritize and balance multiple priorities
* Azure / Snowflake experience is a plus

Individual Skills

* Strong attention to detail
* Foundational scripting language experience (DOS & SQL)
* Strong leader, collaborator, team player, and individual contributor
* Strong communication skills with comfort in speaking with and presenting to IT leadership
* Strong Power Point and Excel user

Mindset & Behaviors

* Passion to challenge the status quo and find new solutions and drive out of the box ideas – loves and embraces change
* Believes in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust
* Not afraid to “roll up sleeves”; seeks to go beyond comfort to learn & pushes teams to do the same
* Empowers others to fail, learn, and grow with an experimental mindset to drive innovation

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

Experience:

* Oracle EPM: 4 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* HFM/FDMEE Certification (Preferred)

description:
Job Title: - Software Quality Engineer 
Location: - San Jose CA 
Currently seeking Senior Software Quality Engineers to join our exciting and
growing team. At you will have the opportunity to create software applications
that are used to help all people live healthy lives.

Senior Software Quality Engineer is responsible for the development and
execution of software test strategies/techniques, schedules, plans, designs,
procedures, and automated scripts or code for testing complex software systems
within project boundaries established by management. 
Uses independent judgment to assess project test status and product
acceptance. 
Responsible for leading small to medium Software Quality Engineering teams. 
Reviews requirements, design documentation, and code to assess correctness,
completeness, testability, and usability. 
Performs automated and manual, black and white box testing. 
Sets up test data and configures hardware for verification of software
applications. Determines the means to overcome technical problems. 
Analyzes, reports and maintains documentation of test results, defect reports
and requests for change. 
Works on complex problems where analysis of data requires an in-depth
evaluation of various factors. 
Exercises judgment within generally defined practices and policies in
selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Normally receives no
instruction on routine work, general instructions on new assignments.

Responsibilities: 
Determines scope of work for complex tasks and establishes project test
schedules. Responsible for ensuring team adheres to project test schedules. 
Responsible for establishing and documenting software project test strategies
and techniques in a Test Plan. 
Responsible for translating requirements for complex software systems into
traceable test suite documentation including: Test Designs, Test Procedures,
Automated Test Scripts or code. 
Responsible for executing Test Procedures, automated test scripts and code,
exploratory testing both on the instrument and in a simulated environment,
submitting clear and concise defect reports, regressing defect corrections,
and entering requests for change to improve the usability of the product. 
Participates in code inspections, technical reviews, and design reviews. 
Work with application developers to assess the application's potential cyber
security risks and develop test plans accordingly. 
Works proactively with staff from Systems Verification and Validation to
determine the best strategy for project test coverage. 
Presents project test data at project review meetings, and presents product
acceptance determination. 
Communicates project test status, progress, problems and changes to program as
well as functional management. 
Recommends options to resolve testing issues. Participates in defect reviews. 
Initiates interaction with other departments to maintain open information
channels and to facilitate transfer of technology. 
Demonstrates knowledge of Manufacturing, Service, Quality/Regulatory, Training
requirements and actively participates in multifunctional product development
teams and develops expertise recognized by other technical groups in B. 
Develops knowledge of B products through training and use. Contributes to the
advancement of process capability for software quality engineering. 
Leads brainstorming sessions for software quality engineering process
improvements, identifies specific improvement options, and presents to
management. 
Writes/revises Desk Procedures, with appropriate reviews and approvals.
Recommends innovations and improved methods, and tools. 
Recommends and participates in functional training to advance the capabilities
of the group. 
Continues pursuit of software quality engineering knowledge through seminars,
webinars, technical publications, and contact with members of profession at
technical meetings. 
Provides technical guidance and instruction to less senior technical staff. 
Performs other related duties and assignments as required. 
Keeps abreast of the basic requirements for compliance in own area of work and
complies with those requirements. 
Participates as required in training on regulatory issues affecting own area
of work. Brings regulatory compliance questions/issues to the attention of
management. 
Participates in Environmental Health and Safety programs. 
Addresses corrective actions whenever a hazard is identified. 
Notifies supervisor of all observed hazardous conditions or unsafe work
practices.

Qualifications: 
Required 
Typically requires a BS degree in a related discipline (PhD is equivalent to
MS plus two years of directly related technical experience; MS is equivalent
to BS plus one year of directly related technical experience) and six years of
direct technical experience in software quality engineering, or equivalent
combination of related education and experience. 
Must possess ability to communicate technical ideas clearly. 
Demonstration of value creation for the business through effective
implementation of software testing methodologies, process improvements,
productivity improvements, and applied software testing practices. 
Good understanding of how to test software applications for cyber security
risks.

Hana

619-324-4008

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

description:
About this Role

The DevOps Engineer is critical to the project’s overall success, from
planning to supporting primary KPIs such as customer satisfaction and
productivity. A DevOps Engineer has an essential role in integrating the
project functions and resources across the product life cycle, right from
planning, building, testing, and deployment to support. DevOps Engineers are
conversant with all the technical as well as IT operations aspects for
integrated operations.

Working as a DevOps Engineer at PropStream, you’ll bring positive energy,
dynamic, detail-oriented, pride, and passion to automating the development and
cloud infrastructure processes. You’ll be developing and deploying complex
infrastructures and technical solutions.

Responsibilities:

* Design and build scalable, reliable, and secure cloud infrastructure
* Provision, configure and maintain AWS cloud infrastructure defined as code (CDK)
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for reliable deployments and rollbacks as needed
* Triage incidents affecting application performance, uptime, and infrastructure health
* Promote and develop DevOps best practices by collaborating with developers/managers during various phases of development
* Improve site performance and reliability with a focus on high availability, security, and scalability through effective monitoring, alerting, automation, and infrastructure reviews
* Ensure monitoring and health of resources deployed
* Defining and setting development, test, release, update, and support process for DevOps operation
* Troubleshooting techniques and finding code bugs
* Monitoring the processes during the entire lifecycle for its adherence and updating or creating new processes for improvement and minimizing wastage
* Document procedures used during deployment cycles
* Implement clean and maintainable infrastructure-as-code that adheres to industry best practices

Requirements:
* 3+ years experience in AWS
* 2+ years experience in DevOps pipeline development
* A desire to write tools and applications to automate work rather than doing things manually
* CI/CD Automation experience with configuration/deployment management systems such as, Terraform, AWS Cloud Formation, Jenkins, Git or other such tools
* AWS and CodeDeploy experience preferred
* Experience with the following or similar languages: Python, Java, PostgreSQL
* Experience with Linux OS
* Proficient with Git and Git workflows
* Working knowledge of containerization (Docker) and supporting technologies a plus
* Strong verbal and written communication
* Ability to meet deadlines and adapt to changing conditions
* Able to multi-task, well organized, and a self-starter
* Be on weekend on-call rotations with other DevOps engineers

About the Company

PropStream was founded in 2006 and has become the leading real estate data
solution to real

identify new opportunities and effectively grow their businesses. In November

independent entity.

including, but not

description:
Department Summary  

DISH is transforming the future of connectivity. We're doing it by building
the country's first virtualized, standalone 5G wireless network from scratch.
The foundation of a connected world, it's a network free of the limitations of
the past, and flexible enough to satisfy all the social, economic and
transformative needs of the changing world.  

Job Duties and Responsibilities  

DISH Wireless is seeking a CI/CD DevOps Engineer II to build and manage the
automation process for the continuous delivery (CI), continuous delivery (CD),
and continuous validation (CV) of the 5G Network functions. This person would
work closely with network functions ISVs, testers, and DISH's engineering &
operations teams to integrate, test, and deploy the artifacts necessary to
realize zero-touch operations of DISH's 5G network.  

Day-to-day job responsibilities:  

* Design, develop and maintain features and functionalities of DISH 5G Network CI/CD pipelines 
* Configure and manage the tools necessary to successfully deploy new features into the 5G network 
* Create the necessary feedback loops to communicate the status of the pipeline to the stakeholders 
* Configure and maintain the Git Repo, Docker registry, CI tool, configuration and deployment tools 
* 5. Learn, evaluate and implement new technologies to further our quality and delivery capabilities 
* Work in a Scrum team to add functionalities to the CI/CD process 
* Work within an Agile development framework to deliver high-quality software 
* Create process to analyze logs as a way to determine the health of the feature deployment 
* Design and develop state-of-the-art approaches to solving complex quality issues 
* Communicate clearly with Product Owners, Developers and management to establish understanding of issues to address and proposed solutions 

LI-HMM

Skills, Experience and Requirements  

The successful CI/CD DevOps Engineer II will have:  

* The ideal candidate has 2-4 years of experience in a related role with mid- to large-sized companies and has demonstrated the following: 
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical degree 
* At least 2 years of experience using Cloud technologies such as AWS, VMC, GCP, and/or Azure 
* At least 2 years of experience using CI/CD and DevOps tools such as Java, Java Script, Python, Grafana, Gitlab, GitLab-CI, Jira, Kubernetes, Docker, Ansible, Splunk 
* Experience deploying Cloud Native Applications, building and managing microservices, and creating tools to monitor real time metrics in the pipeline 
* Experience deploying Docker containers in multiple Kubernetes clusters using deployment strategies such as Blue/Green, Canary, Rolling 
* Experience building pipelines as code using YAML specs 
* Experience using Jira, Confluence, or similar bug tracking and documentation tools 
* Demonstrated ability to identify, troubleshoot, diagnose and fully define problems 

Salary Range  

Compensation: $75,600.00/Year - $124,200.00/Year 
Benefits  

From versatile health perks to new career opportunities, check out our
benefits on our careers website .  

Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may
include a drug test.

description:
We are currently looking for a full-time DevOps Engineer to support the
infrastructure needs of our growing team. In this 
role, you'll be the second DevOps hire and will work directly with our lead
DevOps Engineer to maintain 
the reliability, security, scalability and deployment of our platform.  

Responsibilities  

* Build, integrate, test, monitor and deploy code across multiple cloud and on-premise environments
* Build tooling to assist with maintenance, upgrades, deployments and monitoring of AWS and on-premise
* environments.
* Assist with provisioning and setting up new AWS environments for dedicated cloud installations.
* Help maintain data security policies and best practices by designing and implementing secure, immutable
* infrastructure through infrastructure as code and thoughtful security practices compatible with external standards(SOC2)

Requirements-  
* 3 to 6 years of DevOps industry experience
* Familiar with Linux, command line, bash scripting, yaml
* Experience with cloud and on-premise containerized infrastructure built with Docker, Kubernetes, Helm,
* Terraform, Packer, GitHub, and Min.IO
* Experience working with AWS cloud architecture and services such as VPC, EKS, EC2, S3, RDS
* Experience with PostgreSQL and AWS storage encryption, data at rest, and data in transit
* Familiarity defining and executing CI/CD pipelines with tools like Docker, GitHub, CircleCI
* Experience with monitoring services like DataDog is preferred
