description:
Department Summary  

DISH is transforming the future of connectivity. We're doing it by building
the country's first virtualized, standalone 5G wireless network from scratch.
The foundation of a connected world, it's a network free of the limitations of
the past, and flexible enough to satisfy all the social, economic and
transformative needs of the changing world.  

Job Duties and Responsibilities  

DISH Wireless is seeking a CI/CD DevOps Engineer II to build and manage the
automation process for the continuous delivery (CI), continuous delivery (CD),
and continuous validation (CV) of the 5G Network functions. This person would
work closely with network functions ISVs, testers, and DISH's engineering &
operations teams to integrate, test, and deploy the artifacts necessary to
realize zero-touch operations of DISH's 5G network.  

Day-to-day job responsibilities:  

* Design, develop and maintain features and functionalities of DISH 5G Network CI/CD pipelines 
* Configure and manage the tools necessary to successfully deploy new features into the 5G network 
* Create the necessary feedback loops to communicate the status of the pipeline to the stakeholders 
* Configure and maintain the Git Repo, Docker registry, CI tool, configuration and deployment tools 
* 5. Learn, evaluate and implement new technologies to further our quality and delivery capabilities 
* Work in a Scrum team to add functionalities to the CI/CD process 
* Work within an Agile development framework to deliver high-quality software 
* Create process to analyze logs as a way to determine the health of the feature deployment 
* Design and develop state-of-the-art approaches to solving complex quality issues 
* Communicate clearly with Product Owners, Developers and management to establish understanding of issues to address and proposed solutions 

LI-HMM

Skills, Experience and Requirements  

The successful CI/CD DevOps Engineer II will have:  

* The ideal candidate has 2-4 years of experience in a related role with mid- to large-sized companies and has demonstrated the following: 
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related technical degree 
* At least 2 years of experience using Cloud technologies such as AWS, VMC, GCP, and/or Azure 
* At least 2 years of experience using CI/CD and DevOps tools such as Java, Java Script, Python, Grafana, Gitlab, GitLab-CI, Jira, Kubernetes, Docker, Ansible, Splunk 
* Experience deploying Cloud Native Applications, building and managing microservices, and creating tools to monitor real time metrics in the pipeline 
* Experience deploying Docker containers in multiple Kubernetes clusters using deployment strategies such as Blue/Green, Canary, Rolling 
* Experience building pipelines as code using YAML specs 
* Experience using Jira, Confluence, or similar bug tracking and documentation tools 
* Demonstrated ability to identify, troubleshoot, diagnose and fully define problems 

Salary Range  

Compensation: $75,600.00/Year - $124,200.00/Year 
Benefits  

From versatile health perks to new career opportunities, check out our
benefits on our careers website .  

Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may
include a drug test.

description:
Responsibilities:

* Project Planning - work closely with development teams, provide guidance and expertise on system options, risk, impact and costs vs. benefits.
* Development - install and configure solutions, assist with all stages of test data, perform script maintenance and updates.
* Deployment - build automated deployments. Deploy new modules and upgrades and complete fixes within the production environment. Documenting knowledge transfer.
* Maintenance and Troubleshooting - Routine application maintenance tasks, create requirements and procedures for implementing routine maintenance, troubleshoot existing information systems for errors and resolving those errors.
* Performance and Cost Management - evaluate existing applications and platforms and give recommendations for enhancing performance and reducing operational cost.

Qualifications:
* Git version management and best practices
* Infrastructure As Code – Preferably Terraform
* Configuration Management with one of the following (Ansible | SSM | Salt | Puppet | Chef)
* CI/CD Development and Maintenance (Azure DevOps | Jenkins | Other).
* Cloud Infrastructure Knowledge and working experience (AWS | Azure | GCP)
* Working knowledge of Containers and administration of such (Docker | Kubernetes)
* Scripting languages, at least one of Powershell/Bash
* Strong Linux System Administration skills
* Ability to automate complex processes using multiple toolchains and programming languages
* Experience receiving inputs and creating | populating complex variable/s group/s
* Selected applicant will be subject to a background investigation, which will be conducted and the results of which will be used in compliance with applicable law.
* Selected applicant will be subject to a background investigation, which will be conducted and the results of which will be used in compliance with applicable law.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $84,063.98 - $130,134.93 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Application Question(s):

* What is your annual salary expectation?
* Are you US Citizen?
* Are you Green Card Holder?

Experience:

* Azure: 1 year (Preferred)
* AWS: 1 year (Preferred)
* Google Cloud Platform: 1 year (Preferred)
* SAP: 1 year (Preferred)
* Devops Engineer: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: One location

Software Engineer

This person will perform duties related to application development and
operational support. Overseeing environments’ health and facilitation of high
priority incidents to improve the state of service availability and
continuity. Develop processes and activities that focus on restoring service
after an incident occurs. Understand the interactions between systems, the
applications and services hosted and evaluate the impact of changes and
additions. Perform analysis on existing systems to ensure performance and
reliability, enhance scalability, meet security requirements and interoperable
and maintainable technology portfolio. Design, develop, modify, and/or test
software applications for the healthcare industry.

Primary Responsibilities:

* Perform all phases of software engineering including requirements analysis, application design code development and testing
* Partner with engineering / product management groups and represent operations, influence capability prioritization process with reliability challenges and operational investments
* Ability to work in a DevOps frame of work and responsibilities
* Collaborate with System Analysts and Product Owners to align business requirements to the functionality of the application
* Troubleshoot production support issues post-deployment and come up with solutions as required
* Monitor and assess end to end performance on services by understanding all infrastructure components within the service chain
* Utilize ITSM tools to manage high priority incidents and reference problems, changes and configuration items
* Utilize infrastructure and application tools (Splunk, Grafana, and Micro Focus BSM) to monitor the health of large scale systems
* Utilize ChatOps and ChatBot technologies
* Identify opportunities to automate routine tasks

Requirements
* 4+ years of relevant application development and DevOps processing experience
* Knowledge of monitoring tools, automation scripts, and overall automation to reduce manual efforts
* Experience working with Open Source technology such as Git/GitHub, OpenShift, Kubernetes.
* Experience working with Python, JavaScript, HTML.
* Experience working in an Agile CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery) development environment
* Experience with writing batch files, PowerShell scripts or UNIX shell scripts
* Excellent written communication skills and ability to document technical content
* 4 year degree in computer science or equivalent experience

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: From $65.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: One location

description:
Responsibilities

Play a key role in the delivery of world-class patient care. Leverage
innovative technology to advance high-quality care. Take your career in a
rewarding new direction. At UCLA Health, you can do all this and more.

Under the direction of the Cloud Platform Services Manager, the Cloud DevOps
Engineer will be responsible for cloud infrastructure and application design
and implementation, DevOps optimizations, and 3rd party integrations. You will
apply DevSecOps principles to cloud infrastructure and is responsible for the
construction of landing zones and deployment of respective capabilities.
Additional responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Infrastructure production
* Security issues, and their underlying causes
* Maintaining and supporting current environments while identifying and executing system architecture and process improvements
* Building tooling to enable faster deployments and reliable rollbacks
* Write code and design processes to improve the delivery of our cloud instances and applications

Qualifications

Required  
* Extensive professional experience with Azure in a production environment (network, security, applications, serverless, and containers)
* Knowledgeable in cloud networking - security, identity and access management, DNS, etc.
* Eble to work with Terraform at an Enterprise level
* Strong experience with Linux system administration
* Experience with Configuration Management systems (i.e., Puppet, Ansible, Chef).
* Proven track record of supporting production systems, and able to effectively coordinate cloud infrastructure service requests and incident response
* Strong sense of ownership and can prioritize and work on tasks independently

Highly preferred  

* Professional experience with AWS.
* Experience with CI/CD systems such as Github Actions, CodeBuild/CodePipeline, or Azure DevOps
* Familiarity with Docker and Containerization of applications
* History of working in a HIPAA compliant environment

UCLA is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified
applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,
color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,
disability, or protected Veteran status.

description:
AWS DevOps Engineer (REMOTE)  

Position Description 
CGI has an immediate need for an AWS DevOps Engineer to join our financial
services team in one of our selected CGI locations. Due to the current
COVID-19 status, candidates will not be required to work within the physical
work location at this time. When COVID-19 restrictions are lifted, they will
be required to be located within the proximity of the assigned CGI location.  

This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced team environment
supporting one of the largest leaders in the secondary mortgage industry. We
take an innovative approach to supporting our client, working side-by-side in
an agile environment using emerging technologies.  

* We partner with 15 of the top 20 banks globally, and our top 10 banking clients have worked with us for an average of 26 years!
* We have over 73,000+ CGI Members in 40 countries and over 5k+ loyal Clients who are leveraging our end-to-end services across the globe

Project Pitch 
This position is a part of the strategic initiatives projects in Capital
Markets area working on the latest tech stack. Join a fast paced team to grow
your career. High aptitude, desire to grow and the right attitude are key to
success in this role.  

Your future duties and responsibilities  

* Build and deploy CICD pipeline using GitLab with multiple technologies like AWS
* Participate in technical design and choose the right tools such as AWS, Tomcat, WebLogic, and Spring Boot application
* Implement standards, processes, and controls for release and deployment activities in DevOps space

Required qualifications to be successful in this role  

* 8+ years of relevant experience
* AWS hands-on experience required.
* Hands-on experience in building application CI/CD pipeline using GitLab, expertise in setting up CI/CD
* Should be hands on with application build automation tool Maven/Gradle
* Experience in writing Groovy/Python Scripts for executing commands on GitLab/Jenkins for build/deploying application
* Experience in working with application Git/BitBucket - branching strategy
* Experience in using Sonar for continuous inspection of application code to detect bugs, code smells and security vulnerabilities
* Experience in using Nexus Artifact repository & Component lifecycle management for given application
* Experience in automating application deployments, some exposure to application deployment to AWS Infrastructure
* Experience with full SDLC lifecycle, taking from Dev to Release
* Experience with Urban Code Deployment (UCD)
* Excellent communication, and documentation skills
* Professional demeanor
* Must be well versed in creating CI/CD pipelines, build docker containers

Desired Skillset 
AWS, CI/CD  

EDUCATION REQUIREMENT 
Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field 
AWS Solution Architect Associate or Developer Associate certification desired  

li-df1

dice

Insights you can act on  

While technology is at the heart of our clients' digital transformation, we
understand that people are at the heart of business success.  

When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues
and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and
sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI
shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to
build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it
has brought us to where we are today - one of the world's largest independent
providers of IT and business consulting services.  

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a
work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more
inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower
all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any
point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to
assist.  

Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI - where your ideas and
actions make a difference.  

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard
to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national
origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military
and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual
orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status,
political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected
status or characteristics.  

CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with
disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S.,
please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at
USEmploymentCompliance@cgi.com . You will need to reference the requisition
number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be
routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this
email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an
accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do
not include a requisition number will not be returned.  

We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be
directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service
members.  

All CGI offers of employment in the U.S. are contingent upon the ability to
successfully complete a background investigation. Background investigation
components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US
government security clearance held. CGI will consider for employment qualified
applicants with arrests and conviction records in accordance with all local
regulations and ordinances.  

CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees
or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their
own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who
have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants
as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other
employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to
compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal
complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding,
hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or
(c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information.  

Skills

* Python 
* DevOps
* GitLab

description:
Come join Tyler Technologies as a DevOps Engineer! The Tyler Cloud Platform
team is looking for Engineers to build and run the services and infrastructure
that power the platform.  

This position will work an evening schedule to improve our team 's ability
to support our clients as broadly throughout the day as possible.  

We are hiring high quality engineers with a diverse set of experiences and
skill sets for positions on the cloud platform team delivering the vision of
Connected Communities. The strongest candidates will have a solid operations
expertise and demonstrated software development experience on large scale
cloud infrastructure. Our clients count on us to provide exceptional
availability, scalability, and security for services and infrastructure. As an
DevOps Engineer, you'll be on a team of engineers whose mission it is to build
and improve Tyler's most critical cloud services.  

Are you up to the challenge?

As a part of Tyler's corporate staff, you will make an impact on outcomes that
affect various areas of the company. Your work will ultimately support our
team members, clients, stakeholders, and the public sector.

Location

Remote

Responsibilities

* Architect, author, champion, and deliver software to improve the availability, scalability, and security of Tyler's Cloud Platform services.
* _Design, build_* _ and manage_ systems, infrastructure and applications through automation that support self sufficiency
* Deploy, support, and monitor new and existing services, platforms, and application stacks
* Use scalable testing to measure, report, tune, and optimize system performance
* _Develop tools to improve our ability to rapidly deploy and effectively monitor services in a large-scale Kubernetes environment._
* Participate in periodic on-call duties
* Recommend new solutions and technologies
* Collaborate with team and others to share operational best practices
* Function well in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment.
* Cover after hours support needs with core hours from 5pm to 1am Pacific Time, M-F
* Provide an escalation path to the rest of the team after hours.

Qualifications

* 3+ years in a UNIX-based large-scale web operations role.
* _5+ years programming experience in Python, Perl, Node, Java/Scala, or C#_
* 3+ years designing and implementing, large-scale AWS production workloads
* _Experience with large scale Kubernetes architectures and configuration_
* Expert scripting knowledge, specifically for systems automation
* UNIX/Linux systems administration background
* Knowledge of most of these: data structures, relational and non-relational databases, networking, Linux internals, file systems, web architecture, and related topics
* Ability to guide technical teams through design and implementation across an organization
* Previous experience working an evening shift with geographically distributed coworkers.
* Strong interpersonal communication skills (including listening, speaking, and writing) and ability to work well in a diverse, team-focused environment with other DevOps, Engineers, Product Managers, etc.

Preferred Experience
* Experienced in configuration and deployment of containers at scale in AWS EKS, ECS, and Fargate
* Experienced in configuration, management, and monitoring of DataDog
* Experience authoring infrastructure using tools such as cloud-formation or terraform
* Experienced in configuration and management of CI/CD tooling like Github Actions, Jenkins or CircleCI
* Experienced database engineer with MySQL, specifically Aurora

State Specific Salary Range Disclosure Requirements for Colorado,

Connecticut, and Nevada

Salary will generally fall between $55,537 - $100,000 before adjustment for
geographic differences. Recruiter can confirm if position is incentive
eligible.

Great Place to Work & Grow Your Career

Come join us as we transform the public sector! Our mission, vision, and
values guide everything we do. We're also frequently recognized as a great
workplace locally and nationally. See our many awards and accolades.

Taking Care of You & Your Family

Your health and well-being are important to us. That's why we invest in our
team members by offering competitive benefits to support their health and
financial wellness. Learn more about how we care for our people.

Tyler is subject to regulations, guidelines, and/or client requirements
relating to the qualifications of Tyler personnel performing certain client
work. Because of the nature of this position, it is a requirement that the
candidate can successfully pass a federal background check at the time an
offer is extended and over the course of employment with Tyler.

description:
Great Day Improvements, a top 10 home remodeling company, is experiencing
double digit growth and is undergoing a digital transformation of the
business.

Our success has allowed us to make significant investments in the business to
further fuel our growth, including a technology-enabled end-to-end customer
experience platform.

We are looking for key DevOps engineers who want to make our vision a reality.
The right individuals are energized by building and creating, not just
managing tickets. You will have the chance to support a technology platform
from the ground up, alongside a team of highly skilled and dedicated
engineers.

We are committed to investing in our future and in our people. Join us at this
exciting stage in our business!

The DevOps engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, testing,
publishing, and documenting an enterprise level cloud application. 
Primary Job Duties 
· Work with technical engineers at large to understand its CI/CD and release
management needs to be able to transform those understandings into solution
requirements.

· Implement and maintain various aspects of CI/CD release cycle using CLI
scripting, tools, and datasets

· Must understand application architecture and configuration structure very
well

· Design continuous integration, continuous testing, continuous delivery, and
configuration management for enterprise software solutions,
monitoring/observability, and cloud platforms, and provide technical oversight
of DevOps implementation and delivery.

· APM - Monitor distributed application clusters in multiple environments
(dev, uat, prod etc...)

· Managing IDP: security catalogs, roles and ACL descriptors in IDP solution

· Admin cloud infrastructure (block storage, compute, network topologies)

· Identify and evaluate the value of emerging technology 
Skills 
· 3+ years API deploy/development with any modern tech stack (e.g., .NET,
Java, Node, Elixir etc...)

· Web/Http APIS: reverse proxy, SSL termination, balancing and related topics

· Base IP networking: net classes, NAT, subnets, masking etc.

· Security: OAuth/OpenIDC management, roles, ACLs

· Command Line Interface scripting / CLI tools in Linux/Bash experience is
required

· Basic understanding of distributed architecture topics: queues, events,
APIS/services

· Base knowledge of databases, RDBMS, NoSQL/Document. Replication and sharding

· Strong Communication skills with ability to work within a distributed team
in the USA

· Documentation skills are required

· Knowledge of modern frameworks/languages is a big plus (e.g., .NET, Java,
Node, Python)

· Knowledge of cloud service providers is a plus: AWS, GCP, Azure et.al.

· GitHub et.al projects/demos/Portfolio is a major plus

About Great Day Improvements, LLC

Great Day Improvements is a vertically integrated, direct-to-consumer provider
of branded premium building products, including Patio Enclosures brand
sunrooms and screen rooms; Stanek brand windows and patio doors; Apex Energy
Solutions energy efficient windows and doors; and Hartshorn Custom Contracting
pool enclosures and lanais. In the last 5 years, Great Day Improvements has
more than quadrupled in size and footprint, expanding its workforce to over
740 employees across 62 metropolitan markets throughout the United States. The
company has been named to REMODELING Magazine’s 550 List and Qualified
Remodeler’s Top 500 List, and is among Inc. Magazine’s fastest growing private
companies. Great Day Improvements has an excellent reputation with an A rating
from the BBB and an overall Google rating of 4.6 with over 2,300 reviews. To
learn more, visit www.patioenclosures.com, www.stanekwindows.com,
www.greatdayimprovements.com, www.hccscreens.com www.apexenergygroup.com

Equal Employment Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without
regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected
veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Right to Work

In compliance with federal law, all personals hired will be required to verify
identify and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the
required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Command line scripting: 3 years (Preferred)
* AWS/GCP/AZURE CLI as code (not using UI): 3 years (Preferred)
* Software configuration: 3 years (Preferred)
* Networking knowledge (IP/NAT, HTTPs/balancing, routing, SSL): 3 years (Preferred)
* APM: Logging/Telemetry/Alerting: 3 years (Preferred)
* Deploy: CI/CD: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

description:
Do you have the skills--and drive--to join a tech team that's working to
digitally transform a trillion-dollar industry? From test-driving the latest
technologies to creating intuitive consumer apps, Liberty Mutual is constantly
innovating and creating industry-leading solutions that provide peace of mind
for our customers worldwide.

As a software engineer on this Customer Success team at Liberty Mutual, you'll
apply your talents in an agile environment that has the creative energy of a
start-up--and the full backing and comprehensive benefits of a Fortune 100
company.

Note: This is a range posting - Software/Sr. Software Engineer - and the final
offer will be based on the candidate's skills and experiences.

Responsibilities:

* Provide technical support to Liberty Mutual's product development teams as they use our CI/CD tool suite to build and deploy code to our internal and cloud computing environments.
* Guide developers to self-service options for resolving issues.
* Troubleshoot CI/CD platform and infrastructure automation errors, provide solutions and escalate issues as needed.
* Interface with and direct customers to other teams as needed.
* Observe trends in ticket types or questions asked and engage with product teams to provide solutions for known issues.
* Learn the inner workings of our end-to-end CI/CD software delivery environment and innovative public cloud infrastructure automation.
* Improve the developer experience: reduce obstacles and provide solutions.
* Develop automation to provide fast resolution for common inquiries.
* Create self-service documentation and utilities.
* We encourage innovative ideas to improve our development community's experience.
* Demonstrated success in Jenkins, JIRA, AWS, Pipelines
* Familiarity with CI/CD deployment tools and agile software development practices is desired, including Jira, GitHub, Bamboo, Jenkins, Artifactory, AWS, Azure, GCP Cloud Foundry
* Experience working in an agile environment utilizing Scrum, Kanban or XP.
* Strong oral and written communication skills--and a knack for explaining your decision-making process to non-engineers.
* A collaborative, adaptable working style, demonstrated initiative and the ability to prioritize your time and efforts.
* A Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline, or equivalent experience.
* Troubleshooting complex systems, and needing an understanding of cloud computing, DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and cloud engineering best practices.

At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently
pursue tomorrow. That's why we provide an environment focused on openness,
inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you'll discover our expansive range of
roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding
profession.  

Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a "Great Place to Work" by Great
Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of
the "100 Best Places to Work in IT" on IDG's Insider Pro and Computerworld's
2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of
America's Best Employers for Women and one of America's Best Employers for New
Graduates--as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity. To learn
more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit:
https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion  

We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and
we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-
being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit:
https://LMI.co/Benefits  

Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate
discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual
orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran's status,
pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or
local law.

Bachelor's Degree 
15

description:
About this Role

The DevOps Engineer is critical to the project’s overall success, from
planning to supporting primary KPIs such as customer satisfaction and
productivity. A DevOps Engineer has an essential role in integrating the
project functions and resources across the product life cycle, right from
planning, building, testing, and deployment to support. DevOps Engineers are
conversant with all the technical as well as IT operations aspects for
integrated operations.

Working as a DevOps Engineer at PropStream, you’ll bring positive energy,
dynamic, detail-oriented, pride, and passion to automating the development and
cloud infrastructure processes. You’ll be developing and deploying complex
infrastructures and technical solutions.

Responsibilities:

* Design and build scalable, reliable, and secure cloud infrastructure
* Provision, configure and maintain AWS cloud infrastructure defined as code (CDK)
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for reliable deployments and rollbacks as needed
* Triage incidents affecting application performance, uptime, and infrastructure health
* Promote and develop DevOps best practices by collaborating with developers/managers during various phases of development
* Improve site performance and reliability with a focus on high availability, security, and scalability through effective monitoring, alerting, automation, and infrastructure reviews
* Ensure monitoring and health of resources deployed
* Defining and setting development, test, release, update, and support process for DevOps operation
* Troubleshooting techniques and finding code bugs
* Monitoring the processes during the entire lifecycle for its adherence and updating or creating new processes for improvement and minimizing wastage
* Document procedures used during deployment cycles
* Implement clean and maintainable infrastructure-as-code that adheres to industry best practices

Requirements:
* 3+ years experience in AWS
* 2+ years experience in DevOps pipeline development
* A desire to write tools and applications to automate work rather than doing things manually
* CI/CD Automation experience with configuration/deployment management systems such as, Terraform, AWS Cloud Formation, Jenkins, Git or other such tools
* AWS and CodeDeploy experience preferred
* Experience with the following or similar languages: Python, Java, PostgreSQL
* Experience with Linux OS
* Proficient with Git and Git workflows
* Working knowledge of containerization (Docker) and supporting technologies a plus
* Strong verbal and written communication
* Ability to meet deadlines and adapt to changing conditions
* Able to multi-task, well organized, and a self-starter
* Be on weekend on-call rotations with other DevOps engineers

About the Company

PropStream was founded in 2006 and has become the leading real estate data
solution to real

estate investors, agents, and service providers providing the data and tools
they need to

identify new opportunities and effectively grow their businesses. In November
2021,

PropStream became part of the Stewart Title family (NYSE: STC) yet continues
to operate as an

independent entity.

Headquartered in Lake Forest, CA, PropStream currently maintains a remote and
hybrid-

friendly working environment. Our team is diverse, innovative, dynamic, and
has a passion for

providing an exceptional customer experience in everything that we do.

Benefits Package

PropStream provides a competitive and comprehensive benefits package
including, but not

limited to, paid medical and dental benefits, PTO, bonus potential, and
internal advancement

opportunities.

The salary for this position is DOE.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401K with company match
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Flexible Work Environment:
* We offer our employees flexibility in their work location. Whether you prefer to work onsite at our headquarters office in Lake Forest, CA, work fully remote from your home, or a hybrid solution, we have a place for you.

Please note: All remote work must be performed within the United States.

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on
a full-time

basis now and in the future. We are unable to sponsor currently. 

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* On call
* Weekend availability

Experience:

* AWS: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

About Net Health 
 * _Belong. Thrive. Make a Difference._* 
Are you looking for a meaningful and satisfying career where you have endless
opportunities to grow and be financially rewarded? Net Health may be the
perfect place for you. 
A high-growth and profitable company, we help caregivers harness data for
human health. We also honor and respect the needs of our Net Health family and
staff, which is why we offer a work-from-anywhere environment and unlimited
PTO. Our welcoming and collaborative culture paired with progressive benefits
makes Net Health the ultimate career home! 
As a leading-edge SaaS company in healthcare, we deliver solutions that help
patients get better, faster, and live more fulfilling lives. Our software and
predictive analytics cover the continuum of care, from hospital-to-home,
across various medical specialties. Come join us and start the next chapter of
your exciting career while helping others to live better lives. 
 * _World-Class Benefits That Reflect Our World-Class Culture._* 
Click Here to Learn More!:  

WorkFromAnywhere #UnlimitedPTO #ComprehensiveBenefitsPackage

EmployeeResourceGroups #CasualDressCode #PrioritizedEmployeeWellness

DiversityAndInclusion #AVoice #NewHireSupport #CareerDevelopment

EducationalAssistance #EmployeeReferralBonus #ProgressiveParentalLeave

Net Health, a leading developer of specialized EMRs across various markets, is
looking for an experienced DBA who can help support our development teams as
they build apps and services using data at scale across multiple product
lines. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of Relational Database
systems, with some exposure to the DevOps methodology, nosql/document
databases, and containerization. The candidate should be as comfortable
designing tables and indexes as they are advising development teams on the
tradeoffs between standard row based data stores, columnar database systems,
or document based databases. 
 Purpose: The Devops DBA will be responsible for working with development
teams to design and build resilient, well-performing data environments that
meet our application needs in the most efficient, economic way possible.

* Essential Job Functions: 

* Work with a cross functional team in an Agile/Scrum process to refine stories into work product that meets Net Health’s standards for quality, performance, and usefulness within project timelines.
* Be able to translate stories into needed data stores, tables, queries, and processes required to meet story needs.
* Make sure projects are built for easy verification by automated testing and easy integration into CI/CD Pipelines
* Ability to turn feedback from internal stakeholders into meaningful courses of action
* Troubleshoot and tune poorly performing queries
* Monitor usage in production environments and design and execute plans to meet our SLOs around performance.
* Troubleshoot problems and provide options for possible solutions
* Pick up new technology, frameworks, data stores, apis, and sdks with minimal oversight
* Participate in code reviews

* Specialized Knowledge, Equipment/ Software Requirements: 

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field
* Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences
* 4-5 years’ experience running production RDBMS (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle, etc…) at scale.
* 4-5 years’ experience working with development teams designing resilient, well–performing database environments
* 2-3 year’s experience working with data systems in public cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP, etc…)
* 2-3 years’ experience with scripting language (powershell, bash, python, etc…)
* 2-3 years’ experience integrating database changes into CI/CD pipelines

* Nice to Have: 

* Experience with running databases on containers
* Experience with kubernetes
* Experience with modern source control tools and practices

Additional Info: 
EEO Employer: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for
employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. 
 Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee
may perform other related duties as requested to meet the ongoing needs of the
organization. 
 Colorado Pay Law: If you are a Colorado resident and this role is
available in Colorado or remote, you may be eligible to receive additional
information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will
provide upon request. Please send an email to Recruiting@NetHealth.com

Job Type: Full-time

description:
Finagraph is leading a new wave of innovation in FinTech that is transforming
the way financial services are offered to businesses. We continue to add some
of the world’s largest brands to our list of customers and these customers are
taking mission-critical dependencies on our cutting-edge technology. We are
expanding our team and looking for exceptional teammates that can help us grow
and make broad contributions to accelerate this industry’s transformation.

We are currently seeking a talented, results-oriented DevOps Engineer who is
experienced with all aspects of an Azure based SAAS offering.

At Finagraph, you won’t just be a spoke in the wheel. We are large enough to
make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. We are an
organization where every person matters. You’ll be a critical part of the
business where everyone contributes to the solutions that our customers love.
In addition to the day-to-day management of operations you’ll have the
opportunity to influence software design and implement parts of our solution.

What you will be doing:

* Infrastructure setup, provisioning and planning
* Environment standardization
* Platform configuration management
* CI/CD architecture
* Service tool implementation
* Implementation and monitoring of security testing
* Regular security audits and oversight
* Threat management and response

About you:
* At least 3-5 years of progressive experience and accrued good judgment with Azure provisioning, managing, and supporting cloud infrastructure for scalability and high availability.
* Passionate about delivering rich, high performing solutions that delight customers.
* Experience using and managing observability and monitoring tools supporting the operational and security health of services running in Azure
* Experience developing tools and infrastructure CI/CD pipelines for developer productivity running in Azure DevOps
* Experience with troubleshooting/incident management for cloud native services
* Demonstrable experience with scripting languages such as PowerShell
* Functional knowledge of 1 or more high level programming languages, preferably C#
* Infrastructure as Code methods and tools (ARM Templates, Bicep, etc.,)
* CI/CD - Azure DevOps, Git etc.,
* Ability to debate issues and not people.
* Ability to make complicated things simple 
* Self-awareness that allows you to thrive in an agile work environment where everybody is wearing a lot of hats.

Benefits and Perks:
* Remote position with a talented team.
* Comprehensive health benefit plan that has a rich provider network
* Unlimited vacation policy
* Peer bonus program
* Regular team events
* Vacation reimbursement benefit

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you willing to undergo a background check? Y/N

Work Location: Remote

description:
Technical Analyst - DevOps

K3 helps companies easily manage complex data streams and integrations without
having to rely on developers. We’re focused on enterprises with increasing
amounts of data to manage, the need to move fast, and deliver sustainable
solutions. K3 gives users a seat at the table in these complex environments.
We have had great success on Wall St. and are now increasingly solving similar
problems in new domains.

Our Technical Analysts wear many hats. They assist on customer projects and
training, run our infrastructure in AWS, investigate bugs, and guide our
product roadmap.

We are currently looking for analysts with a focus on DevOps in AWS.

* Help manage our infrastructure on AWS - (ec2/RDS/ElasticBeanstalk/CloudFormation and more)
* Support project teams with AWS deployments and maintenance
* Maintain knowledge base for internal and customer consumption
* Automate software deployment, configuration, and monitoring processes
* Troubleshoot customer technical and data issues

Being a technical analyst at BroadPeak is as much about communication and
thoughtfulness as it is about technology. In this role you need to be
relentless in figuring out how new things work.

Skills Required:

* MUST enjoy discovering the details of complex systems and understanding how they work.
* MUST have demonstrated experience in AWS DevOps technologies
* Communication of technical details to a less technical people
* Comfortable working from the command line
* Experience with Linux environments
* You get a buzz from an environment that goes from fast to slow to fast again
* “Select * from” is the start of a wonderful investigative journey

About Us

Our headquarters are in NYC but we have always worked in a distributed manner.

We measure goals and delivery, not time spent at a desk.

We have a "no policy" holiday. Just get your stuff done.

Our people work on multiple areas, continuously refine processes, and
participate in the financial success of the company.

This job is based in NYC in our Flatiron district office but would be remote
for the time being.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $67,286.00 - $116,923.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

COVID-19 considerations: 
We are all fully working remotely for the time being. Remote working was a
seamless shift for us.

Experience:

* AWS: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Remote

About Caption Health 
Caption Health’s mission is to detect disease early – when there is the
highest potential for impact – by leveraging artificial intelligence and
ultrasound. Our breakthrough AI platform enables any healthcare professional
to perform high-quality ultrasound exams for early disease detection, in
convenient and lower-cost outpatient settings including patients’ homes. It
was recognized as one of TIME’s 100 Best Inventions of 2021 and one of Fast
Company’s Next Big Things in Health Tech.

Through our work with health plans, providers, patients, and industry
partners, we are transforming care, expanding access, and reducing costs.

To learn more, visit captionhealth.com.

Job Summary:

The DevOps Engineer is responsible for designing and managing the cloud
infrastructure needed to support all Caption Health products. Duties include
deploying product updates, identifying production issues and implementing
integrations that meet our customers' needs. The role will have a large impact
on team productivity and as such requires an understanding of the software
development lifecycle and various automation tools for developing digital
pipelines (CI/ CD pipelines).

Duties/Responsibilities:

* Manage the Azure and GCP cloud infrastructure tools and data with a bias towards automation and scaling
* Maintain, improve, and monitor data ingestion and processing pipelines
* Manage and improve container orchestration and deployment strategies
* Develop tools to manage continuous integration, software stack support, code quality and coverage
* Ensure and develop tools for monitoring security, privacy, and integrity of data and other resources
* Consult with application teams on architecture, performance, and access control design
* Perform other duties as needed

Required Skill/Abilities:
* 3+ years of experience with Azure cloud infrastructure development and administration
* Experience with scripting languages
* Experience with continuous integration tools (e.g. Github Actions, Jenkins) and best practices for codebase management
* Experience with Docker and Kubernetes container strategies and orchestration
* Experience with FaaS/serverless environments (e.g. AWS Lambda, Cloud Run, Kubeless)
* Good verbal and written communications
* Proactive and assertive in driving solutions/solving issues
* Bonus: Experience with Google Cloud (GCP)
* Bonus: Experience with network security and management of sensitive data
* Bonus: Experience working in startups
* Bonus: Experience working in healthcare or regulated environments

Caption Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly
pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Caption Health does not make hiring or
employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious
belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity,
sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other
basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by
Company policy. Caption Health. strives for a healthy and safe workplace and
strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair
Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its
internal policy.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations: 
Caption Health requires all employees to be fully vaccinated at the time of
hire. Will you be able to meet this requirement?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Kubernetes: 3 years (Preferred)
* Azure Cloud Infrastructue: 3 years (Required)
* Docker: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

Groovy JD

Hands on Experience in any cloud

Strong Expertise in Groovy scripting.

Hands on experience in writing Pipelines in Jenkins through Groovy or any
other scripting language. (Not Freestyle jobs)

Strong understanding on SQL queries

Expertise in GiT or any other similar version control tool.

Understanding of any configuration tool like Chef/Ansible/Puppet.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $40.00 - $45.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

* O'Fallon, MO: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

* Azure: 1 year (Preferred)
* AWS: 1 year (Preferred)
* Kubernetes: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: One location

description:
Job Description:

* 
Essential Job Functions

* Solid understanding of source management, application lifecycle management, build management and package management tools TFS, Azure DevOps/VSTS, Visual Studio, Maven.
* Experienced in leading efforts to implement continuous improvements to all areas of pipeline automation and infrastructure services in order to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of overall DevOps capability.
* Experience with secure scripting/coding, collaboration across multiple product development teams and complex troubleshooting across multiple infrastructure teams.
* Knowledge of cloud environments.
* Knowledge in various branching/merging methodologies and release procedures.

Basic Qualifications
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education and experience
* Bachelor's degree in software engineering, information systems, computer science, or related field preferred
* 6+ years of IT technical experience in product design and support
* 3+ years of experience with automation, cloud, CI/CD or DevOps specific role.
* 3+ years of experience as a DevOps engineer integrating tools like Jenkins, or other deployment tools
* Knowledge of C# and .Net technology
* Shell, Perl, PowerShell, Ruby, etc
* Experience in IaC tools like Ansible and Terraform

Other Qualifications
* Good organization skills to balance and prioritize work
* Good analytical and problem-solving skills
* Good presentation and communication skills to communicate with clients, support personnel and management
* Ability to adapt to changing situations, handle multiple tasks simultaneously and to switch between tasks quickly
* Ability to anticipate problems, deal with and resolve ambiguity and take decisive action
* Ability to work with relational databases
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Willingness to travel

Work Environment
* Office environment
* Other US locations may be considered
* Remote work may be considered

latest_reviews:
{"advice": "Take care of the people that made what Gainwell is today. Specifically, those that endured the past 10yrs with negligent predecessors (not including EDS), not treating them like people, and not paying them a fair salary. If you have employees that are top notch, you should get their salary at the midpoint for their range or you will end up losing people that have a long history with the systems we implement and maintain, otherwise you will lose them.", "cons": "The cons... Well, if you were part of EDS back in 2009 when HP bought the company, everything went downhill from there. We went from EDS to HP to HPE and spun off to CSC and became DXC.

The best thing about DXC selling off the healthcare and life sciences to a joint venture capitalist company is that we were freed from years of employee neglect, no bonus or salary increases.

Gainwell is still working to get peoples salaries to where they should be and have made significant progress in doing that.

Coming into Gainwell now, make sure you get top dollar for your skills and negotiate. We need ~3k people for all the work in the pipeline.", "countHelpful": 9, "employerResponses": [], "employmentStatus": "REGULAR", "featured": null, "isCurrentJob": true, "jobTitle": {"text": "Advisor, Project Management"}, "lengthOfEmployment": 20, "pros": "Gainwell is privately owned and was purchased from DXC. The company's focus is on healthcare solutions for Medicaid, Pharmacy Benefit Manager, and Data Analytics. The company is about 18 months old and is doing great things in the healthcare market space.

They are very focused on the employee experience. The promote a real work-life balance and provide many perks (not benefits) that are free, fun, and really useful to the employee.

The company is always looking for people will skills in healthcare systems, Medicare and Medicaid. If you are coming into Gainwell as a new employee, they do pay a premium for good talent.

The health benefits are good and typically year after year you would see the increased cost of healthcare benefits passed onto the employee. Gainwell is self-insured and has taken on the bulk of the increase rather than pass it on to the employee.

It is a great place to work and most of us work remotely from home and there are some office spaces depending on where you live.

We also have Flex vacation, no set number of days or weeks. You can take time off when you need it or want it. there are some guidelines around it but you can easily take 4-5 weeks a year being a 1st year employee.", "ratingBusinessOutlook": "POSITIVE", "ratingCareerOpportunities": 5, "ratingCeo": "APPROVE", "ratingCompensationAndBenefits": 4, "ratingCultureAndValues": 5, "ratingOverall": 5, "ratingRecommendToFriend": "POSITIVE", "ratingSeniorLeadership": 5, "ratingWorkLifeBalance": 5, "reviewDateTime": "2022-04-19T14:27:27.157", "reviewId": 62990269, "summary": "Healthcare and Medicaid Solutions"}

 LOCATION: Remote / Austin , Texas 
 DURATION: 6 Months contract on w2 (Possible extension) 
 Unfortunately we cannot work on a C2C basis and are seeking candidates who
can work on our W2

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Lead tools and build-release activities for infotainment software
(images/packages) on single or multiple hardware boards with latest multi-core
multimedia SOC.

Lead and set technical direction for tools, build-release-test automation and
cloud-backend services.

Be responsible for developing tools & automation solutions for CI / CD / CT
workflow, including software updates and manufacturing support.

Develop integrated tools and processes to work in conjunction with JAMA, JIRA,
GIT, and other repositories to provide a seamless CI / CD / CT workflow.

Develop the tools, plug-ins and solutions necessary for CI / CD / CT workflow
using Jenkins, AWS, Docker, REST APIs and other microservices.

Work with other cross-functional teams and convert business requirements into
engineering requirements for development operations.

Be responsible for tool/software development and maintenance, adhering to
appropriate internal & external safety/security standards.

Be a dynamic cross-functional technical leader enabling other dependent teams
(like software, hardware and application).

Identify and set new technical directions to improve development process and
FULFILL company / group vision. this is what you'll need:

5+ years of experience with embedded or Linux software development using
C/C++.

5+ years of experience with auto build tools (like make, Waf etc.,), Jenkins,
AWS, Linux-server installation and maintenance.

5+ years of experience with scripting languages like Python and/or Shell.

5+ years of experience in one or more areas - chat-ops, OTA servers, micro-
services and cloud backend operations.

5+ years of experience with SQL or other non-relational databases.

Ability to be creative/resourceful - to work in a fast-paced start-up
environment.

Android / Linux / QNX.

Ability and experience to design and develop application tools (running on

an end-to-end payment processing company in Durham, NC. The DevOps
Engineer will be responsible for working on the dev team to scale, create,
and improve current software.  

Responsibilities of the DevOps Engineer:

Qualifications of the DevOps engineer:

* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field 
* 4 + years with DevOps experience.
* Experience with AWS and AWS technologies.
* Experience with Docker and Kubernetes. 
* Experience with CI/CD and testing automation.

Compensation of the DevOps Engineer:
* Salary: $140,000 - $170,000 based on relevant experience
* Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k match up to 4%, PTO

Keywords: DevOps, DevOps engineer, engineer, remote, CI/CD, automation, start

description:
Overview:

Are you curious about how modern software projects are developed, built, and
tested? Do you have a desire to design and implement new processes and tools
that create efficient build and test environments across a full gamut of
desktop and mobile platforms? The ArcGIS Runtime DevOps team is eager to add a
software development engineer to our team that has a passion for driving
efficiencies in development & production environments using the latest cross-
platform techniques, technologies, and frameworks.

Who are we:

The ArcGIS Runtime DevOps team develops the infrastructure and automation
processes that support development, building & testing the ArcGIS Runtime
Native APIs across a multitude of operating systems and industry standard
platforms. Each API is unique, and we strive to find the tools and practices
that can be implemented and normalized across our fabric of supported
platforms. We enjoy being able to work alongside a large development team,
providing best practice solutions that resolve impediments and improve
efficiency. We place an emphasis on teamwork and personal growth through
overlapping responsibilities, and friendly communication.

Responsibilities:

* Develop automation for build and test workflows
* Develop innovative solutions for data capture, visualization, and alerting
* Collaborate to implement continuous integration best practices on a modern codebase

Requirements:

* Curiosity for exploring a wide assortment of platforms and technologies
* Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
* Comfortable scripting cross-platform workflows
* Strong written and spoken communication skills
* Ability to clearly document work for others
* Passion for supporting others
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related experience

Recommended Qualifications:

* Technologies: Jenkins, GitHub, Docker, OpenShift, Ansible, Artifactory
* Languages: Python, Bash, Groovy
* Concepts: Configuration as code, Continuous integration and testing, elastic infrastructure, build pipelines, package management
* Cross operating system knowledge: Ubuntu, MacOS, Windows
* Platform knowledge: C++, Java, .Net, Qt, Swift, Kotlin, Unity, Unreal Engine
* Version control: Git

The Company:

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of
everything we do. Esri's geographic information system (GIS) technology
inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to
save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the
changing world around them.  

Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in
today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional
benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs,
opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.  

Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will
receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion,
sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status,
protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process,
please email askcareers@esri.com and let us know the nature of your request
and your contact information. Please note that only those inquiries concerning
a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this e-mail
address.

IND1

LI-AL1

LI-REMOTE

description:
This leading Cyber Security firm is looking to hire an experienced DevOps
Engineer. This is a permanent role and will be 100% remote working. Please
note, however, that the company is based on the east coast and does require
someone to be on the same time zone. Candidates, therefore, must be based in
an EST zone.

This is a senior role and requires an individual who can operate independently
if required and make key decisions relating to the DevOps environment. You
must have a strong background in DevOps as well as an understanding of
software engineering and development principles.

Responsibilities will include:

* managing the build and release environment.
* supporting the high availability of cloud hosted platforms.
* develop scripts to automate DevOps functions, automating test tool configuration, automating and monitoring the platform environment.
* helping define future DevOps plans and strategy

The successful DevOps Engineer should have:

* Azure DevOps experience or similar.
* Experience of at least one PCP, ideally Azure or AWS, but also GCP.
* A good foundation in engineering. An understanding of a development language ( C#. GoLang, Python or Java).
* CI/CD
* IaC ( Terraform etc)

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $120,000.00 - $160,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Health insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus pay

Experience:

* DevOps: 4 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

Our Fortune 100 client near Cleveland is looking for a Systems Engineer to
assist in supporting IT technology strategies, such as continuous delivery for
business agility, end-to-end application development and deployment processes,
and the administration of such supporting tools. In this role, you’ll be
responsible for defining and implementing robust, scalable, pragmatic and
realistic build and deployment solutions that work for our customers. You will
work closely with our engineers on a variety of assignments that help improve
the usage and scalability of the tools we support, specifically, with a focus
on Azure DevOps and GitHub. Experience with enterprise level system
engineering, Microsoft Azure DevOps (formerly TFS), GitHub, or Artifactory are
highly desired, along with working knowledge of Splunk, Git, CI/CD pipelines
and supporting tools. This is a fully remote position and high likelihood of
going beyond the initial 12 month contract. Candidates must be willing to work
EST or MST hours and live and work in the contiguous 48 states.

Come join an industry leading company with a large IT shop and great work
culture. Apply today!

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

description:
Hybrid working model

Position Summary:

The CoE DevOps Solution Architect provides accountability for the technical
solutions from the Modern Engineering Center of Excellence to ensure that the
new technology, processes, and ways of working within IT align with IT
strategy, increase our security posture, and drive higher quality products.
Modern Engineering is our adoption of DevSecOps processes and tools. The CoE
DevOps Architect is responsible for the technical thought leadership of modern
product development technology and supporting DevSecOps processes across the
company, addressing people, process, and tool aspects of organizational
change. Primary responsibilities include developing holistic architecture for
all Modern Engineering platforms (including Continuous Integration /
Continuous Delivery (CI/CD), Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC), Continuous
Security, Infrastructure Immutability, Automated Testing, and Observability),
overseeing output of other technical resources (e.g., CoE Security Architect,
CoE Quality Architect, CoE DevOps Engineer), and leading the technical
implementation of the Modern Engineering solutions across the company. The
ability to build collaborative stakeholder relationships is a must.

Duties:

* Serve as technical authority for IT on the Modern Engineering solutions
* Serve as subject matter expert for modern product development and tooling landscape; stay current on market trends and research
* Work directly with breadth of stakeholders across the organization (from individual contributors through senior leadership) by leading and being accountable for the design and delivery of advanced cloud and DevSecOps solutions
* Educate stakeholders from the business and IT on services offered by Azure DevOps, AWS, and other SaaS solution providers and how to best leverage the services for improved business performance
* Facilitate leadership alignment on Modern Engineering vision, strategy, and methods
* Define future state application and reference architecture, operations models, and technical requirements of cloud ecosystem in accordance with leading practices from industry and AWS Well-Architected Framework
* Design, architect, and manage all Modern Engineering platforms and environments for scale across the IT organization
* Perform and follow strong software coding practices
* Iteratively improve deployment methodologies through process streamlining and automation
* Work with the CoE and Delivery Teams to define automation strategy tools and deployment, and build and maintain solutions
* Evaluate benefits and risks of a solution’s feasibility and functionality
* Lead and coordinate technical reviews (architectural, security, compliance, etc.)
* Consult on and evangelize the behavior change and mindset shifts required of people resources to implement new architecture and processes
* Partner with other CoE members and HR to account for effort associated with culture change as part of implementation strategies
* Model desired culture including open knowledge sharing, proactive cross-functional collaboration, and adaptive learning via continuous improvement
* Define, review, and implement Modern Engineering Standards
* Define, update and document technical Procedures related to software development best practices
* Provide collateral support, including architectural guidelines, design guidelines, coding guidelines, test guidelines, handover guidelines
* Develop project case studies, training materials and technical guidance for teams within the company
* Assist with estimating work efforts required for each phase of a project
* Structure work efforts and determine engagement model of technical architects from CoE and IT Delivery Teams (teams using scrum or Kanban to manage workload in conjunction with Agile Framework)
* Review and approve technical output of other CoE technical resources (e.g., CoE Security Architect, CoE Quality Architect, CoE DevOps Engineer)
* Contribute to and enhance Security Standards and Procedures for Modern Engineering solutions
* Accountable for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, and maintenance of CI/CD infrastructure. This may include provisioning of AWS instances, configuring servers, streamlining deployments, scaling out servers
* Monitor and consult on all network, security, and other services to meet the organization's current and future requirements
* Manage current state and future state Modern Engineering tooling including configuration, maintenance, and upgrades
* Implement key performance indicators (KPI) to monitor process health and service metrics
* Facilitate compliance with internal and external audit and regulatory requirements

Requirements:

* 10+ years of broadened software engineering and architecture experience preferred
* 5+ years of demonstrable software engineering and DevOps experience
* Must demonstrate accountability, sound decision making, and analytical thoroughness
* Hands-on experience designing and implementing end-to-end CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Azure DevOps Preferred)
* Hands-on AWS and Azure public cloud experience in a production environment (e.g., network, security, deployment, automation, serverless technologies)
* Hands-on experience with Configuration Management and Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, GCP Deployment Manager, Azure ARM) and/or
* Hands-on experience to common container and container orchestration solutions (e.g. Docker Enterprise, Kubernetes, AWS ECS)
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience required. Computer Science or related field preferred
* Certification on AWS and Azure DevOps platforms preferred

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Behaviors:

* Experience working with and integrating system components into other vendor solutions
* Experience with the products and solutions of open-source, cloud, and SaaS ecosystems
* Experience working within an Agile/Scrum framework
* Experience collaborating across multiple functional/technical teams to deliver a project
* Ability to design optimally durable and consistent patterns for distributed systems
* Ability to communicate with customers on a business level and translate their needs into a technical solution
* Ability to adapt to organizational change and advocate for the required culture change within the organization
* Strong emotional intelligence to identify the behavioral and cultural indicators to team effectiveness
* Consultative, collaborative approach to solving complex problems, with customer service skills
* Invigorated by new challenges and ability to professionally challenge the status quo
* Passionate about developing the skills of team members through technical and professional mentoring
* Demonstrated growth mindset, enthusiastic about learning new technologies quickly and applying the gained knowledge to address business problems
* Self-starter; ability to proactively define work and deliver results

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $114,398.41 - $192,927.55 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

* Chicago, IL 60601: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Experience:

* Software engineering: 10 years (Preferred)
* DevOps: 5 years (Preferred)
* CI/CD: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: One location
